text: This Melissa & Doug Round The City Rescue Rug is a great gift for children. I know my great nephews loved zooming around on that colorful rug to perform various rescues in the city. The children can use their own vehicles or additional toys on this colorful rug to make up their own adventures. Plus the rug stands up to being used in a not so gentle way, which is very important if kids are going to be running toy vehicles over it.I recommend this Melissa & Doug Round the City Rescue Rug highly for anyone who want to engage a beloved child's imagination. The kids love it  and it is sturdy enough to withstand the wear and tear a much used toy endures.

The Lenox Angel Wishes Holly Bell China Ornament is the perfect gift for the person you know who collects Christmas ornaments. Lenox has been know for making beautiful ornaments for many years and this is one of prettiest ornaments I have seen.It is small and it is delicate, not a suitable ornament for a child because the child could (unintentionally) break the ornament. But for those of us who collect angels or Christmas ornaments, this is a perfect gift. You can start your Lenox ornament collection with this beautiful angel. I recommend this highly.

I have a pizza stone I have used for a long time. I have never been able to find a satisfactory way to clean it. I clean it but it just doesn't really seem clean to me. I received the Cusinart CCB-399 Pizza Stone Cleaning Brush and finally took it to my pizza stone. It looks as if it should be a grill brush as it has a very long (to me) handle. Maybe this is how this type of tool is designed, I don't know. But what is important is how the brush works on the pizza stone. I was very pleased with the brush after I cleaned my pizza stone. I didn't have to scrub to try and get the icky stuff off. The brush worked its magic on the pizza stone and it was very clean.I am very happy with this pizza brush. I advise anybody with a pizza stone to buy this brush to thoroughly clean their pizza stone. It almost looks brand new (it is over 20 years old). And if you are buying a pizza stone as a gift, I suggest you buy this to accompany the gift. The reciepients will be very happy for your thoughtfulness.

Oh, this Serta Plush Velour Electric Heated Mattress Pad is so very comforting. You can set it up easing and have your bed all toasty and warm by the time you go to bed,  You could set your thermostat lower because your bed would be warmer. There are 10 different settings so you can get the amount of heat you want. It also automatically turns itself off after being on for 10 hours. And the best part? It is machine washable and dryable. So if you spill something on the mattress pad, no big deal.The top is microplush which is extremely soft. Combine the softness with the warmth and you have a perfect environment to sleep in. It is especially comforting during those unfortunate sneezing, coughing sick days. It cradles you in its warmth.I recommend this product highly for people like me who are always cold and I think it would be a great gift for someone who always feels cold. But don't try the gift mattress pad unless you bought yourself one of these - you will  not want to give it up.

My youngest sister had a similar toy when she was a kid and she really enjoyed. What my mother did not enjoy was the mess she could create by playing with this. This art spinner seems a little smaller than the one my sister had.This was for my great niece and she loves it. It's easy for a child to use (age 6 and up). This model has a splash shield, so hopefully my great niece will not be repainting her bedroom walls while creating with this toy. It does need a C battery to be fully functional. There are 20 cards and 5 colors for the child to use. I am going to try to buy more supplies so my great niece will have them on hand when she feels creative.. This toy doesn't make noise or play a  video game, but it is something very different for kids of today. It inspires them to use their imagination. I recommend this toy highly for someone buying a child of 6 or up a creative toy

This DII oversized towel set is very pretty. It's eggplant and white print make a nice contrast to my kitchen where I tend towards blues and yellows.The dish towels are oversized which is very handy if you have a lot of dishes to dry. They are made out of 100% cotton.I will warn you that you have to be careful with these towels. You have to wash them separately so the colors do not bleed I washed mine with a cold water and vinegar rinse so the colors will not run. That's a trick my mother taught me and it usually works.I recommend these towels for anybody in the market for off beat kitchen towels. They will add a splash of color to your kitchen.

Another DII kitchen product I can recommend. These towels are plush but of course I think they should be more plush. It's a personal preference and should not affect your enjoyment and use of these towels. They are durable and work well for the varied tasks in the kitchen. I wasn't too thrilled with the green color, but that is also a personal preference.Except for  my color preference, these clothes are a good buy. I recommend them highly to anyone wanting a sturdy kitchen cloth.

The DII Kitchen Millennium clothes are perfect if you need to scrub a delicate surface without scratching it.  I have used this on my refinished tub and have been pleased with the results. I can't use any harsh abrasives on the tub because it has been refinished so these cleaning clothes have been extremely helpful. I use a non-abrasive cleaner, this cloth and some elbow grease to make my tub clean.I recommend the DII Kitchen Millennium cleaning clothes to anyone who has a tough job to do.

I usually buy the store brand paper towels because they are cheaper than brand name paper towels and like most people, I am trying to save money. But after using the Georgia-Pacific Perforated Roll Paper Towels  i realize that I made a foolish choice. The Georgia-Pacific paper towels actually save money because they actually perform much better at any task than the store brand paper towels.For instance, need to wipe up a spill? The generic paper towels make take 4 or 5 to clean the spill. The Georgia-Pacific paper towels only require 1 paper towel. So the money I "saved" using generic paper towels is non-existent because I have used more paper towels. It doesn't make a lot of sense to actually pay more for a poor quality product when you can buy the much higher quality Georgia-Pacific.I recommend the Georgia-Pacific Perforated Roll Paper towels to anyone and everyone that uses paper towels.

This "Faith and Inspiration" necklace is quite pretty. The eighteen inch chain is made out of sterling silver. The pendant is two toned, the body of the angel is sterling silver with a cubic zirconia. The heart the angel carries is gold toned. It comes in a small soft bag tucked into a jewelry box.This necklace is quite delicate looking but looks are deceiving. This necklace is beautiful and well made to take everyday wear. It could be quite a beautiful addition to you or a loved one's wardrobe.Hallmark makes quality jewelry. I recommend this necklace highly for all of those who love angels or as a gift to somebody who loves angels.

Daisy McDare is your normal small town interior decorator, if there is such a thing. Daisy is coming off of a breakup with her boyfriend when she lands what seems to be a dream job. Her old friend, Kara, married a  rich painter. And now Kara wants to redecorate the "parlor" into a party room. Sounds great, doesn't it? Old friend, great job, a bigger payday than usual.  Daisy does have a little envy of Kara for living the glamorous life.The envy quickly recedes when Daisy meets Luke, Kara's husband and the two obnoxious stepchildren. They are an adult son and daughter, contend to freeload off of Daddy. Then there is the matter of the hunky gardener, who is definitely interested in Kara. And Anna, the maid/cook who makes the cranky Like smile like he doesn't for his wife.Toss in a murder. While Daisy tries to comfort Kara, there is rising suspicion that Kara murdered her husband. Or maybe one of the "children" did it? They were cut off from Daddy's will?Daisy takes all of this and more and manages to solve a crime the police are unable to solve.. This seems a tad strange, but the story is well told with relatable characters. That Daisy believes there's nothing that can't be solved with chocolate, there are lots and lots of references to cupcakes, candy and all sorts of sweet stuff.. Oh, and she does eat a few vegetables in the course of the book.I recommend this book to anybody who is looking for a engaging read. The characters are relatable (okay, except for the rich people) and enjoyable. If you need a break from all the horrible news in the  world, this book will give you a delightful respite.

I like the bright colors of this Dll Oceanique 3 piece bathroom set. It's blue,  green and white and it really brightens my small bathroom.  The three pieces are a chevron patterned shower curtain (72"x72") in the blue, green and white pattern Very bright and eye opening especially for the morning shower. The second piece is a 16"x24" blue microfiber rug. that feels very good on the feet. The third part of the set is 12 blue shower hooks to match the shower curtain and the rug. They are easy to use and really compliment the shower curtain.One of the blurbs stated this is perfect for a kid's bathroom. Well, I only have one bathroom and that's where I am using it. I was afraid the colors would be overwhelming in my small blue bathroom, but they worked. Obviously if you purchase it, you can use it anywhere you please.I like this bathroom set, it's so bright and cheerful. If you are in the market for a slightly wilder bathroom set, you should definitely consider this one. I believe you won't be disappointed.

I am not that familiar with PaintShop because I have not used it that much. I was pleased to find this program  as it seems relatively simple to use. I realize some people will get it right away, understand it intuitively but I'm not normally that person. I need to play with it a bit before I actually  feel comfortable with the software.The installation was relatively smooth (Windows 10 OS). The program did not seem to interfere with the other programs I already had and for me, that's good. It has some new features (all of it is pretty new to me) such as being able to wrap the words around whatever shape you choose. This is very convenient for playing with photos. I haven't really made a project with the software yet but I am enjoying playing with it.I recommend this software highly for anyone who wants to organize their photos in one convenient area. I look forward to totally immersing myself in this software and being able to organize my photos.

At one time in my life, I used to make my own greeting cards with rubber stamps and collage. I tried to make them reflect the event (birthday, wedding) and I was usually satisfied with the way the cards turned out. Though it sounds as if it should be very easy to do, it's not. It takes a lot of material and time to figure out exactly how I could achieve the effect I was trying to obtain. Those card making days have been long behind me.Because of my experience, I was very interested in seeing the Hallmark Signature Collection. I was afraid it would be an imitation handmade card, slap dashed together and not really looking that great. I was quite pleasantly surprised to be proven wrong. The cards, as one card states, are "fabulous". There's a beautiful stiletto heel, dressed up in (fake) jewels and glitter. There is a lovely line drawing of a woman with her dress accented in pink flowers floating around the dress. The sentiments expressed in the cards is very simple (one example: "Happy Birthday, fabulous you!") so you have space to add your own sentiments. These are great cards for the women in your life._BUT_  having written this review, I want to add a few "buyer bewares". If you plan to mail these cards, you will need a padded envelope (this does not come with the cards, you have to supply your own). You will also have to pay extra postage due to the weight of the card. If this sort of restrictions are an issue for you, you will not want to buy these cards. They are beautiful but some people do not want the extra expense of money and time to mail a card. That's fine - you can hand deliver them to your friends. No extra effort than a regular flat card.On the other hand, if you want something truly special for your friends, this collection of cards is right for you. It is impressive and beautiful and will certainly be treasured  by the recipient for years to come. I recommend these cards highly..

I truly must have confused this heater for something else. I thought this would get rid of a bedbug problem, but it does not appear to d that. It's much too small to try and tent a mattress. It's entirely possible that I didn't really understand how to use this ite properly, but since it was supposed to be a "bedbug toaster", that's what I thought it was.I can't recommend this item because I had entirely different expectations for this particular item. I suggest you read the other reviews as well as the product description (which I apparently did not do) to see if this item suits your needs.

Toners for printers are expensive - very expensive. Sometimes it seems like  a better deal financially to just buy a new printer for the cost of the toner alone - there is not that much difference in price sometimes. And of course the toner runs out at the most inopportune times, leaving me to try and find an expensive replacement at the local office supply store quickly. This method works very poorly and ends up leaving me frustrated and angry.Then I found the EPS Replacement Toner to fit my Samsung printer on Amazon. I was hesitant at first to try it. After all, I have never used this brand before now. I also remember some incredibly cheesy generic toners from worker being absolutely horrible to use. But I checked the prices of toners again and decided that the toner was at least worth one try. f t didn't perform well, I'd know not to buy it again.I was very pleasantly surprised at the quality of this toner cartridge. It was easy to install and worked well with my printer. The printing is clear and sharp. The cartridge doesn't shed what I call toner dust everywhere. (You know what I am talking about, those tiny black dots that sometimes sprinkle the paper, making it messy to handle). I am impressed and happy.I recommend this EPS Replacement Toner to anyone in need of a toner for a  printer. There are other configurations to fit various printers and you can find a toner that suits your printer. I intend to keep using these for my Samsung and I believe after you have tried this product, you will use this for all your printer needs.

This Zaki Designs Hydra Trak Insulated Tumbler is a colorful 20 ounce tumbler. The color is from the colored bands that surround the tumbler. The purpose of these bands is more than ornamental. Every time you finish 20 ounces of water, you move a colored band to the top of the tumbler. This makes it much easier to track how much water you have consumed through out the day.I recommend this tumbler for people like me. I know I should drink water and I also know I don't keep track of how much fluid I have consumed. This tumbler helps me to keep track of how much water I have consumed during the day.

Unfortunately, I am very disorganized in some areas of my life. For instance, home improvement bills. Where do I file them? What should I do with them? And those weird receipts for postage or some repair to a tool? Well, I have to tell you upfront that I do not organize the way normal people do. For instance, I have my divorce papers (from my first husband) in a file marked "Medical". That may seem strange, but if you knew the situation, you'd agree with me.So I am using this neat little file for my home improvement receipts as well as for repair receipts. This handy colorful file has 6 pockets, so I can, if I want add a few more files in there. It expands without resistance and the bright colors should cue my mind that home improvement receipts go in there.. I would have loved to have it in my school days, I believe it would have been very helpful to keep papers in order.I would recommend this 6 pocket expanding file to anyone who wants to organize something important.

This is a weird but useful tool. The NeilMed Ear Spin Safe is for people who have a problem with wax build up in their ears. You know the kind of build up I mean, the one that feels as if you are deaf or going deaf. And as long as you follow the careful instructions on the package, this will remove a lot of ear wax. It will also feel very weird to you, but trust me, it works. And the bonus of it all - it works quickly.I would recommend this product to anyone who has an ear wax build up problem or anyone who knows someone that could use this product.

I love these adorable little coasters. They are well made out of silicone in bright colors and look like a giant button. They are easy to clean, I wash these off with a little soap and water. The button coasters are approximately 3 1/2" across and are suitable for hot drinks as well as cold drinks. They are easy to use and stay in place.But the most endearing quality to me is the cuteness factor of the button coasters. I not only want to use them as coasters, but maybe for a few craft projects. I am considering getting at least 1 more set of button coasters so I can be creative with the coasters.Yes, these button coasters are functional as  well as fun and fashionable. These would make a great gift for a dinner party host or just anybody who happens to go bonkers for buttons. I recommend them highly.

It's difficult to review a hand held broadcaster when there is snow on the ground. Yes, I could use it for rock salt, but I want to save it for gardening applications.Here's what I can tell you. I like using Scotts products as they are generally well made and suited to the task at hand. This broadcaster is very easy to turn and does not seem to cause a lot of wrist fatigue. I believe it will work well for my future gardening applications.I'm sorry this isn't a more detailed review but I have a limited time to review the Amazon Vine items. I expect it to work well, as all Scotts products I have used work. I look forward to using this in my yard come spring.

I received this recently (while we had maybe 9 inches of snow on the ground) so I haven't had a change to use this particular bag. But, I have used Scotts Bulb Continuous Release Plant food previously. I generally use it in the fall. This supplement helps the bulbs to form more flowers and generally offshoots  over the winter. It's easy to apply and it doesn't make a mess of me while I am  applying the product (and I'm a messy person).  So when spring finally shows up this year (2015), I will have a beautiful display of daffodils and tulips.I recommend this product highly to anyone who grows bulbs in their garden. It really does improve the flowering of bulbs.

This is a very good book. I think the editing needed to be tightened up, but that is my opinion. I will warn you this book will make your sick to your stomach.Why would it make you sick to your stomach? When you see how much money is raised to "increase awareness" and how little money actually goes to finding a cure, you will be shocked and angry. I lost my mom and my sister-in-law to this disease. It is an ugly disease. If you are not "aware" of breast cancer, then you must be living under a rock at the bottom of a deep well. Almost everybody knows somebody who has breat cancer.This book will most likely make you angry. It made me angry. All those pink products advertised in October making all that money for the companies that produce the stuff. Most of it does not go into prevention or cure, just paying the executives big salaries.If you are wondering why so much money is being spent on "research" on breast cancer, read this book. It won't make you happy but it will give you what you need to break away from the pink ribbon culture.

I guess this little kit is meant for a person 14 years and up. I am over 14 years old (by a few years  ;) ),. It has been gray and raining and snowing here for what seems like forever and we have more snow  in the forecast. My intention was to give this to my great niece and let her create. However, being curious and suffering from cabin fever, I decided to open up the box myself .  I will say my original intention was to check out what  was included in the kit. But looking at the kit's components ,The tools included are a small amount of yarn, 2 pompom makes (different sizes) and a small book of how to make a pompom creature. I thought the little Russian pompom doll was cute, so I thought I would try it out. After all, I could always replace the yarn.The instructions are clear and easy to follow. The project does not require a long time or a lot of skill. There is more than enough yarn to complete more than one of the projects given. I recommend this Make Pompom Fun Shapes kit highly for anybody over 14 years old. I also recommend this kit for an older person that may be interested in playing with pompoms. It's a bright spot in a snowy day.

Melissa and Doug produce many quality art projects for  children, so it is no surprise that the item is terrific. Children can easy complete the mirror and treasure with a minimal supervision. A huge plus is after this is finished, there is not glitter scattered all over the house. Yes, really, a glitter project where you won't be brushing glitter off of you and everybody else in the house for the next 6 months.I know this sounds incredible, but it's true. The glitter is applied using a sticker. You carefully remove the sticker backing and apply it to the correct area and rub the sticker into the right place. If need be, the stickers can be reused.This art project is highly recommended for any child who wants to do an art project and an adult that does not want a mess to clean up..

The Extreme Max 3005.3726 Heavy Duty Spare Tire Mount  does exactly what the name says - it  provides a heavy duty tire mount for your trailer.  It is relatively easy to install (if you know about these sort of things). The instructions are clear and concise. All you have to do if plan where you want to place your spare tire mount, follow the directions and ta da, there you have a sturdy mount for a full size spare tire.I would recommend this mount to anyone who needs to have a spare tire mount on their trailer.

This is a great product - for small animals. I made the mistake of buying these for my big bunny Shadow. The litter box worked as advertised but Shadow was a little too bit for the box. It was funny seeing Shadow scrunch himself up to use the box but I do think he was uncomfortable. I think it would be great for small bunnies and guinea pigs.I recommend this product highly for small animals litter box needs.

This is a book I bet many parents wish they had for this winter's string of snow days. This book shows kids, with minimal help from an adult, can make their own new toys. It takes a bit of cardboard, a bit of paper and some imagination. The instructions are easy to understand and the projects are cool.I recommend this book highly, especially for parents who are snowbound with their kids. This is a good art project book, you don't need to be snowbound to enjoy it. But looking at the weather forecasts and the temperatures, I think parents would really get a lot of use in this winter of 2015.

Beyond cute. I purchased this for a friend of mine who loves Basset hounds. He loved it. Since he loved it, I certainly love it, too. Buy this is you are a Basset hound fan or you know a Basset hound fan. He/she will love it.

I recently purchased this from Wal-Mart on a whim. I like Bigelow Teas, but I never tried this new (to me) tea. And I had just come off of four days of pathetic hot tea. (Some people just don't seem able to make good hot tea.) So this morning I made a huge steaming cup of the kind with the honey. It was great. I was hesitant to try the tea based on the increased caffeine of the tea. I needn't have worried. The tea was a little stronger than I am used to, but of course, that's what I had expected and wanted. The American Breakfast (I tasted the kind with the honey) was strong without being bitter, even after the tea was down to the last drop. Many teas turn bitter at the end of the cup.If you like strong good tasting black tea with a hint of honey,  buy American Breakfast  tea by Bigelow.  It is really good.

Right off, this is not a child's introduction to the series "Cosmos". Instead, it is a book about Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson who was the guide in the television series "Cosmos". There are bits and pieces of the astrophysicist's childhood and education. There is background on how Dr. deGrasse Tyson came to be involved in astrophysics.I recommend this book to anyone looking for an interesting book for a young one. I think most children would find the information intriguing and stimulating.

First off, if I liked being called a "bitch", I would have stayed married to my ex-husband (thank you, "The Closer"). So I have a problem with the title. I realize it captures the eye and the mind of possible readers. I believed there could have been a better title, but this one is probably the most titillating title.Dr. Julie Holland, author of "Moody Bitches....." has done a lot of research on the subject of the effects of hormones and drugs on a woman's body. (There is, I think, about 40 pages of footnotes).  Dr. Holland writes in a way that is easy for the non-medical people to understand. It is not an easy read, but certainly an interesting one. If you are approaching menopause or going through menopause, you will definitely get a lot of good information from this book.I recommend this book for any woman who wants to understand herself better. You can check how the drugs you may be taking could be affecting your moods.  Read and understand.I deducted 1 point for the use of the word "Bitches". yes, I am an old fuddy-duddy.

"Love Never Dies" by Dr. Jamie Turndorf was a difficult read for me. Not because it wasn't well written, it was. It's the subject matter that I found hard to read and process. I have ost a lot of loved ones in a relatively short time, so grief seems to be my constant companion.  But I thought I'd give this book a try (I'm not familiar with Dr. Turndorf) and see if it would help me suss things out.One of the most interesting aspects of this book is the how to make a connection part. It isn't hocus pocus or some sort of Ouija board type of thing. It seems to be a well thought out plan to allow the survivor to connect with his/her loved one. I have used elements of that to connect to loved ones, so I thought it was helpful.  Some people will not care for the book and that's okay, too. What mattered to me is what _I_got out of it and that was a lot.I recommend this book to anyone  who has lost a loved one, anyone who wants to reconnect with a loved one. It won't be everyone's cup of tea, but I believe it could be helpful for the majority of people reading this book.

I am biased in favor of Barilla pasta products, so I was already predisposed to like this product. The Barilla Fettuccine Pasta is of the same high quality as Barilla's other products. The texture is great and the pasta seems to soak up the sauce to make a better pasta eating experience.The directions are on the box and it is cooked much the same as any other pasta. It does not get clumpy and lumpy in the water. The Barilla Fettuccine Pasta enhances any meal that it is included in.I recommend this Barilla Fettuccine Pasta highly to anyone who likes pasta.

I have to admit, I do love pasta. I especially like Barilla pasta. These elbow pasta cooked perfectly as per the very clear instructions given on the box. The pasta has a great texture and great mouth feel.But more importantly, this pasta can stand it's own against any sauce. I made my mom's recipe for pasta with whole tomatoes and green peppers. Whole tomatoes and green peppers  can be a big strong and overpower a less flavorful pasta. The elbows can sometimes seem to feel like squishy lumps in tomatoes and peppers. But this is where Barilla shines, it has a distinct flavorful taste which seems to absorb the sauce. This adds a very welcome change from starchy pasta lumps.I recommend this Barilla Whole Grain Pasta (elbows) to anyone who enjoys good pasta.

Dale Peck writes about the  time between 1987 and 1996,  or as Mr Peck calls it, "second half of the first half of the AIDS epidemic,. He is extremely outspoken on the subject of AIDS (as his earlier works have shown). He focuses on several activists, some named but some unnamed..I remember the dark old days of the early 1980s, where I would hear about an AIDS diagnosis and within 2 weeks, I'd hear of the same person's death.Now AIDS is a chronic disease that can be managed but not cured (at least as of this writing). People who have been diagnosed AIDS have a much longer expected lifespan. But some of Mr Peck's descriptions frighten me.Mr Peck speaks often of people practicing extremely unsafe sex, including sometimes Mr Peck himself. I want to yell at the people in the book "please don't do this,  please use protection, be careful" . It's like watching a slow train crash, where everything is happening so you can see every gear, every shard of metal come flying off the train and you can't do a damned thing to prevent anyone from getting hurt.Mr Peck's work is sexually explicit, so if detailed descriptions of various sexual activities would upset you, do _not_ read this book.I recommend this book highly for anyone interested in that time period of AIDS. It has a very good history from a real person's point of view.

Believe it or not, cat treats are not always welcome by my 2 cats. And if you have a cat, you know they can be finicky to say the least. Many times the treats are ignored until they are swept up and tossed. The cats aren't interested in the treats at that point, but I am because it seems like a waste of money to toss cat treats.The Nature Balance Perfect Bites were not allowed to get swept away. As soon as they arrived, Heidi and braveheart was all over the package, trying to dig the treats out. I couldn't smell the treats but obviously the cats could. They were quite pleased with the new treats and ate them very quickly. I had to hide them so the cats wouldn't try to eat all the treats at one time.My cat Braveheart said "rowr" or mrrow-rowr-rowr" which I am certain is a signal of approval. If the vocalizations weren't enough to convince me, Bravehearts begging for more treats did. I recommend these treats highly to any cat owners that want to treat their cats.

I am so lucky I got this Eucerin Professional Repair Body Lotion today. You see, tomorrow we are supposed to get a cold snap in my area (in the 20s, wind chill single digits) and my skin is dry.  I've used Eucerin products for quite some time and they work very well. But the cold weather really does a number on my skin. I used this after the shower and it makes my skin soft and smooth and not ashy.If you have dry skin, I recommend this Eucerin Professional Repair Body Lotion highly.

I love this. I purchased this as a gift for my son's girlfriend and I got to admit, I seriously thought  about keeping it for myself. It's lightweight fleece and it is soft and warm. I love the ears and the tail.This coat comes in only 1 size  (the "one size fits most" size) otherwise I would have ordered one for myself. It was a big hit with the girlfriend, so that's a major plus for me.I'd recommend this coat for anybody that wants a cute fleece coat and fits into the right size range  It is great.

This book left me cold. Although it has been almost 34 years since my father's death, I was curious to see how other women handled that rite of passage. I have seen some of my friends newly shaken by the loss of their fathers in recent months. I was hoping this book would be some sort of guide to the recently fatherless and I could pass it along.I was totally wrong. My life is (and was) nothing like Clea Simon's life. I'm not saying that my father and I had a perfect relationship, of course we didn't  because we are both humans. But compared to her life and father, I had an absolutely lovely walk in a beautiful sunshiny park.There is much blame laid at the fathers feet in this book about fatherless women. I don't know if it because most (if not all) women are much younger than I am. I don't know if it's because my mother worked since I was a baby, so I didn't have the stay at home mom/working dad  thing going on in my life. Both parents worked, both parents took care of the kids and household chores, (It wasn't in any way a 50/50 divide, but my dad did a lot more than sit in his recliner and smoke his pipe.) From the description M's Simon gives of her childhood, I would say that the Simons had a dysfunctional family.There is no tying together at what age the father dies and the changes occur. If you are 30, you will be going through a different life stage than if you are twenty one. These stages aren't even considered in this book, it's as if everybody exists in a dysfunctional vacuum until the father dies. And then, somehow, you are "free" to do what you want. It never occurs to the author that a death in the family makes everybody to think of their own mortality, that some changes may occur based on the knowledge that life is short.I am very disappointed in this book. Maybe if my life more closely matched the author's life, I may have gotten something worthwhile from this book. I will not recommend this book to anyone and I intend to dispose of the book.  Your mileage may vary.

I think what really puts this into the realm of the casual grower is the fact that it uses LEDs. This basically makes the device worry free. The LEDs won't need replacing, they don't generate much heat and they use less electricity than conventional bulbs. Combine that with the pump to circulate water, automatic on/off cycles to 'rest' the plants and a notification of when it's time to add more plant food to the water and it's a dead simple system.I had no problem with the 3 seed pods that came with it. All are growing now and the basil in particular took off, being the first to require me to raise the lamp (the lamp height is adjustable -- you start at the lowest position and raise it as the plants need more space).Now I'm tempted to buy one of the larger models and then attempt peppers or cherry tomatoes.

The camera itself is great and the whole cloud control works well too -- on Internet Explorer and smartphones, anyway. The plugin doesn't seem to work with Google Chrome and I was never able to figure out how to connect with the provided Windows software but I'm not sure that's necessary anyway. The IE plug appears to give you everything you need, including setting preset camera positions, taking pictures, changing camera settings and so forth.So once you get it setup it's fine. Really my complaint is that the whole software package feels like what you get when you let your engineers design the user interface. It's a bit....obtuse. It's functional but it's not pretty or easy to figure out. Still, the features are here and I see good potential for using these to setup a wireless network of cameras that can be easily monitored from literally anywhere, day and night. The "Pan/Tilt/Zoom" is very nice to have, too. The fact that it's "cloud" should also make it very easy for TRENDnet to keep updating the software without you having to do some kind of difficult firmware upgrade as with most security packages -- there's no "central box" as with other packages. Just however many cameras you want hooked into the network.

Very solid, fantastic quality trunks. The price may seem up there but you get what you pay for. It doesn't even creak when I sit on it dead center. Very solid wood, good metal reinforcement and solid clamps. The optional wheels are a nice touch. You can leave them off for general use but if you ever need to move it, it's not hard to put them on. These are the kinds of trunks you could buy for your college kid and they'll still have them when they're 50.

This is pretty straightfoward: turn your 2 socket wall plug into a 6 socket plug with a built in surge protector and sliders that will cover the prong holes that aren't in use. There are a lot of these on the market and they're all pretty similar but most don't have the sliders to cover the unused sockets. They don't lock, so they aren't meant to be kidproof, but they will help prevent casual accidents.

This was great on my vacation. Hotels don't often give you access to a surge protector and there's usually too few outlets. You can pack your own surge protector but why not a 2-in-1 surge protector + device recharger? Pack it in your carry-on luggage (technically you must do this anyway -- airlines prohibit putting spare lithium batteries in your checked luggage) and you can use it unplugged to recharge your devices from the internal battery on the plane and then use it as a surge protector when you get to the hotel.Note that the 3-prong sockets are NOT for charging your devices. That's what the USB plug is for. The 3-prong sockets are purely for surge protection when plugged into a wall socket.The device outputs 2 amps which these days is getting to be standard. Be wary of devices that only output 1.5A or less as they may not even charge up a tablet. I ding it one star because it's only a 3000 mAh battery though. For the size of the device, I would think they could have done a lot more than that. There are similar sized devices (charger only, no surge protection) that pack over 10,000 mAh, which means a lot more device recharges without needing to plug in. Shop around and see what looks right for your needs.

I tend to agree with the reviews stating that the box in the picture seems like a shame. On one hand, it's interesting to read and it draws the eye to the text. On the other hand it's a bit of an ugly scar against some great photos. Maybe they could have simply cropped the photos at the bottom and put the information there -- it would be a little less distracting.Still, it's an interesting calendar and while the photos are nice, it's those text blurbs that make it more interesting than just another calendar of pretty (but typically unexplained) pictures.

This is a pretty great drone for its size. Best in class? Maybe!It's a palm sized drone which means very limited flying time (approximately 5 minutes) but you'll find that to be typical for drones of this size. There's just not enough lift to put in a large battery. But it's a great "intro to drones" that you can safely fly indoors. Being so lightweight and made of a pretty durable, flexible plastic, the drone is hard to destroy and hard to cause damage with. I've banged it into the ceiling, the floor, the walls, the TV, myself, crashed it numerous times rightside up and upside down and it's none the worse for wear.MAKE SURE YOU READ THE INSTRUCTIONS! I see a lot of people dinging the product because they clearly didn't read the instructions. You can find the instructions online at the manufacturer's website (which you can read before you buy so you have some idea of what you're getting). This is a toy but it's a sophisticated one.Features:TRIM! Lots of small drones don't have this option but this one does. Trim allows you to make small adjustments to the flight surfaces to correct problems. Drone drifts left nonstop? Give it right trim. Drone spins right nonstop? Give it left spin trim. Your first one or two 5-minute flying sessions should consist of getting your trim set. It will never be perfect but 5 minutes spent on trim will make it a whole lot easier to fly later."AI". This activates a sensor on the bottom of the drone that will allow it to automatically maintain a constant height, so that you don't have to fiddle with the throttle. The idea being that now you can work on simply flying the drone around -- left, right, spin -- and the "AI" will handle altitude for you. Of course, if you need to get over a sharp obstacle (like the back of a couch) you may need to turn off the AI and do manual throttle control but the AI option is nice for practicing the other controls.The controller takes 4 AAA batteries but the drone has a rechargeable lithium battery built into it.

Very lightweight, very compact with optional hood. Quality stitching, stuffing and zippers. I've only used this on a single two-night trip so far with mild nights so quality assurances will have to wait but I appreciated the adjust-ability of the bag. The way the zippers are setup gives you some flexibility in how you want to vent it without simply opening it all the way up.

First, some credentials: I enjoy online gaming in the same sense that the United States Navy enjoys ships. I use TeamSpeak every day and frequently game for 4+ hour sessions. I need good headphones and I've tried quite a few.Headsets I have used recently:Klipsh KG-200. Okay design, lacks frills, good for gaming but bad overall sound balance for music (too bassy).HyperX Cloud Gaming. Solid build. Good sound. Stereo only with no frills. Confusing mic.Creative Sound Blaster Tactic 3D Gaming Fury. Fantastic on everything except build quality. Plastic broke in the first month.Logitech G35. I really wish Logitech would have better build quality. I love everything about their stuff but their headphones do not last. The 'faux leather' junk they put on the headsets shreds quickly but the frame isn't well made either and eventually breaks.Astro Gaming A40 headset: Really liked these. Great quality but stereo only. They were my favorite until now.I dunno if I'm an expert but I've been through a lot of headsets.These EarForce Stealth 450s are my new favorite. Wireless, rechargeable, you can use them while charging them and the charging connection is just a generic micro-USB so any cord will do. Standard bluetooth range which for me means I can keep them on all the way into my kitchen downstairs and still listen to TeamSpeak while getting a drink. Has volume for input and output on the headset. Mic is detachable but really who does that.Things I wish were featured but which I do not dock points for:* 1 or more mappable buttons similar to the Logitech G35 ("Well you should just buy a G35 then!" I would if their build quality wasn't so terrible! I love Logitech features but finally gave up on their headphones after the 3rd set.)* A button that controls the equalizer presets. This one isn't so bad because you CAN map that to a keyboard hotkey but your selection of hotkeys is very limited so you'll likely end up unmapping something in your games to make room for this.The design does not seem as rugged as, say, the Astro A40 but so far it's comfortable and I've had no problems. I wear it in 4+ hour long sessions and my chief complaint with previous Turtle Beach headsets was that they hurt my ears. No such problem here.As wireless headphones, though, expect that you may have to wrestle occasionally with Windows, which does not always do well with audio devices disappearing and reappearing. A lot of programs get locked onto one audio device and you may need to restart them if you turn on your headphones after starting the program. This is common to ALL audio devices though and is ultimately a Windows issue, not a problem with these headphones.I will update this review if I experience problems. I expect these will continue to be my daily headphones until something happens to them.

This thing is fantastic. You'll notice it doesn't have a handle -- it doesn't need one. I put boiling hot tea in it every day and the outside of the container never even feels arm.The lid is a bit of a contraption that you take apart to clean but it's basically just a spring that operates the "sippy cup seal" and a piece that holds it in. No big deal to clean it. The mug is all metal and seems pretty rugged. You push a button to drink. If you don't push the button you can turn it upside down and not get any leaks.

I saw something similar to this in a hotel and thought it was worth a shot: a bent curtain rod that gives you a bit more elbow room in the shower while still keeping the curtain anchored on the ends.This is a pretty good rendition but I wish it was curved more. The curve on this one is very slight. It will only gain you a couple of inches of space.Still, installation is easy. I actually just left the holes in the tile where the old shower curtain attached and put this over top of the holes. Being a tension rod, there was no need to drill new holes and the rubber backing covered the old holes just fine. I put it up myself but it would be easier with another set of hands to help you align it and tighten the tension while holding the rod where you want it.So far no problems in quality and with good tension and a big rubber base on both sides, it hasn't slipped. I put the curtain on the inside rod and use the outside rod to hang towels.

I used to be a huge ViewSonic fan but I've had regular problems with their power supplies going out. I have actually opened them up, found the clearly burned out power supply, ordered a new OEM part, replaced it and had that one burn out 2 years later. Meanwhile, I have yet to experience this with Samsung. This 27-inch curved monitor is my latest upgrade from yet another dead ViewSonic.And it's fantastic. It blows my 5-year old Samsung monitor out of the water, sitting side by side, and that one was slightly better than my ViewSonic. The brightness is incredible. This is the first flat screen monitor I've ever bought where I had to turn the brightness down from 100 because it's just way too bright. The curve isn't noticeable when looking at the screen straight on. It just seems natural. It also makes me want 2 more of the same for a "super wide screen" experience.I'm a gamer and don't find the "game mode" necessary -- response time is fast enough anyway in normal mode.Probably the only warning is that it doesn't take DVI, which has been a standard monitor plug for years. You can buy an adapter but these days you probably have HDMI or DisplayPort available anyway.

This is a fun little conversation piece. For the price, it's not bad. I kind of wish they'd leave off the ship name, actually, since it's a fairly generic model that they recycle (with minor modifications) for other ships -- what I'm saying is that this is not an accurate representation of the USS Constitution. Not really all that close, even. But that shouldn't necessarily stop you. Accurate models, from what I've found, will require you to build it yourself or else spend $500+ to buy a pre-assembled version. Those look fantastic and if you don't mind the $500, I'd say look into those.But for this price range, it's decent enough, and one of the things you can converse about over it is the differences between this model and the real thing!It arrived fully assembled and other than a little bit of untangling, was ready to go and ship shape (ho ho ho).

Note: Make sure you shop around for refills. Currently the ones on Amazon are double the price of the ones on the manufacturer's website.I had much better luck with this thing than I ever have with citronella candles. I think if nothing else, the fan wafting out repellent is better than the candles that mostly send it into the atmosphere along with the heat from the flame. Of course, if you only plan to use it for an hour or two every Sunday then the candles are more practical: you can always blow them out and save the rest for another day, whereas these pads will dry out.Still, we used it for an all day barbecue and hangout session and it worked notably better in its area than the candles and tiki torches did in theirs.Also note that the description of "accent lighting" is accurate. Some people seemed to expect an actual lantern (like a bright light) but this is really just for accent. It has a blue internal glow, about enough to see where the lantern is and that's it. The real question is if you think the price of the refills is worth it.

Edit:Upon further use, I find this shaver grows on me. There is a technique to its use, though. Because the rotatory blades are spaced so widely apart, you need to sort of rotate the shaver as you go, to get full coverage. The individual rotors do well with the fine detail and the flexible head helps with the jawline.So I've basically gone from hating it to liking it after thinking about and giving it another shot. Just be aware that if you're used to foils, blades or even other rotatory shavers with closer spacing, this will take some getting used to.The charging/cleaning system is a bit of a gimmick, of course. For a monthly fee, basically, it will clean your shaver for you. You could just wash it yourself, though, and use the charger as just a charger. The head pops off and comes apart fairly easily for cleaning.The variable length beard trimmer it comes with works well too, and pops on and off like the other shaver head.

This is an Android based streaming device with some interesting Nvidia twists meant to appeal to gamers (which I am!). My evaluation of it so far is "needs some more work".The #1 problem is the same as the Nexus: I don't know if this is Google trying to cut out Amazon or Amazon failing to work with Google but I don't see any way to view my Amazon digital content (Prime Movies, purchased movies, rented shows, music, etc) on this device. I think it locks you into the Google Play Store and the Amazon app is noticeably missing. That's the kiss of death for any device for me now -- I'm too invested in Amazon for digital content. If Amazon is to blame, tell me so I can send Jeff Bezos a Firmly Worded Letter. They shouldn't be trying to steer people into their Fire hardware as much as they should be trying to sell digital content to all sorts of devices. If Google is to blame then shame on them. Either way, though, as an Amazon Prime customer with lots of purchased Amazon content, this device screws me.The gaming angle of the Shield seems like a cool idea but:* I tried a free app game that somehow caused the Shield to turn off...?? I was playing it and the device just turned off. I had to unplug it and plug it back in to get it to turn back on.* I was surprised to learn that I could tie it into my desktop to play games from my desktop. Games that support a controller seem to show up automatically, so I got Planetside 2 and Witcher 3 on my list. This is pretty impressive and lets me play with a controller from my TV downstairs instead of sitting at my PC. In theory I think you're supposed to be able to play any game this way (although games without console controller support would be clunky) however I tried Magicka (which does support controllers) and the game crashed immediately. No idea why -- I went back to my desktop and tried it there and it started up just fine.So I see where they're going with it and there's some tempting features here but, even if we disregard the stability problems, Android gaming, while actually coming along nicely, is not up to par with a real console system. Desktop streaming is....I want to say a bit of a gimmick. Most PC games aren't practical for console control play and I don't have a real pressing need to play Planetside 2 from my couch instead of on my desktop.I guess the use-case here is if you want to be an early adopter, you want a streaming Android device, you get your digital content from Google Play exclusively, you want a greater ability to play games from your couch and you don't mind that early adopter pain that will go with it, go for it!Kind of a narrow audience, there.My vote is you wait for the "Nvidia Shield 2.0". Or maybe 6 months after this review by which time they may well have more things ironed out with software updates (I've already downloaded three big ones). But the physical problems of desktop vs couch are not going away anytime soon and I just don't see the Shield scratching too many people's itches.If you really want a streaming device for TV and don't care about games, get the Roku.If you want a streaming device that can do Android games (why do you want that?? does anyone??) I would actually go with the Amazon Fire over any of the Google devices.

Nosir, I don't like it. As a fan of Dresden Files, Iron Druid Chronicles and the Kate Daniels series I feel it's safe to say I like the genre, and I gave this series about 2.5 books before giving up on it, but in the end I just couldn't deal with it any more.The writing style is good and I enjoy the setting, the concept and the characters themselves, but what sent me over the edge was the character interaction: it's annoying and it never gets better. The main character might as well be a parody of abusive relationships and people who don't or can't get out of them because that's what she's in and well into the 3rd book it was still going on. The setup between the characters didn't make much sense and the "vampires are super dangerous creatures on the verge of going crazy at any moment but it's fine, we can live with them" concept didn't make sense either. I trudged through on the assumption that the character problems would get resolved at some point but, like I said, well into the 3rd book they were still a mess. It just wasn't enjoyable enough to keep giving it a try when there are so many other books to read.If you want a very similar series with better character interaction, try the Kate Daniels series.Or go ahead and try this book, but if you reach the end and think, "Man this is pretty good but I hope the character interaction gets better in the next book", that's what I thought. It doesn't.

I vouch for this entire series. Despite the rather ridiculous cover art and uninspired book titles, the content is fantastic -- series vs series, I think this actually beats out Dresden Files, which is high praise coming from me, and I'd put it tied with Iron Druid Chronicles.I like the characters, I like what they do and I like how the series progresses. Kate Daniels starts off powerful and stays that way with the series developing more around character interaction and political intrigue rather than personal power level advancement ("Dragon Ball Z Syndrome"). The writing is solid, if you can excuse the overuse of some terms (Kate Daniels drinking game! Take a shot every time you read the word "preternatural", especially around book 4...) Not everyone lives through every adventure, so it's enough to keep you on your toes, but it's no Game of Thrones either.Basically if you're looking for "modern day / altered reality fantasy with a strong female protagonist and good character interaction, dialog and action", you're in the right place.

I know -- "why pay so much?" Well, I've gone through so many of the cheaper showerheads. They keep breaking. The worst is when they crack at the base because the entire base -- where you hang the showerhead -- is actually hollow plastic, so that cracks and water sprays out!This one is still a plastic showerhead but usually that's not what causes problems anyway. The big difference is the solid metal piece that attaches to your pipe and is where you attach the hose and hang the showerhead. That's what you're paying for. There's no chance this thing can crack and break like all those cheaper ones I've gone through.And the head itself is nice enough. I wish it had a better "mist" setting but I do like the "pause" feature. I especially like the way you can set it to be "halfway paused" and get an even lighter water flow rate (that's nice when SOMEONE has been using all the hot water and you know you need to stretch what's left).Hose seems solid, no trouble at all with the connections, no leaks. Works great; hopefully it will prove worth the extra expense in the long haul.

These are the best, easiest to use drywall anchors I've ever tried. I literally just discard the drywall attachment options that come with things (like shelves) and use these instead. You don't want to screw up your drywall by using something too weak so if you want to get it right the first time, I don't think you can go wrong here.The "self-drilling" works pretty well. Personally I drill with a tiny bit first just to make sure I'm not going to hit a stud, then follow that hole with the self-drilling anchor. Works great. I've gone through 2 bags of these attaching various things and they're very solid.

Despite my 4 stars, I'd still suggest this is the best streaming box, overall, if only because of the number of apps it supports. There are things you can't get on Amazon Fire and things you can't get on the Google boxes but Roku has it all.It is pretty far from perfect, though. There are tons of "channels" (apps, really; one per streaming provider) and no standardization between them. They look different, they operate different, they have different requirements. Some are free, some are subscription, some are pay-per-view, some require you have active cable service and some offer different options and the only way to see which is which is to load them up and try them one by one. It's a hassle!So that's why I don't give 5 stars: the presentation is not great. Lots of room for standardization and improvement. Still, though, when my parents wanted to cut their cable, I got them a Roku. I took the time to sign them up to the good channels and get things organized and they still have to call me sometimes for some "how do I" questions but I think they're getting more enjoyment out of the Roku than they would have out of the other streaming box options. My one disclaimer is that I have never tried Apple streaming products, but I never will -- I hate the Apple ecosystem, I especially hate iTunes and I refuse to get drawn into that swamp. Even if the Apple box is superior in every way, I would still not recommend it because I wouldn't wish the Apple ecosystem on anyone. ("It's a trap!")Roku is still the best game in town in terms of giving you lots to watch and not restricting how you want it.If you're cutting cable, get a Roku and get an HD antenna and you're on your way. (I recommend Netflix as the #1 streaming app by far. Hulu Plus can be worthwhile if you watch a lot of current TV shows. Use Amazon as a fallback -- if I can't find what I want streaming, I will rent or buy digitally from Amazon. These 3 sources account for like 99% of my watching.)

(edit: Just wanted to say the more I use these, the more I stand by the 5-star rating. I think a lot of people simply have wrong ideas about what noise canceling does and have no experience with the concept. It does not eliminate all noise -- but it's very good at cutting out steady background noises like office vents and plane sounds. These are my daily use earbuds now at the office and they worked great when I went on vacation and had a 5+ hour flight each way.)I've never had actual noise canceling earbuds before -- most are just "noise isolating" which is to say they're kinda like earplugs that physically block out sound but these do that and additionally you get the electronic noise canceling.As someone else said, the real test is to put them in and then just turn on the power and see what difference you notice. Sitting in my old office building with the noisy ventilation system, it completely removes the noise of the vents. With some low volume music going I can't hear my coworkers talking or even understand what they're saying when they come up to me. (Make sure you use the correct size earpiece. It comes with 3 sizes. Too small and you won't get a seal and you'll hear too much noise. Too big and they won't be comfortable.)I compared them to my coworker's $300 Bose over-ear noise canceling headphones and these earbuds are not as good, but they're in the same neighborhood and for the price I think they're quite competitive.Caveats:* No power, no sound. The page right now says batteries are not included and not required but mine came with 1 battery and doesn't work without it.* The cable between the earbuds and the clip is too short. Or I'm too tall, I guess. It's fine when sitting but it's too short to clip to anything but a shirt pocket when standing up.Anyway, "no power no sound" is typical for noise canceling headphones and the cable length doesn't seem like enough to dock a star for. I don't honestly know why so many people hate these. I'm enjoying them right now in my office with a little Amazon Prime music going at low volume and can barely hear myself type and all of the usual office sounds are gone entirely.

These are perfect. The beads at the top make it slide easily and the simple hook-and-bulb design makes it easy to take my curtain and liner on and off for washing, without it popping off the hook by itself.I've always used the "clamping circle" design curtain hangers but those are such a hassle. Something like this is really mandatory if you use washable curtains.

I was staying at a hotel recently and the cloth showercurtain got me thinking: surely this is easier than with the "mold resistant" plastic type curtains I'd always used. Those are too stiff to take down and wash and you have to keep them clean or they will, in fact, get moldy. I thought a cloth shower curtain that can be washed made a lot of sense.So far so good! This thing is machine washable, hang dry or tumble dry low, no bleach (so say the directions). I figure that will make it much easier. I ordered some new shower hooks (Maytex Mills Metal Double Glide Shower Ring, Oil Rubbed Bronze, 12 Count) to go with them that will make it easier to put the curtain on and off and now it's in use! No problems so far. Pretty much what you'd expect. The "magnetic weights" are really just a couple of button magnets on the bottom but I didn't have any problem with the curtain flying around. Stitching all looks good. I see other reviewers are upset that the waffle pattern is not waffly enough but it looks fine to me.I'll update if mold becomes a problem but I expect putting it through the wash periodically will suffice.

This is one of those things you didn't know you needed til you had one: tongs with a built in light.Nicely executed design, too. There's a "gravity lock", I guess you'd call it, so that when then tongs are pointed down (as if you were grabbing something), they are unlocked and will swing wide open. Point the tongs up (or slide the little metal bit back with your finger) and they will lock closed for storage.Dishwasher safe. Straightforward. The light easily slides out with a button push and is very bright. So far so good!

This is what I'd call a decent first step towards having an actual "personal assistant". It's nice to wake up in the morning and ask "Alexa, what's the weather?" so I know what to expect, without having to punch up my weather app on my phone.It's nice to be reading a book, see a word I'm unsure of and say "Alexa, define ____".Or to say, "Alexa, play Shovels and Rope" when I'm in the mood to listen to some Shovels and Rope! Or I can just say, "Alexa, play music" and it will pick a random playlist from Prime music based on the music I like. Then I can say "Alexa, what song is this" and "Alexa, buy this song/album" if I hear something new that I like.With a Wemo wall plug I actually have a heater plugged in and I can say "Alexa, turn on/off the heater." I did a heater but you could also imagine using it to turn lights on and off. Wemo plugs aren't cheap right now but you can see which direction the technology is going.The amount of stuff the Echo understands out of the box is fairly impressive. You don't really need to look at a list of commands (although that may help you understand what all it can do) -- just ask it things and you may be surprised.The limitation in this device is mainly that it's just 1 device for just 1 room and, of course, there's no display. In the future I'd like to see a way to tie in a host of cheap microphone+speaker combos that communicate to a central unit so we can easily have "Alexa" in every room without having to purchase numerous discrete "Amazon Echo" boxes. Still, I think this was something of a test run by Amazon, as evidenced by the limited release and the fact that they wouldn't let us review it for a long time. This was a sink-or-swim idea, I believe, and I believe it has swam.Now I just need "Alexa" on my phone. I miss being able to do this stuff when I'm in my car!

This is a necessity for any office or home office. Why mess with conventional staplers that sometimes have a hard time punching through papers, end up bending the staples in the act of trying and make you slam the stapler to get it through all the pages, maybe ending up with multiple staple holes as you have to redo it?With this, you can't go wrong. Load it up, plug it in, put the papers in the narrow slot and POW: stapled sheets.No problems with it so far. Kinda wish it had an off switch but you can just leave it plugged in.

These are fantastic. I've had quite a lot of Mountain House freeze dried food as well as AlpineAire brand and both are great. Mountain House offers these big cans that are suitable for group outings, trailer/RV camping and long term food storage but for backpacking be sure to look for the individual pouches that are also available. The cans are not meant for backpacking and while you could open the can and parcel things out in ziplock bags before the trip, you'd keep your food fresher and safer by just buying the individual serving packets. (Conversely, the individual bags have a shelf-life of around 5 years, versus 25 years for the cans, so for long term storage the cans are the way to go.)So anyway, freeze dried apples. You don't rehydrate these. Just eat them straight out of the can. They're light, crispy and delicious. Just for kicks I tried rehydrating some but found they came out a bit too leathery. It would probably work as a cereal/outmeal mixer if you broke them up before rehyradting them so you end up with small pieces of apple (which, perhaps not coincidentally, is exactly what you get in those bags of Quaker instant cinnamon and apple oatmeal) but as an out-of-the-can snack that doesn't require any preparation this is one of the best choices.

It turned colder after I put the seeds down (though not below freezing), and this probably contributed to the low and slow rate of germination, but 3 weeks later it does seem to be doing well enough and is growing in an area that is normally bare. Regular seed I put down a few years ago didn't take -- the area gets some sun but it's under trees most of the day and tends to be mostly dirt and moss.I actually bought another bag and put that down about a week ago, hoping this will fill in quicker since the weather has been warmer. Some of that is already sprouting. I still feel like the germination rate is low (there are plenty of highly visible blue seeds still laying there) but I'll call it a win if I actually end up with grass in this area. So, provisional 4 stars -- I feel like it should take better than it is but so far it's having some success where other grasses haven't.

If you haven't heard a harp being used outside of classical music, you should really give this EP a shot. Abigail Palmer has a great vocal range to accompany the harp playing in a variety of styles and, well, it's magical. The recording quality is superb -- this is clearly a studio recording. A lot of small groups release CDs that are simply recorded from a live show. I know it's a lot cheaper, but you can't beat studio recording quality and that's what you're buying here.I saw them play live and picked up an advance copy of the EP there. You should definitely catch them live if possible because if you've never gotten to watch a harp being played up close, you're missing out, but the EP delivers a depth, balance and clarity that's hard to get at a live show and you would not be amiss to start off your Abigail Palmer Group fandom with this.

Make SURE you buy some good drywall anchors to use with this. I used the "Toggler Snapskru Self-Drilling Drywall Anchor" that Amazon had listed as "frequently purchased with" and those worked great. The screws and anchors included in the box are junk and will not let the shelf hold any weight without pulling away from the wall. I drilled a small hole to make sure I wouldn't hit a stud and to guide the anchor in, then drilled in the SnapSkru anchor and that worked great. Shelves are very solid now.The shelf material itself is pretty cheap -- laminate over some sort of hollow sounding material. Particle board or similar, I imagine. But it looks nice and apparently this is just what you get for this sort of price range. (You'd think "a flat piece of wood" would not be that expensive but the only genuine wood shelves I could find were 5x more expensive.) Gonna go with 4 stars because once you use better anchors, the shelves are functional. Actually came back to buy some more.....and some more of those Snapskru anchors.

This is a very well thought out humidifier. The only caution I have with it is the noise. I'm not sure how to quantify the noise level other than it competes with my gaming desktop computer when it's on high. By far the most disturbing thing is that if you put it on auto-fan, it may shift between high, low and off and I personally found it hard to sleep with in my room like that. I'd say go ahead and get this humidifier but just set the fan to "low" full time. (Really, even "high" full time is fine. It's a bit loud but you get used to it. It's the auto-setting switching between loud and not-loud that makes it hard to sleep through. You're just about to nod off to a quiet wrrrrrrrr and then suddenly it's WRRRRRRR...)All that said, I'm gonna go ahead and give it 5 stars. I have a lot of experience with humidifiers and this is easily my favorite.So humidifiers come in 3 types: "spritzers", "boilers" and "evaporators". I dunno if that's the proper terms, that's just what I call em. Spritzers will spritz a fine mist of water into the air periodically. This evaporates and adds humidity to your house that way. The problem with these is that tap water has minerals in it and these minerals will be left behind after the water evaporates. That's the "dust" everyone talks about these things leaving behind. The dust are mineral deposits. You can avoid this by using distilled (not "spring" or "filtered" -- distilled) water but that's a lot more expensive than just using tap water. Spritzers are my least favorite kind for this reason.Boilers are my previous favorite type. They literally boil water in a chamber inside the unit and waft out steam. The boiling means that you get pure water steam coming out of the unit -- no minerals get scattered around your house. The downside is that the minerals get left behind in the boiling chamber. There are mineral absorption pads but they only do so much. In the end you have to clean the thing of mineral deposits periodically and that's a pain. Some of these units are well designed to make cleaning fairly easy but it's still pretty far from maintenance free. They are also not the best idea for toddlers since they will have boiling water inside the unit and be releasing hot steam out of the top.And then there's what this unit is: evaporative. Inside the unit is basically a big wick that absorbs the water you put into the unit. A fan blows over this and the water evaporates into the air, leaving any mineral deposits behind in the wick. Replace the wick periodically and Bob's your uncle. All things considered I feel like this is the best type of humidifier. The only downside is that they tend to be the loudest. Spritzers are silent most of the time. Boilers make a gentle boiling sound and usually just have a tiny fan to waft out the steam. Evaporators have to move more air so they need more of a fan and in a small unit like this, it's a noticeable noise.The design itself of this unit is well done overall though. The fan is well protected from little fingers. The water in the unit will be room temperature so the worst that can happen is a water spill. The water bottle is easy to fill and I love that a light comes on when the water is low to let you know it needs more. The humidistat on this unit is the best I've seen, actually letting you set a humidity level by percentage (must units just have a largely meaningless dial -- you can turn the dial but there's no indication what you're setting it to). You can also lock the buttons to keep busy fingers from easily changing the settings.Really there's nothing particularly "childish" about this humidifier other than it's designed to be toddler-resistant.Note that if you're humidifying a house (and not just a closed room) you'll want to buy more than one of these.

This is the quietest air purifier I've ever not-heard. On the lowest setting it still moves a good volume of air but having it in my kitchen leaves it as completely inaudible against other background noises. It has some basic timer functions but since it's so quiet I just leave it running on the lowest setting full time. The highest setting, of course, is quite audible (though not what I'd call "loud") and blows quite a lot of air through. I like that in addition to filtering dust, it has a odor absorbing filter. Filters are easy to change -- no tools required.The big thing in favor of this unit is the solid construction. I've had other air purifiers in the past and they tend to vibrate, as in the unit itself vibrates and makes noise regardless of what surface you put it on, I guess because they just don't usually make them to tight specs. This unit seems solid though. Nothing vibrates. Just a smooth air flow. I put it on a metal rack and it's still silent.

I'm using this as an automatic backup device. I put lots of music, videos and pictures on my phone and am constantly running out of storage space. I have a hard time deciding what to delete. This seems to solve the dilemma: I delete all of my photos and videos after uploading them to the device, because then I can access them easily on the computer OR the phone later, as long as I have the hard drive with me.Getting it up and running using Android and Windows was simple enough. Basically you connect directly to the device (which shows up as a wifi hub) and then you can configure it -- set security, rename it, and configure the device to connect to the internet -- and off you go. It then showed up on my network so that my computer could see it as well, as if it was a shared Windows box (you can disable this part if you are on a public network -- there's a button for that when you go to connect it).The whole process is "less than intuitive" but frankly about as easy as you're likely to get, considering what you need to do. The fact that the device can connect to the internet is a nice touch as it means you can connect to the device and still browse the internet while connected (I've seen other devices that don't do this -- when you are connected to it, you don't have internet access). So that's a nice touch.The device itself is lightweight, portable, can be charged through USB and all of your data transfers are done via wifi. It's important that it acts as a wifi hub as this means you don't need some 3rd party wifi (like the one in your hotel room) to communicate with it. You connect directly.All in all I'm pretty happy with it. I'm honestly not sure how hard it is to move individual files around. I just set it to auto-backup everything and let it roll.

You might have come here to read reviews and ask, "What should I get? A Nexus Player from Google or the Amazon Fire TV?"The very fact that you are here, on Amazon, suggests the answer is probably "Amazon Fire TV".The two devices are essentially identical with the notable exception that the Fire TV does not give you access to the Google Play store and the Nexus does not give you access to the Amazon store or Prime functions. For me, that's a bit of a deal breaker, seeing how literally 100% of my music and movies are already on Amazon. Whatever device I get must support Amazon apps and if you make me choose between Google and Amazon, I'm going to go with Amazon every time.I don't have a Roku so I'm not sure how that compares, but a brief internet search says that might still be the best option, as apparently it supports Amazon content AND Google Play content (plus lots of other stuff). The Nexus and Fire are still very limited in their channel selection in addition to being mutually exclusive.So I still rate this device highly because it is quite functional and works well if what you want is Google Play, Youtube, Netflix and a couple other things but I would still put it under the Amazon Fire for actual Amazon customers and probably put both of them under the Roku in terms of supported content.

Note: you can search YouTube for most (all?) of these songs and find them, as played directly from the book. I found this helpful later on as the songs got more complex and, without a teacher, I wasn't sure I was doing them correctly. Kind of eliminates the need to get a book with a CD. If anything, the YouTube videos are better than a CD because you can also look at the fingering the player is using. Try searching for [song name] + "Palmer-Hughes".Anyway, I'm starting accordion from ground zero (no music knowledge what-so-ever) and have been enjoying this book greatly. I can feel the progress from day to day as each song goes from "well clearly that's impossible" to "I almost got the whole thing perfect that time". The book is pretty well aimed at, oh, 10 year olds, but as that's roughly my knowledge level when it comes to music, it's fitting enough. Okay, so I found it a little annoying to have to grind through a song that's only slightly different from "Mary Had a Little Lamb" but each song is making you learn different combinations of beats and finger movements that does help you master the basics before moving on and some of the songs are quite fun.You should also look at the "1A" and "1B" books. The "A & B" books are roughly the same thing, expanded just slightly. There are some songs in 1A and 1B that do not appear in 1 and vice versa so you could conceivably buy 1A, 1B and 1 and get use out of all of them. That's what I did, just to decide which was the better way and I kind of like having all 3. It's nice when you want a little more variety on techniques you already know but don't feel ready to move forward yet.Book 1 only requires a 12 bass button piano accordion but there will be a few extra things you can do if you have a full accordion.

I hate flossing. And when I say "I hate flossing" I mostly mean "I don't floss".I will keep using this thing, though. It's simple to use and seems like a good match for my electric toothbrush. The electric brush is great for your gums but obviously isn't going to do as well for getting between teeth. This Airfloss system handles that part. It couldn't be easier to use. Fill up the reservoir and move it between your teeth. If you hold down the button it does a "shoot / pause / shoot" routine to give you a second to move between teeth or you can just press and release the button to set your own pace.Rechargeable electric and comes with everything you need.
