But you will use up a lot of extra plastic by doing this.This is easy to install, but tedious folks! You'll be spending several hours if you care about precision and want the sheets properly stretched tight. Less than an hour if you just want to get it up and don't care about precise cuts or looseness.

This is one of those products that I've been wavering on for the longest time, because it's a very doable DIY project. You can build one easily. But ultimately, I know it just wouldn't look as nice, and I like nice looking things, so I bought it! Instructions aren't the best in the world, but it doesn't take a genius to figure it out either. To save some of you any aggravation, here's a tip. The arm bar is shape like a U. On one end of the U is a pre-drilled screw hole with a screw already inserted. You will see the "spool holder" already attached also, and the screw is preventing it from sliding out. I don't know the proper lingo, so lets just call it spool holder. Anyway, you need to unscrew the screw and let the spool holder slide out. You will then slide this same side, now with the empty screw hole, into the base where it will line up with another screw hole, and it will be secured in place with a screw that has a knob for easy tightening and releasing. The spool holder actually belongs on the side without the screw holes. There is a tightening mechanism on the spool holder that allows it to stay in place.I suspect Proxxon put the spool holder there for transport reasons only because it does not belong on that end. They don't even mention it in their instructions. They could actually avoid confusion by packaging the spool holder separately. Because initially, what you'll do if you didn't read my review, is leave the spool holder alone because after all, it's installed there by the factory. You'll then insert the side with no screw hole into the base and stand there like an early Neanderthal, scratching your head, looking at the instructions, looking back at the base, scratch your head, look at instructions again, make grunting noises, etc. That's what I did. LOL!Anyway, in terms of function, it's great. It heats up very fast. Something strange happened though. It stopped heating. I don't know if it's because I used it for too long a period without resting, or if it's because the tension needed to be adjusted. Because after tinkering with the tension of the wire, it heated up again. I don't want to return this if that's just a common quirk with these things. But I'll be definitely using it like crazy for the next 15 days to see whether or not I need to return my unit for a replacement. The fence is a great accessory for steady straight cuts, as well as miters. The spool can be sled back so the wire is at an angle, this is of course, for angle cuts. The whole thing is so versatile. A definite buy in my book!

It's all about simplicity. This is a no brainer for those who don't have anything remotely similar. If your tv is "dumb," and you don't own a roku, apple tv, ps3, etc. Then this is a no brainer! Even if you have one of those stand alone products with the netflix and youtube apps, I'll tell you why you should still buy it. Products allowing you to play netflix or youtube on the big screen are not new, but that's not the point of the chromecast. The chromecast is all about the "HOW."Because of this dongle, I'm watching more and more netflix and youtube on the big screen. You know why? Because chromecast is the closest thing to feeling like the app is a part of your regular cable line-up. In the past, If I'm browsing and messing around on youtube, I do not bother to fire up the PS3, and if I own a google tv or apple tv, I probably wouldn't bother turning on those boxes either. It's just faster to browse with your keyboard and just watch the clips on your notebook. In the past, watching Netflix on the big screen is something I had to prepare for. I have to browse and search on my smartphone or notebook first, add the movie that I want to watch to my que, then turn on the ps3. Because highlighting letters with your controller pad is stupid and impractical. And the funny thing is my TivoHD has a netflix app too, but highlighting letters on the tivo remote was even more excruciating and worse than the ps3.Hence, this is why the "HOW" part of the chromecast is so awesome. You're already browsing and searching with your smartphone or tablet, now just hit play. No need to power up anything else. No need to buy mouses, air-mouses or media center keyboards for your roku or ps3. YOUR SMARTPHONE DOES IT ALL!!!! That's the point folks! No extra mouse, keyboards, or accessories cluttering your coffee table. And you can still use your smartphone to do anything else you want. The chromecast is processing the video from the cloud. Your smartphone is free! That's why I say it's the closest thing to feeling like Netflix and Youtube are a part of my cable line-up. I can get to these apps quickly! No need to power on anything else or fetch keyboards and controller pads. That's why we hardly watch youtube on the big screen. The hassle is not worth it for short videos. With chromecast, we've been watching more youtube. When a few of my family members are sitting around, I always take the opportunity to cast a few funny videos, or share interesting videos I've seen. In the past, would I bother to ask everyone to huddle around my notebook, fire up the PS3, or hdmi out my notebook to the big screen? NOPE. Another cool thing is that anyone with a smartphone can start casting videos too. You can show a funny video, and your friend or family can try and top you with a funnier video from their smartphone. This is something that you cannot experience with any other product out there.Of course, they need to develop this and add more apps. As it is with just Netflix and Youtube, it's already worth the $35. When they develop more apps, especially an app that will allow us to play our own videos and view photos from the cloud, then this dongle will be the bargain of the century. Right now, you can play local videos by loading the video into your pc's chrome browser, then cast the tab. But this uses your computer's processor and if you view in full-screen, then you can't do anything else with your computer. I consider this a "work-around" and I hope they give us a dedicated app soon. Also, this "work-around" is not possible on your smartphone or tablet. Even if it was possible, it would use your phone's processor and eat up its battery. So those complaining about this, just be patient and wait for a real dedicated app.We are creatures of habit, and this chromecast happens to be very compatible with my habits. I understand my review may not sound appealing to someone else who has different habits. But if you can relate to some of the things I just wrote about, then buy it, you won't regret it. If you don't like using your Smartphone for everything, then don't buy it. But then I would have to ask, why did you buy a "smart" phone? I think you would be missing out on it's capabilities. You paid up the wazoo for your smartphone. Use it for something else other than texting! I read a review where the person said they rather have a dedicated remote because they don't always have the smartphone on them. Seriously, think of what you're saying folks! If I called you right now, you wouldn't pick up the phone because it's placed somewhere far away? I don't know anyone who stashes away their cell-phone to the point, they can't hear it or reach it. C'mon, stop resisting! This chromecast is awesome and it simply makes sense! The more you resist, the more you don't make sense. LOL!-------------SET-UP TIPS--------------If phone set-up isn't working, go to notebook. Vice versa, if notebook isn't working, then set-up on phone.-When it fails and says TRY AGAIN, close the app.-Disconnect router, reconnect router. (sometimes, magical things happen when you disconnect. The router just figures itself out.)-Disconnect chromecast power, reconnect chromecast.-Start Set-up App again and try it again.I have two chromecast and my first set-up was one shot and smooth. My second chromecast took some fiddling, but I did those steps above and it connected. I also took it to a friends home and tried it on his network. When it failed, I did those same steps above and it worked again. I highly recommend doing these disconnecting/reconnecting tips before spending hours on the phone with a rep.-----------------------9/11/2013 UPDATE TIPS------------------------In my review I mentioned that your notebooks is rendered useless when you cast full screen to your big tv using the chrome browser. I learned that if you hit the ALT+TAB buttons, you can regain your notebook while the tv is still casting your movie in full screen. Awesome! Keep in mind, this is still a "work-around." It's not ideal to watch a movie because the streaming is crappy and your PC is processing. Ideally you want the Google folks to create more apps like Hulu, Amazon Prime, etc. Casting from the browser is ideal for photos, presentations, etc. I wouldn't recommend it for movies.-To cast Amazon prime in your chrome browser (from your notebook of course), uninstall microsoft silverlight. Next time you play an Amazon movie, it'll ask if you want to install silverlight or use adobe flash. Choose adobe flash, and enjoy!
100% brass! This will last you a lifetime! What I also like about this Jaclo bracket is the design. It's not generic and does not look like the majority of brackets out there.

This is not an Amazon verified purchase because I got mine at my local Lowes for $8.68. So check out your local store before paying $15.These jaws are just what the doctor ordered! To make sure my objects are not scratched, I used to wrap them with cloth, rubber, etc. This is making my job much easier!! And because the objects I work with are round, it would spin free from my vise and get all scratched up because I used to be afraid of putting too much pressure on them. These jaws solved so many issues for me! I now can apply a lot of pressure without worrying about it marring. And Its rubber traction and cut-outs prevent round objects from spinning. My vise is only 3" wide, this thing is 6" so it looks kind of weird if your vise is not exactly 6". I think you can actually just cut to size. But I'm not going to do that. The different grooves and cut-outs are useful for different tasks and I can slide the jaws and line it up to what I want to use. So the fact that it's magnetic, makes it perfect. Because if it uses adhesion then I wouldn't be able to slide it up and down.Terrific!!

Like many, I would have given this product a 1 star review too, but something told me not to do it. Something told me this is one of those stupid things where you realize it is you who is the dummy and not the product. The way this organizer works is that there is a flap that you slide under your bed, and the unit is supposed to stay in place. But like many have reported, once you add items and weight to it, the flap starts to slide out. There is not enough friction or pressure from the bed. I figured I could use some sort of large clip against the side of the rail, Velcro, double sided tape, etc. But decided to take a closer look at the product itself. I found out that at the end of the flap hidden inside the fabric is a thin bar. Well I felt this bar before, but never paid much attention to it. I just thought it's there so the flap won't be completely flimsy. I decided that there might be a purpose to it. I had a hunch. So I bent it and sure enough, I was right!! It's bendable wire/bar!! I think the purpose is for you to create traction for your bed. I bent a few V-grooves, you know like the peaks and valleys of a Chinese hand fan. Now when you place it under your bed, you've got traction. I've added weight to the organizer and it stays in place.Now there are no instructions. Makes me wonder if my discovery is an unintentional benefit. If the intention of the "hidden" bendable bar is to allow you to create traction, then why were there no instructions? So many people are giving this product 1 star reviews because this feature, intentional or not, is not obvious. In any case, follow my tip and you'll get good use out of this organizer.

My package is missing the stylus and OTG Cable. So until they send it to me, I'll have to knock off 1 star. Otherwise, it's perfect! My GN started getting very sluggish, and I didn't know why. Recently, the phone would just black out after 10 minutes of usage after being fully charged. So I knew it was time for some new batteries. The batteries do not sit flush on the charger, but It actually makes mounting and dismounting easier. The charger will change from pinkish/redish to blue to indicate complete charge. Some people complain that the wall charger takes longer to charge, I didn't notice that, but I wasn't waiting by the wall. LOL! My package is missing the stylus, which I have no use for. But the OTG cable adapter will definitely be useful. Will bump to 5 stars once the seller sends me the missing items.

I also gave the TK-209K 5 stars, but this IOGEAR is better. The cabling system on this unit allows you stash all the ugliness under your desk because you have a remote for switching. Whereas the switching for the Trendnet version is on the unit itself, so if you want to hide all the cabling, you'll need to bend down under your desk every time to switch. The price is approx the same, but I would have paid an extra $10 for this IOGEAR's cabling system alone.Another interesting thing that may be just unique to my situation, but my desktop has two monitor outputs and I have a dual display set-up. I use this switch to share my notebook with one of the monitors, so at any given time, I could have 3 screens going, the two from the desktop and the notebook screen. Well, when I used the Trendnet TK-209K, the monitor that was not connected to the KVM did not know how to shut-off when it was time to power off. I would have to manually turn it off. When using this IOGEAR, everything shuts off as it should.Here's a tip... The unit only has 2 available USB ports. It's meant for you to plug in your mouse and keyboard usb. If you have a Logitech unifying receiver that controls both keyboard and mouse with just 1 usb, then that will free up a port. And even better yet, it works with hubs! And that's what I used. This way, you can share many more peripherals besides just keyboard and mouse.

SOCKET REDUCER are the two key words folks!"Medium to Candelabra" can be confusing. If you're looking from the SOCKET point of view, which you should, then it means what it says, which is reducing the medium socket to candelabra size.Some people are looking at it from the BULB point of view, thinking that they are reducing the medium base to candelabra size, so that the can then thread it into a candelabra socket.I will buy more! Econotone shipped fast!

My Desktop has a video card that has two monitor outputs, one is VGA out and the other is DVI-I out. They are each hooked up to a monitor. I wanted to hook up this KVM switch in order to share the keyboard, mouse and one of the Monitors with my notebook. So I used the Desktop's VGA port. The switch works as it should. The notebook was able to share the VGA monitor. The notebook monitor and vga monitor can be on at the same time, it can duplicate or extend as expected.I also have a Macbook Air that I tried to test out. But as you know, it doesn't have a VGA port. I had a thunderbolt to VGA cable, but the VGA end was male. You need a female end because the Trendnet VGA cable is also male. So you would need something like this: Patuoxun Thunderbolt Mini Display-port to VGA Cable Adapter For Apple MacBook Pro Air iMAC with Cable TieOne last thing. No matter what you're hooking up, you need an available USB port because the Trendnet VGA cable is a 2 in 1 cable. It also has a USB that you need to connect to your computer. Because this KVM switch is USB powered. There is no power adapter.UPDATE 5/7/2013---------------I'm knocking a star off because I didn't know about the IOGEAR GCS72U. I wrote a review on that as well. It has made me realized that the Trendnet design is inferior. The cable management by the IOGEAR is far superior due to the remote feature which allows you hide all the ugly cables away. Both cost approx the same, that's why I have to knock off a star for the Trendnet. I'm keeping both though because I have another set-up in the garage. So I'll be back to update both reviews regarding each version's longevity. There are so many reviews about FAILURES after a certain amount of time, so we'll see.

My video card has a VGA out and a DVI-I out. I've been only using the VGA output. Found an extra VGA monitor laying around and wanted a dual monitor set-up, so I needed a DVI-I to VGA. This worked perfectly. When it comes to computing, disregard people who make definitive statements like DON'T BUY THIS, or THIS DOES NOT WORK. If you know anything about computers, then you know there are so many variables as to why things don't work such as old hardware, firmware, drivers, etc. You need to trial and error yourself and don't take other people's word for it. Especially when you buy from Amazon, if it doesn't work out, you can return it.Just make sure you know the difference between DVI-I and DVI-D. This cable is for DVI-I. Do what I did, if you're not sure. Go to yahoo search engine and search DVI-I vs DVI-D. Then click on images. The very first image explains it all. Then go to you computer and take a look at your connection and see which one you have. This is probably one of the reasons why people say the cable doesn't work. They are buying the wrong cable!!

Have you seen those science specials where they show you they've develop a way to control the mouse cursor with just brain thoughts? Well, that technology is a long ways from being practical. In the meantime, a trackball is the closest thing to that! LOL! It's main value is really not at the desk because a wired mouse at the desk will do the same job. It's true value is when you're laying on your couch or your bed. So practical and comfy! It takes time to get used to it. Call it a training period. Some people don't pass this training period and they go back to wired or optical mouses. Those who pass never look back.

Cuts like butter! I'm new with jigsaws so cutting curves is still tough. The minor imperfections has to do with the top light button and the back speed dial. I saw a youtube review of this jigsaw by toolselecttv, you should check it out, it's very informative. Anyway, the user said the light button doesn't feel good when he presses it. I thought it could be just an isolated imperfection on his unit. But now that I own this, I know what he means. When you press the button, there is no click, you'll only know it's working when the light turns on. Sometimes I have to dig my nails into the button to turn it on. Another minor imperfection is the speed dial, you scroll to select your speed. Well, the scroll doesn't give a solid click either. It's a very subtle quiet click. But I'm lucky that I do not have the metal shoe issue. Mine slides in and out with no problem. I'm also lucky in that I got this from Amazon Warehouse Deals for $203. It was labeled as "LIKE NEW." When I got it, it looked like it was never even used. There is one right now in Amazon Warehouse for $264, same "LIKE NEW" label. For me, it was $203 so I guess I got lucky getting it on a very low price fluctuation day. Or, did they make a mistake and priced it as if it had no L Boxx? Because I got the whole sha-bang! :)

This is not a verified purchase review since I bought mine elsewhere. But just wanted to say this is exactly what you want. There seems to be confusion among people. Some are not happy because they think they should be getting the blue label 950mah version. Well, that version is faulty and many users, including me, have experienced the swelling/bloating issue. You'll need to pry out your battery. Here's a tip to pry out your battery... Remove the battery cover. Cut an expired credit card in half lengthwise and slide it under the battery that's still stuck. Using the credit card and some jiggling, try and slide the battery out as much as possible. Then use an A clamp to grip the entire remote. Make sure the point of pressure is resting on the exposed part of the battery. Cut a cardboard paper or get some cloth to layer the side with the buttons so your clamp doesn't scratch your remote. Once you have the A clamp on properly, just slide out your remote. The clamp will be holding firmly onto the battery while the entire remote will be sliding out. It won't slide out entirely, but just enough so you can undo the A clamp and remove the battery manually.If you contact Logitech, they will most likely send you a white label 930mah version since this one does not have the swelling issues.

I got a Pixel Pro Digital & Film Camera 100M Wireless Shutter Remote Control Release for Canon EOS 60D 1000D 550d 500D 450D 400D 350D 300D Powershot Pentax Samsung Contax , replaces Canon RS-60E3, but unfortunately you cannot control the video record button. The Pixel Pro is a far superior product. I recommend getting that one for shooting pictures because it is not line of sight and it's better built. You get both a transmitter and receiver.This cheap Opteka will do both pictures and video but you have to stand in front of the camera. There is no receiver. I guess your camera has a built in receiver, and once again, it's cheap. I don't expect this to last long. I need to do an occasional video review of products so this remote will do.

This review is geared towards 7 1/4 Circular Saw owners who want to add a laser guide.I love my DWE575SB circular saw, and wanted to add this laser to make it the perfect saw. Why are lasers only featured in budget circular saws for like less than $70? The more expensive ones do not have a laser guide, strange. Anyway, this did not fit my saw. It all boils down to how your lower blade guard is designed, and whether or not it's close to the outer center washer where you mount the blade. This laser guide is basically a washer. You remove your manufacture one and the laser guide serves as your new outer washer. The problem for me is that the design of my lower blade guard is a bit fancy schmancy. A part of it protrudes out like a wave. It serves no purpose, other than for aesthetics. This protrusion is close to the center, so it gets in the way of the laser guide. It does not get in the way of the original manufacture washer because that's much smaller than the laser guide. I can make room for the laser guide if I break off or saw off that protrusion. At this point, I'm not willing to do that yet because I don't know how well the laser guide works. This laser is going back.I have uploaded a picture explaining this. I believe I'm the 6th picture. http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo1FKM3OYDDQ18V/B000CRE7Q4/ref=cm_ciu_images_pl_link

This is my first so I have no experience and nothing to compare it to. However, I can't imagine why anyone would choose one without the electric brake. Currently, the DWE575SB is only $10 more than the DWE575 and absolutely worth it. Power tools, especially saws, are dangerous and the sooner you can have the blade stop, the better. Finished my first project today, just a basic stand, and the cutting was smooth. I ordered a Diablo 60t blade, but they're backorderd, so I got a Dewalt 60t. Your saw will come with a 18t blade. If you need fine smooth cuts, buy a blade with more teeth, 60t was fine for me. Once again, I just love how once I'm done cutting, the blades will stop spinning almost immediately. I watch a lot of youtube videos and I see people waiting for the blade to stop. The SB edition is totally worth it! I use this saw in conjunction with the Kreg KMA2600 Square-Cut, a tool that is invaluable. Lastly, I chose this saw because of the weight. It's considered the lightest in the market. Still feels heavy to me, so if you're a person of smaller stature like me, you should definitely get this saw. It will still feel heavy to you, so imagine what other saws will feel like.Make sure you clamp your workpiece. I use a Rockwell Jawhorse. I'm a newbie I did so much reading and preparation. My advice to beginners is read the circular saw manual, watch youtube videos about kickbacks, buy all the necessary accessories like sawhorses, goggles, earplugs, clamps, etc. and just be prepared. Search youtube for circular saw accident videos as well, they will sober you up. It will scare the crap out of you, which is a good thing because then you're not going to rush through things. Being scared will force you to do everything right. Will force you to read the manual and understand and be aware of all the dangers. Once you're educated and get through your first project, the circular saw won't be so intimidating. You'll be searching for more projects!Lastly, I was pleasantly surprised that a nice Dewalt carrying bag was included. A reviewer for the DWE575 said there was no carrying case in his list of cons. The word "case" and "bag" are often used interchangeably, so I'm not sure if he got a bag and wanted a hard case, or if he got nothing. I'm thinking the DWE575 doesn't come with anything otherwise, he would have mentioned the carrying "bag." Point is for $10 more, you're getting the carrying bag and the electric brake feature. It's a no brainer!This is not a verified purchase review because I got mine at Lowes.

I have not shopped for monitors for about a decade. The last time I bought a monitor, LCDs and CRTs were still pretty mixed in the market. My 19" Sony LCD cost about $600. I cannot believe prices of LCD/LED monitors now. WOW! I got this baby for $109 during this past weekends Black Friday lightning deals. You should have no problems hooking this up because I'm running an old school Dell Insprion 9100 with Windows XP and this monitor booted up without issues. It will prompt you to install the latest drivers, which is included in the CD. The picture is awesome, but I have to admit, I'm not a videophile. I'm not picky and for less than $150, how can you be picky? This thing has all the connections you need including HDMI. I did my research this past weekend and so many sub $200 monitors do not have HDMI. There is no VESA mount, so DO NOT buy this if you need to mount. I bought this for my garage, so it did not need to be the highest quality and for $109 it was a no brainer. If you simply want a nice picture, more screen real estate, HDMI, and you do not care to mount, you can't go wrong. Even at $134, it's a bargain.

If you "KNOW" how to use a pvc cutter then please disregard the 1 star review by the other poster (JR VALDES). He says it may be best for 1/2 inch pipes? He's obviously using it incorrectly. It is designed for up to 2 inch pipes and that's what I cut with EASE. Based on his review, you can tell he's a rookie with this tool. His comment about how you need to use a lot of force and how it doesn't cut all the way, so he has to twist it off at the end is classic newbie mistake. He's probably making the mistake of using it like a scissor. If you use this tool like a scissor or garden snipper, then it won't work. This is a PVC cutter. You open it up as wide as possible and line up the pipe inside its jaw. Now you slowly close the handles making sure the blade is lining up where you want to cut. At this point, newbies will force it all the way thinking it's a scissor. You cannot do that, you need to pull the handle apart again, and the mechanism winds up, you'll hear a click. That means it's ready for you to close the handle again, after you close the handle as much as you can, you pull the handle apart to rewind, always wait till you hear the click, then close it again, pull apart, close again, pull apart, close again. As much as you need to, get the picture? It's hard to describe in words, but it is the opposite effect of a scissor. If you pull the handles of a scissor apart, then obviously there is nothing left to grip your object, it falls out. With a ratcheting jaw, each time you pull apart the handle, the object is still held in place, and each time you close, the jaw just keeps biting in further and further, and it doesn't take a lot of strength, especially if you're using the floor for support. By using the floor to brace one side of the handle, I'm free to grip the upper handle with both hands, and simply push down. Then pull apart, push down, pull apart, push down, etc. It gets easier with each crank. It takes me two or three quick cranks and the 2 inch pipe is sliced perfectly, just like butter. It is awesome, I just finished building a stand for a workbench. I can not imagine getting through my project without this cutter.I got mine at Home Depot for $30. Highly recommended.

I was surprised that it came with a case, and it's a nice case too! The flashlight itself is of very high quality, and has a nice weight to it. Take a look at the COAST logo, not sure if you can tell in the picture, but you should know that the logo is printed on a flat surface. They indented that section and flattened it. Why does this matter? Because on the other side is the same flat indentation, only it is left blank. So if you choose to, you can have someone's name engraved on a plate and stick it on there. Just make sure the plate has the same measurement. Or, have the name printed in white directly on the surface just like the Coast logo. If you have a flashlight enthusiast in your life, this would make a nice gift. This is not a verified purchase review. I got mine at Home Depot, but you should get yours on Amazon because Home Depot costs $40, but I had a special coupon.

All tablets do the same thing, so why not get one that's also an advanced universal remote? Not only that, there are facets of playstation integrated in this tablet. You can connect your wireless dual-shock controller and play play-station games. Way cool! Like I said, all tablets virtually do the same thing, so I'm going to focus on what makes this Tablet special, the Universal Remote feature! My review my also help you decide if you want to spend the extra money to buy the new Xperia version for the macro functionality of the remote. In case you don't know what that means, all it means is that it has the ability to turn on a set of commands with one button. Like the really expensive Harmony remotes by Logitech. With one push of a button, it will turn on your tv, audio system, your blu-ray player and even change your tv to the correct input, your audio system to the correct input, etc. Having used the Sony S Tablet's remote and having owned the $250 Harmony 900 by Logitech, I now realize the macro feature is an overkill luxury if I keep both gadgets. Here's why...You don't have to register a bunch of remotes! For example, before owning the tablet S, I thought I had to register my Samsung's remote to power on and off the tv, the tivo remote to control the tivo and the Sony audio system's remote to control volume. So I imagine when I'm using the Tablet, I would have to switch between three different remote apps. But luckily, I'm happy to report that's not the case!! You can program a bunch of remotes into just one remote lay-out. So in my case, I simply register one remote, the TIVO. So then it shows me the tivo lay-out. The power on the tivo lay-out does not turn on my Samsung, it's useless because you never want to turn off the tivo either. But here's the cool thing.. You can specifically re-program each button to make it learn a new command or learn a new command from a different remote. So I program the volume functions and the power functions with my Samsung remote. If you've ever own a tivo, you know that you have to program the remote to control your tv. So we're basically doing the same thing here. We're teaching the Tivo remote on the Sony S Tablet to learn some of the Samsung commands like power, input, volume, muting, etc. So with just one remote lay-out on my Sony S Tablet, I can control my Samsung TV and my Tivo. Lets take it a step further, my Sony Audio system has to be turned on and has to be at a certain input. With the same Tivo lay-out, you can even create new buttons, you can name your new buttons too. So I can simply create whatever buttons I need from my Sony audio System's remote. I only need three commands, the power button, the input selector and the volume control. Actually, what I did was even better, to keep the lay-out clutter free, Instead of creating new buttons, I re-programed and rename some of the tivo buttons that I don't use. So now those buttons control my Sony Audio system. You want to be as clutter free as possible because if the lay-out doesn't have enough room, then it'll automatically generate a 2nd page for your remote. So then you'll have to swipe the screen to get to page 2 of your remote. I like to keep all buttons on one page, and with a 9.4" screen, you'll have plenty of real estate. So with just one Tivo layout and with just one page, I control my Samsung LCD, my TIVO, and my Sony Audio system. How hard is it to tap a few power and input buttons? I have sold my Harmony 900.You can also create a remote from scratch, but my advice is to at least register one remote for each activity (Activity is harmony remote lingo). Which ever remote that is most important, in my case, it's the tivo. Why? Because then I don't have to learn every single button like the numbers 1 to 9. It would be tedious! Register your most important remote, then customize it and add other remotes to the same lay-out for that activity. If you have another activity that uses three entirely different remote, then do the same thing. Register the most important one, then customize around it. For example, you might want to take your tablet upstairs to your bedroom. In that case, it's a whole new set of remotes. So you create another lay-out for your Bedroom activity. That's essentially what those high end Harmony remotes do, they program different activities. But with macro, for each activity, they have the ability to press one button to power up multiple machines. With Sony Tablet S, for each activity, you'll need to tap a few power buttons. No biggie. Unless your activity involves powering up 15 machines and changing 10 inputs. LOL! Then I can see the benefit of macro functionality, otherwise, I've come to realize it's an overkill luxury.At the current price of $350 on Amazon, I would just fork over the extra money and get the Xperia and tegra 3 processor. But another thing to keep in mind is that the Xperia is not playstation certified. So $350 may be a good deal especially if the certification means a lot to you, but if you can get the Sony S Tablet on a sale elsewhere for under $300, then it's especially worth it. Which is what I did, that's why this review is not a verified purchase review.Enjoy!--------------------------------------9/30/2012 updateMy whole review is about how you don't need macros because the new Xperia comes with macros and originally, the Sony Tablet S did not. But today, there was a software updated that added Macros functionality to the Sony Tablet S. So if you love this Tablet, it just got better! Macros means with one button, you can power up multiple devices. So there you go! The only thing you need to decide now is whether or not the extra money is worth it for the new processor of the Xperia.

Simplicity!!! A screwdriver is all you need. We had our eye on the John Louis system which listed a SAW as a part of the list of tools we need, a pencil & leveler, and by reading the reviews, lots of screws and anchors cause there will be a lot of drilling into the wall. We said forget about it!!! The Seville Classic is a quality heavy steel set that is free-standing, no need to drill into walls. You'll only need a screw driver to tighten the hanging rods on the system. This system is not elegant wood, but it's not $100 more either. You save money, your wall, and lots of labor hours.To save yourself from a little anxiety, you should know that when you open up the box, there will be these black plastic end caps falling out all over the place. I was worried because the first thing I like to do when assembling is to make sure all the pieces in the box are complete. I was immediately worried when these plastic caps were all over the place, not only that, some of them were warped and broken. I thought, "Dang, I'm going to have to call Seville for some replacement parts." It turns out that these end caps have nothing to do with the system. They were fitted on the shelves to minimize the clanking of the metal during transit. There will be a bag with plastic caps that you will be using, but these are neatly inside a sealed bag, so you'll know the difference. The loose ones, don't worry about them. When you open up your package and these caps start falling out.. Don't fret, you won't be using them.As for the closet system itself, it works! They even come with earthquake safety straps, but for us, this system is going inside a closet behind sliding glass doors. There is no need for us to use it. The plastic liners for each shelf was a nice finishing touch. It is pretty sturdy, and it feels like quality because it's made of steel and it's heavy. My closet depth is 24 inches, so I wish the shelves were bigger, at least 18 inches square would have been ideal. This system is barely 14 inches, you need to round up to call it 14 inches. The John Louis system that I mentioned above is 12 inches deep. So I guess the puny depth is normal for these types of products? Anyway, take a close look at the pictures, the stock picture showing the empty rack makes it look like the top shelf is one long piece, but it's not. Take a look at the picture with clothes, when the rods are expanded, you have a hole in the middle. This is important because if you're fitting this system into a closet like us, and it's expanded and fills the whole closet from end to end, then you'll find that passing/stacking storage boxes to the very top shelf is impossible, you'll need to use the hole/space in the middle. Credit the Seville team for thinking ahead!! Which brings me back to the depth issue. I think they made these shelves 14 inches to help our maneuverability in the closet. But even at 14 inches, I still had to use the middle space to stack boxes to the top. So whether it's 14, 18, or 20 inches, it wouldn't have mattered, you'll still need to use the middle space to stack boxes to the top, so why not make the shelves bigger? I think 18" would have been perfect. And for those who are using it free-standing outside of a closet, then bigger would definitely be ideal.Anyway, I still love this system and giving it a 5 stars! Like I said, I could use more depth, but it's especially acceptable in our situation because it's installed in the nursery room. How big are baby clothes anyway? :) Lastly, you don't need to follow the instructions to a T. You can adjust these shelves to any height you want. You can adjust the rods anywhere you want. Some people complain their clothes are touching the floor, well don't follow the instructions to a T! Move your rod up a few notches! However, you'll need to plan it out first. Adjustments are difficult and it'll take some strength and jiggling to remove the shelves once you slide them in. So plan out exactly how you want the shelves to look in terms of distance from each other and at what level you want the rods. We changed our minds several times, and it was hard work lifting the shelves back out. So I cannot stress this enough, think and plan ahead first!! Because when you start, you'll be tempted to breeze along because it's so easy to assemble, but once you change your mind, dissembling is the hard part.One last thing! Read the review by DUMBASTHEYCOME, I believe it's currently voted as the most helpful review. I don't know if I would have made the same mistake as that reviewer, but that was a good heads up and because I read it beforehand, I didn't have to think twice as to how the shelves should slide in. So thank you dumbastheycome!

Like a previous reviewer mentioned, your screw hole may be too large for the screw. The size of the screw hole does not seem to be universal. Even though these sockets can fit up to 1 inch diameter rods, we used 5/8 rods. The hole in our 5/8 rods were incompatible. So we thought 5/8 did not work and started searching for 1" inch rods. All the while, I kept thinking why does the ad say UP TO ONE INCH? That would entail that smaller rods would work. Sure enough my suspicions were correct, it had nothing to do with rod diameter. It had all to do with the diameter of the hole of the rod. We found another set of 5/8 rods, and this time the socket did fit and screw tightly.So my best advice is this.. Do what we did! Take the socket with you when you shop for rods, and test them out.

At first, I wasn't impressed with the power. I put my hand in front of it and thought, what's the big deal? But if you move the air up your wrist and along your arms, you'll see your skin move, it's pretty gross. To confirm the power and make sure a regular blow dryer doesn't have this effect, I quickly ran upstairs and tried the blow dryer on my arms. My skin didn't move. Power of data vac confirmed! LOL.I cleaned my DELL XPS5 which was bought in 2005. 7 years of casual wiping, never serious cleaning, so it had quite a build up. It is absolutely clean now. I love this thing!Some are saying that the more expensive listing on Amazon is newer and has a push button and holes in the adapter to allow them to click into place. Well, I bought from this $50 listing and I got the newer model. So there is no need to pay for the extra money, what you get is retail art box vs OEM plain box packaging, that's the only difference.I would like someone to confirm something via the comment below. Did your Air Flare and Blower Nozzle have pre-drilled holes? The only thing that came with a pre-drilled hole for me is the tool kit adapter. The blower nozzle and the air flare had outlines or indentation of a hole. As if they were marked for drilling, but they simple forgot to drill it. If you have a rotary tool/dremal, you should be able to drill it yourself. Please comment below if yours came the same as mine.About the heat! This thing does not get hot, it gets reasonably warm. I just don't see how anyone would turn it on long enough for it to get burning hot. Because the nature of cleaning a PC doesn't warrant leaving it on for such a long stretch. You're blowing one part of the case, you'll be turning it off as you move around to the other side, you turn it back on, you turn it back off as you detach the optical drives, you turn it back on, you turn it back off as you reattach drives, you turn it back on, you turn it back off to attach a different micro tool to get smaller crevices, etc. You get what I'm saying? Unless you're blowing leaves in your back-yard, which this is not intended for, there shouldn't be a project that requires this thing to be on for so long that it burns up.Highly recommended!!

Recently installed Windows 7 via Bootcamp to my Macbook Air which only had 128gb to begin with. I partitioned 50gb for Bootcamp, and when it was all said and done, I had 47gb to use. Once windows 7 and some programs were installed, I had about 25gb left. LOL. I had a 300gb 2.5" HD laying around pulled from a PS3. I wanted a case that was USB 3.0 and also be able to match my Macbook. So I was a little disappointed in the color of the case. The description says Milky White, the pictures even looks white. But more accurately, the description should say, CLEAR FROSTED PLASTIC CASE. That's what they mean folks, when they say MILKY WHITE. My hard drive can be seen through the case clearly. Not enough frosting. For all all intents and purposes, it's basically a clear case.Having said that, I love the function of this. Think of those plastic VHS tapes in the 80's. That's what it basically is. You put the hard drive inside along with the usb 3.0 module/sata connector. Then you shut the case. It snaps in place, no screws. Underneath the case is an opening for the usb cable. Extremely versatile if you have multiple bare 2.5" drives laying around the house like I do. It does the job. USB powered too, no need for power adapters or cables. As for longevity, who knows.Previous review says you can probably connect a 3.5 hard drive since you don't really have to use the case. I was very doubtful because it takes a lot of power for those 3.5 drives and there were no power adapters or cables supplied. But for the curious cats, I tested it out, and the answer is NO. You cannot use 3.5 drives. It did not recognize the hard drive. I double checked by connecting the 3.5 again via my Apricorn Drivewire Universal HDD Adapter USB To 2.5IN & 3.5IN Sata & Pata which has the proper power adapters and my macbook recognized it fine. I don't know if it doesn't work due to the hardware itself or simply a power issue. If it's a power issue, you cannot simply add a power connecter either because once the Ineo module is connected to your 3.5 drive, it blocks/covers the power slot of the drive.So there you go. There is no killing two birds with one stone. This is only for your 2.5" drives. Despite the color disappointment, I'm still giving it a 5 stars because it works and it's versatile.

I bought it for the Oxygenics Body Spa Handheld Shower Kit, White. That set came with a holder, but it was only usable if you're using the handheld as your main shower-head attached to the arm. I use it as a secondary attached to a diverter, so I needed a separate holder. Lots of reviews about how loose the ball joint is. You need to keep turning the socket to tighten it up against the plate. The ball is tight for me after I do this, and I have to use strength to even budge it. The Oxygenics Body Spa Handheld is white, so once this white mount was in stock, I ordered it. You have two choices on how to install, using screws or adhesives. A nice aesthetic touch is that if you use the adhesive option, it comes with a little round plastic button sticker that you can use to cover the bottom screw hole. The instructions didn't mention anything about caulking the edges, but I suppose that's an extra step that you can take if you're using adhesives.

Needed a handheld that can provide a nice blast on a diverter. Got a shower head I already love, but wanted a handheld. Tried a waterpik with 7 kinds of water flow and it just sucked even with the flow restrictor removed. Realize those types of shower head will lose pressure on a diverter. This Oxygenics body spa is perfect! No fancy dialing of the head to get different flows, it just blast water out at a high pressure. It has what it calls a comfort control valve so you can adjust how much water or strength you need.However, here are my tips.1. If you want good high pressure.. You should do what I did and remove the flow restrictor at the bottom of the handle. It was easy to remove, just pull with your fingers, no need tools.2. I'm not using the comfort control valve. I don't know why you would ever need to adjust the flow down to a trickle... unless you're buying this to give baths to your baby or your pets? Secondly, I think it's dangerous. Because the comfort controller allows you to adjust flow all the way to nothing. If you have kids or guest, you'll need to constantly remind people that adjusting the flow to nothing is not the same as turning off the water. You still need to turn off the water as you normally do. If someone forgets.. uh oh!!! So I just don't use it at all. You should adjust the flow using your normal bath handles. If you decide to use it, you just connect it to the bottom of the handheld then you connect the hose. If you don't use it, you can just connect the hose directly to the bottom of the handheld.

I wanted to rate this higher, because the peacock pearls are amazing! I love seeing the green tones and the pearls are a good size although I prefer them to be just a little bit larger. My reason for knocking a star is the clasp is not good, it comes open very easily and I knocked off a second star because the knotting on the string is not as tight as it should be. I have a pearl necklace that cost ten times as much as this one, and I've had it for 15 years. It's in better shape than this one that's only been worn a few months. I don't expect this to hold up, but it's fun to wear and satisfied my desire for a peacock pearl necklace without costing a small fortune.

I bought two pairs of these, one for myself and one for my sister-in-law. They look STUNNING on her, and average on me. It was interesting to me to see how the same earrings can look so different on two people. They were too flat for my ears, but just perfect for hers. I love the design, and the size was just slightly smaller than I was expecting.

At over 7 carats, this pendant is just so over the top! It's huge and gets lots of attention. The included chain will not be enough to ensure this pendant does not get lost, so I recommend picking up a 2-3 mm chain to go with this as well. It's gorgeous & I highly recommend this pendant if you don't mind wearing some bling.

I am so disappointed with these earrings.  The posts are weak, even though at 10k gold (41% pure gold) they shouldn't bend as much as they did. I bought these because of the gold content, I wanted a strong post on my black CZs since I like to wear them often but they are thin and bent immediately with very little handing. Not recommended at all.

I like the ring, but the cz's are just not as sparkly as I like. The center stone of course has a lot of sparkle, but the surrounding marquis shaped stones were rather boring. The rhodium plating is nice, it looks very white, and the size was accurate. I also love the substantial band. I highly recommend this ring as something fun & different.

I got this necklace for my sister in law, and nearly kept it for myself! It's a stunning stone in a beautiful setting. It has a lot of sparkle and is just the right size to look classy. I would recommend this for anyone that loves citrine.

This works surprisingly well. My husband is a big fan of this now, and I actually like the scent. I don't remember to use this, and my movements are not overwhelming in scent, but it's a nice thing to have around the house for anyone that may feel embarrassment over having a bowel movement.

This is a well designed, sturdy game set. I like how it's ultra portable and the components were spared expense. I can see EastPoint had longevity in mind when this was designed.  Organizations such as schools, churches, and kid friendly gyms would be wise to purchase this because it's fun for everyone.  For my family, I expect this to last us longer than we would ever need it to, and I don't have to worry about leaving it outside and the elements destroying it... this can withstand a hurricane, and it folds up with everything being self contained inside so no parts will get lost.

I'm super impressed with this projector. It was easy to use, all I had to do was hook up an HDMI cable from my laptop to the projector, and adjust my settings on my computer so the projector would not act as a screen extender but rather a mirror. Then I started a video. The picture was so bright and clear, even with morning light coming in. I had an older Epson projector from a few years ago that was a similar price but much smaller. This one is far better. The remote is well laid out and self explanatory, I never needed to open the manual to use the projector.My only complaint is that I wish the projector had Bluetooth output for the sound or even a built in aux cable output.  The included speaker is very weak and I have several portable Bluetooth speakers I would prefer to use, and there is no aux cable output either.  The only option I can come up with is an audio to aux cable adapter, which is probably what I'll end up purchasing.The picture quality is very good though, and for this very low price I'm impressed and recommend this.

The chocolates in this glass jar are quite good, especially for those that like dark chocolate. Even if you're dieting, these chocolates are small enough to not wreck your diet, while still satisfying.I find one chocolate to be enough to satisfy a chocolate craving, and I keep these next to the espresso machine for a small treat when desired.The value is not exceptional, but it's gift package, in line with other similar gifts on price. I love that the just is reusable.

I'm actually surprised I like this. I normally use a very fine Korean powder on my face or mineral foundation. This looks surprisingly good on my skin, although not as good as the other two products I use.What I like about this though is that it's in a compact so I don't have a powder mess, so I've started taking this in my purse and I don't have to worry too much about excess powder getting on my clothes.The color is very good, and I love the blush as well!

This is an attention getting watch, an so very heavy. I had a hard time believing how heavy it was. I don't like the way the white hour and minute hands cover up the date. If someone asks you the date, hopefully one of the hands will not be covering up the date or you'll be very embarrassed. I wish Swiss Legend had made the tips of the hands outlined only with white for this reason. It also came far too big to be worn on my wrist. Swiss Legend recommends taking the watch to a jeweler to have links removed. Other than that I had no trouble setting the time and date using the instruction book provided. This is a great beach watch due to it's high water resistance. I don't feel like I have to be overly careful with it.

Babies new best friend!This is an adorable little crawling bear that will definitely become your babies best friend and make her think bears are friends!The voice is very cute and she's well programmed to encourage and teach.She's not fully plush though due to the mechanized limbs.This is the cutest toy ever!

This is a really small and thin cross. If you are looking for dainty this will be perfect. I own several cross pendants and this is my least favorite one. The rose gold is hardly noticeable but the gemstones add a nice touch. If you upgrade the chain to a thick, shiny chain out would improve the look tremendously.

I honestly didn't like this watch at all. It felt like a child's watch with it's tiny bracelet and simple design. I have a medium sized wrist and it fit me fine, but I wonder how it will fit for ladies with large wrists. My mother of pearl garve was also inconsistent. The three bracelets stacked didn't look too amazing, and I prefer looser bracelets.

This tanning lotion works really well if used in moderation, if not sparingly. I now use it once a week, but had using it three times a week to get really dark.Now I only use our weekly to maintain a nice glow. If you use it too much it will come off unevenly.The mitt really it's an absolute must in my opinion. It makes application very even.

This is a beautiful,  simple rose gold necklace.  I'm a fan of rose gold because it's something different and I don't like to be like everyone else.This casual necklace is great with jeans or simple dresses.  My only complaint is the same  one I have every time with this style of necklace,  the pendant is attached to the  chain so if it breaks you can not replace it.

This was much nicer than expected. I love it! The cross is somewhat whiter than shown, which is a good thing because it glows. The garnet is very noticeable and a nice size. The chain is also thicker and sturdier than Amazon Collection chains I've received in the past. I didn't feel the need to use a different chain. It's a very beautiful Celtic cross, well designed and will get a lot of wear from me.

I own a limo service and we have a couple dozen car seats. This is now the best and biggest one we have, as well as the most versatile (with some adjustment). I like that everything is soft and washable. It's very heavy and sits well in all of our vehicles. I would buy this for my own baby. The car seat is very protective and works well as a rear facing infant seat and forward facing toddler seat. I love the dark color as well to mask wear and tear. If you plan to keep your car seat a long time, this is a great color to get as well because small scuffs and minor stains will not wash out on lighter colors, but will be masked well with this dark color. Overall we love this car seat and bring it for our pickiest guests.

These earrings are gorgeous! Even though I  have smaller earlobes these look great! I have double pierced ears and these look amazing on either hole.This is a great variation on studs and are now my favorite pair.My only complaint is that the post is very long so I cannot lay my head down for a nap with these on.

Our office bathroom was in need of a new fan, the old one was original and very noisy. We purchased the fan to go with this as well, so its nice that our clients and guests do not have to remember to turn on the fan, it now goes on automatically. I watched the wiring videos, they seemed very understandable, but since we were installing a new fan anyway we hired an electrician to install the fan and this sensor.The new fan is very quiet and I love the automation. I plan to always have automation in the future.

This toddler toy is certainly worth it's price. It's most ideal for ages 18 months to three years old. Children older than this may find it too juvenile and unchallenging. What makes it worth it's price is the interactivity, it talks to you!I recommend a more advanced builders set for older kids, and then of course free home depot weekend kids projects!

I though this would be good, it even looked great in the packaging. However, it doesn't work as well as my Revlon tweezers that cost less. It doesn't open very wide, so it's harder to clean, and it's very short, shorter than I'm comfortable with.It also didn't come with a storage sleeve, but rather a tiny rubber tip for the end. I won't be buying this as I prefer Revlon or Tweezerman.

This is a simple, adjustable massage roller. I use it on my back which always has knots, and my husband likes to use it on his legs which seem to be where he gets sore muscles. I like the rolling action and the entire massage roller is easy to clean. This works better than a foam roller because it has the handle to allow the muscle to relax and be manipulated better.

This is such a cute take on the old shape sorters (remember Tupperware shape sorter?). This is cuter and more appealing to young kids, and was surprisingly bigger than I expected it to be. I also like that the shapes are different colors as well, which gives another teaching opportunity in addition to just shapes. The friendly smile on the cat also encourages smiling, which is a great character trait.

I take tons of outdoor pictures and has been previously using an inexpensive filter. Most of my pictures are landscapes, beach, vehicles, sunrise, and sunset. This has made a night and day difference in my photography. I now need to do less editing in my pictures because they look better to begin with.I have a Canon with a 58mm  lens, so I also got a 58 mm to 77 mm adapter to work with the 77 mm lens I received, along with a 77 mm lens cap. I keep this in my camera almost permanently since nearly every shot is outdoors with sunlight.I'm getting ready for a Pacific coast highway trip, and plan to capture every sunrise and sunset at is golden hour, so I'm very excited to put this lens to use.The lens is very high quality, one of the best I've seen. It's clearly a professional quality lens.I'm so impressed with the quality of this lens that I I plan to look to this brand for future lenses.

These are very lightweight and delicate earrings. The rose gold is very subtle, almost looking like silver depending upon the lighting.I love heart jewelry and have very little rose gold, so it's nice to have an inexpensive pair of rose gold earrings to match the couple of rose gold pendants and rings that I have.

This is a nice transition piece, to get babies used to developing muscles needed to sit up. It's lightweight, washable, and has a few toys included that won't be dropped out of reach. I think it's priced about ten dollars higher than it should be. I like that unlike a walker it can't be pushed or moved around by another sibling or a pet, perhaps putting the baby in danger.

These are a lot smaller than I expected, but they are very nice and look great on my ears.I was surprised to find out the ear wire does not pivot, and is instead fixed. The level of sparkle is very nice, almost like rhodium plated or platinum plated. They go with almost everything and are now one of my preferred Celtic design earrings.

I really love this appliance, it's such a great device to cook so many different things. I've made brownies, french fries, naan bread pizza, sweet potato fries, spinach dip, and several more things. The way it circulates the heat and heats evenly from the bottom as well produces a nice result, plus it's easy to clean up. It is noisy though, which I don't mind because my husband has tinnitus and we regularly keep bathroom fans and air filters on for him. The noise on this is a good thing for us! Although we have a small kitchen, we were able to find a place on a kitchen cart to store this when not in use. It's nice to be able to have people over and take advantage of this as a extra cooking device and leave the oven, microwave, and stove top free. This is quickly becoming our go to device for not just fried foods. Also, considering it uses so little oil I think if you cook a lot of fries/fish this could easily pay for itself because you are buying 90% less oil.

This works nice, but I find it works best dry. Once your hair gets wet. it sticks to the skin causing it to be harder to shave off. I've tried it both ways a few times  each and wet hair is not easy to remove with this tool. I recommend using in the shower regardless so there won't be a hair mess, but be sure to remove your body hair before starting the shower!

I really love this bracelet and wear it all the time. However, my bracelet has a completely different and far better closure than this one. Basically, the bracelet looks nearly seamless with no clasps as shown, instead one side of the bracelet goes under the other, and there is a hole for a raised piece of silver to slide in. Mine looks better than shown, and I love bangle bracelets. I would say it's big enough for most wrists as well. I have a medium wrist and there is plenty of room.

Like other reviewers have said, this necklace is bigger and more beautiful than it looks online. It's a substantial pendant that looks really gorgeous against all skin tones and the gemstones are noticeable.My only complaint is that I wish it incorporated some silver in the design so that it can be mixed with silver jewelry as well.This pendant is better than I expected! I've had gold plated silver in the past, and recommend dipping in silver cleaner if it tarnishes.

This is the BEST self tanner ever IMO, and definitely the best of the Xen-Tan products. It produces an even dark tan after two uses, plus a good tan after one use. The mousse makes an even tan and the smaller size is a great way to try the product without a huge investment. I highly recommend the mitt for even application. The mitt will last a long time, I've used mine at least 15 times!

This is the best and most relevant classic monopoly game I've seen yet. The properties make sense and appeal to today's current and future travellers.If you're looking for a classic monopoly game that is fun to play and uses real and properties this is the best choice to please a modern group.

This has really worked out perfectly to keep my computer power cords off of the floor. It plugged in nicely to the wall, stays secure, and now my roomba has more floor space to clean and I don't accidental unplug anything with my feet. The color is not very desirable and the packaging is really basic, but otherwise I love it!

This necklace was a lot smaller and more basic than I was expecting. I have a lot of Amazon Collection Celtic jewelry amd this is the least impressive of all the pieces.It's a very simple design without much texture or contrast in the metal.  I would recommend looking for a different pendant from this collection.

I love this elephant, it is not overwhelming and has just enough activities to keep a baby entertained. The textures and colors used are very well chosen and the size and layout is well designed. I think this may be my favorite baby toy ever.

I've used these handheld frothers for many years, and this is just as good as my last one. It's great for making hot cocoa using all natural ingredients and getting them to combine properly. I also use it to froth milk for my coffee from time to time. My husband and daughter get a lot more use from this than me since they really like homemade hot cocoa. It takes up very little counter space and is very affordable as well.

I'm not sure how well the UV protection lasts, but the cleaner works well, and I like that it's alcohol free. It seems overpriced for the amount of cleaner you get, but if the UV protection actually works then it's something I will buy. The product seems very concentrated and is unlike other cleaners in that you don't just wipe off, you actually have to buff off and all of the product remains until it's fully buffed, it does not evaporate.

This works very well and is more economical than self tanners that build over time. The mitt does a great job of distributing the tanning mousse without staining my hands. The tan I got from this was very natural looking, especially on my white legs.

I hate tanning. First, there is the time involved, the heat you must endure outdoors, or the cost you incur at the tanning salon, plus the most valuable of all, my time!This is the perfect solution because it quickly produces a dark tan without the need to build it up like most self tanners.I used this recently before a beach trip anna was impressed with the mitt for application! No more orange hands!Although the price is somewhat steep it's perhaps more economical than other self tanners that take time to build, plus it's far safer than tanning salons and laying out in the sun.I love this and am glad I tried it!

There is an abundance of this sort of earring available on Amazon. I have a few pairs. This is the least impressive of all. I find them to be very small for this style. Although I love small earrings, these just don't look as good as my other ones.

This is a wonderful hair oil. I've been using oil in my hair for years, and this one works great without giving me an oily look. It absorbs completely, moisturizes, and keeps my hair looking great despite humidity. I would highly recommend this..you don't need much because you use very little. This should last three months,

This is very nice for belly play time, but I do wish it was bigger, and the colors, noises, and fabrics seem to repetitive to be an effective learning and stimulating toy.I plan to use this as small carpet outside the crib eventually, plus it can be used as a changing mat, temporary blanket, or even a wall hanging so it's very versatile, thus the 4 stars.

We got the kitchen set with the two pot holders. They are very well made and thick enough to keep my hands from burning. My husband loves the design. He calls them the most beautiful pot holders ever.I would buy these in the future because the price is really great considering the quality.

I really don't care for this for nighttime use. It seems harsh on the eyes and the projection feature is not impressive. For daytime entrainment it's great however. I've seen much better nighttime products to create an entertaining projection.

My husband keeps raving about these kitchen towels, and he's a very particular person with textile education. He loves the fabric, the feel, the size, and the design. Of the three sets of kitchen towels he's got this year, this is by hear his favorite. I love them as well and they look very sophisticated in our kitchen.

This necklace is absolutely stunning! I have many heart pendants and this is one of my favorites! It's fairly large and I love the black diamonds. The pendant chain loops allow for a much larger chain to be used.I wish I had bought several more when on sale to give as gifts.

I love that this is antimicrobial, and can sharpen a variety of pencils. So far this is working very well for all family members, no matter if they're sharpening colored pencils, school pencils, or drawing pencils. We also don't have to worry about looking for the pencil sharpener throughout the school year, since it's so big it has a designated home.

This is a well themed educational toy comparable to Legos our knex but with a singular focus. The parts are well designed and packaged in a useful tote.My only suggestion is that I wish the parts resembled actual cars, lol! They look nothing like a real car which may be disappointing to some children.

These are really beautiful and feminine earrings. They look exactly as pictured and are very well made. The post is strong and the CZ's (especially the round ones) really sparkle. I love wearing these instead of simple single gemstone studs. I would not hesitate to give these as a gift. They're unique and so feminine.

These were simply "okay" and may be more appropriate for a young girl. I have other Amazon Curated Collection Celtic drop earrings and these were smaller and less noticeable than the others. I wish they were larger!

These earrings are gorgeous. The color of the stones was exactly as shown and they were larger than most stud earrings I wear, although not too large. I have double pierced ears, so I wear them on the second hole, and worn that way they perfectly sit on my ear lobe. I already got many compliments on these when I wore my hair up. They are different and athough the colors are shades of blue, I chose to wear them with black and white so they stood out very well. I don't think I would be interested in the coordinating necklace but I would consider a bracelet with the same stones. I LOVE these earrings and so does my husband. They are now one of my favorite pairs of studs.

I've been wanting one of these for a long time because not only was I not wanting to add cooking oil to my diet, but I also hate the expense and wastefulness of cooking oil, and of course the disposal. For these reasons we rarely eat fried foods. So, this was a great solution!My husband loves sweet potato fries and this makes amazing sweet potato fries! They cook so quickly and clean up is far easier than cooking with oil.This is a must have in my kitchen now, but it really only makes enough for two people at a time.

This really is the best notebook I've ever seen. Five star brand keeps getting better and better as time goes on. I love that the spiral is not exposed, and the cover is incredibly strong and protective of it's interior contents.Although the price is far higher than its competitors, this is a notebook that will last the entire school year and may be very appropriate for certain subjects that require the student to keep a special full year notebook.

This is  a really beautiful, substantial bracelet. It's much bigger than I am accustomed to wearing, but looks great with nearly everthing. I like the two tone so I can easily mix and match this with silver and yellow gold jewelry. My main reason for knocking a star is that a clasp closure would have been better, and also I never spend money on yellow gold plated items because in time the plating will wear off and then what do you do? I would rather buy silver or 10/14/18k gold instead. This will not last but it is very beautiful.

For Chinese polyester this is extremely overpriced. It looks nice so we have it on our sofa for decoration, but honestly I feel icky with the polyester fabric against my skin.Purely decor: 4 starsQuality, price, materials: 2.5 stars

I'm in love with this case. I've had the iPad mini since they came out and have had three other cases that were fantastic, but this one is the best one yet!It looks very stylish and cleans up nicely, plus it's ultra protective.I would recommend this one to anyone!

A non-profit group has filed lawsuits against e-cigarette manufacturers, claiming they failed to warn consumers about two cancer-causing chemicals and the health effects of nicotine.The Center for Environmental Health (CEH) said it purchased  e-cigarette manufacturersA test on one e-cigarette found the level of formaldehyde was more than 470 times higher than the California safety standard.The two chemicals are known to cause cancer and are also linked to genetic damage, birth defects, and reduced fertility, the lawsuits argue. Under Californias Prop 65 consumer protection law, companies must warn consumers when their products expose users to chemicals that can cause cancer and/or birth defects.Those named in the lawsuits include RJ Reynolds (Vuse brand), Fontem/Imperial Tobacco (blu brand), and NJOY.In all, the nonprofit has launched legal actions against more than 60 companies for failing to warn consumers about exposure from e-cigarettes to nicotine and/or one or both of the two cancer-causing chemicals, formaldehyde and acetaldehyde, as required by California law.

Tell Pop Secret to Stop Killing Bees!Its no secret we love popcorn, In fact, Americans consume more than 16 billion quarts of popcorn each year. But were getting more than we bargained for in all those bowls of popcorn: bee-toxic pesticides.Bees are dying at alarming rates, and scientists have identified a group of insecticides called neonicotinoids (neonics) as a prime culprit in these drastic population losses. The largest single use of neonicotinoids is as a seed coating for field crops. In fact, researchers estimate that 95-99% of all field corn grown in the U.S. comes from seed coated with bee-toxic neonic chemicals.Unfortunately, the popcorn industry uses bee-killing chemicals on their seeds, too. Thats why were calling on Pop Secret, one of the biggest brands in the industry, to urge them to source their popcorn from seeds that are NOT coated in these harmful chemicals. Thanks to your pressure, Pop Weaver has already agreed to phase out its use of neonics.1Neonics are the most widely used insecticides in the world, and are a class of systemic chemicals, meaning they are dispersed throughout the treated plant, rendering the whole plant toxic. Just as alarming, neonics can last in the environment for years and they can harm species that the chemical was not designed to kill - like bees, butterflies, birds, and entire food chains.As one of the largest popcorn brands in the U.S., Pop Secret can make a big difference for bees by joining Pop Weaver in phasing out their use of neonic-coated seeds.Sign the Petition to Tell Pop Secret to Stop Killing Bees!

Made well.  Stitching is strong and sling pack does NOT have a cheap feel.
