Adjustable strap is thickly woven polyester, rugged and I feel it looks good while wearing..This is precisely what I was looking for, and never quite found satisfaction, until now.  I can wear the pack securely over my torso, hanging in back, or simply throw it over one shoulder if in a hurry. Zero issue with this being called a "purse", or "bag". Not the least bit "bulky" , even when filled up, and I can slip into my two-seater car without the pack being an issue.  Happy as a clam with this...just wish they made a "real leather" version, but I'll keep looking.

I received this item at no cost to evaluate and review.Nicely compact FM transmitter While I have an auxiliary port in my car stereo, being wireless seemed like a wonderful idea, no clutter.  This turns out to be an ideal solution.  The Kollea Mini FM transmitter is small and feather light.  Function keys are straightforward, so you can get the FM Transmitter up and running in a flash. I spent just a couple minutes to get things going.  You'll need to tune along the FM frequency, to find a dead spot that gives you clearest, loudest sound.  LEDs are bright, and switching frequency is easy with left/right numbers up & down, couldn't be easier, really. No need to move the device around for connectivity, the signal is strong and clear. I've heard other wireless FM transmitters, this one works and sounds ten times better than the others. Really impressed me.NOTE: No power button: Instead, you simply press the LEFT button, and doing so, the unit will shut down in under a minute if it remains unused. Plugging back in turns the unit back on. Easy!Transmission seems excellent. I can be 15+ feet from my car, and get a strong, crackle-free sound. That suggests quality. I used my Samsung Note 3, and got GREAT sound. Samsung S4 and works great and transmit clear sound from my Mp3 player to my car stereo and works best if you find an unused radio frequency. I can tell this has good transmitter on it since I have no trouble transmitting even if I am away from my car about 10-20 ft using unused station no scratchy and I get clear sound transmission.ROS:Built-in rechargeable battery.  No need to worry about replacing batteries or running out of power. Batteries can be expensive so savings is a plus!Fits in palm of hand, a feather-weight.CONS:Can't find a facet that's problematic or fussy.I ordered this at a discount in exchange for my fair and honest review.Hope this helps!

DANGER PLEASE NOTE:Recalls and WarningsWeight and Energy Supplement Contains Synthetic "Amphetamine" (Date Posted: 9/30/2015)On September 21, 2015, the FDA issued a warning letter to TruVision Health LLC. because the company's supplement ***tru Weight & Energy*** lists a synthetic, amphetamine-like compound, AMP (also called 1,3-dimethylbutylamine or DMBA) on product labels.DMBA is an analogue of the pharmaceutical stimulant, 1,3-dimethylamylamine (DMAA), which is banned by the FDA. DMBA may also be listed on labels as 1,3-Dimethylbutylamine, 2-amino-4-methylpentane, AMP citrate, AMP, or 4-methyl-2-pentanamine .In addition, the FDA noted that tru Weight & Energy contains high levels of synephrine, a stimulant from bitter orange extract which may cause hypertension, increased heart rate and cardiovascular toxicity. The product contains a bitter orange extract (synephrine 30%) while the agency noted that the content of p-synephrine in concentrated extracts or commercial products are standardized to 4-6%.See ConsumerLab.com's Reviews of Weight Loss Supplements , B Vitamin Supplements and Energy Drinks and Muscle Enhancers for more about other synthetic stimulants and steroids found in these types of supplements, and tests of popular products.

Recalls and WarningsGNC Accused of Selling Supplements with Unlawful Ingredients RECENT RECALLS AND WARNINGS Weight Supplements RecalledOn October 22, 2015, Oregon Attorney General Ellen Rosenblum filed a lawsuit against supplement retailer ***GNC***, alleging that the company ***sold products that were adulterated with BMPEA and picamilon, which are not lawful dietary supplement ingredients.*** The lawsuit states that GNC "knew or should have known" the products contained these unlawful ingredients.BMPEA (beta- methylphenylethylamine) is a synthetic, amphetamine-like compound found in some weight loss and workout supplements. It is often found in supplements labeled as containing acacia rigidula, although it does not appear to be a component of this plant. It is not a legal dietary supplement ingredient. The Attorney General's lawsuit contends GNC should have known as early as 2013 that BMPEA was not a lawful dietary ingredient but continued selling products containing BMPEA until April 2015, when the FDA formally announced it did not meet the definition of a dietary ingredient and issued warning letters to a number of supplement manufacturers.  Products containing BMPEA sold by GNC include Fastin and Fastin DMAA Free (Hi Tech Pharmaceuticals), Meltdown (VPX Sports) and Isolean 2 (Advanced Nutrition Systems).Picamilon is a synthetic compound of GABA and niacin found in some supplements promoted for physical performance or cognitive enhancement. According to the lawsuit, GNC was aware as early as May of 2007 that it was not a lawful dietary supplement ingredient, but sold products containing the compound, such as Charge Extreme Energy Booster (Labrada Bodybuilding Nutrition), Turbo Shred (Swole Sports Nutrition) and Mr. Hyde - Fruit Punch (Prosupps USA LLC) until September of 2015.GNC has filed a motion to remove the lawsuit. A statement issued by the company noted," There is no basis for the Oregon Attorney General's assertion that GNC or any other retailer "knew or should have known" that these ingredients were not legal for use in dietary supplements. As a matter of law, this critical legal issue remains undetermined as neither FDA nor any court has issued a legally binding determination of the status of these ingredients. GNC stopped selling products with BMPEA and picamilon, immediately upon learning indirectly, rather than from notice directed at GNC, that FDA did not view BMPEA and picamilon as legal dietary ingredients."See Related Warnings:FDA Identifies More Products Listing Synthetic AmphetamineDoes Your Weight Loss or Sports Supplement Contain Synthetic Amphetamine?Study Finds Some Vinpocetine Supplements Contain No VinpocetineTo read the complaint filed against GNC, which includes a list of products containing BMPEA and picamilon which were sold by the company, use the red link below.http://www.doj.state.or.us/releases/pdf/general_nutrition_corporation_complaint.pdf

Be Aware: Recalls and Warnings: Consuming a Single Energy Drink May Increase Cardiovascular Risk!(Date Posted: 11/11/2015)A recently published study found that consumption of a single caffeinated energy drink significantly increased blood pressure and noradrenaline levels in healthy young adults. The researchers noted these changes could potentially increase the risk of cardiovascular events. The study was published on November 8, 2015 in the Journal of the American Medical Association (JAMA).In the study, 25 healthy adults consumed a 16 oz. energy drink ***(Rockstar, Rockstar Inc.)*** containing 240 mg of caffeine, 2000 mg of taurine, and extracts of guarana seed, ginseng root, and milk thistle. On a separate day, the same adults consumed a placebo beverage that was similar in color and taste but did not contain caffeine or other stimulants. Measurements taken 30 minutes after the drinks were consumed found that, following ingestion of the energy drink, blood pressure increased an average of 6.4% (about 5 mm Hg), compared to a 1% increase (about 1 mm Hg) following ingestion of the placebo drink. Blood levels of norepinephrine (noradrenaline) increased by 73.6% following ingestion of the energy drink, compared to 30.9% after placebo. Compared to placebo, there was no significant difference in heart rate increase.The researchers warned that the increases in blood pressure and noradrenaline following ingestion of the energy drink could pose an increased cardiovascular risk, but stated the larger studies are needed.See ConsumerLab.com's Review of B Vitamin Supplements and Energy Drinks for more information about the safety of energy drinks and tests of related products.To access the complete study, use the red link below.http://jama.jamanetwork.com/article.aspx?articleID=2469194

It's very easy, as an Amazon reviewer, to post nice videos, and sing praises of a product to ensure you receive more free stuff. I am an Amazon reviewer, and I received these earbuds at to cost to evaluate and review.My first impression was these buds were a real tangle to deal with. Being smooth, round, rubber coated basic cording, these will tangle, be certain of that.  The magnetic "bud", which separates easily, yet does not fall apart, goes behind your neck, leaving the very "well-fitting" ear buds (best for large ears, will be problem for women or smaller ears) and the small rectangular volume switch hangs rather high, just below your throat, about clavicle height. The magnetic bud worn at neck in back, cleverly has the charging port in one side of the magnets closure.My two issues with these buds are 1. the sound is clear...but there is insufficient volume for me to really enjoy my music. Listening to music at lower volume, or audio books might not be an issue. But the volume is a major issue for me. Depending on how you listen to music, let the volume concern help you decide. 2. Because of the clever, but "tentacle-like" nature of these buds, for me they're like sorting rubber bands, each time I use them, and regardless of how I store them.Hope this helps.

I was asked to evaluate/review this product, and received a sample at no cost.While the product is Silicon, and likely without toxic PBAs, which is nice, the amount of actual "vibration" the device is capable of putting out, is well BELOW what is typically acceptable/effective for "usable stimulation".There are much better products out there, and Lelo is one.  Issue with Lelo is their products tend to be staggeringly overpriced, because they are well made.  Amazon's selection isn't very expansive. If this is for your personal/private use/or a couple here's an old favorite which will "buzz" enough to absolutely do the trick. Being corded, it can be slipped into the vaginal canal, and the remote can be used to turn on, and modify strength and measure of pulsing, felt deep inside.  Excellent as simply clitoral stim as well, and inexpensive: http://bit.ly/1NHS00A .To really pack a wallop and get unbelievable results (I assure you...) my old Hitachi corded powerhouse rips orgasms from your lady.  Amazon has a nice inexpensive version: http://amzn.to/1NHRgZz.  The Hitachi classic looks much like the last one I suggested, but is known for stunning power, and results (most often seen in porn).

A sports ball, is a sports ball. There are many manufacturers and levels of quality.  What matters to me as much as using the ball, is how easy it is to get ready for use.  There are NO instructions provided, so figuring out inflation - you're on your own, which should be easy, right?  After reading reviews (not knowing if store had shotgunned Amazon reviewers, like myself with free balls for review), many said inflating ball was a cinch with accordion pump provided. My experience was dead confusion as to which tube went where. NO INSTRUCTIONS.  The "pump" is the absolute cheapest/useless device I've ever seen for this application.  Cord kept being blown out of ball (losing just pumped-in air), again, and again.A friend has a ball she showed my wife (who picked this up for me here on Amazon), different supplier, ball, and pump.  The pump shown to my wife was stiff and deeper pump, with metal bands around each tier of accordion, so it could be re-used if ball needed to deflated and inflated again. The difference between the two I cannot find words for. The other a usable, impressive pump. This "device", not even fit for a toy really.Had the ball inflated at my gym.  This ball retains a noticeable "PVC" or vinyl (shower curtain odor) still, about a wekk later. It's used as a seat for my office in our home, and whole office still has strong PVC odor.In nutshell, ball went to Goodwill, and I picked one up at sporting good store...with usable, strong pump.

UNU supplied me with this product to evaluate & review here.  Like many review readers, I watch for freely offered merchandise, expecting an outstanding analysis because the reviewer wants more stuff.Anyway, the UNU SUPERAK portable battery is exceptionally nice.  It's 5000kmAh (milliamps - iPhone 6 carries 1,810mAh battery, by contrast the Samsung 6 Edge a 2600mAh, & the Samsung Note 4 a more substantive 3200mAh) capacity, at full charge, can theoretically "recharge" any of the phones mentioned above, some twice.  Chargers like this, whether Anker, a fine maker of portable batteries, or this UNO PORTAPAK, hold a charge a long time, weeks in fact without being topped off.  I like the small charger size, it slips into my back jeans pocket, but with a bulge in that it's 3,75" long...but about an inch wide.  It's more an issue for jeans pockets than a suit coat or purse. Great size in cold weather, multi-zippered coats.  I've already charged from near empty...my Samsung Note 3, and of four LEDs on chargers side (to suggests available charge), 3 of the 4 lamps were out.  That's not bad for the heavy 3200mAh Note 3 battery to filled.Here's the pice de rsistance. The charging cord which comes with the battery has a standard USB male plug on one side, and a WONDERFUL "piggy-back" arrangement of MICRO USB (Android, etc.) with an attached LIGHTENING interface for someones iPhone. The two tips are attached by a small piece of plastic and always there in whatever flavour you require in the moment.  This feature alone is worth the savings in aggravation of 'whose got a micro cable??? NO...that's for my iPhone!!!.This is especially handy and offsets my uncertainty about charger shape. There is both a MICRO and STANDARD outlet on the end to allow powering and charging options of every sort/device.  This accompanying cord would have been wonderful were in somehow attached to the charger...eliminating the need to carry two things...and a small carry-bag would have been a nice touch as well.But for a very fair price, right here on Amazon when available (which should be shortly - after reviews finish is my guess), and the 5k power and compactness...ADDED to the piggy-back MICRO & LIGHTENING interface availability, you simply cannot lose here.If you have family with both iPhones & Androids...this is a grief saver!

Highly recommended to those who need the glue of genius to improvise repairs, convenience remodeling, and a dozen applications waiting in your house right now!HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

I received these cables to evaluate and review on Amazon.The cables performed flawlessly. I'm an Android User, with a wife, daughter, and son with iPhones. I asked them all to try the Baxia cords for a couple days and give me any and all feedback, plus or minus.Bottom line, they performed like OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer - Apple in this case) equipment. My son seemed to experience a faster charge than OEM. He's very tech oriented, so I'll include his observation. Everyone found the contacts a STURDY FIT, the lightening male connector fitting tightly/securely into phones, and charging time seemed NO DIFFERENT than OEM. Both daughter and wife reported the Baxia cables felt "more substantial - solid", than OEM.  That's a distinctly positive bit of feedback, and makes owning Baxia cables even more desirable than Apple product replacements.The price point is very good, and there seemed no issue using the Baxia cables with Apple AC power source. This is a short review in that I've nothing in the "con" category to report.I'm hoping Baxia will eventually offer cables for Android brand as well. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, and my experience seems to reflect what most others found using Baxia.

I received this product to evaluate and review. This is a fantastic replacement for my Anker portable charger. Less expensive, and all the stuff I need. Size is excellent for 10,200mAh charging power, and it fits in my back pocket nicely. Yes, I sit on it, it's with me all day long should the need for power arise, and it's admirably STURDY.  I received mine charged to illuminate 3 of the packs 4 beautiful Blue LED indicator lamps.  It took about an hour and a half to top off, so plan on enough time to recharge MoJuice when it's low!Really nice is "sedentary drain" is not an issue.  I just tested my MoJuice charger by pressing power button, and all four LEDs lit, full charge, with last charge to unit being almost two weeks ago.  It's there when you need it.  Equally FANTASTIC, the micro USB charging strip is incorporated into the MoJuice's smooth design. Just pull the strip cord from the side of the unit and no NEED TO CARRY ADDITIONAL CORDS!  I love this!Included on the charger, at top, are the micro-UDSB port for charging, and a standard USB port for extra convenience.I'm very happy with this product. I have no "cons" to pass along. Price is great right here on Amazon, and VERY HARD TO FIND a portable charger with BUILT-IN charging cord, no clue why. Highly recommended by this reviewer.

Of FOUR "watches" i purchased, THREE had same defect. One "segment" of LED, upper right, was defective/not working...on ALLl 3. The left vertical segment of a numeral "4" (open four) was dead. Additionally, the amount of pressure needed to press the display button went from fine, to impossible (needed to get thumbnail in slot and PRESS, to get LEDs to illuminate.See attached photo, where Red arrow I inserted marks the DEAD LED segment. LOVE a return people. Do you have ANY which actually work?Purchase at risk!

I was provided with Diffuser to evaluate and review.PROS:Well crafted, solid, unit, with very easy/intuitive directions for use. The plastic dome turns once, and lifts off exposing the water cavity. Iused filters water from refrigerator door to fill the basin. I happen to have a bottle of Clary-Sage oil I use for after shave, so I used 5-6 dropsto add to water. The wood body feel substantial, and the AC cord plugs right into back of unit. There are two "soft" buttons, easily accessedTo Turn On, Pause (nice feature), and select from an amazing offering of colors. You can also allow the colors to slowly blend into oneanother if that's a soothing look for you. Along with Pause, you can set the unit be on for three minutes, off for three. This conserves water/oil mixture, and regulates strength of scent.The scent is immediately apparent and can be very strong, so adjusting drops of oil is by experimentation. You can ACTUALLY see the stream of vapor whirling from opening some 6-8 inches into the air, a very "soft", soothing physical dynamic. Overall the unit seems to fit a guy's environment, as well as a female's. The wood provides a very Scandinavian look. Vapor last a good while, about 2 hours and change before refill, and depending upon FULL ON or INTERMITTENT modes.  Three thick rubber legs keep the diffuser on the surface it's placed. Won't skid around on you.CON:Not a big deal at all...however, the Red and Green LED lights, which tell you which modes are in effect, are mounted in the front of the diffuser (the power cord comes in the other side, or back). I have no problem with this. The LEDs are not intrusive on a long piece of furniture in our dining room, where the scent moves around the area nicely. If in a bedroom, in the dark, the LEDs would be rather bright. Just a heads-up. Curious design. For me the front LEDs aren't a deal-breaker, at all! Diffuser can be angled to face the LEDs off to the side of course.Recommended!With great looks and adding a scented oil to bathe room in preferred fragrance, this unit is wonderful at a great price here on Amazon.
Great cable! TWO cables (each bagged) for one low price. Sturdy, yet flexible so when plugged into device, moving phone wont bend/stress the male/female connection. Nice!

I was supplied with Mastermind for evaluation, and this review. The product arrived nicely boxed with a Zahler baseball cap, and my hopes were not high for Mastermind.  Working with the helping profession, I'm keenly aware of products addressing mental health in general, anxiety (GAD) and depressive disorders in particular.  As a child I had a profound anxiety disorder. It was hell. Proper meds wisely combined w/ talk therapy helped amazingly over years.  Thank god for meds.  Where would the suffering be without them? But side-effects are a bitch.A terribly close friend of mine ("Jane", thirty-two), has suffered a "profound" depressive disorder (genetically predisposed) all her life. It ebbs/flows, as depression will (often exacerbated by environment/situations/stress. She has most recently been on Prozac (SSRI) and  Diazepam (Valium), which have offered minimal benefits, and she'd begun tapering off those for lack of benefit vs. side effects.  She has undergone TMS (trans-cranial magnetic stimulation), the effect of which was really hard to determine.When approached by Zahler, I asked Jane if she were up for another option.  Key is the profundity of her depression. She is very bright, reviewed the materials (the fact this product is NATURAL - made of things found in nature, as opposed to pharmaceutical chemicals), and jumped inIt's a 30 day regiment, 4 caps a day, two morning, two night. After 3 days she identified a "noticeable" difference. I was very skeptical. We spoke daily. She claimed she felt, a bit "lighter". The month passed with reports she was feeling better as she went along. She took two capsules mid-day with lunch, two before bed. NO SIDE EFFECTS AT ALL were experienced!After the 30 days, she reported Mastermind has had a "significant" effect on her profound depression! More so than Prozac, and finds her needing Valium, less often as needed. This is terribly, terribly impressive & important. She estimates (and it's hard to put numbers to...), Mastermind increased her mood by "about", 20%, more so than Prozac, and any "cocktail" she's been on. Stunning.What's critical: depression is so difficult on mind/body/stress, depressed people say, 'it's a physical pain as well as emotionally immobilizing. It simply "blunts" all emotion. SO...a 20% decrease in torment, is CONSIDERABLE, worth it's weight in years of life. I don't mean to sound overly dramatic, but my dear friend suffers 20% LESS, because of this trial with Mastermind. Before reviewing, I waited to check her mood AFTER  Mastermind. Two weeks after use, she reports feeling less "light", less motivated and happy in general. Remarkable. There's a con.CON: This is NOT an inexpensive product! Retailing at $99. ($78 here on Amazon - for how long?), and as a postal worker, not in good financial shape, another $100. monthly, top of car payments, insurance, rent, etc., she's in a really tough spot  Hopefully money will not stop those who need this stuff. Bottom line: I'm TERRIBLY impressed with Mastermind.  I highly recommend those who suffer depression give it a full 30 day try, see what it might do for your body's chemical make-up. I intend to try it myself.Ron Kolman

I was provided with this product for evaluation and review. This is an entirely new company to me. To determine "Quality", I'd first check ingredients.A preferred company for most of my supplements is Carlson. I trust them for many reasons, so let's check Carlson D3, against PCNL D3.PRO: You get a lot of product (360 TINY gel caps), of 5k International Units (IU) D3, for a very good price (about $16.) with PCNL Platinum.CON: Quantity isn't always quality. For example: PCNL uses Soybean Oil in its D3. Generally speaking Soybean oil, in food, isn't good for you.  It suppresses the thyroid, and could contribute significantly to obesity ion our culture. Carlson uses Sunflower oil, lighter, and assists in  controlling cholesterol and blood pressure.  Sunflower oil costs a company more to use (PCNL is inexpensive, yes).CON: PCNL uses Vegetable Glycerin which breaks down to add triglycerides (unhealthy) to the body. However in the small amounts you'd be  getting in PCNL D3, relatively benign!  Carlson, uses a more expensive approach: Glycerin: classified as a sugar alcohol, but  more similar to sugars: readily absorbed and is probably converted into glucose.  One can say it's not critical in the long run: I think it  speaks to the company's mind set, and quality goals. I don't need more triglycerides in my blood.CON: There is an extra "Vegetable Oil" listed in PCNL's ingredients. Might be for shelf life. But WHAT KIND of vegetable oil? Something healthy  like Canola, or something cheap and less attractive like Palm Kernel, or Coconut Oil (cheaper).Both companies use "gelatin" made from animal source (cow hooves and bone), rather than a more desirable Vegetable Cellulose. In PCNL's case, I might chalk it up to expense, but Carlson uses the same...so I'm at a loss here. I DO wish Carlson would begin using Vegetable cellulose instead.Bottom line...Too many extras in PCNL, cheaper product. Will it work? Likely just fine, given the above. You certainly have more value in PCNL quantity:price. Now quality is another story.

This is a unique and interesting concept for brewing tea as you like it.  This is a great tea maker. It's not quite as tightly manufactured as Teavana's gadget (some drops from bottom of pot in transferring to mug), but keeping a dish towel around and problem solved. Home-Complete Tea Maker does EXACTLY the same as Teavana's for less bucks.  Buy more tea with savings!  The smart design allows you to put tea in bulk, flavourings, even water with chunks of sweet fruit to make a dazzling flavoured water cooler, steep as you choose, and simply lift the pot (THE BOTTOM IS SEALED BY PLASTIC COVER), and transport to your mug. As you rest the pot on the rim of your cup, the plastic disc keeping everything inside pot, allows the contents to drain through strainer, and fill1. out of box a breeze to use. Pot, plastic stand, and really clear instructions & ideas for use.2. filter simply pops-out for cleaning (there's a metal ball seated beneath the filter.  careful it doesn't fall out and go rolling under the refrigerator,  the final resting place for screws, pens and pills that make it to the floor.3. great for the office as well to knock out a fast cup of tea, cold or hot, as you prefer it.Clever, very USEABLE idea, great price, right here on Amazon.Product provided for evaluation/review purposes.

I was asked to evaluate this product for an honest review. I've had a beard since twenty-three, and have one today decades later.There are lots of "beard products" out there. Here's my honest evaluation:PROS: very pleasant fragrance. subtle, but tones of tobacco and smoke (Bergamont) which I really like.  not at all greasy, rather a thick-ish balm which emulsifies nicely, and makes for easy application. I use fingertips and just apply as I  would a conditioner.  packages smartly. clear container is pleasant (avoided bright colours for guys (smart), and dispenses lotion easily, just right amount.  I use Just For Men to keep my beard colour enough colour, enough grey. the constant use of colouring dries a beard out. using Mr.  Rugger/Bold seems to have softened my beard, and perhaps...helped the ends, frayed from Just For Men use.*In all I recommend you try it!CON:  like men's colognes (I like a citrus blend, crisp clean), fragrance applied to skin dissipates rather "quickly". applied to fabric (sweater,  shirt), the scent can go all day and into evening. heavier, natural oil-based fragrances dissolve on warm skin, and will last much longer  sans alcohol. I'd hoped the manufacturer, who seems very erudite where scents are concerned, beards, and VERY consumer aware,  would have concocted  scent heavier in longer lasting oils, with a chance of staying with you beard - all day? scents like Royal Spice &  Royal Rum (Google them), do last a very long time which is a real pleasure.*Bottom line, I'd truly recommend this product. I dropped a star for not having a scent that can stay with you past 20 mins.

I'm a real Maslow "appreciator". Mike Lewis, back in the 60s, worked with Maslow as a grad student. Mike made the switch from psych to orthopedic/sports medicine, and is rather well known in his field. He did my rotator cuff surgery.While I truly enjoy the way Lewis has cobbled some of Maslow's best philosophies and observations into "Colors", the inclusion of full-page photos from various family vacations I could have done w/o. For me, they enhance nothing, and simply get in the way.I think Lewis had the opportunity to coalesce Maslow's best insights into a real self help presentation, and just missed the mark.

These headphones are extremely comfortable, with flex in the structure to move nicely with your head, and allow the soft pads to stay in play and eliminate most noise, ideal for extended wear. For the price, music sounds excellent. I'm looking for volume - w/o distortion, clear and crisp highs, and bass that's rich and deep There's plenty of volume, bass thankfully deep and has some "thump". The SoundPeats deliver all of the sound spectrum, and I believe will not disappoint at this price.PROS: The SoundPeats do use a handy standard micro USB charger, have fantastically placed and designed buttons for volume (UP volume has raised edge for easy identification. Forward and reverse buttons are notched as well and easily locatable. There is a smartly placed PLAY/PAUSE button at bottom of left ear piece, and POWER/PAIR button on right pad. Pairing is a breeze. Very cool, is the charging port positioned next to a useable jack, and with right cord you can go "WIRED" if you choose. An EXTREMELY nice feature rarely seen.Phones have solid feel, substantial weight, and feel well constructed. Buttons and rubber flapped charger port are all substantial. NO sense of cheap her AT ALL!CON: The phones disappointed a bit in calls. The call is likely to sound fine to YOU. Your caller might identify your voice as "muffled". Three people mentioned the muffled issue, in my trials, two...did NOT. Charge has a great deal to do with performance. A low battery will degrade all sound associated with a Bluetooth device. Keep a good charge!Bottom line: music sounds great, and phone calls are NOT a "loss", just not the "best" I've heard. Reason for purchase: Was offered sample product for evaluation, fair/honest review. I'm common consumer as you likely, and avid camper enjoying strenuous hiking. My evaluation is based solely on quality, durability, and "value".Pros:1. STURDY: early Spring camping and hiking trails in Minnesota showed these crampons "tough. On 45 degree slopes, teeth bit into  ground, clashing with rocks, without any damage to cleats.2. WEBBING: strong, continuously abraded by stone without cuts or breakage. Impressive. I've crampons designed for repelling costing about  $100, and CampLeaders performed as well. Given price, compared to quality = HIGH in VALUE!3. STRAP ON: I'm a size 11 shoe (wide), and these Large crampons slip on like butter. On both feet in under three minutes.4.  FIT: with correct fit (I mention my sizing in point 3), these crampons NEVER slipped off. A fine set of crampons should never slip from  shoe/boot.5.  PRICE: as fine a product as my Angled HillSound Pros (about $80 on Amazon). Same quality & performance costing $15 - $26, right here on  Amazon.Cons:1. Absence of anti-balling pad is disappointment, but AB pad typically found on crampons 3-5 times the price, and for singularly serious  climbing.You can use CampLeader crampons to hike steep hills w/o concern, easily traverse snowy/icy Winter conditions, SIGNIFICANTLY reducing chance of falling!  If doing yard work - planting grass seeds - wearing crampons will aerate your lawn with every step. Clever idea.Additional Thoughts: I enjoyed using these crampons and have suggested friends look into these. I'd likely never have tried a pair at this low coast, if not for this opportunity. I learned quite a bit about price assumptions and value.Company that provided me the product: CampLeader/crampons - fifth editionCompany that shipped the product: CampLeader/crampons - fifth editionShipping time: Item was shipped out promptly and boxed smartly and securely.Would I buy this product; YES, unquestionably and recommend.I take pride in these evaluations/reviews. I check consumer feedback on Amazon, whenever possible, and am glad to give back honest feedback for your consideration prior to purchase. Hope my perspective is helpful.Good fortune & Health!

Quality product. Rated well in ConsumerLab.com, and ingredients are clean, manufacturing seems top notch. I called the 800 # on bottle, asked for consumer affairs, and an extremely gracious rep explained it can happen once in a great while. I was offered this product at no cost to evaluate and review.My first impression, in handling the recorder, was it felt rather light, had a "cheap" feel, but cheap isn't a factor of weight. They packed a lot into this device and it's feature rich. 1) Ear buds, 2) USB data sync charging cable, 3) Phone recording jack (connects phone and wall line to voice recorder for call recording - GREAT feature!), AND 4) Clip on microphone (for use with interviews or hands free self-recording - also a fantastic gadget!), and 5) Li-ion battery.QUALITY of RECORDING: I would not use this device to record music, that's a shame. But for voice, the iGearPro does a nice job.  Results are clear, but not as loud as I would prefer, mic just isn't the very best.  The recorder's 8GB storage should offer about upside of 80 hours of recording, which should be sufficient for most meetings, interviews, thoughts-to-self.  You can transfer higher quality files to it from your computer if you want to use it for music playback. Actually any files.  You can use this just like a flash drive for documents, or JPG files for transfer to another computer also.You'll find BUTTONS CLEARLY LABELED and simple RECORD & PLAY. No problem using the Lapel Mic quickly. These are important selling points; reasons why I would purchase. All buttons/functions are clearly marked, spaced nicely, and made for quick finger access and comfort. Instructions are not easy to read, not easily understood, but the very basic functionality of a hand-held recorder should allow most to intuitively get going.So you can, if you choose, transfer your music files for listening, Mac OS X v10.6 and newer will recognize this recorder because it's formatted FAT 32. For voice recording it works really well, good price here on Amazon and easy as pie to use.With ease of use, solidly "GOOD" recording, thoughtful & handy features, lapel mic (very cool), and great price point,  I use the one I received to evaluate, and have had no issues with it thus far. I'm happy to own this item, and happy to recommend it to you as a reviewer on Amazon..

I love these. Prior to these full-length pants, the 3/4 length were ideal for the gym/working out. These are as well. Same quality/substantial feel to material (94% Cotton, 6% Spandex), the right weight, with the perfect amount of "give". Stitching is tight and has an expensive feel, much like a pair of LuLu Lemon yoga pants my wife picked up for me. Quite a bit less obviously - fore essentially the very same thing.The Length is perfect, falling right at the arch of my foot (just a bit higher than where the pants fall in the pair pictured). In work-out shoes, the fall in perfect. (I'm 6'0"/185 and I ordered a LARGE. In jeans I'm a 34W/32L.) Running down the outside of each leg is a woven strip which allows for better air circulation. The feel against the skin is soft and smooth, no cling even when sweating, and allows for maximum range of motion. I really like the way the pants conform to my body and sit right at the hips, with an elastic top band, to hold the pants where you want them, and long cloth ties knotting the way "scrubs" tie-off.  I've picked up another pair, and can see these will be a favourite casual "slack" in nice weather. Light, flattering a man's body, with comfortable/handy side slash pockets AND a back pocket for wallet phone, etc.Reviewing for YogaAddict is a treat. Being introduced to perhaps the most comfortable pants I've owned was a real find. Highly recommended for the gym, yoga, kickboxing, and lounging around the house, going out to a movie (you've got pockets!), just about anywhere you'd wear jeans or slacks. Looking forward to many years of comfortable wear in these! Enjoy.RonProduct supplied by YogaAddict for evaluation and reviewing purposes.

Perhaps better than Breaking Bad. OUCH! I know...but there were times it SAMCRO had me on the edge of chair, and I'm not easily impressed. EXCELLENT character development, 180s at break-neck speed. You don't know what's possible next.HIGHLY recommended!Ron
Wires quickly loosened from the plastic port casings, and finally just hung from a thread of wire - fell out/off.I'd not recommend.

I was asked to review this product.The first sample received simply would not dispense any soap. Before I could contact the seller, the soap in the container leaked through the device, and into the battery compartment, finally all over the counter. After communication with the seller, relating the story, I was told failure with this product was 1%, or less.The second sample was received. While this one did dispense tiny amounts of soap, the soap, once again, leaked through the device, into battery department, and all over the counter-top. Stay clear of this device!

I was asked to review this product. I had a simple (costly of course being an Apple product) clear case on my iPhone 6. When I began to evaluate the case...I noticed my phone settled sweetly into the HUSKK plastic carrier, snapped in solidly, settled and ready to go. No jiggle, everything "perfectly" aligned, and a solid feel for such a minimalistic carrier. Corners nicely bolstered, and extension of corner "bumpers" is a fraction longer than edge of case, to provide a buffer for screen in event of a fall. The case is cleverly cut-away, so camera is available without case interference, even if you elect to add an iPhone camera attachment, that's rare!.The rest in fine leather, beautifully stitched, and layered with an eye for contour and precision, so you've a "neat" and clean look to the entire affair. The front pocket holds cards perfectly, The taller leather backing provides a "pouch" between the taller flap and the case. Here is where I keep my paper money, and a security key for my Audi. I love leather (sorry), and buffed-up the already expensive looking pockets with Cadillac (none better, try it) leather cream, and it softened, has more luster, and is better protected. My cards which needn't be with me at all times, are locked in a file cabinet at home. This goes everywhere with me, including the gym. At the office, and slipping out of my suit pocket, the HUSSK phone case/wallet has gotten it's share of comments in a very short time.Whole wallet/case, with cards,key, and enough folding money fits in my jeans without creating anymore bulge (I hate that) in front pocket, than the phone itself (under 10mm loaded). This is my case from this point on. My son twenty, and daughter twenty-three, have both made plans to order one of these for themselves ('Nooo, you can NOT have mine...').  All at a terribly fair (and less than expected) price of less than $50, right here on Amazon.I've seen all sorts of cases online, and mallet ideas for iPhone 6 being offered for backing on Kickstarter.  This is the best I've found. I do hope HUSKK with offer-up case-wallets for my wife's Note 3, and other Samsung/iPhone models as they're slammed at us.Highly recommended byRon Kolman

Just the best "quick-release" hip carrier for smart phones, my Samsung Note 3 in particular. Minimalistic case secures your phone, and hip-clip is strongest, most secure, and nearly unbreakable to wear in the vulnerable position (also the HANDIEST) on your hip.I'd slammed my last hip carrier against so many door frames, so many times, after about a year and change...it just gave up. Just received my replacement which will handily take me through my decision to go with Note 4...or wait and see what Note 5 looks like.For Case, carrier, and all your phone's needs...you can't beat SEIDIO. Period!

Best replacement adapter/cord for double-charge adapter, as needed for my Samsung Note 3 (and other Samsung devices - DO CHECK!). Best male/female fit, good, snug connection, and have never gotten 'Please use OEM cables for rapid charge'. The "sung fit" is CRITICAL I find, and with the lightweight cable, excess pressure is slim to none on your phone's charging port. Has yet to fall out after significant use, while charging!NOTE: because the cable is wonderfully long (10 feet), DO BE CAREFUL of extra cord getting tangled as you move about. One good yank from surface will cause phone to go flying, and will more than likely ruin the adapter fir (and possibly your phone's port). NOT A REASON to avoid...simply a heads-up to be careful with the great extra length.
Fair price for high-capacity ink. blazing fast delivery, right here on Amazon!Recommended - price right on the dime competitive.
