This new version of the Key West Frozen Concoction machine has only slight improvements over the original; it holds more ice, and it has a new jar with an "easy pour" lid which you no longer need to remove to pour drinks. These two improvements mean you can make more drinks, in the same amount of time, as you don't need to refill its ice reservoir as often. There is no larger motor as it uses the same 450 Watt motor as the original, and it has the same controls. The product review claims a new bullet style blender, but I got the exact same beverages out of it as my original Key West unit.Sadly, these improvements don't add up to justifying the new price - at current list price of $299, it is almost $140 more than the entry level machine, which does exactly the same:Shave Ice from cubesDispense ice into blenderBlend drinkAll of these machines are essentially the same, the only difference is the price. And for all of the fans of Jimmy Buffet - keep in mind that these machines are just mass produced by Sunbeam who license the name.The final product from this new Key West machine is certainly good, but it is exactly the same as all the other machines. Whether this increased ice  reservoir is worth $140 is a matter of personal taste, and how often you plan to make frozen drinks. If you are like most people, you'll only pull this out once or twice a year. If on the other hand, you enjoy a tasty frozen beverage daily, then a larger jar might be worth the extra money to you.

This is a great concept, and on the box and product description this looks amazing. We waited till we finally had a nice warm day, found a flat surface with nothing sharp to set it up, and hoped for a fun time That fun time was over in about 8 minutes. This product does NOT deliver, and it has a major quality problem when a side seam burst. It appears to be beyond repairable state, so ended up in the trash.

Judging the usability of this product is extremely hard to do - the results are not known for weeks of use, and the technology behind the product is mostly based on theoretical results. All studies on these products use terms like "are believed", and "the actual results will vary by skintype". In other words - this may or may not work for you. That said, the technology isn't entirely bogus (like magnetic bracelets), so it isn't fair to give the product a poor rating based off on individuals results. In my case, I used it daily for three weeks, and didn't see any difference - but then again, I also didn't see my skin get worse (and it is summer), so it wouldn't be right to produce a bad rating, as there are clearly enough people who DO see good results. I'll leave it with this piece of scientific explaining about what goes on when you use the wand:Red light LEDs are also believed to target the skins oil glands to reduce cytokines, a class of pro-inflammatory substances believed to play a role in chronic acne.I don't have acne (at the moment), so perhaps NOT breaking out is thanks to this device. I'll never know...

This is an incredible little charger. As promised, it pumps out 20V at 65W, and was able to keep my Lenovo Yoga 2 Pro running and charging, without getting too hot.The charger beat the mythical Finsix dart to the market, but that is no surprise since that charger is 8 months late to market. It is also smaller than the FSP laptop charger, which until now was one of the smallest on the market.Downsides in my opinion are that the plugs are relatively easy to lose and that it doesn't come with a carrying pouch for the plugs, but other than that, this is a great purchase for people with a NORMAL laptop charger plug.The kit is missing charger plugs for the newer Samsung ATIV book line, as well (of course) with the Surface tablets which use proprietary magnetic plugs. Additionally, as more and more laptops move to USB-C this laptop will eventually become obsolete. But till then - kudos to the manufacturer for making a winning device.

As a wireless charger, this Belkin performs quite well. Once you position your phone correctly, it charges with abound 1.3A of power, which is about the maximum you'll get out of Qi. It does not work well through a case, as the coil is quite small, and the unit has a single coil (as shown by others). It does include a small AC adapter and a decent USB cable, but it is still around 2x the price of similar Qi chargers from reliable brands.The LED indicates when it is charging, and turns red when the charging isn't working right. Sadly, the whole product is entirely reliant upon the user placing their phone exactly right. This is caused by their decision to use a single coil. As you can see in the photo of the interior, the actual board and coil is just a small portion of the internals, so they made the product larger than it has to be, making phone positioning even harder.At the end of the day, it is just a basic Qi charger with a not-so basic price tag.

In its shipping box, you'd be forgiven if it arrives, and you don't realize the box contains a tent. The TN 2 packs/rolls nicely into a relatively flat pack, making it the ideal backpacking tent. At 4lbs, it is a good weight for your average trail backpacker, but may be too heavy for those trying to go ultra-lightweight.Setup was simple (in a backyard test), and as long as you've done this before, you'll have the tent setup in no time. The included stakes are fine for hard soil, but won't do you much good for sandy ground.One of the best features of this tent is a massive mesh opening on, making it ideal for warmer nights, or for when you just want to lie down and look at the sky. That said, when open, the mesh does not provide any privacy, so keep that in mind. The mesh is fine enough to keep blowing sand out, and condensation in the morning stayed on the outside and didn't penetrate the inside.As far as space is concerned, when I was in the tent with my Osprey Aether 85 pack, things were snug - so I'm not sure the 2 person moniker is entirely valid. If you feel comfortable storing your gear outside the tent, you could fit 2 people in there, but you'd better be good friends, because you'll be pretty close.Repacking the tent wasn't too bad, but you'll be re-rolling it several times till you get it tight enough to fit back in the bag. You may be better off with a different sack to store it in.

At $275, the Spyder 5 Elite is the most expensive Spyder 5 calibrator. Sadly, Datacolor seems to have fallen for the old Microsoft trick of offering several versions of their software. Express, Pro and Elite all come with the same calibration tool, but the different software versions do different things; and there is a $150 price difference between the entry level and the top one (Elite). For that $150, you get ambient light settings (using the light sensor on the front of the calibrator), faster tune-up calibrations and full screen mode for calibration before and after checks.The calibration itself isn't bad, but there are a lot of dialog boxes that get in the way and can be turned off after the initial check. Some small annoyances are present, like having to manually click "update" after each brightness change when calibrating. Why they didn't allow for live checks is beyond me.The final result is very good, so it definitely deserves some points there. The "hanging" lens cover system seems like a decent idea, but on larger monitors it isn't all that convenient and you'll need to tilt it quite a bit to ensure the sensor is positioned right. The USB cable is also too short if you are using a floor placement desktop computer.

I can sum this cable up in one word: "meh". It doesn't feel overly well made, but in my tests (iPhone 6 and iPad Air 2) it performed just like the original. Sadly, at $20 it just is not worth it. There are much better and cheaper cables to be found on Amazon. In fact, this cable is a whole buck MORE than the original Apple cable. Other than pretty colors, these cables do not offer anything worth a buck more than the one Apple makes

I'll admit that based off my previous experience with Belkin products that I wasn't expecting much from this universal mount, but they have pleasantly surprised me. The mount feels really well made, with a spring loaded clamp system using metal brackets internally instead of the usual plastic. The suction portion locks in place using a nice dial, and the package includes a self adhesive mounting disc.I took it out for a spin with my Nexus 6 installed (which fits nicely by the way). Even on a hot day, the mount didn't come off the windshield.The entire thing feels over-engineered, and it is really well packaged, and if you are looking for a reliable mount for a larger phone, this is a good choice.

This NuTone branded (officially this is the GD00Z: Linear Z-Wave Garage Door Opener Remote Controller Accessory) is the first full Z-Wave garage door controller. The product has been available since January as part of the Lowes Iris system, but now it has moved on to being available as a stand-alone product in four different "flavors": Lowes Iris, Schlage Nexia, NuTone and Linear . That said, because the system is entirely Z-Wave compliant, it should work fine on any other Z-Wave controller, For example; I can use this on my Smartthings controller, but it also works on the Vera Lite controller. Both need little work to get them installed right.One of the highlights of the system is its security. In addition to this, it is also a rare secure Z-Wave repeater - this means any Z-Wave products you have in the area of the controller will repeat through this, which should increase the range. On some Z-Wave setups, you may need to do a rescan or reinitialize of the Z-Wave devices to get them all synced.Installation was pretty simple, and I had the setup working on my Chamberlain controller in no time. Unlike the Chamberlain MyQ system (which I also use in its add-on version), this system is wired, and connects to the push button connections on your opener.The system also includes a tilt sensor, so it always knows the status of the door. All in all a good system, but one with some stiff competition. The MyQ system has its own app, and is independent of any third party systems (like Nexia, Smartthings or Iris).Speaking of MyQ - the system doesn't work with MyQ enabled systems where the MyQ is built into the control pad. A list of incompatible openers can be found here: http://www.linearcorp.com/info/Linear-GD00Z-Product-Compatibility-Notice.pdf

Unless you REALLY need a slightly smaller brewer, this is a really bad value for your money. This K250 brewer is only slightly narrower, and has a smaller water tank, but it also lacks an included carafe, and when you consider that you can buy a 300 series brewer here on Amazon for LESS than this, or a 400 series at Costco or Sams for $10 more, you should hopefully see why this new K200 series just isn't a good idea.As far as the brewer goes, it isn't all that bad of a brewer, and I'll refrain from the usual complaints about the 2.0 brewer system.One new thing, and something that shows that Keurig has listened, is that an included flyer promises to swap out any 1.0 generation k-cups for 2.0 if requested, but I've yet to test that

Unlike some of the other reviewers who don't seem to understand that flavors can get mixed when all together, I'm a huge fan of these candies. They definitely have the same texture and flavor as the larger wrapped ones, but the inclusion of the watermelon makes for an interesting combination. The only complaint is that it is too easy to eat as you don't have to unwrap, so sometimes end up with a handful of these :)

Once you get past the firmware upgrade (which failed twice), this is definitely a rock solid large router. It has many of the features you'd expect from a $280 router, but is also missing a lot of them; It offers a USB 3.0 port and dual USB 2.0/eSATA Who in the home market really wants to try and get an eSATA drive hooked up to this?It also lacks a lot of the apps found on similar routers from Asus and Netgear like VPN server, download server and more.That said, where many of these other routers focus strongly on added apps and features, so far (on the latest firmware), the AC2600 has proven to be one of the more solid routers I've tested. Both speed and range were at least 50% above my Asus AC68U, and while it doesn't offer as many gimmicks, it makes up for that with a quicker UI and easier to find features.Now, on to the max link speed of 1733Mbps - I'll consider that bolderdash, since it really only can occur when you are right next to the router, and even then, home networks don't have the capacity to pull speeds like that. Even on the fastest services available, you'll have 1000Mbps to work with. In reality, you'll be seeing between 100 and 200Mbps on an AC capable device. On devices with internal antennas (like Microsoft Surface and Yoga 3 Pro), you'll start seeing speeds drop pretty quickly - albeit much more stable than on other routers.Downsides: it can't be wall mounted, and it only has 4 Gigabit ports.

This Jetsetter Pack N'Play lives up to its name thanks to a smaller than usual footprint when folded. It is still going to be up to the gate agent whether you can actually carry it on board as it is quite long and heavy. When unfolded, it turns into a half pyramid shaped Pack N'Play which makes it sturdier and less prone to falling over, which is important because unlike previous Pack N' Plays, its legs don't extend beyond the outer walls.The include canopy is brilliant as it allows baby to be in an open, yet secluded relaxing room, but because it is at the top if the "pyramid", the space will limit you to around 3-4 months at most.All in all, the perfect addition for summer travel with your baby.

First of all, this thing stinks - quite literally. It has a strong chemical smell. The light is bright, but not as bright as some of the more recent LED lights you can pick up. The unit is heavy poorly made, and takes an extremely long time to charge. Dont' bother

This is a rather disappointing product as its charger ports are only 1A (2x) and 2.1A (1x). Most multi-port USB chargers nowadays have at least 2 2.1A ports. Why is 2.1A important? Because that is what you need to charge a tablet. With three large device ports, you'd purchase this expecting to store tablets, and with these ports, it only has the power to charge 2 phones and 1 tablet.Its LED is extremely bright, and once you plug in the USB cables, the whole thing is a bit of a mess.All in all, it isn't a bad product, and has a nice touch as it stores the AC cable under a panel on the bottom, but I can't rate it higher than three stars because of the limited power output.

This is one of those products where you wonder why you didn't think of it yourself. Part trunk organizer, part carrying cooler - the Cool-N-Carry is the pinnacle of simplicity, yet offers a very efficient product. The cooler portion works perfectly, and a 12 pack of cans with some ice stayed cool for 8 hours during our early spring weather in the back of a car. You can't really carry it when the storage portions are in use without it buckling up a bit, but that is pretty much the only downside.

As another new version of Cyberlink PowerDVD, Cyberlink follows the Quicken method of adding a variety of new features most people don't need. Yes, the app will play your media, but the vast majority of the features can be done with a free copy of VLC. All the included codecs are freely available. Where it does do something most free packages struggle with is Blu-Ray playback - that said, the app is finicky about its hardware, I could easily get playback on one machine, but with a different drive (external USB) it wouldn't playback.All in all, $100 is far, far too much for the limited amount of use you'll get out of this package. Some of its most heavily advertised features are the things you'll need the LEAST- like 4K playback, Dolby 7.1 output and 3D playback. If these happen to be things you MUST have, then perhaps your $100 is worth spending, but for most people it is just throwing money away.

In an extremely crowded market of Bluetooth speakers, this little Philips will have a hard time standing out, but in real life use, it is a definite one to recommend. It sounds great - for a small crowd. It won't have the power to fill a large room without distortion. But perhaps its best feature is that it REALLY is waterproof - and not just a couple of splashes - this thing went under in the bathtub and kept on playing.At under $60, a great little speaker for the beach or other trip.

This is an amazing alternative to the larger GLM50 unit. While that unit does come with a belt case, you can find multiple suitable cases for the GLM35 here on Amazon. The new GLM35 comes with batteries, a manual and a much larger book filled with the usual safety warnings we all throw away.Measurements are very fast, and extremely accurate. Simple length measurements are done in seconds, and if you are a pro (like an HVAC service tech), you can measure the square footage of an entire home in minutes.Not much more to add - or anything else you need; it works, it is fast, accurate and affordable. A real winner.

It is incredible what can be made for under $50 nowadays. Wireless access, starter ink, and a reliable paper feed all make this a really good starter printer for any home or even light use small office.It lacks the great features of pricier devices like duplex printing, ADF scanner and fax, but if you just want some cheap prints and scans for home, this one is the winner. With Kodak out of the market, the roughly $40 refill of ink on this one is a close second best

If you want the short version: Well made, 22V power from 18V batteries. The set has two batteries, a single light charger, a bag (which smells pretty bad). The tools have incredible torque, especially from an 18V setup. I have DeWalt tools with larger batteries that have the same kind of torque.The kit is missing a simple bit set, and some other basics like a tool clip, but at under $200, this is an excellent buy. It had zero problems helping me take an old bathroom apart

They're short and stubby and that's just what I wanted.  I like having the dock up close to the laptop and these fit the bill.  They're Belkin and they work just as good as their Apple equivalents on my iPhone 6.Recommended as long as you know how short they are!!!

Here in Colorado we've already had snow and I must say I'm really impressed with the simplicity of the Boa system in making these snow shoes fit over my boots without a hassle and maintaining the tightness throughout my trek.  At the cabin in the mountains there's already three feet of snow on the ground and it ain't goin anywhere soon so I went out for a walk with these and had no problems with maintaining my balance or with sinking in.  You get two of these in the package.  I thought I'd point that out because as of this writing Amazon's product page doesn't make that clear.They're much narrower than I'm used to but I'm old school snow shoe...been wearing the same pair for thirty years and I only got these because the kids said "Dad, you need to move up to the new technology..we think you'll like it".  Darned If I didn't.  They're less cumbersome and that dial in your fit system really works.  I love em.  Won't use anything else but now...I recommend for the High Country and anyplace snow gathers and you need to traverse.

Very good protection for the iPhone 6s Plus.  Not too bulky but guards against those corner falls extremely well.  Fits tight but not too tight.  Cut outs are all on the dot and access is a breeze.  I'll be using this for a long time to come.  No problem with adding a screen saver.  Sleek lines and isn't slippery.Longevity is an issue I'll have to experience and I'll come back if there's a problem.Highly recommend

Average DVD player.  This is a bare bones DVD player (only rca and hdmi out)  usb is 2.0 but set-up is simple.  I don't recommend this for 4K TV's that up-convert.  My LG TV makes the picture seem like it's in some kind of minute animation in the movement of the human form (best I can describe it) and there is an occasional flash of green around the edges.  On a 1080P TV it looks great and the up-conversion is okay.Personally I wouldn't buy it.  I think the Sony's do a better overall job, especially on 4K TVs.  But It depends on what you're looking for really.  If you just want a bare bones hdmi capable DVD player with 1080p up-conversion.  This will fill the bill.  Sound reproduction is fine through my receiver.  Remote is simple but complete.Sorry Panasonic I usually love your products and I have a Panasonic 3D Blu-Ray player that I love!!

This center speaker has remarkable sound replacing my Infinity Beta C360 which is a huge 2-ft 1-inch by 9-inch behemoth I've had since 2006 and haven't heard a better once since till now.  I don't know who Andrew Jones is and I am not an audiophile by any means but this smaller Elac C5 boasts as big a center speaker as the Beta C360 enhanced by all the audio advances made since 2006 and I can tell you it sounds better than the C360.  I bought the biggest Infinity at the time to handle all the new sound separations and dialogue and I thought the sonic field it provided was the best I could get without spending hundreds more but this Elac which cost less new than the 14 year old one did then is blowing it away and sounds as good as any high end center speaker I've heard.I am retiring the C360 for now in favor of this one and I must say that I had now idea what I was missing in that sonic field until now.  I'm not an expert and all I can report is what my ears hear.I'd recommend it.  Can't wait to see how it sounds with DTS-X.!It would make a nice gift for DAD if you know what I mean.

Got this for the college kid.  He's just the right fit for it and he likes the modesty it affords him in his co-ed dorm (a fact I just learned about...and where the heck were they fifty years ago?????).  He and the other kids built a Sauna (Russian Style - seats 8)  in the spare room attached to our garage and now on weekends he and his college friends hang out over here and use it so this is definitely gonna be good to have around here.  He bought seven more of them to keep for friends and guests to use when they come over (a fact that I appreciate - since I'm not out anything and I don't want a bunch of naked college guys upsetting the women folk - of course I haven't asked their opinion yet because I might find out that they didn't mind at all!!).  Timmy likes the micro-fiber absorbency and the fact that it dries quickly when they turn the heat up and the steam off.  Two of his best buds are Russians and they helped build and design the sauna (you should see this thing - you'd swear you stepped into a regular bath house) and they thought these micro-fiber wraps where marvels of modern science!  I wear it in the Sauna too and I can attest to the comfort and security of the velcro wrap around tab.  It's not going to fall off and it's not too skimpy where it shouldn't be.I would definitely recommend them.

Great fun!  This thing is huge but that just gets the players more excited until the fatal moment and then you have a real crash!!!  It's also heavy and made of real hardwood.  A new twist on an old game - supersize it.  I love it.  The family loves it!  It would make a great Xmas gift to a Jenga fanatic or as a family gift.It's portable and you can take it to parties and I'm sure you'll find plenty of people who wanna give it a try.  There's an add on pack at Jenga's website to make it even taller if you want, but as it is the game can go over 4 feet!!!  Takes nerves of steel I can tell you!I'm ordering two more and giving them to the kids to take home Christmas day.I do indeed recommend!

Works great.  Sticks fine.  We're elderly proofing a close bedroom because grandpa keeps hitting his knees on the sharp corners of tables in the room but won't let us take them out...so we went this route and I'm impressed with the product.  The corner pieces work fine for the four corners we needed to pad and the cut to size runner is helping with the floor level toe stubbing sharp cornered legs.  The tape is 3m (the best and sticks good).I couldn't be happier with this purchase.

Not as much protection as former OtterBox products but still stylish and fashionable and we all know there are plenty of people conscience of both out there these days.  Should be right up their alley with the interchangeable inserts to match the color of your outfit or what not.  Personally give me combat style protection every time, but this fits snugly without being too snug and all switches, plugins and buttons are easily accessible without effort on the users part.So if style is your thing then OtterBox has you covered.  I just wouldn't go this way personally.

Denon has put out a solid mid-range network receiver that focuses on the coming goodies in audio and video, including DTS-X (in an upcoming firmware release) and already has Dolby Atmos decoding out of the box.  I am replacing an Onkyo TX-NR646 receiver that was good but fell way short on Dolby Atmos.  My mind was made up when watching San Andreas and realizing the Atmos wasn't there or if it was it was so weak it was overcome by the other speakers.  If ever there was a movie besides the latest Transformers that was made for Atmos this was it.  Huge disappointment!  I can report that the Denon AVR-X2200W blew the Onkyo away with it's atmos decoding.  Some have noted that they believe this unit does not have the punch of the Onkyo series but I disagree.  At 95 watts per channel, delivered with clean power I have no problem rocking the room with this receiver.  I also have not experienced the sound drop outs that have been mentioned when using this with an HDMI Television box.  Changing channels is smooth and the sound is there.The 4K upscaling capabilities have made my Perry Mason dvd's look like they were filmed yesterday when upscaling from a Panasonic DVD-S700 which is strictly a DVD player (I still prefer watching DVD's on a dvd player for the memory, slow motion, and frame advance functions which never seem to work just right on Blu-Ray players)Set up is pretty straight forward and it does have the Audyssey Silver set up that really does a good job of measuring your room and setting things accordingly. This is pretty essential for me since I am by no means an audiophile but I do know if you're going to rely on this kind of setup then it doesn't get any better than Audyssey Silver.  I just want a set up that plays my movies and gives me the complete range of sounds available today for home viewing and this baby delivers in spades!It is capable of doing just about anything you want wirelessly for those of you that are into wireless streaming these days (I'll stick to my vinyl and turntable - which it reproduces magnificently - I am really pleased with that aspect).Overall I'd recommend this receiver to anyone like me who isn't an expert on these things and wants to hook up his movie theater with 7.2 sound and take advantage of the new Dolby-Atmos and then down the pike the DTS-X Surround.  I only had to add two speakers to move up from 5.2 to atmos (in this case Onkyo does make the Onkyo SKH-410 Dolby Atmos-Enabled Speaker System (2) for about $150 that work great in a room like mine where overhead speakers are out of the question).  Otherwise there are many overhead configurations possible that work and you should do your homework on Dolby Atmos before deciding and buying speakers for your set up.  The Atmos adds a lot in films like San Andreas where things are falling from overhead or filling the air and it is a thrilling experience when watching the film (I actually ducked a couple of times).  Sound reproduction is clear and doesn't overwhelm the dialogue (an issue with my age group) and this is the best receiver I've found for that particular necessity besides my $2K Marrantz in the family room upstairs and obviously I'm not gonna buy a lot of those.Like the title says I recommend it because I think it's the best bang for the buck in this price range for my needs and hopefully yours too.

Nice pants in the classic style.  They fit right (by that I mean they run to size) and they drape well.  Material is very light and comfortable and movement is completely unhampered.  They wash good and come out basically wrinkle free.  The price is right for this quality and cut.  I will definitely buy more.

These Scott Hard Roll Paper Towels are really good in my Sanitouch Hard Roll Paper Towel Dispenser (09990).  I like the texture  and they are very absorbent.  We use these dispensers in the Garage for mechanic work and in the kitchen (The Sanitouch) for working with raw meats and such for a quick hand clean-up without cross contamination because you never touch anything but the paper towel.  Now that we know how well they work we use them for spills and every other kitchen job as well.  Dispensers eliminate the ever popular never ending roll when you pull a regular roll of paper towels and it decides to unwind from a few to the entire roll which you have to patiently wind back onto the roll.  Never again with these dispensers.  We have a fully automatic one that uses batteries and another size towel (09992) and this one which is manual but still operates quietly and efficiently using these towels and the manual benefit is you don't have to use batteries!.  You do need some installation room in your kitchen (we mounted it over the sink to be handy) and garage as they are commercial size but the benefits outweigh any size considerations...believe me!  These models are elegant looking and smoke colored so you don't see the paper towel roll and your relatives and guests will soon find themselves using them all the time.  Of course the review is about the paper towels themselves and they are very good quality and not the old stiff paper towels you picture in your mind when you think of commercial paper towels.  They're not tissue soft but they do feel like regular paper towels and perform accordingly.These towels come 12 rolls to a case of 800 feet each for a total of 9600 feet.  Using these in the kitchen a case should last us about a year and a half or more.  At around $75 a case that works out to $4.17 a month (your usage may vary of course depending on size of household and the individual user - so bear that in mind).  Quite a bargain considering both the quality of the towels and the absorbency, which is excellent.  The dispenser is automatic and costs around $39.00 here on Amazon, even less if you buy from the Warehouse when available.Over all a great towel, in quantity, quality and the price breakdown after the initial dispenser investment.  I suggest this as an alternative to buying those high priced paper towels every week that you're just going to throw away anyway!!!  And I've noticed the quality of the home versions of paper towels has plummeted in the last two years or so (what's with that?).I recommend for people who recognize the convenience, the cost savings and the logic of their use.

Very nice 400 thread count sheets.  AmazonBasics has done it again.  These are nice and soft and wash out wrinkle free.  The fitted sheet has deep pockets and  and the flat sheet's dimensions fit over my Queen size bed (12 in deep memory foam mattress) with a nice drape.  The fitted sheet is nice and tight and doesn't pull loose on the bed but you could probably add an inch maybe two to your mattress depth.  Under my comforter I am not too warm so the sheets breathe well.  The Pillow Cases are standard sized but forgiving because my slightly bigger memory foam pillow fits nicely inside and it doesn't on my other standard pillow cases.  The price is right and the quality is there.  It's becoming my go to brand for an awful lot of household and techie items of late and I must say I have yet to be disappointed in any way.  You might want to put AmazonBasics in the search box and see what comes up these days...you might just be surprised and they're all backed by Amazon's return policy which makes the occasional lemon less painful indeed.I really recommend this sheet set for everybody.

We have an old tub in the house and I had my doubts whether this would fit it but I went to my daughter's house to fix a bathroom sink leak and she had one of these DII mats in her tub (also a 15.75 by 39 inch) and her tub looks a lot like mine with the old claw feet so I came back & measured mine and sure nuff 39 inches is the length of my tub as well.  I asked her if she liked it and she said 'no...I just put it in there to annoy people'...but that's a typical answer from my daughter...ha ha...then she smiled and said it was the best non-slip mat she'd used.  She'd tried the appliques (am I saying that right) and the kids still managed to slip and she tried another brand whole tub mat and it kept bunching up and losing suction so on the strength of really liking their kitchen towels (micro-fiber and available here on Amazon too - great towels - but that's another review) she bought this mat and said she hasn't looked back since.  She said it stays in place and the kids don't slip and slide all over the place or trip over bunches and she herself likes it when she showers.  That's endorsement enough for me!!!!.

My grand son Login has one of these for his iPhone six and he uses it every day.  I could tell that my grand daughter Kayla really wanted one so when Vine offered one and it was in her favorite color purple I grabbed it.Belkin always makes quality products and the one Logun has (blue) has worked great for charging and syncing.  The cord is 4 feet and sits on his desk plugged into his docking port for his laptop/tablet combo.  He loves the convenience of having a dock for his phone two.  Makes a good Christmas gift for the students in your house too.I recommend it.  Made of aluminum and sturdy as it is it also accepts iPod 5 as well.

Very nice button down oxford.  The size runs as stated (rare these days).  The cloth is substantial and it washes well.  I haven't worn this brand before but I will have to buy more now because they fit so well and feel very good on the skin.I will be giving Oxford NY some of my business now.

I've raved about Scotts products for years and this one is something new for me.  I'm reseeding (yes in the fall here in Colorado) a lawn that had to be torn up to replace a retaining wall and I want to get the seed in the ground and taking hold before the spring so I'm seeding now and putting this down to hold water on the hard packed dirt through the remainder of the unusually warm fall we've been having so far (cross fingers).  I'll have to let you know in the Spring if this has had any effect although a few sprouts might actually start (two frost warnings so far no freezing at night).So for now all I can say is that I depend on Scotts for all my lawn needs and have for many years now.  You won't find my reviews on any other lawn product except some weedkiller I had to use earlier this year because of the eternal dandelions.I think you can buy with confidence because they've never let me down yet.

Great idea.  You can create your own 3x5 foot dry erase board with this roll-up.  I wanted to put it on the wall in the office to be permanently affixed to a frame with a wooden backing that had held corkboard before and this did the trick with no problems.I cleaned the backing and dried it carefully and unrolled this and peeled the backing back enough to start the sticking process on the backboard of the frame and lined it up carefully and just pulled slowly and pressed all the way across.  First time I've ever done this without hiccups and uneven application.  It stuck really well and has shown no sign of peeling back at any corner or along the edges.The dry erase surface is much superior to those boards you buy that have to be really cleaned to erase the entries but with this surface a dry erase eraser is enough.  I bought one like they use on blackboards.  I'm very pleased with the end result and it cost much less than if I had to buy a good one this size.I recommend without hesitation.

These are the best dish towels I have ever used and the family completely agrees.  We have the striped versions and now these grey ones will add a touch of elegance to our towel rack (the others are in blacks and whites).The DII towels are very absorbent right out of the package but improve with age.  The microfibers hold a lot of moisture and plates get completely dry quickly.  They wash good and are well stitched and using now for almost a year they are wearing very well with little sign of deterioration.They make wash cloths too and wash cloths with plastic scrubbing netting on one side (I love those) and they hold up much better than other brands I've used.I have no problem recommending these towels for the kitchen in any home.

Nice idea but the thing gets very hot on the outside and now after about seven months use the numbered display is slowly failing.  The top portion of the far numeral is dead so O becomes a U and the middle one is showing signs of dying as well.  I really like the concept and use this cooker about twice a week for casseroles for the family so I'm very disappointed to see the display beginning to fail after only 7 months (I suspect the surface heat of the unit is the culprit).  I would suggest you just buy the one with the regular old crockpot controls that are manual because it really does cook up casseroles of all types extremely well.  The manual ones are cheaper and will probably outlast this unit by a good bit.Personally I hope they address the issue because I like the timer and the automatic switch to low when done.  If they do someone leave a comment indicating they have because I doubt I'll be back this way soon.

This is a unique little idea and unlike other reviews I had no problems with getting it to work with my Samsung HU8550 2014 model.  I got it up and running in under an hour (including firmware upgrade).  Last night I watched Exodus and I must it admit it looked great on my TV but no better than my streaming a movie from Netflix.  This may be the way to go for some people but I just don't like the download times to get new movies... anywhere from two hours to overnight.  We deleted Exodus and bought another movie and I was really disappointed with the fact that four hours later it was still downloading.  I really think this will cause a problem with the target customers because I can stream 4K movies from Netflix and they look great.  The selection is sparse streaming but this is early in the 4K game and I'm sure the selection will grow.  I imagine people with slow streaming would find this idea beneficial and if they are willing to wait the download times it would certainly eliminate the problems slower Wi-Fi has with streaming.  I'm deducting one star for the download times involved.  The picture quality is slightly better than streaming in my opinion.I realize some people have no problem with this but I don't have time to download during the day and I don't leave anything turned on overnight.  Guess I'm old fashioned in that regard.  In my opinion people will buy the product of least resistance and while M-Go works and has a fairly good selection I'm not sure this is going to catch on...but that is purely personal opinion with no facts to back it up.  You can store up to 13 movies on the drive before you have to delete or buy another drive and at the current price of $69 that is a bargain.I'm ambivalent about this product as I can see how it would be nice for some customers and not really any more feasible than streaming for others.  And if, as others have pointed out, M-Go throttles the download speeds then the slim advantages I can see evaporate immediately.My advice is do your homework.  Decide how you want to access 4K material on your TV and if it's right for you...buy it.  It is convenient.  The software, copyright issues, website etc are in their infancy, so you might have to put with bugs till they get them all worked out but it delivers on what it promises.  You can watch ten movies stored on the device (two free - eight paid) and then you can buy more and download them and watch.Eventually if it catches on I'm sure they'll add other TV manufacturers.  Meanwhile caveat emptor.

I have been using this keyboard since August to control my LG 4K TV and it works flawlessly.  When Vine offered the same model I jumped at the chance to add an extra one for the bedroom Samsung.  Just to make sure however I took the one I have and paired it to the Samsung to make sure I had the same level of control and surfing that I have with the newer LG and it works just as well there.Primarily I wanted the keyboard that lights up at night.  It's not too small for my hands and the touch pad works great and the keyboard isn't so light you'll throw it across the room swiping (I had that happen with another one).  It has some heft to it.  The battery life has actually exceeded the ten days for me and I usually recharge around the 12th to 13th day.  The light up keyboard makes it much easier on these old eyes when I want to go through web pages on the browser (The Samsung browser is a bit slower than the LG which has nothing to do with this keyboard, it was just odd that in the past it's been the other way around, I guess LG is catching up with the competition).I've used several brands of wireless keyboards (including microsoft (give them a C-) and this one has the features I want and works extremely well in your hands.  I highly recommend it.  The good ones are all a bit pricey so you may as well get the best one.

The day I got this the power company called and informed me that a recent bypass and rerouting of power to my house because of a new retaining wall that is still in the process of being built had to be redone because of fluctuations that couldn't be traced paced the new connection.  Because it was a faulty connector (can't remember the exact term the Utility guy used) and because the wall was nearing completion they wanted to send a crew out the next day to reroute the power again and I would be without power for somewhere between 20 minutes and 2 hours.  So the test for this device was on!!  I charged it initially in just over two hours and plugged in my modem, router, and phone in preparation for the next day.Next afternoon they came about 1 PM and started digging down to the new connector and about 1:35 PM they cut the power to my house.  The results were refreshingly good.  An hour in (they found they had a problem down there) I was still surfing the internet via my tablet.  At One hour and fifteen minutes I turned on my laptop to make sure it had internet and it did.  At one hour and  thirty-seven minutes the power came back on and I hadn't had even so much as a flicker on my wifi.I consider that test enough as I wanted it primarily to back up my wireless network and phone (voip) in case of power failure.  I made two calls during the power outage with no problem.I haven't used the battery charger that's part of the main unit yet but I can vouch for it as a backup system for your network.  I recommend this one without any hesitation at all.  It doubles as a surge protector so your apple products should be safe using it.  I use Android and don't spend nearly as much on my phone but I still want it to survive!!  Always a pain to have to break in a new one.  I think the price is worth the piece of mind.

Excellent vacuum mug from Aladdin.  Seal is super tight and design simple enough to even use in dishwasher.  Fits my Subaru Forester cupholders well.  Keeps my coffee hot for 3 hours and warm for an hour or so more.  Cold drinks stay cold for me most of the day.  Would solidly recommend.  Don't use Keurig anymore so can' t comment on that.

Excellent.  Restored hardwire internet access to my Toshiba Satellite L55w Laptop which is what I bought it for.  The new sleek ultra thin laptops for the most part have done away with the ethernet port in favor of the new faster WiFi's but I'll stick with the tried and true for now thank you very much.  Plugged into my USB3 port it gave me back my Comcast Blast speed that I pay for.I highly recommend.  The USB dongle stores in the body of the connector which is very convenient.Any longevity issues I'll come back and report here.

I've used Brita water pitchers for years without issues and this one is no different.  The main reason I wanted to try this one besides the 10 cup size was the new type filter.  I've had filters stockpiled that I'm just now beginning to run out of and I wanted to see if the new one did indeed do away with the black flakes in the water and if it altered taste or didn't do as good a job as the old.  The flaking has stopped.  There is no discernible taste difference and it filters at the same rate as the old one as far as I can tell, but I must say I never hung around to watch the water flow into the pitcher, I never saw it as an issue at all.Reading other reviews clued me in to the fact that you could refill the old ones.  I never knew that and so it didn't affect me but I think that losing that capability probably would rankle quite a few customers.  All I know is that my water tastes better I feel better using Brita.  Call me an old fool.  I'm deducting one star for the new filters not being refillable but I'm happy enough about the flaking issue being solved to not deduct more.I'll still use the product as I have for the past ten years.

My step son asked me to get him a modular crimping tool on Amazon because he lost his and he needed it the next day.  He didn't have time with his work schedule (Cable & Fiber Optic Installation Supervisor) to run to the store before then and he gets home too late.  He said try to pick a brand name and I had heard of Jonard  (he had too but he thought them inferior to a couple of others that cost much more).  So I ordered these and had them over-nighted.  I got lucky he was very impressed with them and stunned when I told him what I paid.  He's used them in the field now for over a month and told me last night that he was very happy with them and that they were holding up very well indeed in everyday use.  So I scored one with the step son.He said to say that in his opinion these were as well made as any he's seen on the market and he likes the feel and the balance in the hand.  They cut and strip as well as crimp first time every time for him.  When he's working a business job (installing networking and cable components) that's important to getting a highly complex job done within his allotted time window.He said he'll buy them next time too and other Jonard tools of the trade from now on.

Finally an AI system that I trust!  This racing set is amazing.  It is very easy to set up.  There's a bit of a learning curve on the controller but after that between you and the AI helping out...the race is on.  This will be the Christmas toy to beat since it's equal fun for adults as well as the little ones (8 & above recommended).  You can race alone with the AI or compete with another racer of course.My grandson and I have been racing for a week now and slowly but surely I'm getting the hang of controlling that car and I may beat him any day now!!!  Of course 10 year olds have plenty of patience with us old timers as long as they're winning and after I master it I'll probably keep him happy with more wins than loses but right now he's the King and I'm the wannabe!!Why an I so enthused you may ask!  Because this is realistic racing....not tied to a slot...or losing power when off the track...in fact you just drive your car back on the track if you slide off!  The battery life is very good (6 of both AAA's and AA's - 12 total).  You won't run out of juice in the middle of the race.  I am not a techie and I don't understand all the principles of design that make this track work so darn well...all I can tell you is that this is it....the home racing track and cars and controllers that everybody has been waiting for since I was a kid!!!Considering how well the system performs and how easy it all is to use it's more than worth the price believe me.  Of all the Vine Items I have ever tried (probably in the hundreds by now) this has been the most fun and the most consistently performing item I've seen...and I've had them all from smokers to fancy televisions and humidifiers just to name a few.I'm buying two more sets for my two other sets of grand kids for Christmas this year before they sell out and I've already ordered expansion packs for the one I have.  I'd advise you to get one now if you know what i mean.Any problems and I'll come back, but honestly, I don't anticipate any as my grand kid and I have put it through enough rough and tumble set-ups and races to see that it's built to last from the track to the cars and everything in between.Tips...you don't have to keep the track flat you can put some bumps in it (put something under it for instance) and that adds to the fun.

Bottom Line...Does It Do What It Says It Will Do?  The answer is yes.  It has the most simplified set-up I've ever seen.  Very welcome to a guy who isn't tech savvy.  Out of the box it was up and running in under thirty minutes and the specific problem we had selected the product to solve or at least improve was completely solved.  My set up is a typical Colorado Tri-Level house with bedrooms upstairs and in the basement.  We had always had issue in the two bedrooms at the far back of the upstairs configuration.The unit for reasons of configuration (by that I mean that no middle section of the house is convenient or has the outlets necessary to set up the network)  has to be at the opposite end of the house on the middle floor.  I've been using a Netgear Nighthawk AC1900 Smart wifi router which has done an excellent job to date with the exception of the drop outs and dead spots in the three rooms upstairs.  I am using an extender but it is quirky and works about 85% of the time.  This Titan High Power AC1900 Router has given us faster speeds on wifi than the Nighthawk and has made 4k streaming seamless instead of a buffering nightmare.  I noted some people having trouble with guest networks.  I didn't encounter a problem and you can set up to 8 with specific users.  The instructions included are well laid out and cover everything.The Nighthawk was consistent and only needed to be rebooted on firmware upgrades I'll give it that and I can't speak to the stability of the Titan yet but if it becomes one of those routers where you have to reboot every other day etc. I'll come back and let you know immediately.  It features a 1GB dual-core processor (as does the Nighthawk) but the real boost comes from the 14 amplifiers and the four antenna configuration (guess that's my word of the day).  They deliver.  (on a side note way way off the subject at hand am I the only person on planet Earth that misses Nighthawk TV dinners???)Right now out of the box I'd say it's got to be the easiest to set up I've ever seen and it delivers on it's promise to extend your wi-fi!  If you're moving to 4k or 4k gaming then the improvement in performance in those areas alone is worth the switch.Right now I'm very happy with the results and to repeat the answer to the question:  Yes...The Titan - High Power AC1900 does what it says it will do.

Very nice.  Easy on the eye in the backyard near the garden plot.  Easy to put together.  Stake included.  No problem sticking in ground.It's full of color and the Colorado wind really gives it a workout.  It does look very pretty spinning away in the morning and the evening when I sit out on the deck and drink my 'biotic' yogurt drink.  I'm getting used to it already as part of the landscape.  Right now the retaining wall on the other side of the yard is being rebuilt and all is ugliness galore so it's soothing to have something pretty to look at on the lawn at both those times (before the work crew arrives and after they go).Hard to describe something this pretty and I'm not techie enough to whip out the old phone and take a picture.  I don't think I've ever used the camera on my Fire Phone.  So all I can say is it's much prettier than the picture on the Amazon page.  And virtually silent...or I'm deaf...one of the two.Worth the price if you value this kind of yard ornamentation.  I find movement very relaxing as long as I'm not doing it.I'm buying a couple of these (they have different ones featuring hummingbirds and different things) for the neighbors for Christmas.  They make especially nice gifts for them I think.

Georgia-Pacific pretty well wrote the book on commercial towel and tissue dispensers and this item is a great home addition for guys who work on their cars or outdoors or any hobby that requires a workroom or garage and results in dirty hands.  My brother has one of these and it is very useful when we're changing sparkplugs or oil or what have you on our autos.  I've envied him this dispenser for about six months now and lo and behold Vine offers me one of my own to try out.  Couldn't have been more pleased.Being able to simply wave your hand and get a pre-detemined size of paper towel (you set the size or leave the default during set up) delivered right into your goop covered hands is a true triumph of modern technology...at least to me it is.  It comes with a roll of paper (which is available right here on Amazon) and set up and programming is easy.  The dispenser holds an additional roll as well and can be set to use up the old roll and move (literally it switches roll positions itself) on to the new one without any having to open and replace.  That means if you're deep in the dirt when the first roll runs out you still have paper towels!!!One piece of advice...hang on to that key...you can't do anything without it and though I'm sure you can get it replaced that means a wait for shipping etc or whatever it takes to get a new one.  The towel rolls are not the old rough feeling tear away kind you find in most commercial bathrooms (remember this is a commercial towel dispenser) but are softer (not too soft) and feel better and are way more absorbent.If you have a business your customers will thank you for using this dispenser and G-P towels (I know I would!)  But I'm really pushing this thing for the garage or workroom in the home itself because it has made life so much easier for the garage mechanic that my brothers and I are.  My brother paid more for his unit (which is the same model) than what Amazon charges so you're getting a deal worth having.  His first roll lasted him five months and he's out in the garage every weekend with his buds and their cars so that should speak to evening out the cost factor.  Remember you're using it in the privacy of your home not a public facility where maybe a 100 people are in and out in a day if not more and the rolls are 500 up to 700 feet  He's also never had a glitch or a torn or distorted towel and the towels tear evenly every time out.So summing up.  The unit is well built and will last.  The mechanism is trouble free and stands up to repeated use (commercial quality).  The rolls are not that expensive and last forever.  After a set up that is carefully explained (instructions included and online videos available too) and not that hard you're up and running.  Priced at around $75 dollars or so with rolls ranging from about $18.00 single to $90 for five figuring conservatively around 25 months for the 5-roll price that's over two years before you have to spend again!!!  All these figures are outside estimates for my family usage so bear that in mind.

Epson scores with the best presentation projector out there.  This baby can put a picture up on the wall or screen in a bright room that is just like you're watching an LCD screen.  Unlike the other projectors I've owned this one is light weight and easy to handle.  It comes with every imaginable hookup built in and it can go to sleep in the middle of your presentation and wake instantly up and continue on (I had to turn the other two off).  I also like the fact that you can turn it off quickly when your done and don't have to wait minutes for it to cool down.The picture is stunning and the 1080p accounts for a great deal of that!.  The color brightness is much better than any projector I've seen before in a lit room and in a darkened one will knock your socks off.  You can also go off-pc and use USB sourcing (remarkably easy software download and installation required) for your material (nifty for movies).  I need to get a better screen as it's outperforming my old one but a new one was due anyway.When Vine offered this I had my doubts at this price range and I don't really like Epson printers and I'd never thought of them for office projectors, but now I'm glad I took a chance and tried it out.  It really is just outstanding.  The size is completely portable and I've already indicated that it is amazingly light to offer the performance it does.  It's fully pc integrated meaning your remote works with both for smooth handling of your presentations.  It doesn't come with every cable needed (no HDMI or USB cables included) and that's a wee bit of a downer but the price point reflects the lack of high end accessories.You won't go wrong with this little projector I promise you and it's brighter than those costing twice it's size.  I heartily recommend!!

Nestle has been my go to quick hot chocolate pack for years.  I especially like the mini-marshmallows.  This way you just make your cup with one packet and you wind up with a nice creamy rich chocolate flavored cocoa with those sweet treats floating on top.  Vine offered these just in time to stock up for winter this year and I grabbed them because the whole family loves them (one of the very few things everybody agrees on around here).Of course I already knew how good they were so I didn't really have to try them out...just report what I already know - Nestle does them right!A fifty count box priced right makes sense to have on hand for the Winter weather in Colorado.  It can get mighty cold up here in the mountains and Nestle takes the edge off with every cup.  I highly recommend!!!

De'Longhi has a winner with this 5 in 1 ceramic grill.  I love the paninis that come out of here.  I had never had one (panini grill I mean...I've had plenty of paninis)  but my daughter-in-law is Italian and she's been making them at home for years and years so I invited her over here and she tried out the De'Longhi and came away really impressed with the ceramic heating plates...she said they eat more evenly than her iron and they sear magnificently (apparently the most important part of the panini process).As a griddle it's equally excellent I make pancakes to perfection and cook eggs without a problem.  Pressing some bacon is easy enough and if you just want a grilled cheese you can do both sides at once, quick and efficient.  The wife loves the ceramic plates and says also that they heat more evenly than our old combo machine and are a cinch to clean.  The plates are durastone ceramic and are dishwasher safe.  The base unit is really solid and easy to clean.My wife also says that the controls are the most precise she's seen and definitely offer more direct control than our old Cuisinart.As for grilling it came up aces again.  I grabbed two frozen ribeyes out of the freezer about an inch thick and cooked them from frozen to keep the centers juicy and the grill worked like a champ.  No overcooked spots on the surface and medium and juicy in the center.  I really like that convenience and even with the Cuisinart I had trouble getting them to cook evenly over all.Barring any future problems that I will come back and address if they occur I can give this multi-cooker a five star rating without hesitation.  Of course I'm gonna have to buy one now for the Daughter (maybe for Xmas - I'm safe - she never reads these) because she raved and raved about the paninis and I have to admit they were even better than her usual offerings which were good to begin with!!

Heavy duty 100% oversized apron for us smokers (smoking meat)!  I like this new apron because it provides a thick wall between you and those splatters and spills in the kitchen, out at the BBQ or at the electric smoker.  It covers more clothing and has a nice large pocket for tools or what not.  Uses the double ring holder for the neck tie and the strings are wrap around twice on most folks.The ladies will appreciate the added coverage area as well I think and the apron is well sewn and sturdy.  Bear in mind it's 100% cotton and wash accordingly and it looks like it'll give you years of service.Any problems and I'll come back and say so.I'm buying some more to give out to the family.

Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed is just the best product for what I needed.  I'm having a retaining wall that collapsed on the side of the house rebuilt and that required digging up the lawn ten foot back to find a city power line that couldn't be located (put in in 1973) and had to be moved on top of that. They will be digging six feet down and taking up all that dirt and depositing it on the back lawn which will kill it as well so when Vine offered me this I knew that it was exactly what I needed formulated for the hot/cold cycles we have in North East Colorado.  I don't know if I'll have enough time to seed this year when they're finished as we're rapidly approaching October but I have used nothing but Scott Products for some 18 years now and I'm sold on them.Will report results back here when used either early fall (sometimes it stays hot here through October) or more likely next spring early.  It's good stuff though and the way they tailor it for your area and your grass needs you can't go wrong.

Not a bad idea but you'll have to keep expanding to keep the fun up.  It's kind of a new take on Laser Tag in some regards with the interactive arm bands and the target stands, but it has pre-programmed missions and such  for the kids to act out their hero antics.  It is a lot of fun for the 8 and 11 year old we have using it at present.Be warned that it takes 12 AA batteries to power up the whole system and that the drain on them is pretty quick.  I think I'd go with rechargeable if I were you.  The pieces are well made and seem fairly durable thus far.  Nothing has broken between the two boys yet and they seem to really enjoy themselves when immersed in play.The system has 25 missions built in and there are things you have to accomplish to progress in the game so bear that in mind with kids who are easily frustrated by such things.  You can download others online, but I haven't tested that yet since they haven't used up what's already programmed.  It is a good idea to be able to download more I think.  Also there supposed to be an app for this too.Of course the real profit for the toy company is in the expansion of the system.  I've already got the eleven year old asking for additional sets and this isn't even available for sale yet!!Over all I'll give it 4 Stars.  I'm deducting one for not having the capacity to recharge everything via USB or adapters.  That and the 12 battery toll it takes.  So far the kids have gotten 2 1/2 sessions max out of batteries so that's an expense you'd better consider too (like I said rechargeable).

This is a great idea and I think that they last as long as my Energizer batteries.  I just had a good test because they had to reroute the power cable to our house due to a retaining wall giving way before the re-construction could begin and I had these in my portable lamp because I had to be in the basement area (with no power - hence no light) while they cut the old cable and laid the new...a total of about an hour and 45 minutes or so and I had dug out an emergency light that uses double 'A' batteries (twelve of them) and drains power like a vacuum cleaner.  Energizers will give just about two hours lamp time (double florescent) with this particular lantern and the GoGreen batteries lasted the hour and 45 minutes without the light weakening in the slightest.  I left them on and at about 1 hour and 55 minutes the light began it's dance with one bulb flickering and going off and the other dimming substantially so they passed my acid test for longevity first time out.The idea that everything about them is renewable is long overdue when it comes to batteries and I'd highly recommend these just on the principle of it's time we started giving back instead of take take take from Mother Earth.Didn't try them in any cameras (don't have any that take them) so I can't vouch for items that have an intense immediate draw down.  Other than that I consider them good to go.

I love this thing!It features a 360-degree hinge design with five modes, which you can switch between laptop, multimedia, tabletop, presentation and tablet. And with Windows 10 Home delivers faster start-ups and gives you easy use with its new interface. Whether you want to use it for work, play, study, entertainment, or everyday -  this machine is ideal and easy to carry around. The weight is 5.1 pounds and 0.90' thin, you can take it anywhere you go without a problem.It comes with multi-touch control which offers smooth scrolling, swipe, zoom or tap. With Premium Frameless TruType Keyboard and 10-Keypad designed to be comfortable, easy and fast for typing and in putting numbers.  It has an LED-Backlit keyboard to make it easy to type even  in low light.It comes with an Intel Core i3-5015U entry-level dual processor for laptops based on Broadwell architecture. The CPU feature a 3MB cache and processor speed up to 2.1GHz (no turbo boost support unfortunately). With 6GB DDR3L 1600MHz of memory, It provides power enough for multitasking and my needs.It comes with 128GB solid state drive  - space enough for a document, files, photos or music. It also provides ultra-high speed read/write to files, gives you access to data quickly and fast starts windows.The display is a 15.6-inch full HD touch display with LED-Backlit and TruBrite technology offering vibrant visuals and sharp details providing wider viewing angles with IPS technology.  The screen has a resolution of 19201080-pixels and 16:9 aspect ratio...it features integrated Intel HD graphics with shared graphics memory.I enjoy listening to songs, playing games and watching movies with the built-in stereo speakers tuned by Skullcandy. With DTS Sound audio allowing you to tune the sound and it provides crisp, powerful audio with immersive sound.  Even for these old ears.As for wireless connectivity, it comes with the latest 802.11/AC wireless technology and Bluetooth v4.1.It also features a Memory Card Reader, HDMI output, one USB 2.0 and two USB 3.0 ports.The Toshiba has a three cell/45 Wh Lithium Ion battery (non-removable) that will last up to 7 hours on a single charge (so far I've used it for five hours with no problem yet but I can't swear to the 7 hour claim).  Windows 10 Home is included.My only complaint is that when in laptop mode the keyboard is not protected in any way...but because of the performance of the laptop overall I can live with that!Hope you enjoy it too.

I remembered Riptide as a fun action adventure series from the 80's that had that early to mid Eighties cheek and attitude that was the best part of the era.  Joe Penny and Perry King brought that Southern California laid back way of doing things to solving their weekly crimes which always involved sexy girls and guys going about their business in the tightest clothes this side of a Circus.  Including a whole cruise ship crewed by girls that Hugh Hefner himself would have drooled over and Captained by a mama hen played with perfect 'been there done that' street smarts embodied quite handily by Anne Francis, at least in the first season, after that she and the producers parted ways because she wanted more character development and they didn't.  Countering Joe And Perry was Thom Bray playing what was undoubtedly the very first computer nerd on a TV show (now watch...ten other shows will come out of the woodwork with earlier portrayals of computer nerds) and he did a good job of being the innocent among lamb among the lions on the show.  The plots were forgettable, the guests were great fun,  Anne was top notch while she lasted, and the true star of the show the California Lifestyle of the 80s made the audience tune in and have fun.  I did and I think you will too.  Doesn't matter your orientation, remember what I said about everybody was showing off great bods every week...there's something for everyone.  Watching this show is a lark.The early computer equipment and the first computer robot sidekick (besides Robbie in Forbidden Planet and The Robot on Lost in Space) is a hoot and still Thom Bray makes what he does seem logical to the layman.  The cars are great.  And yes ladies there's always the 'hair'!  It was usually non stop action with a little implied romance for our boys Joe and Perry that never went anywhere and a damsel in distress to rescue at the end.  And of course the eternal struggle to get the computer nerd hooked up with someone...anyone!!  Fun Fun Fun a la Beach Boy chic.I recommend it a lot.

This is a true eccentric British series that Ian McShane did a few years ago (cough cough) that truly captures the British ability to find mystery anywhere.  In this case with an Antique dealer, who in his pursuit of the classic and the profitable usually comes out on the short end of the stick involved in anything from smuggling from the Continent to murder most foul and everything in between.  Shane's performance and those of his superb supporting cast are spot on in keeping the eccentricity level high and the motivated mystery solver's interest at a boil.I loved these when I first discovered them years ago (on PBS I believe...perhaps elsewhere...my memory not being what it used to be) and now that I've had a chance to watch the transfers (very good indeed with both picture and sound - the British always do these things right) to our format across the pond I have rediscovered why that was in the first place.  I think you will too if you're a follower of British mystery, a fan of Ian McShane, or just a simple individual who loves good entertainment.I heartily recommend this series to you.  Enjoy.

Nice packaging.  Wonderful twist top to expose sprayer.  Nice heft.  Sprays directly on and smells fantastic.  Then two hours later I could find no trace of it, nor could anyone around me, the scent was gone.I don't have to learn my lesson twice.  They spent a lot of money on state of the art packaging then went cheap on the scent.  So much for Axe.I don't recommend it at all.

First pair of cargo pants I've ever worn and now I'm wondering why.  I Love the fit and the fleece lining will make this coming winter much more bearable.  The pockets were what I was after when I decided to try them and I love em.They're well designed.  Well stitched and well placed.  I can stuff em full and not be out of balance.I highly recommend these if you like this style and being Wranglers I'm sure they'll wash up nice and last a long time.They fit to size, at least as far as I'm concerned.

My go to jeans.  They fit as expected.  They last longer than the competition.  I have been wearing them for over thirty years and while they've changed a bit over the years the quality is still there.  For a reasonable price you get Wrangler quality.That just about says it all!

This stuff is very good really.  No orange tinge or anything like that.  Considering that I ordered it from vine to play a joke on my lodge brothers I wound up being thoroughly surprised at how good a Tan it delivers.I always go on vacation and just stay home and my lodge brothers always talk about pasty face and his two weeks on the dark side of the moon every year...so this year when I saw this item offered on Vine I thought I'll kill two birds with one stone.  Try out a new product and pull a cool joke on my brothers in the bargain.  I have seen these tanning products and sprays on people before here in Colorado and they always look fake no matter how well the people apply them so I thought I'd wind up looking the same but good enough for my joke.  The thing that drew me to it was its claim that it doesn't wind up looking orange color and fake.  The price is up there but I can attest to its advertising veracity.First off you need to know how to apply it properly.  The first thing I learned is that to apply this properly with the best chance at success you need to order a special mitt for applying (wouldn't try this without it if I were you - and it's also available on Amazon at a good price so I'd order them together)  I suggest you watch a couple of the readily available U-Tube videos on the subject of tanning solution application.  I did and that helped me avoid the first time users pitfalls.  I had my daughter (used to work in a beauty and tanning salon) help me get those hard to reach spots and made sure my application was evenly distributed.  My daughter kept me reminded of elbows, knees and ankle areas and making sure they were evening covered.  You apply it to clean dry skin and then wait at least three hours while the tan 'develops' before you can shower.  That's all there is to it and I was stunned to see myself in the mirror looking like I'd spent a month on a tropical island!There was no orange tinge of any kind and the application developed into a dark tan that looked absolutely stunning.  The Moroccan Oil in the lotion has a clean light scent that I liked.  My brothers were taken in by it and none of them even questioned my story of cruising the Caribbean in style.  Of course I've come clean at the lodge, but the tan lingers on and is fading evenly as well.  No blotchy retreat (almost as important as the initial tanning results to me).Bottom line this product produces a dark even tan that looks completely natural on me.  I recommend it without hesitation.

This is a very well built smoker.  Some thought has gone into its construction and design and it shows.  From the front mounted controls to the remote control you have complete control over the smoking process.  4 racks if you're cooking ribs or anything without too much height and plenty of room when you remove one and stuff in some butt roasts.I fired it up for the all important seasoning session before you can actually use it with all accessories in place with no water and no wood chips by pressing the temp button and then the up arrow until  I had selected 275 degrees and then pressing the time button and using the up and down arrows to set 2 hours for the heating time and then I left it alone until the time had passed.  I was still detecting a bit of a chemical smell and vapors coming out so I added another hour and came back and turned it off and let it cool.  That's all there is to seasoning it.First up was two 6 pound chickens (brined overnight) with the legs tied and my favorite rub applied dry to all parts of the chicken inside and out.  Legs tied and placed directly on the the second and fourth racks with the first and third removed and set aside.  Put the probe target temperature at 165 and used the temperature probe placed in the breast of the top chicken and let em go.  4 & 1/2 hours later they're done (the temp probe said 160 but an instant probe used on both chickens gave 167 and 165 bottom to top so out they came and sat loosely covered in foil for twenty minutes before chowing down.  I had used a combo of hickory and cherry chips and the smoker kept a good quantity of smoke coming out till I turned it off.  Must say everybody was ecstatic with the flavor and the juiciness.  Didn't even need any BBQ sauce.  Fed four people and had one wing left over...so not too shabby if I do say so myself.I like the fact that the excess drip pan is contained on the bottom right side of the unit and pulls out for easy dumping and cleaning.  I'm not too thrilled that the built in drip tray over the heating and wood unit (separate from the bottom drip tray) empties into the water pan before excess drains out the bottom of the unit to the built in drip pan as that defeats the purpose of the water as it gets covered in oil and won't evaporate properly.  It is stressed that in this cooker you don't need the water or to replace chips every hour (the wood pan has a special heavy duty lid that diffuses the smoke as it comes out and maintains a steady heat on the embers (it lasted five hours without refilling so I guess it works)...But I like my water for moistness so I'm deducting a star for that design flaw in my opinion.  You can put a drip pan under the meat but that takes up one shelf.  (pointing out however that the chickens came out moist and perfectly cooked - the problem is I don't know how much of that was the brining and how much the cooker)Over all I've smoked several racks of ribs in foil with holes to allow the smoke access and one 8 pound brisket that I foiled for two hours at the end  as we wanted pull apart as opposed to sliced brisket this time around and I needed to get it up to 190 or so.  This is a new model and there's not a lot of info out there or recipes specific to it but I just used my smoker knowledge from the last 35 years and everything turned out fine...if you're a newbie you'll find plenty of tips and recipes for electric smokers in general on the internet that can be applied to smoking in this unit as well.I also think the light design is flawed as it only illuminates the interior when the door is open and not while cooking.  But then the window smokes up anyway and it's hard to see.  But at least you can see any flare ups.  The remote's distance isn't all that great but if you leave it indoors in a place you can check every hour it'll tell you the temp of the meat as it cooks with the probe.  Just remember to check as you near the temp with other instant read thermometers in several places in your meats because you have to watch for even cooking.  A good tip to remember when cooking different meats with different times to put the longest on top and proceed down from there.  That way the last item won't be dripping all over your already semi-cooked other items.  The smoker has built in vents and nothing about it is made cheap.  No cheap plastic with everything I handled made of metal.  It's very well insulated which makes it do its job extremely well.Next up is my favorite.  Beef Jerky and all indications are that I'll have some really good results with this excellent smoker.  Clean up is a chore, but that's true of them all.  It has back wheels for rolling.  Just remember to empty the water and the drip pans before you tilt it to move.  Compared to Masterbuilts I"d say this one has a slight edge with the smoke pan system that doesn't require adding wood (you can if want to though...just remember to wear heavy High Temp Resistant mitts).I'm buying one for my daughter and her husband since they're drooling over everything I pull out of it and I'd like to have some leftovers sometimes!

I read this in one night!  Miss Smith has always fascinated me as an actress despite my being a Colonist since The Prime Of Miss Jean Brodie where she gave one of the most subtle performances I have ever witnessed.  The novel from which the story comes (written by Muriel Spark) is a miracle of brevity and wit and Miss Smith brought every bit of it and just a touch more to the screen in her Oscar winning performance.
