She is just the Olivier of Actresses as far as I am concerned and this biography (written with her co-operation) beguiles as much as one of her screen performances.  It is both informative and highly entertaining.  Filled with insights and delightful observations.Dame Maggie is still astounding audiences and other actors alike in Downton Abbey of course as it approaches its sixth and final season and winning new fans from around the world of all ages.  So now's your chance to learn her story and take that knowledge back to her performances for fresh insights.I cannot recommend this biography highly enough.  It's the only one I ever read that kept me going til the end without a breather - from morning til morning.  This from a guy who usually takes two weeks to read a book.Buy it and prepare to learn, laugh and love.

Excellent roll about or carry tote for your laptop (mine's a 15 1/2 inch Toshiba) with many pockets and padded places for your tablet and its accessories.  It's not too bulky or heavy.  It wheels very well and doesn't snag or drag.  The handle is telescopic of course and when down hides behind a zipper compartment so that usuing it as a carry tote is much easier and you won't accidentally grab the handle and wind up with your bag on the floor looking silly.  Amazon basic products take the high road on construction, utility and design and while they're not top flight they are upper tier.  For this kind of quality in stitching and design I would have expected to have to pay quite a bit more than the asking price.I am very pleased with it and now that I'm back in school at (%$# years of age*)  I find I can keep my combo laptop/tablet and bookds and various and sundry supplies in one case and take them all to class without having to carry it the whole way...very important at this age.  Then when I am in the school milieu I can handle carrying it from class to class with no difficulty.I would imagine the same would apply to the modern student of proper age as well.  I give it five stars without hesitation and if there are any problems with stitching, zippers, or wheelbase I'll come back and downgrade it pronto.*it's called obfuscation

It's okay.  I wouldn't give it any great kudos.  The scent is too light to last long.  The moisturizing is just so-so in my opinion and my skin didn't feel silky smooth after application (in all fairness tho I'm in my sixties and my skin is sandpaper rough to begin with).  Bottom line I might or might not buy it again.  It does moisturize some and the grand kids like the aroma while it lasts.  So I won't totally trash it.  Might be worth you buying one and trying it for yourself.  You never know and in my opinion all the reviews in the world can't tell you if you're going to like a product like this or not.Only the old trial and error method works unfailingly in the case of beauty products.

Does the job well.  I perimeter sprinkled this on my front lawn because our yard is the only one not xeriscaped on the block and we're right in the middle.  Needless to say we get more than the average share of dogs and cats using the facilities.  I waited a week to test this and my security cam caught all the walkers with their dogs in the evening and early in the morning.  In defense of some they do carry the required baggies and scoop...but most don't...and don't care what their animals leave.  I was very pleased to see that from the tiny toys to the large protectors the dogs uniformly refused to cross the line onto the lawn or the big tree in the middle.That's a 100 percent success rate that I observed there on the cam and I was pretty darn impressed.  The container will treat 300 square feet and for my use of about 75 square feet that means I'll get at least three more applications out of it.  The size of your lawn of course dictates your usage.  It is going into the middle of the second week now and I watched the security cam recording again this morning and saw that the animals are still avoiding the lawn much to their masters' chagrin.  I guess now they have to go three blocks to the park.It doesn't appear to have any really dangerous chemicals and the warnings only warn off moderate eye irritation and skin sensitivity...so don't get it on you...just the grass...or mulch...or whatever.  You can spot apply or do the whole lawn but so far I've warded off the pets with a three feet wide perimeter application.  Haven't seen any cats either...they are always setting off the security light at night and I fast forwarded through last evening and didn't see the light come on all night except for once.  Of course an animal being chased as cats often are aren't going to worry about your repellent and that may have accounted for the once it was triggered.  If the animals are on the sidewalk they are out of range of the motion detector.Overall I am very pleased.  It says it'll last 60 days barring frequent rain (which we've had all summer here in Colorado - Sorry California) and I'm planning on laying more down at the end of the week unless my cam tells me otherwise.I can easily recommend this product and if there are any added problems I'll come back and let you know.

My Daughter has trouble every summer with itchy skin.  She was ecstatic to find this solution.  Despite the fact that we use a swamp cooler to cool the house (about an 80% savings over conventional air conditioning BTW) she has had this problem with dry skin for the past five years ( I guess because her job keeps her outdoors a lot) and Curel Itch Defense Soothing Moisturizing spray has put an end to it.  After applying the spray I let her use from Vine she now keeps one of these in her bathroom at all times and one in her car.  I don't often have a problem and haven't really had an opportunity to try it myself but her reaction to it has convinced this old codger that it must really work because she is the most finicky person I've ever seen when it comes to moisturizers and such.  My wife says it soothes the kids bug bites too.  So overall they must be doing something right with this product.

As good as you're gonna get over here.  You can search and pay premium for a bit better picture, but face it, I've never seen it look better on my TV and that's what blu-ray's all about!  The picture does seem a bit washed at times but that's what video adjustments were made for.  Don't just slap it in with your TV set to THX or Cinema settings because they're basically for modern color extravaganza's...and you might have to play around a bit to get it right but you can if you try - I did!  The real surprise here is the soundtrack...which is as clear as a bell...no hisssss  or flutter like every other version I've ever seen in the quiet moments.  Astounding!!The movie's a classic and Laurel & Hardy are eternally funny.  Even the dated parts are now like looking back at a time capsule so you can't go wrong.  If you're as big a fan as I am then this is good enough!!!!

These are very well made measuring spoons and the magnets work extremely well for holding the set together.  Well worth the price and extremely convenient to have both the oval and the rounded measuring on each spoon.  I have used a plastic set for three years and the other day two of them snapped in the middle during the same recipe.  Guess the plastic hardened and became brittle (hand washed only).  So I decided to go with metal and this set fits the bill in spades.They look like they'll last a whole lot longer than the plastic ones and they don't bend easily (tho any spoon will bend if you put it to too hard a task).I highly recommend them and if there are any developing problems I'll come back and update my review!

Very convenient and the grand kids love to be able to use the Keurig of course.  Having the bulk of the flavors be their favorite candy flavors is a plus too and there's something for everybody including this old codger (I'm partial to the Boston Bean Midnight Hot Cocoa myself).  It's a good way to get a variety without having to buy them all individually.  Works out to around 50 cents a pod so keep that in mind.Over all I"d recommend it to keep around for convenience sake and the kiddies. The flavors are fresh tasting and true to their names.  I didn't find any duds in the selection itself and since I had to review it I tried one of each.Makes that cocoa break or bedtime treat very simple to serve.  I like it.

Very lightweight.  Very small.  If you're cooking for one or two this will do.  You can't use high heat or you'll ruin the ceramics.  It is decidedly nonstick however and what you cook will not stick.  That is the only plus I see to it.  It's too light to hold its place on the stove and in my house it gets knocked out of place on a busy stove.  I won't hold size against it because that's what Amazon sent me to try out.As far as it goes I am impressed with it's nonstick quality and cleanup is a snap indeed.  I'm deducting one star because in my opinion being too light is just as bad as being too heavy.  But I imagine for one or two people with any kind of arthritis or handling problems then that weight is going to be a blessing and it will will sit flat and stay put if you don't knock it.Update:  My wife has pointed out to me that the skillet is not light weight and in fact has quite some heft for its size and will keep its place on the stove unless I'm a complete klutz (her words - not mine) but she also thinks it won't be a burden to arthritic hands because the heft is relative to the size...so I'm already coming back and updating my review!  She also said it's quite handy for small amounts of browning and such for recipes and things like that as well as cooking two or three eggs...she thinks the size is a most convenient addition to her skillet collection.  She also said it is high quality construction and she doesn't expect it to fall apart or chip etc.  So...so much for my expertise in the kitchen folks because I KNOW she knows what she's talking about.  Hence my adding back the star and shutting up.That's my review. (tho you might wanna pay more attention to my wife)  The rest is up to you.

Ziploc has made this process so simple.  I use my regular old Hoover upright vacuum and it sucks the air right out.  The seams seem strong and I put 8 blankets in and got a package about two blankets thick.  I've never used this kind of storage system before, but it is so simple to operate that I sure wish I'd known about them sooner.You put your items in and zip lock all the air you can out then you affix the nozzle of your vacuum to the valve and suck out all the rest.  Cap it and you've got water proof dust proof storage that shrinks the volume down to about 25 or 30 percent.  They're simple to open and remove the items as well.I stored extra blankets, sweaters, and sheet sets with these three and I'm buying more because space is at a premium at our house these days.I highly recommend.

Ease of use and heavy duty performance make these the best Adult Briefs I've encountered.  My father is 89 and uses these at night.  They're easy to fit and hold quite a bit.  The odor guard works well and Dad seems very content with them.  He wears them out now as well and says they are a bit heavier but fit much better with the waist adjustment than his old brand.  We will be subscribing to deliveries to save some more on them and using them exclusively from now on.  For 72 the price will be much better in the long run.

Belkin's The Best.  This apple MFi-Certified cable both syncs and charges and it ends that problem with never having a cord long enough to do what you want.  At 4 feet it's plenty long enough to reach from my pc to my bed in my bedroom which is pretty close quarters these days since I gave the rest of the house over to the kids and the grand kids when they moved in and moved to the basement (familiar story these days).  The cord is braided which makes it more manageable and easier to handle.  The tips are metal of course and well connected.  Unless you abuse it because, face it, the nature of these things makes them susceptible to pulling apart because of how they're used and the world's need to do things quickly when care should be taken.  So if you use it reasonably carefully (I'm not saying it's delicate because it appears to be really well made) it should last a long time.  But if you yank and pull on it or twist it a lot then it's probably going to ruin it or the usb connection you're using.  Yes...I'm speaking to you...Grand Kids!I've had no problem with either syncing or charging and you can plug it into a wall adapter too.  I'm very happy with it.  I'm buying three more for the grand kids and their iPhones and Touches.

Onkyo continues to upstage the competition.  I was so impressed with the TX-NR636 and the new Dolby Atmos that I retired my $2000 Marantz SR6009 in favor of the overall peerless performance of the Onkyo.  Today's receivers have to be so much more than just audio processors now, what with video processing becoming an inherent part of their job.  At the end of my comments I will add some technical information for the techies but for the average middle of the road user like myself I must say that this unit has all that I want in processing capabilities and the overall sound performance has been superior to that of the Marantz.  I am in that age group that has trouble with dialogue when viewing movies on a home theater set up and the most amazing aspect of this receiver is that I can follow the dialogue of any movie I've watched so far and lose none of the impact of the audio decoding when it comes to aural effects.  A lot of people look upon the Dolby Atmos system as a gimmick but I find it offers a real dimension added to the viewing experience and I'm using the extra speakers that sit on top of your floor speakers and bounce the effect off the ceiling instead of utilizing ceiling speakers that were not feasible in the basement area I use for the Theater set-up and I really can't tell a difference between them and the ceiling mounts in my bedroom.  I'm looking forward to the new DTS-X and it's added theater effects that will be able to utilize more aural expansion with the coming 4K discs and 4K blu-ray players (coming later this year).  The video processing is astounding on my LG 4K tv with the upconversion of some dvds rivaling current blu-rays.  This Onkyo TX-NR646 is even better than the 636 in that regard.I replaced the TX-NR636 with this unit because I wanted to be ready for the new DTX-X (can't review that aspect yet as it included in an upcoming firmware upgrade).  I have also prepared for the new 4K experience by upgrading my TV and Sound System accordingly.  All I can say about the new unit is that it works just as well as the old one and adds two HDMI inputs that I badly needed.  Onkyo hasn't skimped on this unit and that should be obvious in it's going head to head with the higher end Marantz and coming out on top!I'm a very happy camper with the sound I'm getting in all quarters, music, movie, streaming.  Here's some techie facts from Onkyo:DTS:X SupportDolby Atmos Support170 W per ChannelHi-Current Amp Design for Authentic Sound ReproductionHDMI 8 In / 2 Out Including 1 FrontHDMI & HDCP 2.2 for 4K UltraHDBuilt-in Bluetooth & Wi-Fi with Pandora, Spotify, and AirPlayDSD 5.6 MHz, FLAC 192 kHz/24-bit Hi-Res Audio Capable384 kHz/32-bit Hi-Grade DACAccuEQ Room Acoustic CalibrationDTS:X is a next-generation object-based surround sound technology that includes height to deliver a fully-immersive listening experience. DTS:X provides listeners the ultimate in flexibility, immersion, and interactivity. Unlike channel-based audio, you will be able to personalize your audio experience. For example, you can turn up JUST the dialog within a mix. DTS:X allows you to customize to your room layout as well as control dialog and dynamic range.From the quietest dialog passages to booming action scenes, Onkyo's exclusive amplification technology dramatically enhances the audio dynamics of your movies, music and games.This Wide Range Amplifier Technology (WRAT) is at the core of Onkyo's signature sound. The innovative amplifier design is comprised of three key elements:(1) a low negative feedback design for punchy, true-to-life sound, and cleaner audio across the frequency ranges;(2) closed groundloop circuits to reduce individual circuit noise and keep the ground potential free of distortion; and(3) a high instantaneous current to handle big dynamic gains.This allows massive power at 170 W/Ch (6 Ohms, 1 kHz, 0.9% THD, 1 Channel Driven, FTC) and 100 W/Ch (8 Ohms, 20 Hz20 kHz, 0.08% THD, 2 Channels Driven, FTC).I will add that it has a phono input and vinyl sounds incredible with full warm sound filling the room.  I haven't heard a better vinyl set-up on any other receiver I've ever owned.Overall I give the TX-NR646 my highest rating without hesitation and when I have experienced the new DTS-X I will come back an make my comments on it here as well.

Remarkably Clever Design!  The strainer is built into the top of the container (with large comfortable handle) and bits and pieces are extracted as the  juices pour in and then when it cools enough to separate the fat from the liquid it does so via a stopper in the bottom of the bowl which lets the liquid out and prevents the fat from mixing in with it which sometimes happens with the spout from the bottom models no matter how well you tilt and turn it.  I don't usually go for kitchen gadgets but this one is an improvement over the old designs that is light years ahead of the competition!!I have been using it regularly with flawless results.  My gravy is now truly fat free and my au jus is flavorful without being heavy.  It's great!!  It's BPA free too.  The baster is nice and long, longer than my other two standard ones and comes with two interchangeable tips that brush on the basting liquid or rains it down like a shower head or you can forego either one and just baste the old fashioned way with the open end.I don't know how I cooked without it!

I own both the black pair and the grey pair. I like the quality- soft, comfortable, not too thin and not too thick a material. They don't feel itchy or too heavy during my workouts, and believe me, I sweat! They're not the most form-fitting cropped pants in the world, but don't expect them to be all flowy, either. They're sort of in-between. The waist could stand a bit more spandex to stay in place. As you work out and sweat, the pants definitely start to droop a bit. However, I have a small waist for my frame and I know this can add to that issue.An Important Sizing Note: I bought them within a couple of days of each other. The grey pair fits me well in the waist. The black pair fits much more loosely in the waist, and looser overall. However, both run small for the size that they are listed as. Penningtons 4X (which according to their website is the same as 28/30) actually fits more like a 24/26. I wear a 24/26 in every brand out there- Lee (Jeans), Woman Within, Jockey, Levi's, etc. I haven't gained weight, as I just bought pants in these other brands which fit like a glove in a 26. (Although my waist is smaller and would be better with a 24, I need a 26 to accommodate my heavier legs.) I have a couple of Penningstons shirts, too- they also run small. I wear a 20/22 in shirts, or 2X in most brands. Penningtons, I always have to size up to a 3X. So be aware of this when shopping for yourself.

An excellent bag. It has enough pockets, all of which are a good size, but not so many that you cannot find what you're looking for easily. The side pockets are lined with mesh and zip up, allowing room for a water bottle, sunglasses, or a cell phone more safely than just a slip-in pocket. The outside pockets are designed well. I keep my wallet in one, and basic little toiletries (lip balm, pressed powder compact, etc.) in the other. The one outer pocket has card slots and slots for a small cell phone or similar item, although I really don't use them much. The zippers are all nice and strong. The main zipper has a mechanism for locking onto the purse itself, a nice safety feature. The color of the purse is true to what I saw online, a stone color that goes well with silver, beige, grey, taupe and so on. The strap is easily adjustable, stronger than what you could typically find of a purse in this price range. I could use it easily as a shoulder bag, but typically wear it cross-body. The purse is large enough to hold what most women need to carry, not one of those crazy bags where you can't fit in a wallet, purse, cell phone, and water bottle (for example). It would hold a tablet or a paperback book in the center. There is a mesh-lined pocket on the interior of the main section. I don't mind canvas bags. The stone color helps keep it looking a bit more neutral and elegant, not so sporty that you can't get away with it in an office setting or from day-to-day.

My foot and ankle type: I have a little bit of a flat arch, worse on my right side. I supinate. Not the greatest ankle dorsiflexion. I wear an 11B.These are my day-to-day shoes. No matter what life throws at me, they're comfortable and they're safe. Perfect arch support. No heel slippage. No rubbing against the skin. Flawless sizing (I wear them with Silkies 3-in-1 socks). Awesome laces, great texture and the exact length one needs to tie without them being too short or too long. Good tread. Keeps my knees happy. I can wear them for doing housework, walking around town, climbing steps, hoofing it around my college campus with a 30 lb. backpack on, a short day hike in the hills, or just chilling- always comfy. If I had the income, I'd buy out every pair in my size there is! If I could get the interior of these with an exterior tread and toe lip that works for step aerobics, hi/lo, and weight-training, I'd be in heaven. Can't go wrong with Saucony. Good price, too.

Others have reviewed the workout itself, its layout and length, in other places here on Amazon. Just be aware that this and some of the other FIRM DVDs put out have worn out fast.  I used Super Cardio approximately once a week for the last four months. I keep my DVDs in a case where they are protected and do not rub up against other DVDs. There are no visible scratches on the DVD whatsoever. However, after "sticking" on a particular frame in places since about a month after purchasing, it now will not pause at all onscreen. It also will not go forward to the next scene or flip back to the beginning of the chapter with my arrow buttons on the remote. Nor does it budge if I go to the DVD player itself and hit the buttons on the front panel. The same problem existed in my portable DVD player, too, so it wasn't my player acting up. If I get a sip of water or need a second to put away a piece of workout equipment, I cannot pause the DVD now! I have to go to the menu and manually select the next scene from the menu. Very aggravating when you're trying to keep the heart rate up during a cardio workout. I have no kids or anything that get into my DVDs and scratch them up or anything. I've had this happen with four or five different FIRM workouts now. Whether that is just the nature of DVDs one uses as often as once a week or so, I don't know, but my VHS tapes lasted a lot longer than this! Disappointing. Wish they were all available in digital format instead...

Love, love, love this watch.  It keeps flawless time.  It came with the time and date already set for me.  Battery, fine.  Inexpensive but TOUGH.  I put it through the wringer from dawn till dusk each and every day.  I found the manual online for free, and learned how to change the time that way when Daylight Savings Time came about.  It's not full of bells and whistles, just a nice simple alarm and stopwatch and timekeeping piece here.  (I have enough bells and stuff on my cell phone...)  WOW, does this fit a real woman's life!  No more taking off my watch for every workout, hand-washing, laundry duty, dishwashing, shower, swim, long session doing homework or office work online, etc.  SOOOO many watches are uncomfortable to work, work out, or sun oneself in.  They get too hot, don't "breathe", aren't easy maintenance...this is.  I've owned watches Ecclissi, Burberry, Timex, and more, but this Armitron watch is the one that I reach for first thing every morning.  It's become a part of me.  And unlike the leather- (which apparently doesn't like sweat or water or reality) or metal- (which doesn't like water, cold, heat, sun, and more...) strap watches that I took off in frustration, this stays on until the day is through.  Now it drives me nuts if my watch isn't on!When women say this watch is too tiny, I'm confused.  I ain't thin.  I'm 5'7", muscular, a size 14/16, my wrist is about 6 and 3/4" (in other words, not small by female standards)- and this watch fits me grand.  The face is the size of most women's watches, so it's not teeny.  I can wear the watch tighter, up at the wrist where it meets my hand, or I can wear it further down on the forearm (as needed).  The resin is flexible and comfy, but doesn't stretch out so much that it loses shape or anything.  It's a barely-there watch, in the sense that it never snags anything or feels heavy and clunky.  I once had a big manly sports watch that was pretty darn awesome with bells and whistles and larger size, but it would catch on sweaters, doors, and more.  I was constantly taking it to the jeweler to get the pin put back in it (after a big metal door would rip the watch off my clumsy wrist as I struggled with my 30-lb. backpack), or getting the battery changed.  Not with this, it's as carefree a watch one can get.

I purchased the 18-lb. bar.  The padding on it is great.  The weight is balanced.  It's very comfy on my shoulders while doing squats or other lower body work, and it's comfortable in the hands for upper body work.  The only reason I wouldn't give this five stars is the SMELL!  It's a weird, strong chemical, rubber smell.  It gave me an awful headache the first few days I had it.  I bought it over two months ago, and I can still smell the chemicals in it faintly!  So be aware that while this is a comfortable padded bar to use in place of a barbell with plate weights, the odor is a bit of a concern from a health standpoint (although I'm not losing sleep over it).  If you have strong sensitivity to chemical smells, this might be something you want to consider before buying.

Like probably every coffee lover on the planet, I naturally prefer to grind my own beans and have my coffee made in an expensive machine. Add a touch of heavy cream and a spoon of raw sugar, and I'm a happy girl.  However, in real life and clothed in my pajamas at some ungodly hour of the morning, what I can accomplish with one eye still half-shut and my brain still half-asleep is to make this in those most decent drip coffeemaker I could locate.  It is the kind of coffee in flavor and aroma difficult to find easily nowadays.  I remember well the era when good coffee could be found within the average supermarket aisle, even in a can of coffee that didn't break the bank.  I'm also old enough to remember when coffeemakers were made on my side of the pond, and lasted twenty years or more.  (My great-grandparents wouldn't have tolerated buying a new coffeemaker every three or four years like I have to do, but that's another story entirely.)  However, those days are essentially over and this is the closest thing to sanity I can find in an insane world, because it is really tasty.

Nice-looking, but sizing is off and comfort is just not there. Easy to walk in for a heel, but more cushioning and better attention to shaping a shoe correctly would set Aerosoles apart. I wear a 10B in most shoes. At most a 10.5B, and then I normally add a heel snug for pumps (for comfort and better heel fit). Unfortunately, the 10.5B hurts my big toes and feels a bit tight across the top of my toes, too. Oddly, I still had to make the strap quite tight to fit this when trying them on, and the heel was loose even though my big toes were being smushed. This despite the fact that I just bought another 10.5 in an Aerosoles loafer, which were too big and require me to wear socks with them to fit properly! This shoe looks cute, but feels like a cheap shoe. The toe is rounded (which I love), but could be shaped better to fit a real woman's foot, instead of pinching toes and being too loose in the heel!

I know...it's just filler paper, right?  Not if you're a college student, and really need the papers to last through the current semester and beyond.  How could any filler paper be worth the extra price?  It honestly is worth it in this case, because writing on good paper is a pleasure.  Notes look neater.  If you have to turn in a handwritten paper, this paper stays so much nicer.  The reinforcement is vital- I am very hard on paper, because I use black Sharpies that can rip through cheap paper easily.  There is also very little bleed-through of those Sharpies to the next page.  The lack of aggravation is worth the wait of shipping time, short as it is.  I have yet to experience any ripped holes, poorly printed lines, lack of holes, or anything else I've read here.  I just ordered my third pack, and I will keep coming back for more.

This is a cute pink case that allows me to angle my cell phone on my desk or nightstand instead of just leaving it flat. I like this angling feature a lot, because I use my cell phone as my clock during much of the day and night. I can have my cell phone angled high or low, depending upon how I fix the bend in the case. This is good, because of course the light changes as hours pass and different angles are best. The magnetic part is nice and strong, but not obnoxiously hard to open. The holder for the cell phone itself (it's the black part within the case) is perfectly good. No problems using volume keys or anything.The only problem I've had is when taking photos- there is a distinctly pink cast over the entire frame, and I've found no way to overcome this flaw. I have to take the camera out of the case in order to take photos without this pink cast. I don't think it's my fault, as the case is perfectly lined up with the phone. For this reason, I must give the product four instead of five stars. Sometimes I'm trying to capture active photos with moving targets, and this aspect of the case is quite inconvenient.The wristlet part is very large, and would fall off of my arm quite easily. But the case protects my phone well in my purse or backpack.There are only a couple of minor changes that I would make to this product, things that I'm not deducting any stars for but am notating just for feedback. One is to have a belt clip on the outside, and I'd be willing to pay a few dollars more to have a good on this case. I really miss that clip, which I had on my Android Smartphone cover. Sometimes I'm not bringing my purse with and having no belt clip is a nuisance However, that is not this product's fault- it's just my personal preference. The other thing would be to either have a dedicated loop to put the stylus in, or to have the stylus be magnetic, so that it stuck to this case automatically. I like the stylus a lot, and hope I don't lose it, since neither one of the options is available.

I'm in my 3rd semester of college German, but have spoken it for 20 years. I listen to Bayern Aktuell on here all the time to reinforce auditory learning of German. I get to hear international news from a logical, well-informed source, too. Sound quality is flawless. On my Fire phone, I experience virtually no interruptions in service. I love the dozens of radio stations to listen to, as well! A must-have free app for all Deutschephiles!

Washing floors went from being a huge ordeal with a bucket and lots of rinsing to being a five-minutes-long, very easy task.  I have an older apartment with two bathrooms and a kitchen/laundry room off of a long hallway, all possessing the original white vinyl flooring.  (I didn't choose the color or the style of floor, I assure you!)  As everyone who has to clean them knows, white and flooring are two words that should not go together!  I have a moody set of knees and a cranky back.  Washing floors is so easy and thorough with this large mop head and the accompanying Sh-Wipes, though, I could do that chore every day if I wanted to.  I never have to scrub floors on my hands and knees, because using this mop once or twice a week after vacuuming first keeps the flooring looking great.  This mop also has a low profile, so I can easily get in tight spaces, ones that my old sponge mop couldn't quite reach.  It will even clean part of the floor under the stove and refrigerator, due to this feature.  I can definitely see why some of the housecleaning pros use this mop.This is a great mop, with only one issue.  The Sh-Mop is threaded into a Versapole.  The part where it screws into place on the handle comes loose and causes the mop head to turn and twist, leaving me unable to control the direction the mop head goes in.  However, some extra-strong duct tape solves that twisting and turning problem.  Otherwise, this has been a fantastic product.  I have had mine for several years, and I've never had to replace the mop itself.  Amazingly, I've also had some of the same thick, white cotton terry cloths that they sell (the Sh-Wipes) for that same length in time.  They don't get threadbare for a very long, even with weekly washing.  I take good care of them; I wash them in hot water, Clorox bleach, and powdered Tide.  They come out white again and like new from the washer and dryer every time.  For sanitary purposes, I also love that I'm not using and re-using the same old mop head- every time I wash my floors, it's like they're getting a brand-new mop.  When the Sh-Wipe gets dirty, I simply replace it with a fresh one.

I bought this originally because I am a) on a very tight budget and this is reasonable in price, and b) it had good reviews on every site I went to.  I've used Jergens (and despised it, because the product broke me out and I am NOT acne-prone); BE Faux Tan (overpriced and underwhelming); St. Tropez (which I love but cannot currently afford for the amount I go through during the spring and summer), and a few other products over the years that probably aren't even made anymore.  One was from Avon, many moons ago.  I would say overall, this one really is the best.  Even if I had the money to go back to buying St. Tropez, I probably would not do so, although ST gives a bit more brown and natural a tan once the color is well-established.I am fair-skinned with a cool undertone (pink/blue), have turquoise-blue eyes, and dark blonde hair.  I don't mind my pale skin in the fall and winter, but come spring, this is my go-to product for a faux tan.  I do not use this product to the point where I will look like a Brazilian babe.  It probably COULD get me that dark, but in the past I've found going that dark to be very odd-looking with my natural eye and hair coloring.  This product turns me from wearing the very lightest and cool- or neutral-toned (never warm-toned) foundation sold into a medium-skinned lady, and very quickly at that.  So that you have an example of the skintone difference- Revlon Shade 001 PhotoReady Foundation, typically not available in stores because it is such a light shade that few people wear it, is what I have to buy normally.  If I don't allow it to dry an hour or more (and I often don't), I may add a drop or two of Revlon SkinLights in Bronze to Revlon's PhotoReady Shade 006 Foundation to up the "bronze-y" factor.  If I apply two coats in one day, it will turn me truly "tan", which for me means I'm wearing Revlon's PhotoReady Shade 008 Foundation.  If you are not starting out with ber-pale skin like me and/or you are sunning outside regularly, you'll probably get quite a bit darker.Re-applying will depend on how dark you want to stay, how active you are, how dark you are to begin with, how much you bathe and/or sweat, etc.  To stay what is, for me, really tan, daily re-application would be required, twice daily on the face (yes, I'm that pale).  I'm fine with staying in the medium range, though, and so the following is what keeps me in that skintone.  I find that I must re-apply this more often on the face, tops of my feet, and my hands.  On my face, I typically apply it once a day, prior to applying my makeup in the a.m.  Because the hands are washed more often, then of course this will fade a bit faster on most people there- for me, it means I re-apply it every two to three days there.  The tops of my feet also fade more, probably because I work out daily and the friction of my workout shoes and socks rubs the product off somewhat.  While on the body I can get away with once a week application, the tops of my feet also need retouching every three days or so.I bought three bottles back in early April.  It is now the end of August, and I'm using the third bottle that came in April now.  This is with daily use on the face and one to two times a week elsewhere- so I'd say it lasts awhile!  Considering the cost, that is very impressive.One thing I ADORE about this product is how little it transfers onto clothing, sheets, towels, and other such items once it's allowed to dry on the skin.  Most self-tanners I've used leave a terrible amount of bronze coloring on pillowcases and such.  Not this!  Again, for the price that is incredibly nice.This product does have some drawbacks:1) The smell while it's drying and for several hours afterwards on the skin.  I don't notice any bad smell out of the bottle; only once it's sat on the skin for a bit.  If you just use it on the face (which I do almost daily, and it never breaks me out or clogs my pores), the smell is hardly even there.  But put it all over, and you'll detect it.  Have the perfume and scented deodorant ready!  It's not the worst I've ever used, but it is especially harsh on application day, and can make me a little self-conscious if I put it on the day of a big event or a date.  I do not notice it the days after application, though.But that said, I've never had any complaints from anyone about the scent of it when they're around me, so maybe it's not bad.  I do know it is FAR better than Bare Escentuals Faux Tan (which is far more costly and fades much worse than this), which was so bad that the second any water hit my skin (shower, swimming pool, etc.) the fake tan product odor became INSTANTLY apparent!  Talk about nerve-wracking!2)  The fade can be patchy.  Again, not the worst I've seen, but it's not the best.  I'd say that St. Tropez's self-tanner was the best-smelling, had the most natural color, and faded a bit better than this.  However, it is FAR more expensive and doesn't get me as dark nearly as fast as this does.  It also doesn't dry as fast as Banana Boat's, and wears off A LOT more on sheets and clothing.3) If not completely dry yet (as in not already on the skin SEVERAL hours), it will stain your towels and such when you dry your hands after washing.  It does stain my towel a bit at night after I've removed my makeup and washed my face, but then I do apply the Banana Boat tanner daily to my face, so I can't complain too much.4) While I like the look healthy and glowing in this, and everyone else who's seen me in it says I look great with it on, I cannot say it is quite the same as a natural tan.  I do not get the, "Where did you go to the beach?"-type comments with this very often.  I try my best between this and my makeup to make it look natural, and I get very close, but I know it's not quite like a real suntan.  It is a bit more medium-toned, a tad more orange, and not quite as natural-looking as a real tan on ME as a real tan would be.  (This may not be true for those with a different natural coloring to start with, though.)  The closest to that real suntan look which I've found is to apply St. Tropez's self-tanner, with a tad of BE's "A Little Sun" sprinkled on the skin for that red-brown touch on the shoulders and other places where the sun hits the heaviest.  However, that look costs a lot more to obtain!  This and my current makeup gives me more of a look like the fitness-buff ladies get in Oxygen magazine.  It can't make me look like Christie Brinkley in "National Lampoon's Vacation"- I wish it did! :DI hope that this review will help other fair-skinned souls out there if they want to buy this or not. :)

Beautiful bra, and it fits okay- the cups might be just a tad small or low for the cup size advertised.  It's not a super deep-cut bra, but it's certainly not high up on the bust, either.  However, the band size fits perfectly.  It is a lovely-looking bra in Black, which is the shade that I got.  It is also very comfortable, yet is also supportive.I have broad, well-developed shoulders which bra straps can almost never fall off of.  It is very important to note this, because the straps are set quite far apart on this bra and that affects fit and shape on different ladies.  While this bra fits me well, that may not be true for a lady with a different build than I have.  If you have small and/or sloped shoulders, this bra might not be the best for you.  But as with all bras, it will need to be tried on for each woman to be certain about that.

This review is mostly about the Gain Original Scent.  I like to use Febreze Fabric Refresher in the same ways as everyone else:1) To freshen up the bed linens each day, so that it seems more like I just put fresh sheets on the bed.2) To finish off weekly housecleaning.  Naturally, it's especially nice to spray on just-vacuumed upholstered furniture, those throw pillows everyone has somewhere in their house, coverlets and blankets, fabric (not vinyl) shower curtains, the curtains hung up at windows, the dining room chairs which have cushioned seats, the rocking chair cushion set, etcetera.3) To use right before company comes over, making the house smell clean, fresh, and homey.I've never had any problem with it spotting anything permanently.  I do wish it would spray a tad bit more finely (more like an aerosol air freshener spray), because the spots are obvious for a bit of time on solid-colored items.  I'm taking off a star for the fact that the sprayer could work better- especially as the bottle gets down to the last few ounces.  The sprayer cannot be easily repositioned, and therefore it starts spurting out larger drops of fabric refresher if it's held at the wrong angle.  The dampness this product creates is quite temporary, as the spray dries fast, but I have had a couple of complaints about the dampness if a person sits down on a chair that I just sprayed a moment earlier.  I do think that it removes nasty scents from fabric items (cigarette smoke being one example), but it's obviously not a replacement for washing items, spot-cleaning, a proper upholstery scrub-down, or vacuuming.  Occasionally I'll see people using this product to try and cover up the fact that they haven't done that deeper cleaning, though!The Gain Original Scent is my favorite.  I haven't been able to find it in awhile, but the Meadows & Rain scent was also nice.  If I can find it, I like to match the Febreze products around the home- the air freshener, candle, plug-ins- and use the same fragrance throughout.I've tried the Antimicrobial formula and the Anti-Dust formulas, the latter of which I don't see offered anymore.  I do like those qualities to my fabric sprays, but with both of them the scent was NOT to my liking- kind of musky and overwhelming.  However, the Antimicrobial is kind of nice to have on hand when someone in the household has had the flu, a cold, etc.  I wish the Gain Scent had one or both of those attributes, but you can't have it all, I guess.There is one grocery store near me that carries the Gain scent, but it's nice Amazon carries it for times when they're out of it.  I just don't like the other fragrances that much, so Gain Scent is what I stick to.  If you like the laundry detergent and fabric softener scent of Original Gain, you'll Also, my housemate is extremely picky about fragrances I spray, but loves the Gain-scented one.  Score! :)

Worse than any other extendable duster that I've ever used.  I've used feather dusters, extendable wands on vacuum cleaners, cotton-covered dusters, dryer brushes to clean out lint...honestly, ANYTHING would be better than this piece of blue junk.  The wand has to be screwed in just right, or it will collapse in length.  No matter what you do, the head will not stay in place.  You can try to hold the head in place with rubber bands...duct tape...a cloth tied around it.  Nada.  Nothing works.  It will just turn and turn, getting loose dust everywhere, if it dusts as all.  Forget using this on an angle- if you bend the duster, it will spin and spin, not stay at the angle you set it at.  I tried to dust the top of my kitchen cabinets with this- what a mistake!  The duster doesn't hold ANY dust- electrostatic, my foot!  A plain microfiber cloth is more electrostatic than this thing.  A feather duster, heck, even a SWIFFER HOLDS MORE DUST THAN THIS THING!  I cannot steer a potential buyer away from this enough.  All this thing does is move the dust into the air and onto surfaces below where you dust- and I do mean ALL OVER those surfaces.  I have never been more disappointed in a cleaning product or item.  I hate leaving negative reviews, but I have no choice here.  Buy anything for extended dusting but this darn thing, but save your dollars and don't buy this.  Even if the head stayed in place, it just throws dust everywhere, so I would never suggest someone with allergies or asthma use this.  It also has a strong chemical smell out of the packing, and sheds little blue threads EVERYWHERE (as if the dust wasn't bad enough...)  After using this, it took me an hour to wipe down all of the kitchen surfaces.  I expect some dust to fall down- but there's no excuse for this thing to be marketed as electrostatic and hold not one speck of dust in the fibers.  But that's what it does.  Horrid...

I am very good at taking care of my brushes. They are stored in a BE bag carefully. I've had many of my brushes for ten years, and they look and feel like new. This is important to note, which is why I'm giving the background.I used this to apply a highlighter and bronzer, and it worked well, though it isn't up to (for example) Bare Escentuals Kabuki Brush quality. The bristle are soft enough and plentiful, but they don't "grip" the product the way BE brushes do. They are also not as soft, and shed a tad more.But my gripe is that the ENTIRE brush- the whole cover to the brush itself- fell off within two weeks. It had no locking mechanism or anything where I could just slip it back on. I'd have to glue or tape it back together. (Which would look and feel tacky, to say the least!) I have no children or anyone around who touches or uses my brushes. So I know that it wasn't destroyed by a careless third party. I have NEVER seen a makeup brush- even cheap dollar store ones- fall apart so fast. I'm not seeking my money back, because it was not enough of a cost output to warrant sending it back. Maybe this is just a fluke- but I will steer clear of this brand forever, despite the good reviews many people have given their brushes.It's back to Revlon brushes for me! They're a good drugstore brush brand that I can trust...I will never buy Eco Tools brushes again. If I have the income again in the future, I'd return to my Bare Escentuals brushes for any new purchases. I felt I owed fellow shoppers a review and a warning- spend your hard-earned dollars on a better brush!

I wear an 11W shoe, and bought the size Large. They fit like a glove. They are cute, breathe well, and make my lower legs look slimmer than when I wear crew socks! I bought the hot pink color, and I love wearing them. They're a tad expensive. Be careful when washing these, as the outer layer snags easily. I highly recommend washing them in the sink, or using a mesh laundry bag to enclose them in the washing machine. I also recommend either air-drying them, or only putting them in on low in the dryer. They don't shrink, but the elastic can be a bit fragile- and the stitching is even more fragile.That said, I cannot stand wearing other socks when I work out now. They can lose a bit a stretch if worn all day long, so I don't care to use them for everyday socks. They can end up sliding into my shoe by the end of an active day, because they stretch A LOT.  But I love that they are thin, but with two thin layers, they always keep my feet at the best temperature- not too cold, not too hot. My feet feel very comfy in these. Do be careful walking in bare floors while wearing these, FYI. They are more slippery than "old-fashioned" socks, not made for sportswear like these are.

I have been a regular exerciser since 1996. Heaven knows, I have owned MANY pairs of workout shoes in that time. Typically workout shoes last me anywhere from three to six months, with a schedule of working out forty to sixty-five minutes a day, six to seven days a week consistently.  I've had many good pairs of shoes, and many awful ones. The best pairs of shoes I've owned (either for workout or wear-a-day) have ALWAYS come from Saucony. Obviously, one cannot wear sneakers all the time in life, but I wear these when I can get away with it! Not only are they designed to keep your feet breathing (thanks to the mesh upper in most of their designs), but they are always fashionable in looks, and feel good on from the second that they are taken out of the box.  Very rarely have I ever experienced the need to "break in" Saucony shoes. This is not true for the New Balance brand with me, as a comparison in workout shoes. While initially Saucony shoes can cost a bit more money than some other sneakers out there, this brand consistently tends to wear out much less quickly than others, at least in my case. Workout shoes almost consistently follow the rule that you get what you pay for, especially if you have anything but a completely pain-free body, no injury history, and perfect feet.My stats (for you to compare your stats to mine, seeing how these shoes might work for you): I wear a size 11W, and this is my true size in every shoe that I have ever worn since I was a teenager. I have average-sized ankles for a full-figured woman; I'd say about they're about 10" around.  I am plus-sized, so I require some padding in my shoes to keep my feet, joints, and lower back happy.  Yet I am big enough that I definitely do not want extra heft in my shoe- and it can be tough to find the right shoe meeting those two conditions.  I have problems with under-pronating (supination)- evidenced by the fact that I always wear the outside tread of my shoes out before any other part of the tread.  I have an average instep, and my arches are basically normal, with a little bit of tendency towards flat feet (especially if I'm stuck wearing low-quality shoes, like for a friend's wedding...)My point is that I know if the shoes are right for me IF they give me a spring in my step. These definitely achieve that goal! Before I switched to supination-correcting shoes, I had really given up on high-intensity exercise. But I do brisk walking, aerobics (both floor and step), plyometric exercises (jumps and high-impact moves, but in moderation), light-to-moderate strength-training, lots of floor-based exercises for the abdominals/core/spinal erector/glutes/hips/thighs/, some Pilates, some Yoga, and lots of athletic stretches.  So in other words, I need a combination of stability AND flexibility in my shoes. I need something that will flex when I do lunges, but won't make me wobble when I require extra balance, such as when I'm doing high-step aerobics. This shoe is amazing in that it allows for both of these requirements to be met! And they are lightweight. Honestly, it's like "barefoot, but better". I never feel like these shoes are "in my way", adding weight and too much motion control to get full range-of-motion in exercises. For the daily exerciser, they know how important this is!They are also great as day-to-day shoes. I walk so much faster in them than I do even my other sneakers. I spent an eight-hour day recently touring NW Washington, D.C. (mostly on foot), pounding the concrete as I toured the city, climbing steps to get in, on, and out of the Metro a zillion times.  I took the long trip past the Navy's Memorial Fountain, the National Lawn, walking up the National Gallery steps and around its marble floors towards the end of the day. Yet I felt great all day and into the night, and had no fatigue or pain the next day, either! I had very severe knee problems at one point, and I can tell you that these are fantastic if you have those problems in your history.A hint that may help in doing exercise shoe-shopping: Do not automatically buy shoes labeled for flat feet or high arches, if you have either of those problems. Instead, look at the tread of a pair of your well-worn shoes. If they are shoes related to the activity you're buying a new pair for, all the better.  My tip is to remember that your arch type is only a part of the equation in shoe-shopping.  If you wear out the inner tread of shoes, then you'll likely need motion control to move more safely, and will probably need a shoe designed for over-pronators. But here's the thing to watch out for...Many times it is the standard recommendation to buy shoes for over-pronation automatically, if one has flat feet. I took that advice for years at face value, and doing so slowed down my workouts, and was hard on my knees and back. I was doing the exact opposite of what I needed, as despite being flat-footed to a degree, I am actually a supinator. The tread on my shoes was the clue. (Although it must be stated that I've regained my arches significantly through losing a lot of weight and by doing exercises/stretches to strengthen and regain normal arches.) While supination is allegedly more common in people with high arches and/or very high insteps, don't automatically assume that you need the kind of motion control which shoes for over-pronators are often designed for. Regardless of your type of foot- look at the tread. Everything starts with the feet- the wrong shoes lead to ankle, knee, back, and foot problems. No one needs MORE wear and tear on their body! :)Once I addressed my true issue- supination- I FINALLY found the shoes that give me the spring in my step needed! I could finally do the high-impact aerobics, running in place, jumping jacks, deeper lunges, deeper squats, tall-box climbs, and plyometric jumps without feeling pain in the knees and/or lower back.  It was also more comfortable for my feet.  If you do the type of workouts that I do, you probably need a shoe with a lot of flexibility- almost like being barefoot- but cannot take the "barefoot shoes" currently in vogue due to high-impact movements. Some people do well with the "barefoot shoes", but my shoe size, body type, and level of physical activity make wearing those type of shoes less-than-ideal. So this sneaker is a godsend to me! I love to exercise, and these make that easier and more enjoyable. Saucony excels in giving me a flexible, supportive, strong shoe with good looks, and just enough motion control that I never feel like I'm losing my balance in them. It was so important to my body, that it actually lessened the fatigue I felt post-workout to invest in these shoes! I work harder than ever in my workouts, but experience far less achiness from my workouts since wearing these shoes. They are truly awesome! I hope that anyone who buys these has the same wonderful experience with them.To the Saucony Co.- PLEASE expand your availability of this shoe in the various colors for ladies like me with wide feet!  11W is now a very common shoe size. I would buy a pair of these in every color if I could, but you only make one color available to me in that size. And keep your best shoes (like these!) available for purchase.  Please don't change these- they rock!

The older I get, the more light that I seem to need for every single task. Come nighttime, my overhead lights caused terrible glare on my textbooks and electronic devices. Table lamps provided either inadequate light or give off a terrible glare themselves, especially off of glossy white college textbook pages, not to mention my electronic screens. I don't know if it's because of the LED or not, but the glare with this is really minimal- astounding, considering how bright it is.I love that this inexpensive light can both sit freestanding, or can be attached to your laptop or desktop via the USB cord. It's virtually weightless, making it a convenient accessory to bring along in your backpack or laptop bag if you have to work in dim spaces on-the-go. I certainly do use it to light up my laptop keyboard as I type away in my living room, bedroom or home office at all hours. But even though I bought it for my laptop, and to try and light up my schoolbook pages when I study at night, I've ended up using it for so many other tasks- things that I's never even thought about before owning this. It definitely makes a good portable book light (important, since I'm a full-time college student right now). It makes tasks like trimming fingernails, sewing, knitting, writing, little household repairs so much easier on the eyes- and now I see so much more detail as I work. (I know- I sound so old...) I also use it to add light around my face when putting makeup on the morning. I've found that this helps me see my face with greater clarity and detail than my beautiful but somewhat dim $80 makeup mirror- probably because this one has so bright, clean and white a light. It helps me catch makeup application mistakes that the more neutral/yellow, dimmer makeup mirrors just don't uncover. I take it with me on longer travels away from home, too, just in case the light where I'm staying is inadequate for things that I need to get done.Since it has a bendable cord, it's far more versatile than any regular lamp, task light or flashlight that I've used before. With it's own stand and simple on/off switch on top of the base, it has none of the aggravations trying to use a wobbly, circular flashlight for fix-it jobs can create. I have a wall-mounted USB multi-port over my computer desk, and can stick this little light into one of the slots in order to create light from a whole new angle that way, too. (This is where the bendable cord also comes in handy.) I often place it on a shelf to give more light temporarily in closets, as I'm getting things out or putting items away. I have a very dark pantry space, for example, and this light helps me see all the items which get shoved way back on the deep shelves with ease. I can get light in any angle that I need it, for any use that I need. I haven't had any power outages yet since I've owned this, but this is so much brighter than the average flashlight, I'm really glad to have it on hand in case that happens. Since it'll run on any charged item possessing a USB port, or will stay lit up on AA batteries alone, I think it's a nice addition to an emergency household or automobile kit. I do wish that it had an A/C adapter power option, though. I like this light so much, but it dims pretty quickly when running on batteries alone. It's a bit tougher and more durable than many of my flashlights, too. I've accidentally dropped it a few times, as heaven knows I tote it all over the place with me these days, and it's not been hurt a bit.Update on 8/17/14: After several months of use, I still like my light a lot, but it drives me nuts that it eats through batteries in a nanosecond. That is why I must remove a star from my original 5-star review. They have increased the price quite a bit since I bought it a few months ago (although it is currently less expensive than the price I had seen lately, which was really steep). Because it has no A/C power option, this light can be a bit inconvenient for my needs, personally. Consider carefully what your own habits are before buying this light, especially if you're on a really tight budget. I like to use it for adding extra, clean white light to my dark bedroom when I'm putting on my makeup in the a.m. I also like to use it sans computer/USB, while studying out of my textbook and writing in longhand, again because it does add a useful task light which is bright and clean. And typically I'm studying at night, when house lights are all that I have to work with. The dimming which occurs within a day or two on battery power alone (and we're talking maybe an hour or two of use a day, max) is really annoying when I'm trying to do tasks like that. (I'm a full-time student and just don't have loads of money to invest in lots of expensive task lighting.) Batteries aren't cheap, and I buy the high-quality, name-brand ones which last forever in my other battery-powered items around the home. So I know that problem is the light itself, and not my choice of batteries. It doesn't totally die on batteries for a long time, but it goes dim fast and stays that way until it finally fades completely. While this LED light doesn't get hurt easily, the tipping over so often can get old fast. It also doesn't sit up well at all if taken out of it's base and placed in a 12-port USB hub that I own, even when I place it dead center in the port. While the coil of the light is flexible, there is just no heft to it at all (in a negative sense). Also, I often study for college or do work while lying in bed, and the light is constantly falling over if it's sitting on my bed, which is pretty firm and flat in surface. I wouldn't remove a star for that alone, but the lack of light on batteries and the flimsiness DOES get old, because not everyone works at a desk!Now my mom, grandmother and best friend all want one of these, too! :)

I went into reading this with an open mind, because I like fitness and nutrition books a lot.  I'm always hunting down up-to-date info on the best nutrition plans, exercise routines and supplements for the dedicated fitness buff.  I wanted to add in more walking to my routine, in order to build my cardiovascular endurance up to better levels.  I hoped that this would provide me with some inspiration to do just that, plus keep me on the straight and narrow path nutritionally through a week-by-week program to abide by.  But it just doesn't deliver on that- at least it did not do that for me.  I don't knock the other positive reviews that this book got- if this worked for others, great.  It just taught me nothing new, personally, and I didn't find it interesting (though I did read it all the way through to the end and followed the plan, loose as it was).  Frankly, this was boring and I had to force myself to finish perusing this.  Most of her "plan" was just sort of keeping a journal, aiming for one rather minor dietary goal a week...hardly anything new or earth-shattering.  She didn't discuss injury prevention, supplementation or cross-training.  I really don't like books lacking specifics!This book actually doesn't stress exercising very much- it is heavy on dietary advice, most of which is rather vague and generic.  I assumed that this book would contain a detailed walking program of some kind to follow, but it didn't.  I found this lack of exercise planning in the book surprising, considering that the author is an exercise video guru and gym owner!  The author sites few, if any, scientific studies or medical research for what she espouses, too.  Though to be fair, the vast majority of her work here is plain common sense- drink lots of water, don't overeat, get some exercise most or all days of the week, don't smoke, don't drink much (if any) alcohol, eat plenty of fruits and vegetables...you get my drift.  All of this information can also be obtained quickly and easily from the Internet for free, except with far more detail about how to achieve peak health through living, eating and exercising intelligently.Even if you actually want a book instead of delving into the vast resources of the web, there are many superior choices available to buy.  A better book on total health and fitness is "Firm for Life", by Anna and Cynthia Benson.  At least that book delves into the actual science of staying youthful and strong through modified bodybuilding nutrition, consistent vigorous exercise and lifestyle balance.  It also provides real women presenting their own fitness stories and testimonials, which are fun to learn and draw strength from.  Anna and Cynthia Benson preach an exercise method of aerobics, weight-training, abdominal work and athletic stretches- a program that has worked very well for thousands of their clients.  If Pilates is more your thing, Brooke Siler's "The Pilates Body" is excellent- no diet advice is offered, but an incredibly solid and easy-to-follow matwork and upper body exercise series is presented there.  "Yoga Conditioning for Weight Loss" is a great book to utilize if you prefer to develop better flexibility, joint range-of-motion and balance through gentle yoga and a nutrition plan based on simple vegetarianism instead.

I was very impressed with how solidly constructed this is- though for the cost, it should be!  It is made in China, but that's pretty unavoidable these days.  I think that the price is fair for the smooth finish, all-in-one welding that makes the piece super sturdy (no way will it tip over or have shelves breaking off) and the large storage space it provides.To advise how I'm utilizing this: One of my hutch shelves was just a sea of papers, extra file folders, printer paper, etc.  I'm a full-time college student and I also needed somewhere to put my "active" files (i.e., papers for current classes I'm in).  Before I bought this, I kept knocking the files over losing them in my shelf o' crap on the hutch.  Now, I've got files for all four of my classes neatly stacked vertically via this organizer.  I put spare manila folders and printer paper in the two bottom, horizontal shelves of this organizer.  The horizontal shelves are all wide/deep/long enough to hold legal- or letter-sized files, just to let you know.  This sits on top of my hutch nicely, very accessible and pleasing to the eye.  Well, as much as a metal organizer can please the eye, that is...This comes with little felt pieces (four of them) to put on the bottom of this organizer, so that it stays in place better and doesn't scratch whatever surface you put it on.  I'd actually bought some 3M Command sticky stuff to lay it down on my desk with- but the felt pieces work just fine to keep this in place, especially because it's a relatively weighty piece.

These are made of heavy, if comfortable, sweatpant material.  I'm 5'7", so I'm on the tall side, but I have average-length legs (a 30" inseam is perfect for me, 29" is do-able but can't shrink at all if they're going to work).  So quite often I only need an Average in pants because a Tall (which typically has an inseam that runs anywhere from 31" to 34" long) will be too long in both the rise and the inseam for me.When I wore these the first time, without washing them first, they fit okay.  Not particularly long on me when I'm in sneakers, but long enough that they weren't high-waters.  After washing, the length had shrunk at least two inches (probably three), though the overall fit seemed no tighter.  This was very aggravating- now they ARE high-waters on me!  However, I like the pants style and color- I have Light Khaki.  So I ordered another pair, this time in TALL, knowing that they will shrink after washing and finally be just the right length!  The old ones, I'll only wear around the house from now on...This length issue was true of two other Woman Within pants styles I've had- their 7-day Sports Pants and a pant which had a running stripe up the side.  So be warned- if you're at the top of the height bracket for pants, order the next length up.  A woman with average-length legs who is 5'3"-5'5" would wear the Average pant size well in this particular Woman Within item AFTER washing.  Cotton pants at Woman Within (though not their jeans) seem to have this problem quite frequently with the length shrinking, because I've read many other reviews with the same situation popping up.Update: I have since bought the Tall length (same size in number alone) in these pants and after washing, they did indeed fit perfectly on my frame.  This perfect fit was true both for the rise and the inseam.

I recommend sizing up in these panties. They are a tad skimpy, especially in the lower ab/hip area. If you are between sizes, of course go up to the higher size since that's been stated. That said, they fit grand when you get the right size- no riding up on the tush, no elastic rubbing uncomfortably at the hems, etc. Overall, they're well-made, especially considering the diminishing quality of clothing around the world today. I've had no problems with the elastic coming undone, loose threads or any of the lace being scratchy.I do like the color selection here. I don't like wild colors or prints in my undergarments. I only wear beige, white and black in my undergarments, so finding a set like this makes me happy. The price for these is reasonable for the volume that you get, too.I've had no problem making these last a long time. I always wash my bras and panties on the delicate cycle in a mesh zippered laundry bag. They won't get any pilling on the fabric IF you wash bras and panties alone, no other clothes or items in the washer with them. I then let them all air-dry on hangers with special clips overnight. This set of panties has lasted a couple of years and still show no sign of wear thus far. If you are unwilling or unable to wash and dry them in this careful manner, they probably will wear out much faster. Lace on clothing IS fragile and if you're tough on your clothing, these probably won't be your favorite panties.I think that they look very pretty on the body, especially the black pairs. I wear the beige panties under white pants so that there's no see-through (an old trick my Mom taught me- same with wearing a beige bra under white shirts). It's easy to find white, beige or black bras with a touch of lace that will match these grand, making for a sexy combo underneath your clothes each day.

This bra is highly rated on Amazon, which made me want to give it a shot. My mother warned me, "Don't buy Playtex!", because she felt they came up too high under the arms with excess fabric and that their cups fit weirdly compared to other brands in the same size. But I bought this anyway, mostly because it was half the cost of my fave brand, Glamorise. Boy, did I make a mistake!Okay, I will say that this covers and holds the bo*bs up just fine. Almost too well- it reminds me of that "Lunch Lady Song" Adam Sandler sang on SNL years ago, about a lady who has 76 hooks in her big old bra or something like that. That's how I felt while wearing this! Granted, I'm a big woman but my chest isn't sagging that much (yet) and I don't need the "duct tape holding method" that this bra feels like. I wear a 48F and this bra just didn't feel right to me. Not tight or with any spillover...just icky. As my mother warned, there is indeed too much fabric on the sides of the bra under the arm. Maybe women with a lot of fat in that area like this extra fabric, but that's actually one of my lean spots (genetics and years of weight-training to thank), so all it does is rub against my upper arms and underarms (which feels awful, too).The fabric is also SO scratchy! Really uncomfortable on my skin all day long. I always hand-wash my bras/panties alone, rinse well and then let them drip dry. My delicates last for years this way. And I have never had a bra with fabric that felt so rough! This bra pilled along the edges, too, which doesn't happen to any other bra that I have (mostly because I hand-wash and drip-dry, I'm sure). Forget 18 hours- after 6 hours, I couldn't wait to tear this scratchy bra off!The straps are just too thick for me. Unless you're wearing a crewneck, these may peek out of your shirts because there's so much to the straps and cups. The bra comes up high on the chest, too, which is fine if concealing your breasts is your goal. But for those who wear ballet-neck, v-neck or sweetheart necklines, this bra comes up too high on the chest and the straps are too wide.I praise Amazon for carrying many bras for plus-sized women like me. I just don't care for this bra and will purchase Glamorise (despite the extra cost) because I've learned my lesson. I DID try another kind of Playtex bra and didn't like it, either (similar problems).

Not much that one can say about a bucket, but here goes. I've had mine for a few years. I use it to clean windows- clean ammonia-and-water solution goes for the cleaning in one side, plain water in the other side for rinsing the window scrubber in. I use a soft window scrubber in the ammonia solution to actially clean the windows, then a squeegee to wipe them dry, FYI. Works like a charm and goes quickly, thanks in part to this large bucket.It also makes a great storage caddy for cleaning supplies because it's so large and tall. Nothing falls over in it because it's got height and is divided in half. It'll hold lots of cleaning cloths, spray bottles, big bottles of all purpose cleaner, you name it and is still easy to carry. With the plastic piece over the handle, it's pretty comfortable to carry around.It pays to buy durable cleaning equipment and this is no exception to that rule.

I have light ash brown hair, fair cool skin (pink undertone) and blue eyes.  I prefer not to wear sparkly or glittery makeup because I am in my mid-thirties and matte colors look a bit better on slightly-aging eyelids.  I also want to be taken seriously and sometimes brazen makeup colors can prevent that from happening.  I have a "remember the woman herself, not the wild makeup/clothes/hair she has on" philosophy when it comes to beauty.  This palette works fine for that look- modest, calm, understated.  However...on someone of my cool coloring, it can appear dull and make me look rather tired.  It seems to make my very light dark circles under my eyes look worse than they really are and doesn't accent my blue eyes all that well.  I can wear just about any makeup color or formulation and pull it off (thanks to my coloring, the type of facial structure I have, good genes and good skincare)...but this makes me look a little blah.  I think it'd be better suited to a woman with green (or maybe brown) eyes, warmer skin, warmer hair color.  For women with cool coloring (black, cool red, ash blonde or ash brown hair), a pink undertone to their skin (as opposed to yellow, brown, olive or tan) and blue or grey eyes, I just don't think that this would be a spectacular choice in color palette.  Obviously some will disagree and that's okay- I'm just basing this on personal experience.  It does possess a lovely matte finish for those who look good with this neutral set of color choices.  Finding an eyeshadow quad with an all-matte finish to each color is quite difficult, especially in this price range.However, the product itself REALLY needs some work.  It's been flaky since day one (and it was fresh when I opened it, not old or rancid) and the powder goes EVERYWHERE.  So much of the product goes to waste due to this.  I use high-end makeup brushes, not cheap sponge applicators, so that's not the problem.  The color saturation on the lids is only moderate at best.  I'm not a makeup line snob- if I can get away with using a drugstore product, I will.  I'm on a limited budget, so I love drugstore finds that work well.  But I have to admit that in terms of not flaking and the color intensity once applied, Lancome and Estee Lauder eyeshadows blow this stuff away.  My Lancome eyeshadow quads last forever because I don't lose half the product to the wind!  If you wear this, you must tap the brush off before putting on the eyes because otherwise the powder will fall on your cheeks.The durability is just okay, too.  I have fairly dry skin.  Oily breakthrough is never a problem on my eyelids or facial skin and I don't use eye cream or anything like that.  I also prep my eyelids with foundation and pressed translucent powder before putting on shadow, which always helps product last longer on my lids.  Even Maybelline eyeshadow lasts all day on me!  But this product?  Gone within four to six hours from my eyes no matter what I do.Overall, this is not worth the money for me.  Were it reformulated to be better quality, I'd give it four or five stars.  The color choice doesn't work for me, but I wouldn't remove stars for that because that's just a personal thing.  At this point, I'd have to say one should either shell out the bucks for a matte palette in a better department store line of makeup or use a drugstore product and most likely put up with the shimmer that seems to be in nearly every eyeshadow quad these days.

I've taken to eating green salsa on every Tex-Mex, Mexican and egg dish I eat.  I'd been using Herdoz, but this is MUCH better.  For one thing, this has more texture- it's not as liquid-y as Herdoz.  I love the little chunks of garlic and green chiles in this, and the tomatillos just sing.  It has potent, fresh, spicy flavor that's well-rounded and yet not so hot that you're dying for bread and water.  I love that this is such a big jar, too, as I go through this product very fast.  It is incredibly hard to get good green salsa in my area (and I don't like most red salsas), so I'm glad that Amazon carries this.  With Prime, it's a very reasonable cost for such a large jar of this wonderful stuff.  Try it on breakfast burritos, fajitas, scrambled eggs- you won't be sorry!

The crackers, beef stick, fruit medley and cinnamon nuts are all good. I bought a package of six boxes, though, and while all the packages were fresh (based on their expiration date) the cheese had this little bit of watery liquid in the container. This was true of every single box. All of the other items tasted very fresh. I bought this in wintertime, it was kept in a dry and dark pantry at all times and so I must conclude that it is simply not a great cheese product. I did try to eat it once and the flavor was plastic-y and not at all appealing. Perhaps this won't be everyone's experience, but I felt I needed to alert people via this review. I personally love the GoPicnic concept, so I'm not knocking the brand- the hummus one is my favorite in the line. But these are too expensive to have even one dud item in the box. I prefer to eat about 15-20 grams of protein at lunch and this is well below that amount, so I didn't find it as filling as the hummus variety over the long haul.

My Background As A Student of German (which I'm sharing so that you'll know if you need what I needed from this book): I'm technically a third-year student of the German language, having taken one year in middle school and two semesters of it in high school. I'm now in my first year of German as a college student. However, my years of German in secondary school were taken many moons ago, and I fully acknowledge that I was a less-than-stellar student when I was a teenager. There were no Internet resources available back in those days, either. I now consider myself a truly self-motivated and dedicated student, as I love the language and culture of Germany, and possess a strong desire to live and work in the country itself someday.
