What's not to love? 5 batteries for the price of one!Came in strong and still going on!
Gag gift for a friend - I have no idea if this is anything worth considering.
Bought as a gift for wedding. I have no idea if this thing works or not, but from what I hear, it can be fun.

Terrific & reliable, but be careful. 60 watts is a lot of power & heat for small device soldering jobs.If you are good, or even not-so and you can do fast jobs without overheating components or if you require a hotter pencil-type soldering implement, this one is very good.Sturdy with a firm and comfortable grip.With proper care and good technique it should last a long time.

Simple - Accurate & Very Affordable!Nice modern design with a super-strong tempered glass platform. Sleek with a blue lit digital readout.Offers either Kilograms or Pounds readout.Auto on function wait for  a still settling and goes "steady" with a fairly accurate readout that stays illuminated for 8-10 seconds before going back into auto-shut off mode.Nice low price for a basic scale for frugal people who only need weight measurement.There are other models higher priced for recording health activities, past weigh, last weight, body fat, etc., but I have no use for those features and the terrific price from a reputable vendor makes it a done deal!Make sure you are on a LEVEL, HARD and FLAT surface.Look straight ahead and keep still until the measuring process completes (approx. 3-5 seconds.)You can step off the scale and the measurement with remain illuminated for about 8-10 seconds allowing you to view it without looking down during the measuring mode.Looking for a basic, reliable simple scale with no use for exotic features and modes?BUY THIS ONE!Gimme a thumbs up, will ya? - Thanks!

I wouldn't recommend using these for anything "mission critical" but as an alternative to buying an expensive cable with right-angle jack connectors, this is a good solution.So far they seem to work well, even though the craftsmanship looks "basic."I use them for my guitar pedalboard effects that are closely spaced as well as, using right-angle plugs will help prevent idiots from stepping on the cables jacks that are "sticking out" from your pedalboard.

I got this for a Christmas stocking stuffer.My girlfriend loves it.She says it has all the sizes she needs and the handle are comfortable to grip.She also said she can go faster with these with less pain. lol.

Much Better Than Expected!Larger dial than the average cheap clip-on tuner.Colorful display with easy to read dial.Fully Chromatic or Guitar, Violin, Ukulele, Banjo, Mandolin modes.Comes with included battery but not installed until first use. (good.)Powered by one small watch-button type battery.Accurate enough for an inexpensive quick grabber travel or in the case tuner.I was impressed enough to write this review.Hope this helps.

I am a certified CompTIA A+ PC Expert Technician & Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE).This device "gets confused" quite easily and very often.I was trying to use it as a Start/Stop button for Media Player and it continuously would "freak out" causing weird anomalies.Sometimes it would work normal, but most times it would act as if it was repeatedly being pressed very fast.I tried the normal procedures for troubleshooting, application setup, reinstall, reboot, yaddaya, yaddaya.It might work well for other uses and the software application makes it easy to program automatic clicks, letters, strings of characters, phrases, sentences, or X/Y axis location, for various tasks.If I wasn't curious to have something like this on hand for repetitive or automated tasks, I would return it immediately, but as a Guru my personality forces me to keep it and tinker even though I could just copy the software & possibly improve the footswitch. ;-)For the price it really should have a metal housing.Amazon also sells this model as an "Add On" item, so I suggest ordering it from Amazon so if you decide to return it for a refund, it will be a quick & painless transaction.

I love it for the inexpensive price, fast speed & quality name brand.9.14 MBps Average Speed - Great Value!I have a moderate PC, nothing fancy with older SATA drives.When transferring a 1 GB file I clocked an average transfer WRITE speed well over 9 MBps.Most USB drives in this price range only average between 4-5 MBps.Average 3-5 year warranty. Great value again.I thought that was enough reason to leave positive feedback!

Worth it for the moneyI found this to be a good deal.A little slow by modern standards but well suited for my frugal means!I have had good results in the past with Kingston brands. They all seem to eventually fail, break or malfunction and Kingston has always outlasted the other brands for a similar price.

I guess you can't complain about owning one of the finest guitars ever created.I too, have owned this guitar for about a year and a half.Upon the first strum I knew that my overly-expensive Takamine Santa Fe was going on eBay immediately.The tone is astounding compared to most other guitars.Nice evenly balanced warmth and clarity.You can "bang one out" or delicately pick & strum a tender melody or tune.The included Fishman pickup system that I received with mine is different from the other review.There is not a built-in tuner on my model.Gibson frequently experiments with various different on-board electronics and uses different formats even on the same guitars.The Fishman Electronic Pickup System on my SDLX is not implanted inside a routed-out hole in the body of this beautiful instrument, rather, they installed a system that is mounted directed above the inside soundhole. You can adjust the settings with your fingertip.There is a good side and a bad side.First the good side:This allows for your guitar to NOT have a hole in the body and possibly create more resonance. I like this. It also has a "modeling feature" that mimics the settings of a studio mic'd guitar. I think this is cool but have found to like the "straight pickup" setting which does not alter tone using modeling circuits...just straight pickup.The bad side:There is no built-in tuner.You cannot pop in a soundhole damper plug/ring to help reduce feedback because the "hardware" that is mounted inside the soundhole prevents a damper from fitting snug.The battery is mounted inside the guitar, in a little Velcro bag and makes changing it a cumbersome task unless you happen to be changing all the strings at once, which I rarely due, so I look forward to having "string marks" dug into the back of my hand when I do change the battery.One weird thing happened:When it arrived there was an obvious inconsistency on the higher strings. The sound would "drop out" and was noticeably lower in volume.When I called Gibson (and they answered immediately) I was told to get a "spark plug socket" and a screwdriver. Place the edge of the socket on the bridge and "sharply tap" it down making sure it was well-seated. I was shocked and scared being asked to whack on my several thousand dollar guitar, but the guy stayed with me on the phone and walked me through it...WHALLAH! - The sound was perfect and I couldn't be happier.The inlays, appointments, wood binding is just gaudy enough to be cool and not overdone. It has a dark mystique to it and I love the extra detailing and craftsmanship. After a lifetime of playing music full-time I definitely deserve this guitar. That was the only criteria in my justification. You only live once and this guitar is a dream-come-true for me.The neck is just wide enough to do some nice fingerstyle playing without muting or dampening adjacent strings which is easy to do with guitars that initially seem easier to play with their skinny necks, but find out later down the road that you will actually need the width to accomplish certain riffs, picking and chording.Once my hand got away from the Takamine trip and used to the slightly wider Gibson neck, I found myself playing much cleaner and more articulate...and sounding ten times better.Yes the Takamine sounds nice when plugged into an amp, same as the Gibson, but when you hear them unplugged, purely acoustic side-by-side there is absolutely nothing to compare beyond that point. The expensive Takamine sounds like a cheap toy compared to the warmth, big tone and volume of the Songwriter Deluxe. The same situation occurs when compared to the Sigma Cutaway acoustic....just sounds like cheap junk when put side-by-side. I highly urge you to do this when purchasing a guitar. Just because your favorite artist plays "X Brand" - doesn't mean that guitar is the best, most desirable, or even right for you.Disclosure: I have been "married" to Gibson for over 30 years -lol.I knew that I wanted a Gibson. I believe in the company even though they are becoming more compromising as the years roll on.Yes, the Custom Shop "ain't what it used to be" and Yes, you MUST have your guitar professionally setup to suit your style and needs. If not you may not be getting the most out of your professional expensive guitar.The action is lower than most from the factory, but you may find it a little high or a little low depending on what you like or are accustomed to. This is a given with all guitars. They crank them out at the factory, and you tweak them in at the shop. Everybody has different likes & needs when it comes to their personal setup and tastes. The higher the strings, the louder and more breathable it is, the lower the action, the easier to play but may seem more "compressed" and weaker in volume. It's all a "trade-off" and you have to decide where to demarcate the balance. Sometimes I wish my action was a little higher, then other times I am so glad it's not!I also did some research on a killer acoustic guitar amp.My conclusion, for the money PLUS under one thousand dollars price tag, goes to the SWR California Blonde II amp.It has plenty of power and many great tone features. I couldn't be happier, and when playing live I use a very slight amount of compression (Boss Compressor Pedal) and it smooths everything out perfectly without sacrificing tone or dynamics...in other words, Yes, it makes me sound like I can play better than I actually do! A compressor will even out the volume and dynamics so that strings & notes that are weak are brought out, and ones that are way too dominant can be tamed a bit.A full-sized professional guitar with all the bells and whistles any great craftsman would be proud to build complete with a Gibson Custom Shop logo!The photo does not show but there is a fantastic inlay seam running down the length on the back side of the guitar made of gold, red and jade green using a southwest motif.There is a nice wood bound seam at the end of the guitar bottom. (where you plug in and attach strap.)There is NOT a strap button on the neck or neck butt joint. You will need to tie a strap to the headstock or install a strap button, and I would ask Gibson where they suggest and how before doing anything irreversible.I am glad they didn't use the "Mustache type" saddle bridge, I like the traditional one much better!One more note:The newer models no longer use the ebony fingerboard. They are using the rosewood. I think this is probably for the best as it seems to be a little warmer than the hard snap of an ebony fingerboard. This guitar is bright and ringy as well as warm and full. Not too much bass overtones dominating the overall tone, but a well-balanced expression and three times as loud compared to most Takamine's and other imports.Buy this guitar if it is still being made!(You deserve it and remember: You only live once!)Don't forget to keep track of humidity (or lack of) with a good guitar case hygrometer & humidifier for dry climates or the winter months. Don't worry, it comes with a killer hardshell Gibson Custom Shop case with plush velour lining.

Large Sized - Not That Good For "Clips"I was thinking that these were the smaller size models that I normally use for clips.Think of these to be used more for tools than as a smoking accessory.Other than that they are big and strong and should work well for most other uses.

Punchy & Clear - High Power CapableThese might even be a wee bit too tight, but for the price I am happy with them.It takes a noticeable amount of power before these really start to kick in, so at lower volumes you will need to adjust your EQ/Tone settings for more bass. As you increase the volume you can then start to reduce the amount of low end bass tones for a bright & clear punchy sound that doesn't go into "flop" or mud.Heavy in weight, large magnet, strong cone with a foam rubber outer edge for improved bass and low end response.If your system isn't going to be driven very hard or if your system is not very powerful. (less than 60 watts) you may want to get a lower power rated speaker for a better match and efficiency.This is a bass speaker and not a full range replacement.

Great Price - Nice FeaturesVery quiet and made well.Cool black aesthetics with a generous supply of standard connectors that are well wrapped & shielded.Large heat exhaust fan is quiet and very efficient.600 watts should be plenty for just about most every PC system.

My Girlfriend Loves It!She says it does several different things & functions that she finds to be quite a time-saver as she loves to cook and bake.Looks to be an easy clean up and storage.If she's happy...I'm happy.

Nice and inexpensive.Quiet and enough power for a basic system.Standard plugs and connectors.Arrived fast and well packed.Should work well for most replacement PC power supplies.If you have some high end video cards that require extra power, several internal hard drives & Optical drives, you may want to get a 600 watt power supply.
Medicine arrived timely with a expiration date of less than 4 months.This tells me it is old product and that the half life of the medicine and its effectiveness is diminishing.

I bought this for an Epiphone USA Map Guitar.I have uploaded photos of all views for this case.Overall Length: (closed) 49.25"Case Thickness: (closed) 5" (5.5" with feet from floor to top)Inside Total Length: 47"- 48" (stuffed)Body Cavity Length: 23"Body Cavity Width: 15"-16"Neck Rest: 1.5" wide / Neck Cradle CenteredTop Headstock Area Length: 12"- 12.5"Top Headstock Area Width: 15" - 16"Inside Compartment Length: 8.5"Inside Compartment Width: 15" -16"CASE IS A BIT HEAVY.It probably weighs more than the guitar inside.Case is sturdy when closed and latched.The walls seem to be a thick cardboard core and slightly bendable, but standard in quality construction for a case this large at this price.Not too many choices out there if you are looking for a case with these dimensions.Personally I don't mind an overly large and heavy case but I would be cautious about it getting beaten up if you are on the road or moving gear frequently. Your guitar will be well protected, but the case might get beat up if care isn't taken.Stitching & binding seems to be of the same general quality.Really nothing special about this case except that most likely any guitar will fit inside. Most Bass guitars included. Check the listed dimensions.Plenty of room inside the accessory compartment as well as at the top up by the headstock for just about anything, and a lot of it. lol.There are a couple of factory flaws with some glue marks, a couple scuffs and a small dent probably from packing & shipping.Overall I am satisfied with this stock Epiphone case.Very well padded.1" x 10" x 44" extra padding for neck on the upper inside lid of the case.Nice quality plush lining - Made in China.Standard quality hardware, hinges, handle, feet, etc. - Nothing special.It closes, latches and performs exactly as expected.Only one key for the lock is included inside the case...somewhere. lol.Check the photos for close ups!amazon(DOT)com/gp/customer-media/product-gallery/B003NAW8MC/ref=cm_cmu_up_thanks_hdrHope this helps!

Installing the battery1. Locate the small screw for the battery cover plate on the back of the unit2. Using a small Phillips head screwdriver, rotate the small screw counter clockwise.3. Remove the plate.4. Insert the two AA batteries with the correct polarity.5. Reattach battery cover plate, insert screw and turn clockwise to tighten.Testing cables1. Move the On switch to Cable Tester.2. To test pins 1-3, you may adjust the Switch 1-3 selector to SW1. For cables with more than three pins, you may adjust the selector to SW2 for pins 4-6 and SW3 for pins 7-8.3. Insert one end of the cable into one of the various inputs.4. Insert the other end of the cable into one of the various outputs.5. If the Grounded Shield LED lights up, this indicates that the XLR out shield has been connected to pin1/sleeve.6. Once the cable has been connected to both an input and output, the LED grid will light up to show which pins are connected.7. Each LED shows which input pins are connected to each output pin. The Input pins are represented vertically while the output pins are represented horizontally. Ex. The LED in the top right hand corner shows that Pin1/Sleeve on the input is going to Pin1/Sleeve on the output side.8. For cables with more than three pins, you may adjust the Switch 1-3 selec tor to SW2 for pins 4-6 and SW3 for pins 7-8. 3Intermittent ConnectionsTo test for broken connections1. While in test mode with a cable plugged into both an In and Out, press the reset button to clear the Intermittent LEDs.2. Next, move the suspected cable end around vigorously while plugged in.3. If there are any shorted, loose, or broken connections, one of the Intermit- tent LEDs will light up showing where the break is taking place.4. Press Reset to clear the LEDs to continue or try again.Installed Cable ModeTo test the integrity of a fixed cable or one in which both ends are unable to beconnected.1. To enter Installed Cable Mode, Press and hold the Reset button while Switching from off to Cable Tester. The On LED light will on and off to indicate that you are in Installed Cable Tester Mode.2. Insert a cable into the one of the outputs.3. The LED grid will now show any short circuits, if any by indicating which out pins are connected. If there are no LEDs lit, then there are not short circuits in the cable.To test for continuity in Installed Cable Mode1. With the Installed cable plugged into the output of the cable tester, attach a shorting jack to the other end of the cable, or connect the ends.2. If the integrity of the cable is intact, the short circuit should show up on the cable tester. If it does not, then there is a break in the cable.4Test Tone Mode1. To send out a test tone, select Test Tone Mode.2. Plug the cable into one of the Cable Outs.3. Press the Reset button to toggle between a 1kHz and 440Hz tone.4. You can adjust the signal strength to the appropriate level for testing by adjusting the Test Tone Level selector between -50 (Mic level), -10dBV (Consumer Line Level), and +4dBu (Pro Line Level).Phantom Power Detection While in Test Tone mode, pin2/Tip and Pin3/Ring LEDs will light up if Phantom Power DC voltage of approximately 9V+ is detected.

#1 Best Camera AUDIO Recorder on the Market for the Price!Zoom's by-line used to be:"A little bit of video and a whole lot of audio"The reason you buy this recorder is you only have 100 bucks and you want killer audio recordings to accompany your average videos.Believe me, an average video with great sound is much better than a great video with lousy sound.For one to get both, you will have to shell out a lot more money or get fancy with various equipment. This is a handy, quick to grab camera that records audio very well.You can hold this up to a savage drummer punishing a crash cymbal with near perfect clarity. The bass and subs come through most excellent. Great for concerts, loud events and people with little money.NOTE:Not convenient for editing the video files without using third-party software applications like Adobe Premier, Sony Vegas, ProShow, etc. Many times I find myself using something like Xilisoft Video Converter to convert them into *.AVI files which are much easier to work with in Windows apps. The good news is nowadays, there are many more options for editing and working with *.MOV video files than just a few years ago.This unit records *.MOV file types.*.MOV files are difficult to work with for a novice in Windows.I suggest NEVER using the included "Handyshare" application. It is total junk, and will only frustrate you.If you record and cannot see video or hear no sound:(how is that possible...to "hear no sound."?? -lol.)...but I digress:First try different settings on the Zoom camera.Windows does not natively recognize every video & audio codec.Windows must be updated to recognize all the different types of audio & video formats, just like when Windows 95/98 first came out, it didn't recognize what an MP3 file was, so you had to use a third-party application like WinAmp or RealPlayer to play the music file. SAME THING TODAY.I suggest Googling "K-Lite codecs" and download the free updated drivers for Windows.This will also update Windows to understand many different, old & new, file types.Once you install a "codec pack" (codec means "compression-decompression") Windows will most likely recognize the files and play them correctly.If you have the Zoom camera set to high fidelity PCM audio, try setting it to 320kbps AAC audio. This is a slightly compressed form of hi-fi audio that Windows understands and recognizes.I can tell you that Windows 7 with the updated K-Lite codecs play the files just fine on all settings.HDMI connected to a TV: No Sound?If you connect this camera to a TV using the HDMI output, you need to go into the settings Menu on the Zoom camera under the INPUT category and select Output Monitor ON. You also have to use the correct/proper HDMI cable. Some of the cheaper ones are crap. (some of the expensive ones do not work either!)Also you need to make sure that you have not inadvertently turned down the volume. This is easy to do until you get used to the little 4-way circular control on the unit. I have a few times tried zooming in and out only to find that I was just moving the volume level and not the digital zoom without realizing it. Zoom is left & right and volume is top & bottom (up & down)using the 4-way control on the back.I also know that some computers can't "keep up" with the large video files so easily with the *.MOV format.I recorded a 1920x1080 video using the highest audio settings (96KHz/24-bit) and when I played it back on the PC, the audio was out of sync. - When I converted it to an AVI file type, it played perfectly in sync with sharp video. I hate *.MOV files, but I LOVE THIS CAMERA!Most people buy this for recording bands and concerts because of the great audio.If you are a novice, average user and you have no special needs for clear audio at loud volumes, you may want to buy a cheap regular camera that records videos...like your mobile phone.If you are in a band, or just a drummer who hangs around musicians...this is the camera for you! (lol)Remember: A little bit of video and a WHOLE LOT OF AUDIO.I have owned and used the older Zoom Q3 (640x480) Handy Recorder for a couple years and have waited for the price to drop on the HD version. It has and I am a proud and happy owner.The audio is just about the same, but the full size HD video is a nice plus, even though it's not great video with many options, it is significantly larger, clearer & better than the older version.If you have the MIC gain setting to Manual, be careful not to bump or move the little thumb wheel control on the side of the camera when recording unless otherwise necessary. The new version only has Auto, Low & High MIC settings, so be glad you can manually control the MIC on this model, even though it may be inadvertently moved during recording.The older (and newer) models do not allow to manually adjust the MIC input gain level, and what would happen is when set to Auto, a loud sound would lower the gain automatically to the point where only loud sounds would be audible. Example: A drummer plays a loud beat, stops and then talks to the camera. Because the Auto setting(s) have lowered the level greatly, you cannot hear him talk. This problem was overcome by using the manual thumb wheel control on the side. I like it!Yes, it eats batteries like you wouldn't believe!I ordered some Tenergy Premium 2500mAh rechargeable batteries. A fresh pair of them lasted for almost 3 hours in full HD and hi-fi audio mode. Make sure the camera settings are set to "Ni-Cad" when using rechargeable batteries.Easy Power Adapter:Buy a cheap one dollar USB wall socket charger and hook up a USB cable to the unit after turning it on.You can even take out the batteries once it has powered up.Zoom also makes a power adapter you can buy that does the same thing.I have seen killer video recordings made with iPads and iPhones, but the audio was always terrible. This in turn made the whole video terrible. The Zoom camera takes average video and turns it into a killer recording worth watching, and hardly ever annoying when viewing loud & live events. I know of no other device that does this, and does it well, for under one hundred dollars.Yes, I am bummed out that the newer models do not have a metal camera mount insert like the older ones. Fragile plastic threads are the new design so be careful and gentle.The jury is still out on the "video aspect ratio."When the zoom is fully wide, it still seems a little "zoomed in".I think this might be a good thing in the long run. Most times you are standing at a distance and the extra "zoomed in ratio" will most likely be appreciated more times than not. This model has a 4x digital zoom function. It works "okay."I have many times found myself having to use the "zoomed in max" to get "close enough" from where I was standing.If you are very close to your subject, this might be compromising, such as close range in a small space.The "view monitor screen" is very small and sometimes hard to see.When you are playing video back on the camera you can make the video bigger by holding down the PLAY button and it will switch to a larger Landscape view, and you turn the camera sideways to view it.You cannot do this in record mode.While in record mode, the screen displays the video and audio settings as well as the MIC setting. This helps.I highly recommend getting a tripod or what I use, a "Microphone Stand Adapter" to hold this while video recording.I also urge you to get a protective case.Smaller, lighter and "plasticker" than before, but hey, it's smaller & lighter!(just be careful with it.)You will probably want to buy a much larger memory card. I use a 32GB card with a speed rating of 10. Zoom advises using a speed rating of "6" or higher.The 2GB card that comes with it will provide about 15 minutes of full HD video and Hi-Fi Audio.If you select lower settings, you can get more "time" but may sacrifice some video quality...then again, you may never really notice it whatsoever. This is not a twenty-thousand dollar television camera.One more thing: Update the firmware on the camera.Mine came with version 1.0 - The newest version on the Zoom website is 1.2I found it by Googling "Q2 HD camera software update" - once again, I only installed the FIRMWARE upgrade. I did not update or use the webcam driver or HandyShare "crapplication." (I just invented that word...street creds & props accordingly.)You will need to download and install the Firmware using 32-bit or 64-bit version for Windows.(see the website)So in recap:The reason you buy this is because you want to easily video record loud events that generally distort most cameras in this price range.You are not expecting great video for this price range, but do expect great audio with average HD video!If you want to "work" with these video files, you will need to use third-party applications, editor software, converting software, etc.(You will probably learn a bit about *.MOV files and video processes.)Use the USB port for unlimited power from a wall socket.Facebook may not recognize all audio/video types, but YouTube does.If you ever have a "problem" try uploading it to YouTube, and then download it back from YouTube after they do their conversion processing...for you! This works for virtually all video files.Happy to help!

I am not reviewing this for TV or even high quality video applications.The main reason I got this TV is to use as a PC/Computer monitor.I needed a larger screen but did not want to shell out the big bucks for an expensive monitor made for PC or computers.This TV works great, but keep in mind I am not using it for high quality video editing or photo applications, though I edit videos and photos just fine as a "regular user."I am sure this TV is not great by any standards except for price.If you need a larger screen, have trouble seeing small text, etc., buy this and try it out.I always get the extra warranty just as a precaution and peace of mind.I had trouble at first when using with a KVM switch (hooks two computers up to one keyboard, monitor & mouse) as the switch would not support all modes. When connected directly to the PC video card it works great!The USB port only seems to recognize JPG photo files and nothing else. I tried AVI, WMV, MOV, BMP, PNG, FLV, MKV...none of those files were even recognized and did not show up in the menu.The speakers are kind of crappy but so are the ones on my new and slightly expensive 47" LG - normal for nowadays.It stands up without the included stand, but I suggest using the stand for full support.Nice to see that it uses LED lighting. My old monitor went out because the old mercury fluorescent lights burned out.3 HDMI ports was also a nice surprise.Audio INPUT is through using the 1/8" (3.5mm) headphone jack.Audio OUTPUT has the standard two RCA Red & White connectors.Digital Audio Output SP/DIF RCA connector.VGA 15 pin for PC/Computer video.Although it is not full 1080p, the 720p size is just fine for my needs and price range.It is so much nicer to see things larger!I am not a gamer, but again, for the price, you get a pretty good & large TV/monitor.CON: If it cannot find a channel through the "scan for channels" function, you cannot select a channel unless it can find it first.There is a way to fine tune the advanced options and adjustments, but using the controls available I can get a great picture.The text is fairly easy to read, but the greys seem a little green when black text is not as bold. Not quite as sharp as a dedicated PC monitor, but works well enough for older eyes, and did I mention the nice larger screen? -lol.It has a energy saving mode that will shut itself off within a couple of minutes if there is no signal present, so that works well with the PC screensaver and/or power off modes. It automatically senses a signal and turns itself back on. (energy mode.)It takes about 7-8 seconds to "boot up" maybe not as fast as others, but "geez, eight seconds ain't fast enough?"Stand is cheap plastic and fairly sturdy if not violently abused.(Sure would have been nice to get this for the ninety-eight dollar black Friday price.)I paid full price, plus the extra warranty and am quite happy.If there are any dead pixels, splotchy screens, dark, etc., send it back until you get a good one.This was the first one I was sent and it's a keeper.*** NOTE: Nov. 2015 Update - It has been over one year and 7 months.. TV is still working perfectly!Hope this helps!

Remember kids:When replacing your Power Output Tubes (such as these) it may be best to have your amp biased/checked for proper plate voltage settings by a qualified service technician!If the settings are too hot, it may sound great but the life of your tubes will be much shorter.Too low and your sound may be brittle or sterile lacking the balls and oomph you like so well.I have 9 Fender Pro Tube amps and have played full time for over 27 years.When choosing between 6L6's and EL34's I tend to go for the 6L6's sound that has a more "American" sounding bottom end, not quite as "woody" as the English overdriven tube sound. The bottom end sounds clearer and more distinct with 6L6's, but there is also a lot to be said about the EL34's, too!Similar to Dell, Gateway, HP, Compaq, etc. not making computers, JJ's does not manufacture tubes, but rather they test and rate them , eventually pairing like kinds within similar tolerances and voltages. This is critical if you have an amp that uses two of these. This will ensure that both sides of the amp output stage are as equal and balanced as possible before any biasing or adjustments.The "burnt silver/black" inside the tube is called the "getter" which is a chemical that is burnt upon first initial firing and burns up any leftover oxygen or air inside the vacuum tube.Very nice price - lower than most other places online!Hope this helps!

Tired of cracking your knobs when simply trying to pull them off?Get this knob puller and end your headaches forever.This thing is so cool, you will actually want to carry it around in your pocket looking for knobs to pull.If you don't watch out, people will start crying out, "Oh look, here comes the mad hob-knobbler!"It got so bad I was hanging around guitar shops, stopping people as they would walk by, coaxing them into the alley and asking them if they had any knobs that needed pulling, ...and this is where all the trouble started.A simple little .79 cent gadget costing twelve dollars that you'll be more than happy to pay for.Hope this helps!

If you are ordering these to replace one or two of your Gibson Speed knobs, you will want to replace all four because they are not identical to Gibson's.In all fairness, these could possibly be BETTER than Gibson's stock, seem to be made with a more solid underside, but the numbers are a little bit smaller.This is the only reason I gave them four stars.Fit perfectly on CTS potentiometers and if you replace all four of them, nobody except you will know! -lol.All four of mine were fine with no apparent flaws or defects, as opposed to other reviews.If you get these and they aren't perfect...send them back until you get a perfect set! It's free!Hope this helps...not much else to say!

Best all-around Gibson P.A.F. pickup.The "Plus" is a little hotter (8.53 K Ohms) compared to the regular '57 Classic @ 7.57 K Ohms.Most blokes use this for their bridge pickup because it has a little more output, but I might try one on the neck position some day when I have money to burn.If you like that bee-buzzing compressed metal sound...don't buy these pickups.If you like your guitar to breathe, react harmonically full with balls, along with a high degree of touch sensitivity...buy these now!Remember kids, the style of music you play is not dependent upon the tone of any instrument.The price was way lower than Musician's Friend, Sweetwater, Zzounds, Sam Ash, Music123, Guitar Center. In fact it was 30 to 50 dollars less than the major online music retailers.I was not impressed, and in fact, rather disappointed with the shipping packaging.I have purchased quite a few of these and several times they arrived in an un-padded FedEX or USPS-type large envelope. I feel for the price, and what these are, they should take much more care in shipping...but they did survive the brutal treatment by the gorillas in brown.Bottom Line: For tonal maturity these can't be beat!Hope this helps!

Exactly what I needed...a big gob of both AA & AAA rechargeable batteries with an 8-bay charging station unit!I have used  four Tenergy 9V batteries (the 250mAh blue ones) every week for the last two years and they keep on going strong so I know the brand is reliable and reputable as of this review date -lol.These batteries work great and provide good strength where normal alkaline batteries are needed.I like the charging station and the fact that you can charge just one or all of them at the same time. Most other chargers use two batteries at once to charge and will not work unless you have two in it.There are individual charging lights at each battery slot.Great price, nice package deal. I ordered these parts because everything was available in one package deal!Even though they are not Prime Shipping, it arrived super fast within two days well protected in a box.The CTS pots are well-known to have good reviews on quality, but let me add my take:The CTS pots seem a little too "touchy" and are very quick to react with just a small turn of the knob.Gibson pots have a slower slope to them and require them to be turned more to get the same type of response.Once you get the idea of how quickly they change with a smaller turn, they're not too bad, though I find myself wishing that they had more "travel" to them. The range I use seems like I barely need to turn it, which would require me to pay a little more attention when playing live on the fly, and possibly over-crank the knob because I play several different guitars.If you mainly play one guitar, getting used to it poses no problem once you get your "habits" memorized.With that said, these are great if you want to use them to do volume swells, and if you were overly erratic, you could use the tone knob as a pseudo-wah effect -lol!There are tabs on each side of the front casing (where the shaft protrudes) that are crimped and hold the casing together, BUT, there are also tabs that are bent/crimped down that are used to lock & hold the pot, preventing it from turning. If you have a guitar that has a plate inside the cavity for mounting parts to (Les Paul Custom, Etc.) then you must first BEND THESE TABS UP. Be careful to bend the correct tabs straight up, and not the ones that hold the unit together.The Russian "paper-in-oil" capacitors sound better than a shirtless Vladimir Putin wrestling a bear!Be mindful. These capacitors are much larger than you think and may require a little forethought as to leaving enough wire on the ends to allow them to be bent up and out of the way...if need be.Over a very long time (10-20 years) these capacitors will probably dry out and need replacing, which after gutting your electronics and replacing everything, will seem like a breeze! -lol. The only way to make sure is to check them with a multi-tester.A large part of the decision to get this set was due to the CTS spec-tolerant potentiometers.Regular CTS stock 500K pots may have a larger than 10% variance in value compared to their rating.The 525K pots are tested, sorted and verified to be within their actual rating.The pots turn and feel almost identical to the average Gibson volume or tone knob.Smooth but not loose. Solid and steady but not stiff. Completely noiseless.The CTS pots have grease inside them for lubrication and use a quality bronze shaft.The cheapo ones (and anything cheap from China) have no lubricating grease and use a steel or pot metal shaft.The sweeping contact medium is a separate wafer piece that is adhered to the base.The cheapo's have the medium "painted on" and most times it does not travel as far.Save your old nuts from the top of the guitar front!Although they provide a flat washer, a lock washer and two hex nuts, you may need to use both hex nuts- one to mount inside, one to adjust the height, -leaving one needed for securing it on the top (under the knob).It would have been good for them to include one more hex nut for each pot...but no biggie!I would definitely order this again and recommend this to anybody replacing parts or making upgrades!Hope this helps!

Itdoesn't get very loud, but loud enough for normal viewing.Standard Remote Quick Buttons:******************************3D ModeApps SelectionVideo Pcture Size (Ratio)Input SelectMuteAV Modes (Off/Cinema/Game)SettingsLast ChannelFavorite ChannelsChannel ListInfo (program, channel, time, video format, etc.)Smart TV MenuOnce you get used to the remote, you can get around very quickly.ACCESSORIES:************4 Pairs of 3D Polarizing Glasses (no batteries or wires, inexpensive, too!)LG USB Video Camera ($99.00) (Not Included)Logitech K400r USB Wireless Keyboard (Not Included)Regular USB cameras aren't recognized and the LG camera is a bit pricey!The Logitech wireless keyboard works great, and in a few cases can save a little timeand frustration when entering in forms, email, web addresses, etc, but some functionsdo not allow the use of the keyboard and force you to use the remote. Most times youcan use the keyboard, but in all honesty, you really don't need it unless you plan ondoing a lot of typing. For regular TV watching, the included remote is just as fast asthe keyboard and sometimes easier.The Good:*********Nice wide format with small bezel frame. Old Samsung was gawdy & obtrusive.When adjusted/tweaked in advanced mode, the colors are rich & the blacks are amazing.The viewing angle is truly amazing!I literally stood as far & wide to each side as I could and it was still very muchclear and quite easy to watch. I was blown away.Very lightweight and easy to lift or move.Shipping Carton is not overly large and moderately sturdy. (51" x 30" x 8")TV powers up and plays within a few seconds.The TV reception using a regular antenna (digital or analog) works quite well!PC or Laptop display using HDMI cable is sharp and clear.The standard remote control is just fine and does everything you need within a fewclicks.If you have a fast Internet connection (or one that isn't shared or simultaneously inuse by others downloading/uploading files, playing online games, or watching streamingvideo), -The Internet Video & functions work well!98% of the time the videos are sharp, clear, smooth without any buffering orstuttering.Be aware that when watching HD video streaming from the Internet, it can use a lot ofbandwidth and GB's in data usage. L/R flip, Auto,Manual, etc.Start with a subtle effect level to avoid any eye strain, headaches or nausea.There is a dual game mode that when two players are playing a game and using a splitscreen, the TV can make it so each person sees their own screen in Full Screen!The Bad:*********If your Internet is "lagging", maybe because the website is busy, or your providersucks, or teenager jumped online, your TV may freeze temporarily until it resumes agood data connection again. During these rare moments I find myself just turning offthe TV to 'get back to it' more quickly than maybe waiting around for the Internet to"flow" again. Sometimes this happens when a YouTube video is slow. Usually it is notthe TV's fault.Did I mention the overpriced specialized LG camera was $99.00...??? -lol.I had to perform three software updates to get the current version. Not bad.You have to create an account on the TV and register it online with LG using the TV,as well as agree to some garbage where they will collect "some usage data". I didnotice an option to 'not allow them to send file info & personal info/data' & suchback to their servers. Who knows what really goes on with any Smart TV data.???The overall TV volume is lower than expected.When using the headphone audio out, the internal TV speakers are bypassed and cut off. You can use one or the other, but not both.There are no settings to adjust the video quality when using the YouTube app. It willtry to stream the highest quality, whether or not you want it to. If network is slow,it will look like a bad YT video. -lol.No PC/Computer VGA port.Slight "soap opera" effect. (not too bad & common on low/med priced TV's.)Cinema & Game video modes do little to help. It also depends on the movie or file.There is no adjustment to force it into a 60Hz refresh rate mode.Factory Settings Need Changing:There is a review here that gives a detailed list of advanced settings in "ExpertMode" (after updating) that is quite remarkable. Half of the settings I have no ideawhat they mean or do, but I followed it through and it looks wonderful!When navigating to the LG Smart Menu, there is an annoying short video that loops over and over until you make a selection, and of course, you can't turn off this annoying feature.It has normal motion & nominal blur, comparable to most 120Hz refresh rate TV's. Notbad, not great.SMART TV Features:Shopping, weather,YouTube, Amazon, Pandora, Skype, Web Browser, Games, etc.The Web Browser works really well.I can get to most places and most video works 98% of the time.Overall after extensive research and hair-pulling... I am happy with this TV.Low energy long lasting LED back-lighting technology uses less electricity, less heat,brighter light and another good thing is this is a rear-lit TV. From my research theyare looked on with more approval than the edge-lit LED TV's.If there are any issues regarding this TV or any Service Problems, hassles, etc., I will be sure to update my review!Thank you for investing a rather sizable chunk of your time.I now return you to your previous life.Hope this helps!

Don't make the mistake I did!This cable is used for specialized video cards that send digital information to the RGB channels.This will not work on a regular PC VGA Video Output. Your video card needs to have the capability to send out the video information. If your PC or Video can do this, you may have to do further configuration or setup the video output for this to work as well.Please make sure your PC or Video can do this, or else the chances that this will work for you are very slim to none.With that said, I am sure this is an excellent cable, very thick and well made.Hope this helps!

Somebody made themselves a nice little niche for this market.These are uncommon bulbs in most places you go to buy light bulbs.Funny how you can get four 4,7, or 40 watt bulbs for a dollar.Don't use the 40-watt bulbs...they get the lava lamp too hot and cause the wax to become dormant.(It doesn't hurt the lava/wax, but a lower wattage, lower temperature bulb is how it is designed to function properly.)All kidding aside, these bulbs work just fine in the smaller sized lava lamps.I will leave me lava lamp on continuously and if I remember to come back and update this review when a bulb blows - lol.Hope this helps!

Needed to get a cable for my girlfriend's Kindle to go to the TV.WOW! - When this rather inexpensive cable arrived it was well made and well packaged! I was surprised.The molded ends, strain relief and good quality connectors made me smile!Hope this helps!

I gave this five stars because my girlfriend loves it!Easy to use and clean.Works well.Graduated container begins at around 1 cup mark.She said there is a little drip to it, but once she got the hang of it she was good to go!Nice little base keeps it "off the counter" or plate.Simple, easy & foolproof design.Hope this helps!

When I got this for my girlfriend, I also thought that I would be able to use it as a crimper for when I make my award-winning crab Rangoon. (lol)Well, it turns out that what I thought was a crimping wheel is actually a squiggly or serrated cutter/trimmer.It makes the edges look cool, but cut them clean through!The "squiggly wheel" is the same cutting tool as the straight-edged cutting wheel.I used my old standby tool... a fork.All in all, I can't say anything bad about my incorrect purchase. It's very sharp and works well!Plastic handle saves you a few dollars and I feel it looks better and easier to clean.Hope this helps!

My girlfriend says she loves it and used it for baking chocolate chip cookies.She said they came out perfect. Not overdone on the bottom and uncooked in the top/middle. :-)A little thinner than I expected but it works well.It came rolled up inside a long tiny plain box about 1"x1"x12" (or so).She also said she saw a chef on TV turn a metal casserole pan upside down and placed the baking sheet  on it.In case you are wondering what I was wondering..."Yes, you place food to be oven cooked/baked directly on this sheet! (lol - I didn't know...I make sandwiches!)I think she also placed it under some cupcake paper baking cups.I am sure she will use this in as many applications as possible, unless you need that bottom a little hotter, crispier, or burnt. :-)Hope this helps!

I thought I would throw my two-cents in about the new design and effectiveness of this soundhole humidifier.After making a few homemade case humidifiers out of things like a travel butter container with many holes drilled into it and a sponge, I started thinking about how some of the cases separate the body cavity from the neck & headstock cavity inside the guitar case and not allowing the humidity to flow freely to all areas, especially the body where it is needed the most.Even though I was getting acceptable humidification in the case I was concerned about the body being dryer in comparison so I went ahead and splurged the 8 bucks on these. (I actually bought three of them.)I crank the gas heat up in the house in the winter and A/C in the summer, keep my guitars inside their cases and inside a closet. The humidity drops quite low, but the sponges remain moist for several days before I can no longer fight the urge to re-wet them. lol.Two great tips in one:Use a regular, more dense sponge, thicker like the ones at the dollar store. Cut them to size and stuff them in!Throw away the sponge when it starts to get yucky and don't worry about distilled water, unless you want to. I can't argue using very pure water compared to the possibly toxic crap that comes out our faucets, but for one dollar you can get a boat load of them after you cut them to size, and toss them away without any regard when needing replaced.Don't worry about the "thing" hanging in-between your strings. It will not damage anything unless you get the sponge  too saturated and it leaks. I will either squeeze the excess water out, or shake the container with the sponge inside until I am satisfied that it won't drip.The humidifier will not cause any stress or damage to your strings by spreading them when you wedge this inside your soundhole.If you ARE rough, careless, thoughtless, or stupid, you could possibly knock this loose and have it rub or fall out, but I would be more worried about the guitar and what it would take for this to happen. This would be more extreme to the guitar than the humidifier or any harm it could cause.The top snaps on by squeezing the sides to release little tabs that stick through the top cover. The sponge inside is quite small, and there isn't too much room for a much larger sponge. The device is simple and fairly solid. Treat it gently and it will last forever. You can easily clean the inside or run it through a dishwasher. If you give the inside a quick rinse every few fills, I'm sure it would be a decade before anything "built up" to require extensive cleaning or replacement.Keep an eye on it for the first few days and then weeks to get a feel for when you should be re-wetting the sponge.Try to keep the sponge moist when it's dry.I strongly suggest getting an Oasis case humidifier, (or similar) mini sized about 1" X 4" costing around 17-20 bucks.This will take any guesswork out of the equation and give you fairly accurate readings inside your guitar or instrument case.Remember, too much humidity can cause your acoustic guitar to warp. Too dry and it will shrink and crack, split the soundboard (top) also leaving the edges of the frets sticking out like the backbone of a fish and quite abrasive!If you spent more than one hundred dollars on your guitar and live where it gets cold and/or dry, you would be negligent (if not careless) to spend the pittance to make sure your 'baby ain't thirsty', or worse...dead & broken!Hope this helps!

Fits nicely and tight on standard wide threaded microphone stands. If you have the smaller "screw headed" ends on your microphone stand, you can get a little threaded adapter at any music store for next to nothing. (Maybe a dollar, if they don't just give it to you.)Using this with stands that have a heavy round base takes up less space onstage and other places, as well as making it easy to relocate and keep out of the way.No need for a tripod stand with the legs folding up and out, getting in the way, plus most inexpensive tripods are cheaply made, very light and will break easily when moving gear or simply tripping over them.The base screws down all the way onto the stand until it is hand tight.The set screw allows for tilting and turning adjustment of the camera.The set screw presses against a ball-socket hinge and has a plastic thumb knob that seems a little fragile. I am very careful not to over-tighten in fear of twisting off the plastic thumb tightening knob.I am also leery of stripping the set screw or the threads inside the housing, but at this price I guess you can't expect to have a sophisticated adjustment mechanism, eh?There is a notch in the side of the housing to allow for a 90-degree preset angle.The metal thumbscrew that attaches the base of the camera to the adapter has a rubber washer as well as a thin rubber mat acting as like a cushioning gasket when tightened to your camera.Be careful. The metal thumbscrew can easily fall out from the holding plate when transporting, removing or switching cameras. I found a little 'plastic threaded washer-like ring' that screws onto the holding plate screw when not in use. You could easily find many types of washers, screws, plastic pieces, etc., to hold it in place when in storage or transport. You could also leave it attached to your camera. Either way, be careful not to let it fall out and get lost.Overall the "little thing" is quite solid, heavy and sturdy and takes up little to no real estate and does a great job at being small, basic, solid and inexpensive.It holds well when bumped or moved. Mine has absolutely "no slop" in it, does not wobble or come loose. I would not put a larger sized 8mm camera or heavy camera on this adapter. Most modern devices will do just fine.Again, just make sure you tighten it up 'just enough' to hold it well. Don't put the grip of Hercules on it and it should last for years. Mine has.I'm happy with mine and bought our drummer one for Christmas.Hope this helps!

Terrific All-in-One Must-Have Tool for Guitarists!I have been using the older style Planet Waves model of this winder/cutter/bridge pin tool and when it came in I was a little skeptical about the new model.I am happy to see that the changes are relatively minor and if anything it is just a little bit smaller so it will fit inside your case compartment more easily leaving more room for other junk.I have used the Planet Waves tolls for years without any difficulty or problems with breaking, bending, becoming dull or unusable. They keep on keeping on and I have one in every case.Buy, you'll love it, and if not, you can always return it.Hope this helps!

Works as expected.Comes with a mini wire antenna extension for hard to reach places or for more line-of-sight reception.Another nice extra was two sets of Y-R-W Composite cables. (video, left & right audio)I use this (on the VCR Out from the cable box) to transmit the HD channels from the living room into the bedroom onto an older TV.I had it up and running in less than ten minutes.There are no video or audio adjustments to this device(s). Whatever you plug into it will be broadcast to the receiver and displayed on your TV or monitor using Composite Video connection. (Y-R-W cable)You can plug a camera in to monitor security, surveillance or baby room, etc. You can use it with a VCR and with multiple receivers broadcast to many TV/Monitors at once without wires.You can use it to send just video or just audio only. (stereo audio)Hope this helps!

Not much to say here except I was expecting a cheap POS with tiny flimsy wires and what I received was a really nice accessory plug splitter with thick wires and quality components.It even cam with protective caps for the outlets when not in use!Nice hinged cable strain relief molded plastic around both the plug and sockets.Very well made and affordable to buy.

5 each A23 size 12V batteries.Arrived fast and work well.This is probably the best deal on Amazon with their Prime service.I surely didn't need 25 batteries and I wasn't going to spend an arm and a leg on a single one, either!There is no expiration date on these batteries. Bummer. That's why they only get three stars.Hope this helps.

This really doesn't spill, which is great. It does require that you suck the liquid through the straw, though. No sipping with this thing. The thing that I don't like is the rubberized drinking tip. It attracts hair and dust like crazy, and kids won't be paying attention to it.
My dogs went crazy over these. They smell pretty awful, but I guess that's what dogs like. I like that it seems to be made with good ingredients.

An eye opening look at the vulnerabilities we face as we move through a future more and more reliant on technology. It's an important read. Maybe not the most exciting book, but well-researched with good information.

This does a great job of grabbing dust and holding on to it. It comes out of the package pretty compressed, so a lot of fluffing is needed before use. I am in the desert and have a lot of dust to deal with. This worked like a charm. It also comes with an extra dust head. If I have any complaint, it is that the head does tend to slip off during use, but that could be user error.

This is a very pretty pendant with an 18" chain. The pendant is a lot bigger than I thought it would be, probably about 3/4" long. I would have preferred something a little more delicate, but that's just my personal taste. Overall, I think it is really pretty.

You can't beat the price of these razors. It works out to a little over a buck a razor. Perhaps Bic is trying to compete with dollar shave club. The razors themselves have a nice comfort grip and sharp blades for a close shave. You definitely need to take time with them to avoid nicks and scrapes, but it's not that much trouble.

This is a great way to expand the number of plugs on an outlet without adding an extra cord. It takes up the whole outlet, so it adds four plugs, plus the two USB plugs. It's perfect for behind the TV where you need to plug in all your boxes and stuff. I haven't had any problems with it at all.
The cotton flannel is very soft and comfy. The fit is perfect.  The material feel strong; this should last a good while. It's a really nice shirt.

This is terrible. It tastes awful. I am all for the concept, but the execution is horrible. No ginger taste at all. Just a weird sweet that isn't even all that sweet and is slightly bitter. I have used stevia before and it doesn't always taste this bad. This actually has 4 g of erythritol, which is a sugar alcohol that can cause digestive issues in people sensitive to it, which includes me, unfortunately.

These are great scissors. They are very comfortable in the hand and very sharp. I've been using the craft scissors for months and have no complaints. My mom uses the larger scissors and likes them as well.
Great hand soap. I love the smell and the way it makes my hands feel. I am a definite fan of Mrs. Meyer.

I'm really impressed with this backpack. The stitching is really strong. The straps are comfortable. There are plenty of pockets. The only thing that I don't like is that the side pockets are actually too small to hold a bottle of water. If it has mesh side pockets it would be perfect. Love the vintage styling.
As expected. Nice needles for quilting.

The screen protector works well to keep my screen safe. There are a couple of things I don't like about it, though. For one, it is not edge-to-edge to the phone. It stops right at the edge of the screen, but the whole front of the phone is glass. I wish it covered the whole phone. It also doesn't seem to quite stick down on the edges, which can cause a bit of a halo. These issues seem to be present with all glass screen protectors, though.

I generally avoid clay based litters, but I actually really like this one. It does a great job of keeping odor down. It is also virtually dust free. It does track a little, but not that much. I plan to continue using it.
The is a nice, heavy glass jar with a plastic sprouting lid. I comes with some seeds, also. It's everything I expected it to be and works great.

I like the way this makes me feel, but it is way too sweet. The sweetness is overwhelming. I add it to my protein shakes and this is all I can taste.FYI, the scoop is not accurate at all. I recommend using a scale to measure it out. The scoop is about 1.5 servings.

I'm sure this will work for some people, but it caused me to break out in little blisters all over my face after a couple of days. I've had this reaction to other cosmetics that were too strong for my sensitive skin.
These are comfortable and they have decent sound. They aren't just good for the money, they are good period. High end? No. But just as good as some of the $30 - $40 earbuds I have tried.

I received all three blends. They are all very easy to apply. They go on evenly and do as they claim. The "Clean" oil control one helps even out my complexion, but doesn't control oil as much as I would like. Within about 20 minutes I start noticing my skin feeling oily again. I used the bronzer all over and it did a great job of adding color without turning me too dark or orange. The blush is very translucent and just adds a bit of color.The only thing I really don't like is how much product comes loose when I sweep my brush over it. I end up having to dump some in the sink because there is so much left on the palette. Other than that, I'm pretty happy with these colors.

This palette is VERY pigmented. The "Pro Basic" shades are for building up a smokey eye and the "Pixelated Color" shades are to add a bit of pop at the corner of the eyes. The pixelated colors are not intended to be use all over the eyelid, and they would look absolutely awful if you tried to do it. I like how pigmented the colors are, but I'm really put off by the fact that the pixelated colors have black mixed in, which makes them really muddy. I get that this is to help them blend with your eyeliner, but I'd rather mix them myself to get that effect. You can't really see how muddy the colors are in pictures, because the light makes the glittery colors stand out. In person, it is very noticeable.
This is great. It has a large magnet on the back to hold it in place. There is plenty of room to write brief notes. The push pin pay is more design than function, but it does work. No complaints

The case is kind of cute and the thread is okay, but none of it is worth the cost. It has a twist latch to close it and it is very hard to turn. If feels like it will break pretty quickly.Fyi, the needles are sewing machine needles

I should have heeded the previous reviews. These just aren't comfortable. They make my feet hurt within about an hour. They also don't breath at all, so my feet get hot and sweaty. I usually wear an 8.5 wide or a 9 regular. I ordered the large, which is supposed to be sizes 9 - 10, but the fit is not good. They are wide enough, but about an inch too short. My heel goes off the back, which adds to the discomfort. I would NOT buy them again.
This has an interesting  collection of stories and is oddly fun to read, but I feel like the author is trying to hard to be irreverent. The tone gets really distracting pretty quickly, imo.
I'm kind of at a loss on how to review this. It definitely works. The hummingbirds are perfectly happy with it, but it's basically just powdered sugar with some preservative in it.
These work great. They stay in place on your hands, but aren't bulky like regular oven mitts. I'm not sure why there are 3 in the pack, but I don't mind it, of course.

This was very easy to set up and it brought in almost all of the over-the-air HD channels in the area. I was surprised at how good they looked, as well. The amplifier is a must. I wasn't getting must before I plugged it in, but once I plugged it in and ran a channel scan, I had all but two of the channels available in my area. If I move the antenna around, I am certain I can get the remaining two. It's a bit ugly, but worth it now that I can ditch cable.

I received this free in exchange for an honest review.The first thing I noticed about this hair masque is how nice it smells. It's a very natural, mild scent. The scent lingers after use, but is never overwhelming. The next thing I noticed is how thick it is. This is a proper hair masque, not just some cream conditioner in a fancy jars. It smoothed through my hair easily and I could immediately tell the difference. I don't often use conditioner, which means my hair tends to get tangled, after applying this I was able to run my fingers through it with no problem.A day later, my hair still feels soft and silky. I'm in love. Amazing product.

This is cute, but I doubt it would last a full school year. The button closure is really awkward and will probably be the first thing to fail. I had difficuly closing an opening it. I imagine a young child would really struggle with it.

I like Dove products in general, but this didn't work for my hair. I have fine, naturally wavy hair and this weighed it down and made it look greasy. If you have nice, thick, full hair, it might be the perfect thing. If you have fine hair, you should probably avoid it.
The case is just okay. It looks nice, but is barely functional. You can only put one card in it, otherwise the magnet won't catch. For what it does, I think it is way overpriced.

This is way better than I expected. I haven't had a lot of luck with Suave products in the past, but I love this oil spray. It has a nice, light scent and absorbs readily into my skin. It gives my skin a really nice sheen and makes it very soft. This is the rare Suave product that I would buy again.

I have very rough heels. I was using keihls but it was bit helping. The Ahava is nothing short of a miracle. I may not use it all the time, but I will use it to repair the current damage. I will also use it when I need a quick fix.

I've been interested in maca powder for a while, but this is my first time using it. I have only been using it for a few days, but I can really feel it. This morning I didn't get my regular protein smoothie in until a few hours later AND had skipped coffee than usual. I was seriously dragging until this kicked in. Today I have had about 1/4 the amount of coffee I usually drink and I feel great (now that it has kicked in). I will definitely continue using it. Love this brand, too.I was a bit put off by the smell. It's a bit like sour milk, but I haven't noticed it adding a bad taste to my smoothies.ETA. Out of curiosity I added some to warm milk by itself. OMG it tastes amazing. It's mapley and nutty and delicious. This is a total win.

This is a lot heavier and sturdier than I expected. I'm not saying you could raise a car with it or anything, but it will hold up fine for a trailer. I love that the box mounts to the trailer. That is an awesome concept. Pretty much everything you need is in the box.

This dog is seriously cute. The flesh and blood dogs are definitely jealous of how much attention it gets. It does get annoying after a while, and it doesn't catch movement when it should sometimes, but, overall, it's fun and hilarious. And, did I mention cute?

This didn't really do anything to my hair. Before it dried it made it a bit sticky. After it dried, it feels and looks like it always does. Not sure what was supposed to happen, but I don't think it happened.

I received this case free in exchange for an honest review.This case is a three-piece case that protects the phone from all angles. First, this is a silicone sleeve. The sleeve fits into a hard case that covers the sides and back of the phone. Both the sleeve and the hard case have all the cutouts in all in the right places. This case also includes a hard case that cover be snapped over the front of the phone to protect the screen when it is not in use. The front cover also slip over the back of the phone, which gets it out of the way while you are using the phone and allows it to work as a kickstand.The whole setup feels very solid. I definitely think it will protect my phone well. I don't think it is particularly stylist, and it is a bit too bulky for every day use, imo, but I still love it. I think it's great for things like running, working out, hiking, etc. I also have an Otterbox LifeProof case, but I like this one a lot better than that one.

No complaints. It works as expected. The magnet keeps it where it belongs. Personally, I think a whiteboard or chalkboard would be more useful than the mirror, but that is personal preference, and those also exist in this line.
These are okay, but I feel that they were just way overpriced. I was expecting more for the money. They work fine, but ultimately I do not think they are worth what I paid for them
I like the feel of the hook. It is really well balanced. The style is really cool, too. I just wish there was a bit of a taper on the Hook. I find it really difficult to get into stitches sometimes.

These have really become my go-to hooks. The little rool-up case, however, is not much favorite. The mesh tends to catch the hooks and makes it hard to put them in the case. I'll be looking for a replacement case in the future.,
Great RAM. I've been using it for a few months and haven't had any problems. It really improved the performance of my windows 8/10 pc.

I love the two smaller brushes, but the larger brush could use some work. The larger brush only has bristles on one side. I don't find that to be very effective, and I really don't see the point to it at all. When you are cleaning the bottom of a bottle, you have to make more effort with this brush that you would with one that had bristles all the way around. I love the OXO brand in general, but I wouldn't purchase the set again.
The flavor is good. The protein/calorie ratio is great. I was looking for something natural and this fit the bill. I will continue using it.

I love coconut water, but I didn't care for these. They didn't taste like coconut at all, imo. It had more of a peachy taste. The quality, however, seems good and I would try other products from this company. I just didn't care for this one.

This journal is great. It is the perfect size to fit in my purse. I use it to jot down notes. The paper is cream-colored with pale lines. The cover is gorgeous. The embossing really makes it stand out. The sewn binding is top quality, too. I haven't had any problems with it at all.

The story is interesting and the artwork is beautiful. I just didn't feel that the artwork always elevated the story. A lot of times, I would have to stare at a page for several minutes to put together what was actually happening. Things get too busy and frames don't always move in was I felt were logical ways. I love both the story and the art as separate entities, but I don't think they came together well to create a final pieace.

This made short work of a very nasty bathroom and allowed me to keep my hands relatively clean. I cleaned for a couple of hours and didn't even need to switch to the second battery. I wish it came with refills for the scouring pad. If I were to build this kit myself, I would get rid of the crevice brush, since the ling brush works just as well for the same jobs, and add a few replacements for the scouring pad. The scouring pad really does most of the jobs.

I love this bottle and may get more in the future. Even though the glass feels a bit thin, it is actually quite sturdy and well made. The design is really sleek and cool, also. The neoprene sleeve offers great protection. I have dropped it a couple of times in the sleeve, including once on a tile floor, and it is still ticking. I use it for both hot and cold beverages. I have also used it to heat milk in the microwave. With hot beverages you really do need the neoprene sleeve, because the glass is too hot to handle.I only wish that there were more options for the sleeve. The plain yellow isn't really my style.

This is a great book, but there is very little real guidance on the writing part. It probably should be called "Illustrating the Graphic Novel with Writing Tips" or something. But the content that is there is definitely worth while and the illustrations are great.

I've been an Izze fan for a few years, but only recently tried the cans. The cans are small, but they are full of flavor. If you are used to drinking sugary soda, these might seem a bit bitter at first. That's because they are natural. Once you adjust to the flavor, you won't want to drink chemical laden soda again. My preference is still the bottle, but the cans do in a pinch.As for the flavors, I would rank them Clementine, Blackberry, and a distant last is Apple. I'm not a big fan of apple juice, though, so that is just my preference and not a reflection on the product.Just an FYI I get these at a member's only warehouse store (not the one founded by Sam Walton) for quite a bit less.

Almost too nice to throw away. I am really surprised by how sturdy this is. The binding has a cloth-like feel and the covers are sturdy plastic. This really feels like it should be refillable, but it's not. The paper quality is good too. The only thing that makes me hesitate is how wasteful it is that this isn't refillable. It's good quality, though.
This is great for more than just lockers. I use it in the pantry to help organize things. It works perfectly and helps add a little space.

I plan on getting another set, that's how much I like these. They are strong, solid glass bowls with lids that seal down well. At first, I wasn't sure about these lids. They down fit around the outside of the bowl the way I am used to. Instead, you press the lid down inside the bowl and it doesn't feel like there is anything in there to keep it in place. They do stay in place, though, just by the power of the suction they create. I've been using these for months without any problems. I also love that they nest, which is an issue I have with some of the pyrex bowls I have bought. I well definitely get more in the future.

Wonderful, fresh lavender scent and excellent cleaning power, what more could I ask for? This is my new favorite multi-purpose cleaner. It made short works of a very nasty bathroom and left it smelling fresh and clean. I will continue using it.
I actually love this. A little goes a long way. The scent is fresh and natural, not perfumey. It also lasts for quite a while, also. No complaints.

I actually use this to keep water cold and it works perfectly. I fill it up in the morning and by evening the water is still cold. I chose this size because it is right around the amount of water I am supposed to drink in a day. By filling this up in the morning, it makes it easy for me to know I am getting the right amount of hydration. As long as I finish it, I know I'm good. It was definitely worth a little extra to get the best quality.

I just get the plain and I really like them. It's an awesome, crunchy, gluten-free snack. I like that it has less fat and sodium compared to pork rinds in the store, but has better flavor and texture. The only thing I don't like is that the edges dry out and don't puff up. This results in there being some very hard bits that I worry will damaged my teeth if I'm not careful. That hasn't stopped me from eating them, though. I just take care when I do.

I've been on a subscribe & save plan with this deodorant for about two years. It's the best out there. First of all, it really works. It doesn't take much to do the job, either, so if lasts a long time. The scent is light and fresh, never overpowering. I live in the desert and need good antiperspirant and this does the job. I've tried other brands and nothing works this well, nothing.

The case I received is nice and clear, but it seriously attracts dust. If the dust was just getting on the outside of the case that wouldn't be a big deal. Unfortunately, after a few days it has dust INSIDE the case. I was worried the dust would eventually scratch the glass on my phone. As such, I have removed the case and gone back to my Caseology case.

I love this wig. Can't wait for Halloween. It's not necessarily the most luxurious wig, but it is fine for the cost. The color is very true to the picture. It did take a couple of weeks to get it, though. So, if you are looking at this for a specific event, make sure to order ahead.Disclaimer: I received this wig free in exchange for an honest review

So far, I'm really impressed by this. I like that it has three different modes, which each have three different speeds. It makes it very customizable. I definitely appreciated having the lower speed when I first started. The vibrations on my gums felt kind of weird, almost ticklish, and the lower speed helped me adapt to it. Once I got used to the feeling, I went up to speed two, which is where I am right now. I really like the white setting, which is timed to give you 30 seconds of cleaning time for each quadrant, then an additional minute of polishing time for the fronts of the teeth.The only thing I don't like is that it turns itself off once the cycle is complete. I would prefer it stay on so that I can clean my tongue and gums a little more. Another electric toothbrush I used a while back did that and it was really nice.Other than turning itself off when I don't want it to, I am overall  very happy with this toothbrush. I would recommend it.
I'm really happy with these dish towels.  They feel thick enough to last and the texture helps get things clean. I would definitely but more if I beefed them.

These really work. Amazing. I was really impressed with how well the lids seal to the bowl. After putting the lid on I can lift the bowl and contents using just the handle on the lid. I don't recommend doing this during regular use, but it was a real testament as to how good the seal is. The lids are also silicone, which means they are heat resistant and won't taint the flavor of the food in the bowl. If I had to complain about something, it is that silicone really attracts dust and pet hair, so these absolutely need to be washed off before use, especially if you have pets. Otherwise, awesome.

I haven't read all of the stories, but what I have read have been really strong, well-written pieces. I appreciate that the language doesn't get overly flowery. There is a really great economy of words that make the stories feel really cinematic. He doesn't spend 20 words saying something that could be said in ten words. That type of brevity is not easy to master, and he does it well. The characters I've read so far have all had heart and clear motivations. Things aren't always spelled out and tied up in a neat little bow, which is great. Sometimes things are a bit messy, as is life.

I really like these. They are comfortable, fit well, and feel durable. They are loose enough through the legs to allow you to move around, but fit well enough through the waist to keep them on. They are perfect for doing active stuff like hiking or playing casual football.

While this certainly doesn't smell as bad as most dog foods, it doesn't look nearly as good as other Nutro foods I have tried. It looks a lot more like traditional dog food. It still is made from high quality ingredients, but, unfortunately, my dog simply won't eat it, at least not on its own. She wouldn't even try it. I had to mix it with some other Nutro food to get her to eat it at all. My dog is not picky at all. It is very rare that I find something she won't eat. Given that she wouldn't even go near the bowl, it must have smelled pretty terrible to her.
