This is a good electric screwdriver for tight places, but it is very small, and for me, not very comfortable to hold. I'd go with the B&D three-position model, which is more comfortable, and can be adjusted, depending on the job. Also, it comes with 2 one-sided bits, standard slot bit and philips bit, but for any other type of screw, you'll need a bit set.

These are excellent earphones; they aren't $150 noise-cancelling types, but in every other way, they are as good as you're likely to get. I'm not quite sure why they're marketed as being for iphones and ipods. Even the packaging states mp3 players they're compatible with and they list only 'i' products, but they have a standard 3.5 plug, and fit into any mp3 player or other listening device you may have. They come with three sets of ear buds for different sized ears. Looking at the product picture, they look like the creatures in the later War of the Worlds movie. Subliminal advertising?

I have been looking for a NYC-based mystery series now that I've read through all the L. Block Matt Scudder novels. Unfortunately, Mr. R. F. Coleman's prose lacks the taut, visceral quality of the former.  The author seems to enjoy pages of description where a couple will walk around New York City, like the scenes from the old Woody Allen movies, or those tacky 1970s 'get to know you' movie scenes with dreamy, desaturated filming to suggest romance. It just doesn't work for a mystery story. I believe this is the first novel in a long series involving cane-carrying Jewish former detective Moe Praeger, so maybe the later volumes improve, but I don't have the patience to find out. For an excellent detective series featuring a Jewish detective, try Stuart Kaminsky's series featuring Chicago-based Abe Lieberman.

I purchased these after my dog chewed up the originals. It's definitely worth the extra expense to get these. There are 'assorted varieties' that have different sizes, but you should know the size that fits your ears, unless you share your headphones with others, or keep changing your ear style at the local ear replacement shop

As a reader to learn Spanish, these stories are OK. Calling them 'short stories' is a bit of a misnomer. They seem to be constructed mainly for language learning, and have little redeeming literary value. I didn't expect them to reach the level of Borges or Marquez, but these stories are at about the same interest level of a concocted story in an intermediate Spanish textbook.  I got bored really quickly while reading the adventures of a few pals in Spain getting lost while going to a restaurant. I'd look for an easy Reader with stories, at least adapted from fairy tales, or even original children's stories (or simple erotic romance if that's to your liking) in Spanish to enhance your skills.

If you hate the idea of high priced sheets, and hate walking through Target in search of the write sheet & pillowcase set, and if patterned sheets make you slightly nauseated because of perceptual effects, these sheets can't be beat. They feel comfortable, and are made well. The color is soothing, and that's important to me since I do relaxation exercises on my mattress. I find that in a high stress world, it's important to control your environment as well as possible. This set definitely seems to contribute.

No bath mat is going to be durable, washable, and soft given that it's placed on the bathroom floor. But this item is a replacement for an older mat whose threads unraveled after a ride in the washing machine filled with warm water. The former was synthetic and had that artificial feel to the touch. The cotton feels much nicer. To tell the truth, bath mats are important to me because the main form of relaxation for me is taking a bath--maybe because it's the one place I won't use electronics.My advice is to avoid getting it drenched. It's not a mop. Don't let it remain wet more than a day, and be sure to dry it thoroughly before placing it back on the floor. You can wash it in a washing machine on COLD. You can even put it in a dryer for about 10 minutes just to get the sogginess out, then remove it and hang it to dry.

I wonder whether this bar isn't more popular because it's not labeled as a protein bar; however it has 15 grams of protein, and low sugar content. In addition, it's delicious. I've tried about six different companies, and now I have found the protein bar I'm going to stick with.
This test prep book is OK, but Barron's is by far the best. If you purchase Barron's you won't have any use for this one.

This is a nifty electric screwdriver. I bought the 2 volt B&D model a number of years ago and it was worthless as the torque was so weak. Buying it would be penny wise and pound foolish. This screwdriver has significantly more power, and the three-way handle positioning is excellent. All the functions respond well; you can feel the quality in this little gizmo, which is always a good sign

These stories are very enjoyable if you would like to get a feeling for stories and writing styles of a different era. Historical novels try to imitate the style and culture of an older era. These stories ARE from another era.  Wilkie Collins has a terrific epistolary short story with a detective who writes in 100 to 150 word sentences. A real lesson in writing as well as plot.  As the saying goes, distance learning provides a way of transcending space. Books allow you to travel in time.

You can notice the four star rating; however, that is the rating I give it for my particular circumstances. If you don't mind being 'hooked up' to the epson printer world, meaning getting updates, e-mails, cute presentation suggestions, impressive features like remote printing of images from smart phones, easy uploads to facebook, an lcd screen that emulates those of high end office printers and copy machines, with lots of instructions, icons, warning lights, etc., then this printer is a five.  However, as I am quite busy, a great printer for my purposes would be one that is 'stripped-down.'  After I installed this printer, I had the feeling Epson is trying to develop a relationship with me like a kidney dialysis patient for his/her machine.  My primary reason for selecting this printer is its 11 x 17 photo output capability. However, I come from the epson dedicated photo printer school--r1900, r2000--where the emphasis is on performance without the bells and whistles.  I guess it's been a while since these aforementioned products were released so the world of color inkjet printers is changing. The image output is excellent for photos if you take good photos (if you know what GIGO means, you should have no trouble understanding this.Even with the 11 x 17 feature, I realize I have to insert one paper at a time, which means you have to really plan ahead in terms of printer placement if you want to get up every five minutes to insert another sheet into the printer, and when considering the extensions that come with the printer, i.e., three paper trays, and a cd tray.I do think this is an impressive printer, and epson engineers are quite ingenious, but I don't know if they've studied consumer habits.  Again, if you don't mind a 300 page user guide, and are gentle with your printing (the many slots and slide out panels are a bit flimsy and won't take much abuse), you should enjoy this printer. If you have a home office, where you sometimes are in a rush to complete a project and don't have the proper finesse, I'd look elsewhere.  I think the 'Expression' in the name of the printer tells it all: it's a very nice scrap booking, consumer-oriented printer for a relaxed environment, where there isn't a lot of human 'wear and tear.' If you don't want or need 11 x 17 printing or scanning, you might do better going with an 8 x 10 printer in the same series

I liked the concept of this book from its description, but the book doesn't follow through on its potential.  There are many sentence examples to emulate from a variety of sources, but outside of the context of the paragraphs from which they originate, it's impossible to appreciate and understand their true style, originality, and meaning.  Reading a few essays by writers like E.B. White, James Baldwin, Virginia Woolf, among others, will teach you how superior writing is composed, and would be more helpful than this compilation

This is a very flimsy book, which does not lend itself to study. The vocabulary roots are arranged more like a medical reference book than a book that motivates you to enjoy learning about language, and there's no workbook section in which to practice.

This is a high quality product and should be part of any anti-inflammatory or anti-arthritis diet. Don't be put off by the proviso that benefits have not been determined to be effective by the FDA. The FDA does not have the authority or the staff to test 'nutritional supplements.'  My advice: if you take this supplement or one like it with all three main ingredients, you shouldn't have to pay more than ten or eleven cents a tablet/capsule., so I buy the largest bottle I can since I take them everyday.

This mat is just the right size: large enough to cover the places your feet go, but not large enough to stick to the tub bottom, making it impossible to pull up.  You really need to maintain this mat, and it's interesting how many people will keep their sinks clean, but let their tubs get skanky. I've scrubbed this product with liquid dish detergent, and it has stayed clean. Nearly anything in a bathroom is prone to bacteria growth if it doesn't dry completely. My advice, every two weeks or so pull it off the tub surface, wash it, and dry it outside the bathroom so it gets completely dry. For those of you that like sex in the bathtub with the shower going...well, use your imagination.

Corel has finally gotten the 'kinks' out of its program, and it's not nearly as cumbersome as it was about four editions ago. it responds very quickly and has a bunch of new features that aren't just fluff. The product opens up at a pretty amazing speed. The literature says it's 50% faster than previous editions; it seems even faster than that. One of the features--apparently with a deal from Onone software - the best 'third party; add-on software company is Perfect Effects--which gives you lots of choices for trying out various image styles. It has batch processing that is much more effective than the counterpart that comes with PS elements. If you are on the more professional end of digital photography, you won't want to give up Photoshop for this program, but if you're new to image software, and haven't learned another program, you should definitely consider this one.I've used Elements since PSE 5, and know it pretty well, so my intention for using paintshop is more as a change of pace than becoming my go-to program. The only downside t is the opening layout. It looks pretty daunting, like the controls you might imagine would be on a jumbo jet. This shouldn't be an issue if you only use a few software programs, but if you're like me, and enjoy trying out lots of variations on themes, your brain might not be able to handle all the choices.I have a feeling that if you like the program, you'll stick to maybe 10 or 15 effects rather than go through the 100+ for each image, Two bargains you won't get with PS Elements is the 'lifetime' free upgrade when a new edition comes out, and a very robust tutorial system that won't make you want to hunt for the dozens of tutorial program on the web that offer advice for the Adobe products.

I ordered these for my g/f who does yoga and pilates. Gaiam is known for its yoga products including DVDs, mats, blocks, bands, etc., which was why they caught my attention.  She says they're the best tights she has worn for yoga. They seem to run slightly on the small side, but that could be a matter of perception based on her previous yoga outfit. I'm 6'2" and weigh 175. I thought maybe we could share them, but no luck.

Yes, my 55-pound dog loved this 'edible.' However, it was not longer edible after one day because he chewed it up and ate the whole thing.  Maybe for smaller dogs, this could be more of a long-term 'chewy product' but not for mean junkyard dogs.

This is a very good smooth iron with lots of settings and choices. It warms up fast, has a huge pressing surface, and terrific steam and splash output. The wide surface makes this iron save you time, and the steam burst is so powerful, it startled me at first! This quick responding iron is of special value to me, since I seem to always running late for appointments.  If that sounds like you, consider this iron.  I like the swivel cord for the same reason. I can speedily move around the iron without getting it tangled. It seems to be an very durable iron as well.

Truly excellent review book. It's clearly written by an author that knows how to compose clear English prose. Covers the essential events, treaties, historical figures, and includes important influences by technologies, art, pop culture, media, etc. The only thing lacking are maps and charts that could elucidate the content. Much better than Kaplan, which I'd avoid at all costs - although I already wasted my money on it.

This product works if you put it on just right so that the collar is equidistant around the neck. I bought it so I wouldn't have to rely on my over the door traction kit.  However, there's really no comparison between the two 'technologies.' The over the door variety works much better. You can adjust the 'dead weight' and you don't get that sticky feeling around your neck. Also, placed properly, the over the door varieties create a neck/chin placement that is adjustable to your physique.  I get that 'wow, that feels good' sensation after using the latter. When I use this one, I get that 'hmm...I guess I feel better than I did fifteen minutes ago.'

I bought this as part of a DIY set up so I could make my own standing computer desk, i.e., I do the standing. The density is just right: firm but gives enough not to feel one's legs (my legs, anyway) are getting fatigued. I've done computer work for four hours (with breaks) standing on this mat, and no fatigue. Good for your posture too

This works great for my B & D drill. Fits just right, and the length of the perpendicular bar is long enough for someone with long fingers. There's another Dewalt item like this that says it's limited to 3/8 inch sprockets for 91 cents. You might want to check that one out also.

This is a high end digital voice recorder -- the technology that replaced mini-cassette recorders. I wanted to upgrade from my VN-7200, which is a great value--about $30 on Amazon--but it doesn't have the fidelity or usb technoogy to use with Dragonspeak.  Since I've been working on an e-learning project that requires I write scripts in a conversational tone, just after one day, I can tell this recorder will save me time since I don't have to be hooked up to a computer with a microphone input to create text. The 852 lets me 'write' a script wherever I am, and then transfer the audio straight to text.One special feature is that the recorder highlights just the functions you use regularly. This is perhaps even a better feature, since I, like most people inundated with technology, get more weary each time I have to learn the operations of a new gizmo. Maybe the under-25 crowd boasts about how many different technologies they can master, and how fast they master them, but as an independent contractor, I'd rather be getting paid for my work. With any luck, I'll be able to forego the tablet revolution. The only tablets that I need are for the headaches I get from keeping up with the latest technologies.

This is one of those short guides that can serve as alternatives to finding web pages with the same information and printing them out. It's a trade off between the price of about 10 pages of toner vs. the price of the book with the added value of not having to bother surfing the net. I find that as my schedule gets more busy, I opt for the softcover book, knowing the info is available for free. Since I got assigned a project that required the use of google docs, I  had to learn its nuts & bolts fast.  There comes a time in a person's life when you just have to bite the bullet and shell out a few extra bucks if you have them.

Even though I'm not a 'pop historical thriller/mystery novel' reader, I bought this book after reading the author's memoir on becoming a writer. I recommend the memoir highly. Regarding this novel, though, it was written in that typical competent (meaning the sentences are grammatically correct) uninspired way.  If you're idea of a good novelist brings to mind Robert Bolano, William Faulkner, or Garcia Marquez, or what some 'high-brow' people call 'literary fiction,' you'll probably feel the way I did reading this. Or, if your idea of a good historical novel is Graves' 'I, Claudius' or 'The March' by Doctorow, you won't find the prose easy to plod through.  I'd say it's the literary equivalent to a TV movie, circa 1985, or why I like to call literary 'muzac.'However, the author comes across as such a nice and unpretentious guy (Morrell is a former college professor), and I feel bad even panning his own literary output, but I thought I'd write it for any of the 'quality' novel lovers out there. If you find the persona of De Quincey of interest, it might keep you reading, but that still wasn't enough for me.
This is good paper, but I have previously ordered 3-hole Hammerhill paper, whose quality seems to be a bit better and at a lower price. It still is a lot better than the 'office supply store' brand.

I bought a version of this produce several years ago, but it was only about 60% as long as this touch pen, and it cramped my fingers.  I am using this 'capacitive' pen with my kindle and once you get the 'feel' for it, works really well for highlighting and taking notes. I haven't tried it on other tablet-type products but I imagine it would do the same. I tend to misplace little accessory thingies, but haven't figured a way of using the little loops and clips that come with this. If I wore neckties, I could probably use it as a tie clip. If you wear neckties, that might be an option, implying the message, 'I'm not only well-groomed and professional, I have impeccable work habits as well.'

I've been reading a lot of peer-reviewed  publications regarding the anti-inflammatory diet, as I have a 'low-level' chronic pain problem, and a number of studies suggest anti-inflammatory agents do work for pain issues.  I also gave the material to a biologist friend who read the studies, and said the theory behind the anti-inflammatory diet makes sense, so equipped with these two reputable sources, I've been working towards an anti-inflammatory diet, which includes taking daily doses of many of the sources found in this product. The only area that I question in this product is the amount of curcumin available with it. The sources I've read recommend 1,000 mg a day, not as much as these capsules contain, but perhaps the other ingredients work synergistically. BTW, read the book 'Healthy Joints for Life' by Dr. Diana, former NFL player and Superbowl participant and now orthopedic surgeon/microbiologist for a good argument for these types of products specifically, and the anti-inflammation diet in general.

I'm not a jewelry expert, but my s/o really likes these. She wears black a lot, and I had a feeling that the bright silver sheen on these very well-made, symmetrical earrings would complement her all-black outfits. It turned out that my intuition was correct, and the recipient of these earrings is sophisticated and knowledgeable about jewelry, meaning I can't get by with just anything that catches my attention.  I don't think the image on the webpage does justice to how 'upscale' these earrings look. They are polished like a sterling silver tea set would be on the dining table at Downton Abbey. They are too new to judge how well made the clasp is, so I can't speak to that aspect of the product.

They don't make them like they used to can't be said of the AT-A-Glance planner. In a tech age where you have to learn to micromanage your fingers for smart phone use, tablets, texting and all the other miniaturized products and activities, this planner is sturdy, large, and connotes you have enough time in your life not to do everything at warp speed. It's practically counter cultural. I plan to use it homeostatically, that is to balance all the electronic gadgets that alienate me from real life contact of actual material rather than the virtual. Even the idea of having the ability to use an outdated writing instrument, called the "pen" should be enough reason to consider buying this rather than spending time with learning a new unpredictable app.

This is the only computer paper I use, except for printing photos. I've never had any printer problems with it, and it's very reasonably priced, and carrying reams of copy paper from the local office store is a definite hassle.

From the reviews of the older 820, The XP-830 seems to be a minor upgrade of the former. Ive always been hesitant to use all-in-ones because if something goes wrong with one function, you end up losing all functions. But Ive decided to give in for three reasons: first,  because Ive used Epson photo printers for several years and love the color and the fact  that theyve worked flawlessly, I have a very positive attitude toward Epson products. I also dont have a whole lot of space in my home office, and this unit is nice and small. And related to the second reason, theres the weariness of having so many cables around and searching for the right one when I need to reconfigure something.My fear of wireless going wrong was allayed. I didnt have any trouble in setting up the wireless connection.  One drawback of all Epson inkjets is the cartridge price. Im planning to do what Ive been doing with my photo printer: buy generic at least for the black cartridge. The colors might be slightly off if you buy generic cartridges for other colors, but its hard to mess up with the color black.If you are the type that likes the bells and whistles, like printing from your cell phone, tablet, etc., youll like this model. I dont really care about that stuff, but it seems that soon those features will be standard. My philosophy is the more you make use of such special unnecessary features, the more you have to learn and the more things are likely to mess up.But the print speed and the output quality, the two things that REALLY matter to me plus wireless make me happy Ive chosen this one, and even though Ive gotten this through the Vine program, the real expense is  going to come in the cartridges. The bottom line is that if I didnt already use my R1900 Epson photo printer regularly, I wouldnt have been so eager to match it up with another Epson, since buying cartridges for one brand will be easier than for two. But if that doesnt matter to you, Ive seen comparable all-in-ones for $100 or so.

My cat Samantha is nearly 20 years old and weighs exactly the same as she did when she was one year old: seven pounds.  She has never been sick, ever,  and can still jump up onto the kitchen counter whenever she wants. So I am very careful about the products I get for her. She loves this mixture nearly as much as she does those expensive bags of "treats," although she is not too excited about the main brand cat foods after about five or six days after they've been opened.  I'd attach a photo of "S" but I'm off to work.If you are willing to spend the extra money for this brand, do so.  If you have a young, healthy cat you might not need to.

The 'premium' branding of this cat food does not justify it's expense.  My cat -- who is 20 y.o., and has weighed six pounds all her life -- likes this product, but the ingredients do not indicate it's a high protein cat foot. It appears my cat is not throwing up as much, but I will have to wait to see if this is a result of the cat food or something else. I see no reason for the extra expense

'Dummies' books often vary in quality--both in terms of the content and the intrusiveness of dummy 'jokes.'  Happily, this has none of the latter, and is very clearly written with exceptionally clear illustrations. I bought it mainly to learn how to improve my profile, and it has excellent tips in that regard.  The only shortcoming of a book like this is that policies and platforms for social media sites seem to change fairly often, and books like this seem to have a shelf life of maybe 18 months to 2 years.Still, when you consider how much web searching you'd have to do to accumulate all the material, the money is worth it. This is a case where trying to get free information rather than buying it all in one document is penny-wise and pound foolish

I got this necklace for my wife, who likes it but says it's a bit flimsy, but appreciates it because she is a TRUE Christian, meaning she has compassion for everyone--and says she will wear it with her decorative crucifix to demonstrate of values.This isn't an item you'd get as that special gift, but it's nice as a thoughtful expression of caring and is not intrusive or overbearing.

Nice shirt, well cut and well made. I'm 6'2" and weigh 170, with long arms.  I'd be wary of purchasing this shirt if I were a big guy since it is cut on the snug side, and unless you're really thin, I wouldn't wear it tucked inside the pants, but rather the way it's depicted on the ad page.
If I had not been familiar with the book, I would have had a hard time understanding the plot. This is an attempt to modernize the story, but instead alienates the viewer from it.
I never imagined I'd enjoy a historical British TV series; but this one is both aesthetically superior and edifying. It would be terrific for viewing in a cultural studies program.
As clear and concise a workbook as you'll find; this is from using fives other workbooks with the same goal--preparing for the quant section of the SAT

The way to read this book is put on a white sleeveless undershirt, make your room look like an old tenement apartment (with an old rotating fan), and have a can of beer in one hand and The Girl with the Deep Blue Eyes (preferably the girl, not the novel--but the novel will have to do), while you get involved in a hard-boiled mystery featuring Doak Miller, a retired NYPD cop, now living in Florida, who has seen it all and done it all, but still has enough life in him to do some more. He drives a beat-up Monte Carlo, but knows how to surf the internet for research as a part-time P.I. He lives in a house with a dock, where he looks out on the sunset, but the idea of owning a boat or going fishing are as foreign to him as becoming an astronaut.He can get down with the local law authorities, and adapt his mood, accent, and style for whatever the occasion calls for.  He doesn't seem like a particularly slick character until about seventy pages in, when you realize he knows how to stay a step ahead of people that think they're staying a step ahead of him.There's a lot of twists and turns to the plot, and lots of semi-kinky contemporary sex scenes that wouldn't have gotten by the censor's axe 'back in the day.' But that just adds some spice to a typically hard-boiled novel (or a black and blue done steak).L. Block can  suit the action to the word, the word to the action, whether it's a serious, troubled character like Matt Scudder, or an ironic, educated one, like Bernie the Burglar.If you like the writings of Lawrence Block, you won't be disappointed. Not that it is necessarily the best novel he's written--the plot line borders on plausibility, but manages to stay within the genre's orbit.  A good novel by Mr. Block is a top-notch novel by any of the other mystery writers out there. And a four-star rating of one of his novels should translate into a 5-star one for just about anyone else.

I wish I could eat a couple of these a day. They are delicious and since they are made with dark chocolate, contain flavonoids, which have a number of healthful properties.  Unfortunately, nutritionists say to eat no more than seven ounces of dark chocolate a week owing to the fat content, but I might cheat anyhow.Notice: The bars arrived slightly soft and sticky, so I suggest you put them in the refrigerator for a while.

I scanned the image of this shower set to find the "14 pieces" and thought, "Maybe I'm missing something behind the curtain." But no, I should have looked up at the curtain rod and spotted those curtain rings.This is not the best quality fabric, although the colors are nice.  Truthfully, though, I think you could buy an equivalent item at one of the 'box stores' for a lot less. Luckily my bathroom has neutral colors so it doesn't clash, but like any item, don't trust the colors in a photograph to be accurate. In this case, the true colors were a bit nicer.

My cat weighs seven pounds and is nearly 20-years-old, and she loves this stuff. It seems to work well with hairball problems since she is throwing up less, but that also could be due to brushing her more.My advice is try it; it is just a couple of dollars more than the major brands, and a change of pace can't hurt. If you have one small cat, like I do, though, don't buy a large bag. Eventually, the odor will fade after being opened, and become less appetizing.

Basic mini-hub but seems to be reliable.  After purchasing a fairly pricey anker multi-port hub, which was extremely unreliable, I'm much happier with this trendnet product. It's sturdy, and another feature that makes this product better than the anker is that the latter has a fairly flimsy AC adapter that bent with use, and forced me to giggle it to get the proper contact.
Just like the first rendition of Classics Revisted, has the irreplaceable wisdom of Rexroth.
Best book of its type. Christa Meola uses minimal equipment but gets maximum results.  Shows how creativity and sensitivity trumps gear.
Very uneven anthology. I was hoping for something better. Maybe copyright on some classic noir short stories are above the publisher's budget.

I was truly disappointed by this book. It lacks the intensity and purpose of the works of Pelecanos and Richard Price. I think Tim McLoughlin needs to dig deeper. But if you can find his short story, "When it was all Bay Ridge," read it!
Best book of its type. Rexroth writes more informed and thoughtful analyses in two pages what Harold Bloom requires in five or six.You could spend a lifetime reading the books Rexroth remarks on.
I've tried some other Manhattan Prep books, and this one is the clearest written, and most helpful for the GRE.  If you only want to review geometry, get this one.
Sure these work fine in the Leitz stapler, but they're imported from England, and they're the only staples that fit the Leitz
Best pyjama bottoms I've ever bought (6'3", 175 pounds), size large.

This is a competent study guide for the new AP U.S. History exam, but it still has that stodgy Kaplanesque tone and design. If you want straightforward information that can help with the AP in particular, this is a good product, but I think it's far better to become engrossed in history through primary sources, and books written with passion--so you don't just learn for the exam, but to enrich your life. Another deficit in this 'package' is the accompanying DVD. Having worked as a writer of textbooks and A/V teaching aids, I think I can confidently state that the mini dvd lessons are worthless. The narrators read the teleprompters poorly, and the presentations are at about the level of a Speech 101 class.

I purchased a similar item for working with a standing computer desk, but it turned out to be bulky and cheaply made. I much prefer this one; it has a small foot print ; ) which is great for stand-up computer work, maybe not so great if you're planning to use it in a kitchen or shop where you move around a lot.  It's evident the product is made of good material, and the slope design on the edges should prevent you from tripping over it.

Just happened to be scrolling through some creative writing books, when my eyes fell upon this one: I read it about ten years ago, and it's hard to believe that not only is it still being sold, but it's popular as well.Bottom line, this is a silly, self-indulgent book, and won't help you write.  It is like an inspirational book that one reads; ponders; feels good about, and a week later, one asks, "Why did I waste my time reading that dumb book."  You can judge a book by its title, sometimes, and the title is as pretentious as the advice provided by the author.  Do you need to know what you call that metal harness that keeps a wine bottle cork firmly attached to the bottle?  As a writer, you need to know stuff like that, so the author made a wise choice and called up a local monastery that made wine, and was informed the item in question is called a "bonnet."  Yes, you too can learn such profound tips about the writing life. You see, it's actually hard work.  However, if you don't know that already, you're not a writer.

I have read dozens of books on creative writing, and I would place Gardner's The Art of Fiction at the top of the list, provided, that is, you already understand the basic components of fiction, and have already done some fiction writing of your own--published or otherwise.Gardner manages to dissect the soul of writing, not just the technique of writing, and that is the great strength of this book. However, without a basic education based on critical reading, and an attempt at developing your own writing talents, this book is perhaps a step too far, and I'd wait until one has mastered the basic tenets of fiction writing such as plot, character, voice, setting, descriptive writing, etc.But listing the elements of fiction is exactly what this book doesn't do. Rather, Gardner's grand plan is to review some of these elements in the service of understanding fiction writing holistically.  The book will teach you how to 'x-ray' your own writing and that of others.jNo other book has done this as far as I know.  The only persons that wouldn't benefit from this book would be those that already know the art of fiction thoroughly--but I don't suppose you'd know that until you read the book

This product might suppress odor for ten days, but really, do you want to test it out?  Not me.  I have 20-year-old cat that weighs seven pounds, and she likes it just fine.  I have always been concerned about clumping litter since I've heard stories of it suffocating cats. I'm monitoring my cat's behavior, and so far everything seems fine.

Terrific slow cooker.  I am at a loss to understand why the two appliances that make the most healthful foods, slow cookers, and pressure cookers, aren't the most popular cooking utensils around, since they both keep in nutrients, and cook the food thoroughly, and they're great for vegan diets or any other type of diet. This slow cooker is idiot proof in case you are the type that forgets you have something cooking: I'm backing up the "on-board" timer with my own, so as to be cued when the food is ready.I am trying to get back to my healthful eating regimen because the microwave makes everything taste the same, and besides, zaps the nutrients.  Talk about blending herbs and spices!  This does the trick better than any of those goofy gizmos that are advertised on infomercials.

Excellent to find the best position for cross drawing. Wear with loose shirt or sweater. Don't plan on eating a big meal while wearing. It will feel uncomfortable. Excellent value. No-nonsense design.

If you like to stuff garbage bags with as much stuff as possible, watching those bulges expand, and wondering how much you can stuff in before the bag bursts, this bag could be fun.  But don't include any sharp objects. They will slit the bag and ruin its capacity.

Harold Bloom has read a huge number of books, and has a vast vocabulary, but I don't think he is a good writer. His phrasings are often awkward, and he has a difficult time expressing himself. I attribute these qualities, in part, to his feeling betrayed or terribly disappointed by the way academia has decided to make works of literature case studies in cultural bias, patriarchy, and gender/sexual orientation. Additionally, I think he over represents this influence. It just happens to be that people that get to be the avatars of academic literary studies get the most attention within the field (that really should be reworded as "industry."Of course, the academics he derides are full of sh_t. The humanities variety go into the field because as Jorge Amado states in his novel 'Tent of Miracle," they want a pleasant and easy life (I haven't met any that volunteer in homeless shelters, or go to third world countries and actually do some labor). But instead of lamenting over and over again about these myrmidons, Bloom should just ignore the academic types he seems obsessed with denouncing. He doesn't owe anyone an apology for his "reading project." He has tenure, after all. Why not just tell them all to go f__k  themselves and be done with it.One consequence of his obsession is his seeming need to restore literature to its traditional role as the highest form of a particular aesthetic by presenting his interpretations in a dogmatic way. At the same time, he claims that you must read literature with an open mind, so that it is meaningful for the individual: a contradiction, it seems to me.So even if we start seeing courses like "Dwarf Literature" featuring Aesop and Randolph Bourne, or "Blind Studies" featuring Milton and Borges, there's no reason to lament. Bloom's lamentations remind me of someone who religiously watches a TV show, and constantly complains how bad it is.If Bloom just turned the channel, there might not be as much noise in his head that degrades his writing.

I really wanted to like this book, and I did to some extent, but it could have been better. I think Ron Perlman is an actor that truly considers acting an art and a craft. Unfortunately, he doesn't mention much of his acting method in the book--not that he had to, or that you can really explain acting technique in words--but some mention would be nice.Ron is brutally honest in his assessments and reflections, which is good. He had to overcome a lot of obstacles to become successful.  The major obstacle is that the movie business is so 'f---d" up that it had a hard time figuring out what "type" the actor was. But they complaining gets tiring after a while, since he will describe someone as "This F----g guy had the nerve... or "You want me to travel 500 miles for an audition for your "f____g" stupid movie? Are you "f____g" kidding me, you dumb f__k."  It's clear that Ron has a lot of things to feel angry about, but what does he expect from a business that dresses itself up as an "art form" You know the old saying, "It's called "show business" not "show art" for a reason.He's definitely correct. Lot's of the people he meets are real "fuc....ers" and lot of the situations he finds himself in are "f----d up." And worse, the "fuc___g public" doesn't know what the "f__K" is good or not good.Albeit some of the writing is actually good and articulate, but at times I got the feeling the memoir was more a therapeutic exercise than a presentation of self.I know the world that Ron Perlman is writing about, all the way back to Arrabal on Off-Broadway, and I also saw him in the original stage production of "A few good men."Overall, though, this memoir contributes to understanding what the 'glamorous' world of movies & TV.Ron seems to have the philosophy that "everyone I meet is an "A--hole" until proven otherwise.  That's a legitimate philosophy. It's just that this "f---king" interesting guy who describes how "f___d" up things are, wrote a "fu_king" bad book. But I enjoyed every minute of it.Peace, Pearl!

This lamp is OK, but two suggestions. Locate the place you want to clamp it and LEAVE it there. Otherwise it will be a hassle to adjust. And the second thing is it only has a five foot cord. You might need an extension cord. Also don't grab it around the shade. You'll burn yourself.
These look fabulous on my wife and she is willing to wear them. Win!
It looks fabulous on my wife but she won't wear it. Too sexy.
I bought the largest size. It is way too small. It is advertised as "US 12.5-14" but no way.
These look fabulous on my wife and she is willing to wear them. Soft and comfortable, and better for winter wear than ordinary (tissue-thin) leggings.

A classic. Really ugly, and the extra front-to-back piece of leather is not helping. But these are uniquely comfortable. I have been wearing Birkenstocks for decades. They are durable. If you can find the right rubber glue to patch up the sole and the exposed cork, they will last 15 years or more. Eventually, the leather, cork, and glue all disintegrate at once, but only after about 20 years.

The straps are easy to adjust. I used this in a swimming pool, doing laps. I experienced no fogging or water leakage. The silicon rubber is soft and comfortable. I can never really like the look of goggles, but as goggles go, these are A-OK. The carrying case is useful, though a bit bulky.

I have been using Panasonic shavers for years. In particular, I have been using a similar shaver for four years: Panasonic ES-LV81-K Arc5 Electric Shaver Wet/Dry with Multi-Flex Pivoting Head and Automatic Cleaning System for Men . Therefore, I can write a bit about durability. The old shaver still works great. It does not shave quite as closely as the new shaver (under review here) but it is still better than any shaver I know of. It is also possible that the new shaver is simply better, but I doubt it. Both shavers use the same "Arc5" blade system, and judging by the sound they make, both shavers have motors that operate at the same speed. Both shavers leave me free of skin irritation. The battery in the old shaver is still strong, it lasts me at least two weeks with daily use. It looks great too. One problem with the old shaver: the cleaning machine stopped working after a few years. But guess what: the new shaver does not feature a cleaning machine.Every Panasonic shaver I have owned has had a terrible pop-up trimmer, so I was not expecting much from the new shaver. But lo and behold, the trimmer on the new shaver is killer! It mowed the hair around my ears like crazy. Thanks Panasonic!I need to write a bit about the replacement blade kit. it is expensive! I replace mine once a year, and when I do, I get a faster shave. This indicates that I could replace  the blades more frequently. If the cost is an issue for you, you can consider a Panasonic shaver that uses the Arc4 or Arc3 blade system. Less expensive, and still better than the competition.The shaver is water proof. I use it dry, but I use a dilute solution of dish detergent to clean the shaver when it gets grubby. So easy! Unlike other shavers, this one is not *partially* water proof, it is simply water proof. I don't have to coddle it when I am cleaning it. I rinse it off in running water.I have included pictures of the old and new shavers in this review. Frankly, I prefer the look of the old shaver. Its plastic parts are all an honest black. The new shaver features silver colored plastic and it looks phony. I don't know if the silver color will wear off, or if it goes all the way through. The new shaver has a flashier LED display that does nothing for me. Finally, the new shaver has a new feature "shaving sensor mode" that varies the speed of the shaver motor in response to beard conditions. I think it is bogus. This feature can't make the motor go any faster, all it can do is slow down the motor for a while. Perhaps this improves battery life, or reduces wear, I don't know. The instruction booklet is no help. Because of the new feature, the power button has three stops "off," "sensor," and "normal" as opposed to the two stops "off" and "on" of the old shaver. Guess which arrangement I prefer. The new shaver features a modern grip-textured plastic on the back side that I like. The old shaver is made of glossy plastic throughout. Although I prefer the looks of the old shaver, the surface of the new shaver is a functional improvement.If I could find a shaver that is more durable, effective or quick than the Panasonics, I would buy it. I don't expect to find one.

The nutrients in this product can be had in various forms. I usually take two LARGE tablets. These tablets are small enough that the recommended dosage is three per day. You will find similar products that are sized so that the recommended dosage is two, three, or four tablets per day. It's a trade off: the large pills make some people uncomfortable. Many small pills are a hassle for other people.I am giving this product (only) four stars because I don't have a chemistry lab to verify content, nor do I have a twenty-year medical study to verify efficacy. I have no complaints in regards to this product.Side note: several years ago, I visited an orthopedic surgeon for treatment. You bet I asked him about the efficacy of the nutrients in these tablets. The expert replied: "I don't know." The honest man: I found him.I have been taking these nutrients for years and I still don't know if they are helping me. I am free of joint pain, but I also avoid stressing my joints.Comment

Cheap appearance, not as nice as the photograph. The lack of exact sizes is a big problem. It is going to look OK if your body fits the top, and not so great if it does not.What good is a sexy top if it doesn't fit?

Always nice to find clothes in size XS. My wife likes it. I like the way it looks on her.Rayon is an interesting material. It feels smooth and it is not as warm as wool. This makes it a great top for warmer climates.

The nutrients in this product can be had in various forms. I usually take two LARGE tablets. This product is in gelatin capsules, and these capsules are small enough that the recommended dosage is four per day. Viva Labs gives you a choice of forms. It's a trade off: the large pills make some people uncomfortable. Many small pills are a hassle for other people.I am giving this product (only) four stars because I don't have a chemistry lab to verify content, nor do I have a twenty-year medical study to verify efficacy. I have no complaints in regards to this product.Side note: several years ago, I visited an orthopedic surgeon for treatment. You bet I asked him about the efficacy of the nutrients in these capsules. The expert replied: "I don't know." The honest man. I found him.I have been taking these nutrients for years and I still don't know if they are helping me. I am free of joint pain, but I also avoid stressing my joints.
This is one of those simple and useful products that makes you happy when you find it. The material is a bit too thin for my taste.

The longer length (ten feet) is useful. I have observed that some families go through cables rather rapidly. One cause is that some people will stretch out their cables to get a charge while (for example) lying on a sofa. If the cable is bent at one end, it will fail quickly. The solution is a longer cable.I cannot find any difference in quality between this cable and an Apple lightning cable. The Belkin cable is fatter, which might allow it to last longer.

Summary: very nice insulated bottle, I find little to complain about.I filled the bottle with water from my refrigerator (cold) and put the bottle in my car with me. After two hours, the water was still pleasantly cool. For the rest of the day, the bottle lay on its side and did not leak. Good.The bottle fit (barely) in my car's cup holder and so it is a perfect size. For me, anyway.The cap "hinge" is of a good design in that it is thick and strong, but gimbals out of the way when you are ready to take a drink.The amount of plastic that comes in contact with your liquids is small. If the bottle is upright, the amount of contact is zero. Hence, no polluted taste. The stainless steel is inert.I appreciate that the plastic bits can all be unscrewed for cleaning. I did NOT appreciate the manufacturer's advice to keep the water bottle out of my dish washer. I dish-washed the bottle anyway and I do not find any damage. I will continue to do so and if I find any damage, I will take off a star. I don't love my water bottle enough to hand-wash it. It might be better to choose the unpainted version of this bottle. The manufacturer advises that the unpainted bottle can be dish-washed.

No shoe looks better on a woman than a simple pump. This shoe has a heel height that is a good compromise between comfort and looks. My wife can wear these all day if she is not doing much walking. The metal detail adds interest and may improve durability too.An excellent value in a leather shoe.

I have to park my car under a tree and so I need protection against bird waste and tree sap. The car cover does the job very nicely. It seems to be holding up rather well. The fit is close enough that it is secure in windy weather. It is not a "skin tight" fit that you sometimes see on expensive sports cars.When it rains, the water seeps through and mixes with dirt to make really ugly designs on the car. I can moderate this effect by washing both the car and the cover.

One of these CDs is "Garden of Joy" and it is great. Humorous, catchy, inventive. The other CD is a collection of "classic" American songs performed by Jim Kweskin. Classic, but awful. This CD is proof that most music throughout the ages is awful.
I got this for my wife and she reports that it does not do anything for her hair. No problem with this product, except that it does not do anything.
The fat grip is great. The eraser is big and fat, another plus. But the sliding sleeve fits too tight to work correctly. The pocket clip arrived cracked so close to useless.

I really like the way this looks on my wife. This is a *thin* leather jacket. My owl has a waist and this jacket follows it in. That is exactly the look that I wanted. At the time of this writing, the value (price) was great too.The jacket has a mild goat smell but I expect it to go away in a month or so.
I bought a box of 16 60-watt bulbs. The first two burned out quickly. Years ago, GE bulbs were OK. This lot came from eastern Europe.

I am going to compare this drive to SanDisk Ultra Fit CZ43 32GB USB 3.0 Low-Profile Flash Drive Up To 130MB/s Read- SDCZ43-032G-G46, to which it bears a strong resemblance. To the best of my knowledge, the Sandisk drive is the leader in the category of "tiny and fast."I have attached pictures of both drives while inserted into an HP notebook computer. The shape is different, but subjectively, the amount of "sticking out-ness" is the same for both drives. The Sandisk drive has a red LED to let you know when it is working. The Samsung drive has some holes in the plastic which might be for an LED. However my drive did not light up at all.I have attached Crystal disk reports for both drives. The Samsung is faster in some categories, the Sandisk is faster in others.One advantage that the Samsung drive has is that it does NOT become blazingly hot during use. The Sandisk drive certainly does.I cannot find a flaw or potential failure point on either of these tiny devices.The Samsung drive actually looks nicer. The metal USB part of the Sandisk drive has a soldered seam on it, which is almost universal to USB connectors on cables and flash drives. But the Samsung part is smooth, smooth, smooth.The heat issue leads me to prefer the Samsung drive. The deciding factor might be price.

I prefer to have an assortment of colored rings to match my clothes. This might not be acceptable to your spouse, but it works for me so yay! If one of you loses a ring, it is not a financial disaster. You don't have to start a war over it.Quality is great: perfectly smooth and uniform.
Such a simple thing. Useful and very colorful. Standard Asian quality: adequate.

I use this sleeve with two 13-inch HP notebook computers: HP Stream 13.3 Inch Laptop (Intel Celeron, 2 GB, 32 GB SSD, Horizon Blue) Includes Office 365 Personal for One Year- Free Upgrade to Windows 10 and HP Pavilion x360 360 hinge 2-in-1 13.3-Inch Touch Screen Laptop (2.1GHz Speed, 4GB Memory, 500GB Hard Drive) Silver . The sleeve fits both machines very nicely.At one extreme, you could use a dead simple sleeve like this one: AmazonBasics 13.3-Inch Laptop Sleeve . It has no room to carry anything except your notebook computer. At the other extreme, you could use this one: rooCase Apple MacBook Air MC234LL/A 13.3-Inch Laptop Carrying Case - Dark Blue / Black Deluxe Bag . It will carry your power supply, mouse, spare cables, and lots of other stuff. It also has a handle and a shoulder strap.This Case Logic sleeve fits right in the middle. If you only carry your notebook computer and some flat items, it will look great. My attached photos show how it looks holding HP's reasonably small power supply. Lumpy, but it works.I really like this sleeve. The main zipper wraps around a corner and that makes putting your computer in and out more graceful. The fabric exterior feels great on a humid or rainy day. Materials seem to be sturdy. The padding is slim so this sleeve is works best in a friendly environment, or placed in the middle of your suitcase.

This review is a joint effort with my wife.The main function of this gadget is depilation and that is no laughing matter. Talk about pain! But this gadget does it very well. Using it with liquid soap adds a small amount of comfort, but we tested this both wet and dry. In spite of the pain, we never experienced any bloodshed. Impressive. To be sure, we experienced red skin galore. But that went away. Quite effective, but we did resort to tweezers to finish off a few surviving hairs.The gadget includes a shaver head that you can swap in. It is a joke. It is vastly inferior to Panasonic shavers for men. I would recommend this one: Panasonic ES8103S Arc3 Electric Shaver Wet/Dry with Nanotech Blades for Men. Both the epilator and the shaver have a pop-up trimmer feature. They are both awful. Be aware, Panasonic shavers are mostly great, but their pop-up trimmers are all terrible.I am a bit concerned about the drive mechanism of this gadget. It is visible when swapping out the epilator head and the shaver head. The mechanism is plastic and it does not look robust at all.
Very nice and the price is half of what you would pay at a chain jewelry store. This ring is dead simple and so safe to buy sight unseen.

I was able to order the solid black version in size small. The last time I looked, this color/size was not available and that's too bad. I really like the way these pants look on my owl. If the pants were even slightly more "racy" she would refuse to wear them so these pants are optimal for us husbands.We have no complaints about the fabric or quality. At this price, these pants are a bargain. That is, if they last. Too early to tell, sorry.
I got the XS size and it fit my wife well. However the length is just too short. I really like the way this top looks on my owl but it exposes so much skin that I am afraid that she won't wear it.
I was happy to find a physical copy of this very early paper. The cover should show the name of the co-author: Paul Arnstein.Miss you, dad.

I have mixed feelings about this. There are a lot of negatives. The packaging was weird. We had to use a tool to extract the necklace from its box.This is not a good presentation. The chain is really thin. The front side appearance is OK, not great. The biggest problem is the back side. It is hollow. This really gives the impression "cheap." In the course of wearing this necklace for a few hours, the thing did flip over, revealing the unpleasant back side.All of this makes for a risky choice as a gift. Your girl might even be insulted. YOU DO NOT WANT THAT.But guess what. I gave this to my owl and she likes it! She wore it all day. It looks like she is going to continue wearing it too. That's why it gets 4 stars from me: The wife is always right. Funny how that works.

We had a very nice Conair hair dryer, 1875 watts. That's the same as this one. My owl was not happy with the Conair because it was not powerful enough. She considers this Remington to be the best hair dryer she has ever used.?The Remington is louder and larger. It has more features: separate controls for air speed and temperature (both high/low). There is also a button to temporarily turn off the heat. Finally, there are two small rubber bumpers, one on each side of the dryer. This will help to protect your counter top.The wife is always right, so five stars for the Remington.

My owl has been using a dense, white lotion on her skin for many years. This is a task that repeats at least once a day, every day. We tried this product in the hope that the spray applicator would save time.It worked. Spraying this directly on the skin and rubbing it in is faster than scooping the white lotion from a jar and spreading it. A disadvantage: you really should not use this spray near your carpets. The sprayer is decent, but mistakes happen.We found this oil to be pleasant. It makes my owl's skin look and feel nice. We also found the scent to be too strong for us. It is not an unusually strong scent, but it interferes with a cologne that my owl likes very much.Ultimately, the white lotion won out over this oil. It's a good product, but not good enough to overcome years of familiarity.

If you care about what you put into your body, this food is worthy of your attention. The list of ingredients is much better than other products in its class. There is no sinister "natural flavors" on the list. Here is the complete account:Hazelnuts, almonds, sugar, Macadamia nuts, Honey, Palm Kernel Oil, Tapioca Syrup, Cocoa Powder, Orange Zest (orange peel, sugar, citric acid), Sunflower Lecithin, Rice Flour, Vanilla Extract, Sea Salt. Most of those ingredients are organic too.The taste is much better than similar products. The dominant flavors are chocolate and nuts. The orange zest is just strong enough to break through and I find it to be very pleasant. A slightly salty taste lingers for a moment afterwards. And guess what: NO DISGUSTING AFTERTASTE. Like you get with the more artificial convenience foods, which is almost all of them.The only drawback is that the thing is rather melty. If you leave it in your backpack during a hike it is going to get really soft and sticky.Take it to the gym instead, it will be something to look forward to.

The 11" model is a good fit for an 11" Macbook Air. The hooks and straps that secure the Macbook in place do a good job. There is no interference with keyboard, trackpad, or display. When the sleeve is zipped up, the Macbook does not rattle around inside.Quality appears to be good: zippers work. Handles are securely attached. The stiff body of the sleeve provides protection, as advertised.Be aware that there is absolutely no space to store a power cord or a mouse. Zero.I did encounter a problem. The idea of this sleeve is that you can unzip it, unfold your computer, and go to work. I find that the weight of the sleeve pulls my Macbook open more than I would like. I could solve this problem by detaching the upper half of the sleeve from my Macbook. But that rather defeats the purpose of the sleeve, doesn't it? I have no idea if this will be a problem with other 11" notebooks.

I don't believe that it would be possible to make this cleaner any easier to use. That's really important for me. I have a two-piece rug cleaner that has sat undisturbed for TEN YEARS. Too much trouble to use. By contrast, the Hoover invites use.Initial assembly was easy. If you follow the instructions, you can extract the machine from its shipping box without lifting it. Rather, you turn the box sideways and slide everything out. Two large pieces needed to be fit together and secured with two bolts and two nuts. If you have a philips screwdriver handy, you can have it done in five minutes.The input and output tanks are both removable. You carry them to a sink or bathtub for filling and emptying. I found that I was able to do this without spillage. I did use a rag to wipe the tanks in my bathroom. That helped. There is a measuring cup for detergent, and you won't lose it. It is also the cap to the input tank. Both tanks have lids, which prevents spills during filling and emptying.The machine is a bit larger than an upright vacuum cleaner. Because it is itself an upright, storage is convenient. The power cord is long enough. You will run out of cleaning solution before you run out of cord.In use, the machine is rather good. I quickly settled into the rhythm of wet and dry strokes. The machine is somewhat heavy, so the best approach is to push and pull slowly. No sense in tiring yourself out. If you watch your posture, you can clean a lot of rug without hurting your back. It would be nice if Hoover included a steering mechanism. Turning the machine to start a stroke on a new piece of rug is a bit of work.I went for two tankfuls and got my dining area and living room clean. These are small rooms, you might need a tank and a half for a nice living room. I did not do a clean water rinse because I am lazy. I got a lot of filth out, and the rug does not feel at all sticky from the detergent. Perhaps rinsing is not necessary.Now I need to talk about durability. I don't have the luxury of waiting six months or a year to write this review, so take this with a grain of salt. This is an all plastic machine. The visible parts are thick plastic, including the crucial input and output tanks. If you are gentle with the machine, you might get a long service life. I am not impressed with the controls. The control for brush speed is especially suspicious. It is cheap, sloppy, and awful. The power switch and the spray trigger are not awful, but they do not inspire confidence. I am concerned.Overall, I like this machine. It is maximally easy to set up, use, and stow afterwards. It is about as lightweight as it could be. It might not last forever, but the price I saw today is still a good value. I surprised my owl by cleaning some rugs while she was out. She was appreciative, and when I promised to do some more rooms she was pleased. Go for it, and make your bird happy.

This is one of those simple but hard to find items that are so satisfying. The wire is *almost* perfectly straight. The base is *almost* heavy enough. On a good day, I might have given 5 stars.That base is the best part of the thing. It is smooth and pleasant looking.

Decent construction and design. The way the telescoping tubes twist into locked position is rather clever.The shutter button is absolutely in the wrong place, which makes it impossible to hold the thing steady while completing a shot. This is a fatal flaw that renders the other virtues of this stick irrelevant.

It is slow but it is adequate for web-browsing, document creation, and watching videos on Youtube. When playing videos through the HDMI output cable, it worked flawlessly.Battery life is OK. Memory and disk capacity are adequate, unless you are editing videos or something. In that case, you will find this computer to be too slow anyway. Computer is a bit too heavy for my taste.HP puts a ton of crapware on their computers and it is annoying. I spent far too much of my time removing this stuff. Some of it was quite stubborn, it used various tricks in order to make removal difficult for me.Touch screen works OK but so what. I cannot find any use for it. The hinge is interesting. You can position the hinge so that the computer is a tablet. USELESS. As a tablet, it is far too thick and heavy. Positioning the computer as a "tent" is OK though. I can place the computer on a kitchen counter and watch a movie while I slave away.This computer delivers very good value. For this reason, I would have given 5 stars (barely) if HP had lost the crapware.
The lead actor is terribly annoying. The lead actress looks fabulous in every scene. That is worth something I guess.

Style is the reason this cable exists. It is beautiful. The metal braid exterior is distinctive and functional. The hardware at both ends of the cable is likewise very nice. The cable fits my hardware (an iPhone 5S and a Dell peecee) very nicely. Not too tight, not too loose.Oh and the cable does function properly.In an environment where looks are important, this cable delivers.

Very sturdy and it is a nice fit for my HP Stream 13 cheapo computer. If anything, this case has too many storage compartments.If you forget which compartment you used to stash your precious flash drive, you will be in for a spot of frustration as you frantically work all of the zippers and pouches.Is that a minor quibble? Certainly! Five stars without hesitation.
The inside seams irritated my owl's skin. This singlet looks very nice on her but I am afraid that I will have to return this.

I bought one of these at Home Depot. It died after less than one year of light use. As well, I had the bulb placed in a table lamp with a big fabric lampshade, open at the top. The chimney effect provided as much cooling as any reasonable lamp could. Even so: fail.Not my best investment, that's for sure.

Very nice live recording. However the physical CD has some sort of copy protection scheme going. I got skips on my car CD player. I also got total failure on two different computers, so I was not able to make a copy either. Thus I was unable to enjoy the music on the CD. I sent it back.
It looks a bit dull. I don't think the product illustration is dishonest, but it should be more detailed. My owl was not impressed.

The quality and the fit is slightly better than what you get at the department store. But not by much. That is faint praise anyway, since what you get at the department store is so awful.For the price, the fabric is too thin. The fit is too short and fat. The V-neck is not deep enough for the modern man, who mostly sports an open collar.Price is OK, not great.

I bought these in order to make some space in my owl's closet. We applied them to high heel pumps, as in the product illustration.The stacked shoes are extremely unstable, and several pairs must be in contact with each other. Otherwise, they all fall down. This is partly due to the nature of tall, skinny shoes. But the instability is greatly enhanced by the nature of this product. It makes very poor contact with the shoes and so results in a wobbly assembly.Then there is the price. For a bent wire rod, it is terrible.
Good quality item but it is way too small. My owl normally wears size XS or S in all her clothes. The size S of this bra is much too small for her and makes red lines on her skin.

An auspicious Eastern symbol in the traditional colors of Chinese owls: red and black. A very useful combination! The piece I got had a slightly dull appearance. Not terrible, but enough for me to take off one star.

No problem with this cable. I would like to emphasize that the micro USB A fitting is rare. If you are not sure that you need the "A" fitting, then this cable probably won't work for you. You probably need the common "B" fitting.
My owl reports that this anklet irritates her.
Over-priced for what you get. Works OK though. In the software mass market, that is worth some money.

This is working well for me. It holds tight enough with a light load on it. Note that this gadget will have an asymmetrical appearance on your mike stand. This is due to the design of the clamp: The side with the knob is going to stick out more than the other side.
We really like the look of these shoes. However the beautiful red color has rubbed off in one place, revealing a black substrate. Honestly, they look so nice that we might just buy some more.

You won't mistake this ring for fine jewelry, but for some folks this is ideal. Both my owl and I picked the wrong ring size, even though we measured each other with a tape. We bought two more rings that are the right size for us and suffered no long-term financial damage. As well, we won't stress if we lose these rings.For what they are, all four of our rings are flawless. If your wife can accept a tungsten carbide wedding set, congratulations. You have chosen well. The rings are a good choice too!

This is the second Iottie "One Touch" mount that I have used. My first Iottie was great, but after a period of daily use, the mount became unusable. Problem: the mount's grip on my smartphone weakened. The phone would fall out of the mount. As you can imagine, this has the potential to damage both phone and car.My second Iottie mount is this one. It failed in exactly the same way. I suppose that there is a spring inside the mount that simply gets old and weak. This time, I checked the date of purchase. My mount failed after two months of daily use.I really don't know what to do next. The Iottie mounts are really useful. In particular, I don't know where I am going to find another mount that is able to grip the textured dashboard in my car. But buying a new mount every two months is a bit rich.

This gadget features a donut-shaped abrasive ring and a strong vacuum. Actually, three abrasive rings are provided. Each one is a different size and features a different "roughness." The vacuum is powerful. The abrasion is powered only by your arm: you have to stroke your face with the gadget.I have some wrinkles around my mouth and I could perceive some improvement after using this tool. It causes redness, but that fades after a few hours. On the other hand, I have a deep wrinkle on my forehead that did not respond to treatment. It got red and it got a bit sore. This condition persisted for days. Oh well, I don't think that wrinkle will go away without dynamite.The tool grinds off some of your skin and as such, it has a filter to catch the dust that was your skin. I just visited the Silk'n website, where I learn that each filter lasts for approximately 5 sessions. I also learned that thirty replacement filters cost $10. I believe that it is possible to rinse off these little filters, allow them to dry, and then use them again.

I use this device on a 5 GHz network that provides a strong signal. Mostly, I have used Netflix, Youtube, and Amazon. In my testing, video delivery is very good. If you have a fast enough internet connection, you can see some really beautiful video with this device.The user interface is OK, it took me about an hour to get used to it. The software has been completely stable in my testing. The remote is small, but very easy to use. Using the remote and watching Roku on my TV, I experience good response time and no quirks and bugs, with one exception that I will detail below. In spite of the exception, this is a huge step forward for living room network gear. Thank you Roku!The Roku does a bit of power management. There is no on/off switch. The device is always ready to serve. There is a power-saving feature though. The device goes to sleep after a period of non-use. The sleep/wake state is indicated by an LED on the front panel, so you know what's going on. The box stays warm when it is in the sleep state, which means that it is still using a fair amount of power.Sometimes the Roku becomes unresponsive when I am watching a movie. I push buttons on the remote, and the LED on the box blinks its acknowledgement. But nothing happens. This problem might be correlated with high bitrate movies. I get this problem while watching the Netflix series _Marco Polo_. I get this problem 100% of the time when I launch the Go-Pro channel, which displays high quality video immediately on launch.This problem is annoying. It is unacceptable in a living room device. On a peecee, maybe. But not in the living room.I find issues with the web browser interface, the IOS (iPhone) app, and the Android app. These items are potentially very useful. Entering text with a remote is very unpleasant, and sometimes it has to be done. Think: passwords, searching, and so forth. Wouldn't it be sweet to use a peecee or iPhone for typing?The web browser interface starts off great. This is the easiest way to enter PINs and add channels to Roku's home screen. But guess what. After I effortlessly performed these steps, there was no result on the Roku! The web browser interface is fake.The IOS app has potential, but it loses contact with Roku, constantly. The Android app has the same problem. These are both simply unusable.Finally, I am not happy about providing a credit card number to Roku. I believe that it is a security risk. And it is mandatory.

My sample was obviously packed hastily. I hope that Amazon does a more careful job when it delivers yours. Reason: the product packaging is pretty enough to make a nice gift.At room temperature, these chocolates are exceptionally creamy. The 7 ounce box includes several different flavors; I liked most of them very much. The marzipan flavor was the only one that was "meh." Very strong and pleasant flavors otherwise. I would have liked a bit less sugar in the mix, but I suspect that I am a minority vote in that election. The gift angle again: the inner wrapping, in printed clear plastic, is elegant.These chocolates are not as great as the best Belgian masterpieces, but they are very nice. I could eat them every day, that's for sure. A complaint: the list of ingredients includes "natural flavors." Translation: one or more substances that the US government allows us to call "natural," but would make you ill if you knew exactly what they are." On a more practical note, I observe that prepared foods with "natural flavors" taste worse than similar foods that include neither "natural flavors" nor artificial flavors.

The suction pad is amazing. The appearance is very slick, and it folds to a compact size. The push button clamp is wonderfully convenient. Problem: the clamping arms. After a few months of service, the spring that powers those arms became weak. My phone would slide down and out while I drive on a bumpy road.I have relegated this mount for use during travel, because it packs well. I bought a larger iOttie mount for every day use.Update: the larger iOttie mount failed in exactly the same way, after two months of daily use. I am sad.
It looks cheap. But a gray belt is hard to find.

Foam core is OK. The fabric cover is loose and moves a lot during use. Sometimes the zipper appears on top, later it rotates to the bottom of the thing. But that cover is removable for washing, which is great.
I really like the graphic design of this shirt. The fit is shapeless, not flattering. I suppose that this is good for professionals. The fabric gives off a "cheap and stiff" vibe.
Great idea. My wipes arrived halfway dried out. I could add (non-sterile) water myself, but that would somewhat defeat the purpose of this item.

I am not able to detect any benefit from this gadget. A three star rating on Amazon is considered negative, which would be too harsh. All I can determine is that in my refrigerator (heavy on fresh fruits, light on green vegetables) there is no benefit.Gadget is designed OK and does not use up much space.

So far I have only tested this box with fresh strawberries. I will try some other produce and update this review later.I started with one lot of fresh strawberries, sold in the typical clear plastic box, with clamshell lid. I transferred half of the strawberries to the OXO box. Following the hieroglyphic instructions on the lid, I slid the top vent into the open position. Then I waited a week.The strawberries in the clear plastic box  had degraded, certainly. They had dried out a bit, and were not great looking. Still tasty though. The strawberries in the OXO box were in really bad shape. Most of them were heavily infested with mold. Few of the fruits were edible. It appears to me that the OXO box had retained too much moisture. I could see condensation on the inside of the box.

For what it is, it is great: A very thin mouse for traveling with your computer which supports Bluetooth 4.0. If you step out of that category, you will not experience joy.The mouse will not pair with a computer that does not support Bluetooth 4.0. I tried to pair with two computers that only have Bluetooth 2.0. No dice. I did pair the mouse with two new-ish computers, and that went smoothly.This mouse is *thin*. Great for traveling with your elegantly thin notebook computer. On the other hand, a thin mouse is not ergonomic. I would not want this mouse on my home or office desk.This is a simple mouse with few functions. Left click, right click, middle button click, scroll up, scroll down. That's it. All functions work smoothly and reliably. The mouse looks pretty cool too. The finish is matte black plastic, which might not appeal to you. It looks great to me, and it does not feel slippery.The battery door is cool too. It secures with (hidden) magnets. You push down on one side (marked) and it tilts off the mouse, effortlessly.I am a bit miffed that Bluetooth 2.0 is not supported. I do not perceive any advantage to Bluetooth 4.0 in this mouse. I also experienced a bit of annoyance with keeping the mouse paired. I had to re-pair with a Windows 8.1 notebook computer that I have. Perhaps this is due to the fact that I had paired the mouse with other computers.

Centon did a lot of things right with this drive. The housing is mostly metal and so it looks nice. You get a red blinkinglight, and it is small and not too bright so it won't annoy you. Build quality seems to be good. The cap does not post on the back end of the drive, so you might lose it when the drive is in use. On the other hand, the cap fits securely over the USB plug. I don't think it will get loose with age; it is designed well.Why only four stars? Speed and price. I have attached CrystalDiskMark scores for this drive, and another drive "Silicon Power 32GB Jewel J80 USB 3.0 Flash Drive, Titanium (SP032GBUF3J80V1T)" that costs the same, as of this writing. The Centon drive writes much faster, but the Silicon Power drive reads much faster. Weird, eh?I have also attached  scores for "SanDisk Extreme CZ80 32GB USB 3.0 Flash Drive Transfer Speeds Up To 245MB/s- SDCZ80-032G-GAM46 [Newest Version] by SanDisk". This drive costs 50% more at this time, and its scores are much, much higher. This Sandisk drive is my current favorite, by the way.So there it is. Buy the Sandisk drive if you want the speed, it is great. At a lower price point, you have to decide if your need for speed is greater in the read department or the write department. I will certainly keep and use the Centon drive. It looks nice and, I need a drive with a cap. That's the kind of drive you want if you're going to carry it in a dirty environment such as a pocket, purse or backpack.

I perceive a strong nutty taste with a bit too much salt. Chocolate taste is minimal. I certainly did not experience a "dark chocolate" taste. I did not perceive excessive sweetness, although sugar is the number two ingredient listed on the package. Go figure. This snack is very crumbly, you might want to eat it over a sink or while you are at work.Overall, the experience is reasonably "natural." This is a big step up from most of the convenience food that I seem to be addicted to. I would like to point out that the list of ingredients includes "natural flavors." Translation: some stuff that the government does not require us to identify and would make us look bad if we did. I am not downgrading my score for this, only because all of the other convenience foods I have also include "natural flavors."
