Excellent cereal free dog food for puppies that grow quickly, ie., large breeds. the stated contents support the vendor claims. Fromm is a family owned business still and has an excellent reputation. For smaller breeds, there are other Fromm foods that blend cereals, good for adults.

Very bright bulb for the rated lumens--high lumens per watt--about 64 ,\lumens/watt. Noticeably brighter than the comparable philips bulb. However the color was very diff even though each bulb was clearly marked on the stem at 2700. One was much yellower and somewhat dimmer than the other. Typically the 2700 degree Kobi bulb have a nice color free of the yellowish cast some leds and cfls have that are rated 2700.
Not nearly as bright as the lumens rating suggest--comparable to an 8 watt LED
Good materials. Leather covers over the joints should be sewn through the leash. Instead there is a single bar tack on each joint.
The ears make it easy to install, the square wire insert that acts as the screw threads grabs tightly to wires and holds them securely. Note size for the gauge of wire you are working with.

Versatile cover. Protects against scratches and other abuses. Allows several options for standing the device horizontally or vertically. Has a "rubberized" paint that wears off in places if the cover jostles about in your back pack. But otherwise it has been very durable. I've used several Origami covers from roocase  for different devices and find them jut to hand to do without.sThe back has s a stiff plastic that holds the cover to the ipad.
very pricey but very good color, quiet performance, bright and well distributed illumination. Good all purpose bulb where you don't want directional light.

This cover stuffs into a sack small enough to fit your hand around. Waterproof, has a stay strap and a cinch cord to keep it on your pack and a drain hole in case any driving rain get in between you and the pack. easily fits a 32liter pack.
Has a polishing abrasive but only half the fluoride of some other Crest toothpastes.
Strong bits, well shaped. End spins free of shaft for easier use.
Has more fluoride than some Crest toothpastes. That is the ingredient that affects sensitivity and repair by promoting remineralizing of the tooth.

Reasonably good warm Color. Focused well. Quiet. Dims smoothly. 2700k bulb is noticeably Not as visibly bright as 2700k Kobi LED-AD-8W450-27 although both are rated 430 lumens and the Hyperikon has a narrower beam spread.

Works well but has a slight audible buzz, especially when lights are dimmed. Does not require a neutral wire and remains energized when switched off by running a a few milliamps through the load. This current running through the load while switched off can cause an LED bulb to be dimly lit while the switch is off--not enough to make a good night light but enough to see that the bulb is lit. If you have a number of LED type bulbs in parallel such as recessed ceiling lights, probably only one will be dimly lit. This doesn't harm anything but it can be confusing if you are not expecting it.Big plus: You can manually turn off lights by pressing the button--so unit could be used, for example, in bedroom.Holding the button allows dimming/brightening. The dimming works well with LED bulbs labelled as dimmable.If used with a 3-way switch then you have to wire the 3-way in a particular way so that the IPVD6 feeds the line to the load and the the 3-way works as a trigger for the IPDV6. The 3-way switch can turn lights on but won't always manually turn lights off. If you flip it on/off a few times, it will manually force the lights off.

I've used several brands and sizes and find the 26 inch Pik Stik to be the best all-around choice. Longer ones exhibit too much leverage; hard on your elbow.  shorter ones don't add enough reach for many cases..The pick stik classic has good jaws that can grab smaller or lighter objects (such as cereal box) with the pads and larger objects (such as fruit or vegetable cans) inside the jaws.The are decidedly durable and hold up to moisture and other abuse. I've never had one break. Have had one where the jaws popped out of place when dropped on the jaws but they can be popped back and then the device still works.

Disappointed with item. It outputs 4.7 A and 19.5 V  but lots of cheaper substitutions can be found that can do that. I'd recommend checking pricing on other power supplies that have the sony laptop plug and output 19.5 V 4.7A.  You can get reliable items at about $20.

Deceptive picture. The box has an ad for Proglide razor but the offer is not for Proglide Fusion cartridges but the plain Fusion cartridges, which cost less than the Proglide cartrideges. If you compare price, note if you are comparing to Proglide Fusion or Fusion cartridge. These cartridges will work on the Proglide handle but won't seem to be quite as nice...possibly this is why some folks think they have gotten counterfeits.

Nice, polished stainless steel (SS304 grade) with laser etched lettering. While the laser etching is not as deep as stamped lettering, it looks nicer.The item includes a small split-ring for attaching the tag to a collar ring or buckle.No rough edges. Nice item for the price. Better looking and much more durable than aluminum tags.
Sound quality is reasonably good but the amplifier is not balanced between the left and right channels. You might need a balance adjustment farther ahead in the signal line to compensate.
Very good paracord. Out sheath does not fray easily.
Stories typical of Vowell's work. Not laugh out loud funny, but enjoyable.

If you go through the reviews on this site and others you will find that all clips get complaints that they are too tight for some and too loose for others. That's how steel clips are, the range of material thickness with which they work well is relatively narrow.You can easily double the range by folding a smaller number of bills in half before you put them in the clip and for a larger number of bills, fold them in half after you insert them in the clip. If that doesn't work for you, then money clips probably are not for you, consider alternatives.folding them afterwards .  the ledovi sc15 works well with about five to up to ten layers of money--ten bills folded before inserting (twenty bills if folded after.)the sc25 works better for 20(40) bills.the SC15 is a thicker metal stock and I can't see this thing ever wearing out. It helps to loosen it it up a tad by spreading with a screwdriver blade....careful, a little spreading can make a big diff.If you have about 15 or so bills, they are hard to slide in or out. If you get down to say, four bills, they won't hold very well and tend to fall out. So if you plan to always carry about ten bills, then this clip works great.The finish on the metal is done well and the cuts and bends are even.For me it ended up being inexpensive but a disappointment. Other clips I've tried also had the tension issue except  for one. Pardon the "ad" but I don't work for or have any connection to the company. I'm just impressed with the product:Although very expensive, the Viper Titanium and mini-Viper Titanium clips have adequate tension yet can be expanded to hold up to a 1/4 or so of materials--the large size can hold 3/4 inch and then still hold a just a single piece of paper. Bills slide in and out easily -- best clip I've found--it does exactly what you want a clip to to-- hold varying amounts of bills and always slide money in/out easily while holding bills together in your pocket. They hold their shape and don't need an excessive amount of tension to do so.

This is a pair of items. They are a soft, flexible vinyl and will hold a soap bar above the soap dish, letting the bar dry instead of melt. This kind of plastic will slowly yellow with age and exposure to ultraviolet light. But for this price you can toss them out and replace.

This is a scalled donw in size version of the well known Redwing 50. This is possibly a best in class for this size bag. Compared to the 50-, it has all the same features except the load adjuster straps on top of the shorlder straps -- they would not be as useful on this smaller bag.32 litres is large enough for small trips, an overnight, or commuting with lots of items. I was able to compare to  Thule's meager choices and North Face's ReCon (29 litres). The Recon is slightly smaller and has a few less features but is equally well made and fairly priced and worth considering.In bags this size I would like a PADDED section for electronic tablets/laptops--this and most backpacks have non-padded or barely padded sections fro laptops or tablets. I would also like a zip-in-place or snap-in-place flap inside the bag to help divide/organize items -- most bags don't have that feature unless they are specifically for commuting and not hiking, camping, etc.The stitiching is even with no dropped stiches that I could find; very nice work compared to some of the commercial sewing done these days. Flat felt seaming along zippers is done evenly on tight seam margins. The fabrics are sturdy.  The maker warns that soaking in water can damage fabric coatings and wet wiping is the recommended cleaning method. No machine washing for this bag.If you never had a bag with a carry handle before, once you use one you won't buy a bag without one.

Based on price get the bundle for the body, lenses, and filters; the rest of the stuff is serviceable but cheap stuff you would never choose to buy individually. This is the case with most of these camera bundles.Shop around, this bundle can be a bargain despite all the throwaway items.The bag works but is small and the stitching cockeyed and uneven. The flash is bottom of the line but comes with a mounting bar that's useful.The macro and telephoto "lenses" are really adapters you put on front of your regular lens. They work but add a lot of distortion. You're better off just digitally zooming a pic than using the telephoto adapter.Mem card is rated 40mbp, (that's read speed--write speed is always slower); it's about half the speed you want for HD video. OK for photos if you don't mind a bit of a lag between shots.And so it is much the same for the rest..So forget all the stuff and buy based on the price for the body, AF/STM lenses and the filters.The t6s is Canon's best Rebel so far. Not the fastest, or sharpest but a relatively easy to use camera that is functionally robust. It has very good reviews of digi cam web sites. And for the money, it's one to consider for DSLR.The 18-135mm lens is a very good canon lens. quiet, reasonably fast and good re distortion when not at the extremes. Early rebels came with a narrower range lens and you'll find this one versatile enough that you will use this lens most if not all of the time.The longer range telephoto is lightly lower in quality but still very useful when you need to pull in a shot that's just too far away for the 10-135mm lens. Vendor called Focus (and maybe others) require signature for delivery and an online signature is not acceptable, so take that into account).

These cases are great, lightweight protection. You can shove the case in a pocket when you are using the camera. It's good protection against scrapes and nicks and minor bumps. They make many shapes and sizes and the stretch so it's easy to find one that will fit on your camera. Got to their website and you can use their product finder to find what fits your model camera and lens best.I get these for all our cameras.

Typical glass cover. Easier to place than plastic films. Prone to various failures due to easy clogging, sticky valves, bad pumps. Listen to samples, if you like, get more. If you're a Dylan fan, then you don't need any reviews to guide you.Less gravel than the last few albums. These goves are lasted with curved fingers. Great as far as it goes; one almost never does anything with fingers out straigh. But the gloves are lasted with the palms flat and one almost never does anything with palms flat. Even the natural relaxed posture of hte hand is with fingers and palm both sightly curved. So what you have with these as with most glves is a material that bunches up in the palm when you wear them.These gloves are tight fitting. The wrist is stitch with a bit of eleastic and is, imo, too tight. I bought ex-large becasue Large was out of stock and I could make use of them for my needs, They fit reasonably well, even a tad tight, very tight at the wrist--hard to get hand past the wrist into the glo ve, and, as expected, the fingers were about 1/2" too long.  So if you buy them you might want a size larger than normal.Can't speak to durability but the wear pads are surface stitched with a thin thread and the crotch of the thumb and palm has no reinforcement -- both bad signs.re warmth they are 100 gram thinsulate. If you want really warm gloves get ones with 150 g or 200g.

These cables a reasonably good for the money. If you want to step up from the $1.89 cables at RadioShack because you find the resistance too high, the insulation too thin, or the wire too thin, the these are the next step up before you start paying I-don't-care-what-it-costs prices.These have a woven sheath that makes the cable thick and very stiff. IF the temperature of above 70 degrees F, the cables are midly stiff and get more flexible ans the temperature rises. If the temp gets lower, they become very stiff. At 50 degrees or so, they are annoyingly if not unworkably stiff. They are suitable for use, therefore, indoors but not in a car.  It's rare to find cables this stiff. Otoh, they appear to be quite durable, the sheath offering a lot of protection against abrasions and minor sharp edges.The plugs unscrew easily and you would be wise to open them and apply a tiny bit of Loctite blue.  This is not an uncommon issue with Monstercable plugs.The outer ring on the plugs can be tight, but there are sufficient slits to allow for some slight flexibility. Some Monstercable plugs with fewer slits are nearly impossible to fit on some sockets..
Nice.  Made from microsuede so slightly easier to clean than real leather.

They will easily accept 12 gauge tinned wire, spade lugs, or bananas Making them better than the connectors on about 90% of the loudspeakers out there.

This has some ferrite rings with coils on them to filter out certain frequencies, some metal oxide varistors to provide surge protection ( they short out the circuit to ground if there is a voltage surge above a certain level--the are sacrificial parts), and a transformer with multiple taps to provide voltage regulation. Basically, if the voltage is too low or high, a relay changes to a transformer tap that boosts or lowers the output voltage relative to the input. This does not give 120V at every input voltage. The output voltages are shown below as a function of input voltages for the rated input range of the device. The values shown are nominal +/- 3 volts so actual out can range from 100 Volt to 130 volts.The sacrificial MOVs are an inexpensive way to provide surge protection. Non-sacrificial method would be to dump the surge voltage through a massive coil, which costs much more than MOVs. Unfortunately you can't tell when the MOVs are shot show you should replace the unit every year or so.Input______OutputVoltage____Voltage87_______103.35688_______104.54489_______105.73290_______106.9291_______108.10892_______109.29693_______110.48494_______111.67295_______112.8696_______114.04897_______115.23698_______116.42499_______117.612100______118.8101______119.988102______111.078103______112.167104______113.256105______114.345106______115.434107______116.523108______117.612109______118.701110______119.79111______120.879112______121.968113______113114______114115______115116______116117______117118______118119______119120______120121______121122______122.0123______123.0124______124.0125______125.0126______126.0127______127.0128______128.0129______116.6130______117.5131______118.4132______119.3133______120.2134______121.1135______122.0136______122.9137______123.8138______124.8139______125.7140______126.6These values are nominal +/- 3 volts so actual out can range from 100 Volt to 130 volts.

Great all-purpose glue. One of the best; it sticks to almost anything that any glue will stick to. It won't stick to vinyl but then, almost nothing will since vinyl isn't a bipolar polymer.The cap is poor; too short. It breaks easily when you screw it back on the tube, splitting the end, making the cap allow the tube to crust up and go bad.Be gentle with the cap and this glue will serve you well for most mending chores.

This item is slow to charge yet it depletes quickly.With the Maxboost Electron Plus starting at 100% charged and the IPad 4 at 28% charged, after 6 hours, the IPad was at 56% charged and the Maxboost was at 7%.To return the Maxboost to 100% charge on a 2amp output charger took over 10 hours.A good rule of thumb is that a charger made of batteries will charge another device that is rated for half as many mAH (milliamp hours). If the device to be charged is rated at 100 mAHs, then you need an external battery of at least 200 mAHs. The Maxboost Electron Plus more or less fits within that rule. I wouldn't expect it to fully charge an IPad 4 battery, which is rated at about 11500 mAHs. But I would expect it to do a little better than charging it form 28% to 57% before being itself nearly depleted. I suspect the batteries within the Maxboost are optimistically rated.The display viewing quality is so so. It is clearly readable only an a very narrow angle, about 45 degrees below horizontal. It is marginally more useful than just one or several LEDS.The display says "Out" whenever it is not being charged. So even sitting idle, connected to nothing, the display says "Out."  When charging it says "In."It does have an auto shutoff to timeout the display to save energy and you can manually turn the display off.The next test is durability and reliability over time.
One of Poco's best set of performances. Perhaps Poco's best album.

Okay for the money. A number of people have said that this feels solid. It could be they are feeling the heft of the several pairs of transformers inside the box. Transformers balance impedance and allow attenuating volume. The volume control knobs click in steps--each step is a diffrent tap on a transformer. So far, so good. I wouldn't overload this unit or you will saturate the transformers and get distortion to beat the band.The output connectors are kind of cheaply awful--lugs or larger crimp connectors would have been better. Each connector  has a small set screw to hold a bare wire stub, or better yet, one tinned with solder. Each wire connection is very close to one or two others (8 on each 2" connector strip), so be careful no bare wire is sticking out or you can short your receiver/amplifier outputs. A short would likely turn your revceiver/amp into a brick.The output connectors are attached directly to the single circuit board in the box and, if you nudge the box much, then the weight and stiffness of the speaker wires can pull on the connectors enough to disconnect the connector strip from the board inside the box. You can pop it back in place but it's not something you will want to mess with. So, once you are all set up, don't move the box around or you can suddenly lose sound in one or more channels.This isn't a bad box for the money.
Works at advertised speeds but one of the two I received has a defective activity light. This isn't critical but makes me wonder about the quality control and the general quality of the components.

A very nicely, accurately sized and shaped glass screen cover. The cutouts are placed accurately. It does not interfere with use of the phone and, if it does get scratched, it's much easier and cheaper to replace the glass cover than to get a new phone screen.Installation is very easy. The cover comes with a backing film on it that has two ears or tabs sticking out on either side. You can hold the cover by holding the tabs and not have to touch the glass -- so no fingerprints when you install.You position the cover by holding the tabs of a backing film that removes easily when the cover is in place. Just follow the directions steps by step.Cleaner fluid, cleaning clot, and clear and simple instructions are provided to ease installation.The feel of the tempered glass cover is the same as the original screen and doesn't add friction the way plastic covers do. Plus the glass cover is much harder to scratch. I used to replace plastic covers about once per month. Glass screens have no visible wear after months of use.The vendor provide the unit to me for review.

Good quality. This hose has qood quality fittings made of brass. The tubing inside the metal wrapping is not the expanding, stretchable type that some similar showers hoses have. This has a stiffer vinyl tubing. I find the stretchable hoses, with the rubber tubing tend to break sooner, usually rupturing at the points of stress, near the fittings.The fitting on showerhead end of the hose is a standard depth but might be too deep for a few showerheads that  don't have a long enough threaded end. In that case use an extra washer, not Teflon tape.I recommend against using Teflon tape with hose fittings. Hose fittings don't seal at the threads; they seal at the mating surfaces that that face the washer. If you don't have a good seal, these surfaces are not parallel and securely pressed against each other. Adding Teflon tape will cause the threads to bind and they might bind before the sealing surfaces are brought fully together--this can keep the washer from sealing.

This is a very good product at a good price. There are lots of portable USB chargers on the market. Some you can buy in convenience stores for a few bucks.  But I wouldn't trust the cheap chargers. A good charger is one you can use confident that it will not start a fire or cause your battery to explode.  The New Trent is a good charger.A USB charger has to handshake with the device to be charged. That is, they trade some info back and forth and the charging rate is established. Charging a lithium battery too quickly or too much, then the battery can explode. Lithium battery devices contain circuits to prevent overcharging. I trust the New Trent not to overcharge.Some batteries will charge more quickly than others because some will accept the higher amperage offered by the New Trent, some will not. Because some batteries are designed not to accept the higher amperage, they will not charge faster than with a standard USB 2 or USB 3 charger (.5 amps and .9 amps respectively). There is nothing you can do about thatits the batteries, not the charger. But most will charge faster. Those that accept the higher amperage will cause the charger to get warmer, but I haven't found it to get hot. This is a sign that it is well designed to handle the heat it develops.It is somewhat larger than other portable USB chargers but I suspect this is partly how it handles heat better than other 2.4 amp chargers. It contains two ports, so it ends up using less space than two chargers on a power strip. It appears solidly constructed, with neat, even seams, no molding cast outs, or loose parts. The plug snaps firmly into open and closed position --a weakness on many other retractable plugs.Bad points: The labeling of the ports is tiny and the ink is faint gray, so it is hard to read except in very good lighting conditions. If you buy one of these, get a sharpee oil paint (mark on anything marker -- http://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B007SYVP50?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_search_detailpage) and mark the outlets so they are readable.There is no pilot light to indicate charging or that the unit is conect to power, which might matter to some folks, especlially with a twenty dollar charger..The vendor provided the unit to me for reivew.

From the Amazon vendor the hat arrived well crushed and creased but direct for Tilley, stuffed with tissue, carefully padded and then wrapped again in tiussue and in a properly szed box,a it arrives somewhat crushed and creased.  It's not for formal wear but you can get the worst bends and creases out using a steamer or steam iron, after which the hat looks liek casual comfort. To steam, stuff the crown with a large towel, the helps to hold shape and give you something to hold onto while steaming.  A few minutes is all it takes.I found the fit slightly small so order a 1/8 up from your usual size--the hat should not be a tight fit--it shouldn't squeeze your head. Tilley says be able to fit two fingers between the hat band and your forehead. I expect it to wear very well like Tilley's do.The flaps are helpful but not as good as ear muffs or a knit wool cap pulled over your ears. But together iwth the warmth from the hat, you can feel comfortable in sub-freezing temps if you are walking or some such equivalent activity.

Worked fine for me, reliably for about half a year and still going. The connector fits fine in the laptop socket--standard Sony Vaio power socket. It doesn't getting any alarming hot spots when in use.Just fyi, the Sony original power supply lasted about a year and a half.

Heats evenly. Is relatively ruggedly built. Having worked in the fitness and nutrition field professionally since my late teens, I've read many books on abs and weight loss. I really resonated with this book because Ive never been naturally good at sports or academics; but through goal setting, hard work, and constant study, Ive managed to become successful.Teachers scorned me for being a terrible writer, but through persistence and study, Ive become a half-decent writer.From Mindset, youll learn why an endless challenge-seeking learning style is the key to growth in any realm or stage of life.I think Mindset is a must-read for everyone, but especially for parents, teachers, coaches, managers, and leaders. Carol shares her research about a fixed versus growth mindset and how the former can be disastrous for people who lead others.Youll learn why successful teachers, business leaders, and coaches praise effort and curiosity over ability and talent. Theyve learned that when we, often mistakenly, praise abilities and talents above other aptitudes, it can backfire.Carol provides examples of many athletes who failed because they relied on their talent to carry them through, and why the most successful athletes throughout the history of sports have succeeded because they grew better through persistence and constant practice.

In A Whole New Mind, Daniel Pink provides a compelling argument that right-brainoriented skills setsempathy, creativity, design, synthesis, and pattern recognitionare the ingredients for a holistic mind-set, todays prerequisite for business success and a meaningful life.Engineering, accounting, law, and codingleft-brainheavy professionsare now being outsourced to India, or performed by computers and robots.Pink gets into detail about how left-brainfocused professions, including medicine and business, are now placing a huge emphasis on right-brain smartness. He discusses how empathy and listening are the new sought-after skills for physicians and how business recruiters are favoring art degrees over MBAs.I think this book is important for anyone entering the workplace, looking for work, or heading up a company (CEOs and managers). The tools and tips discussed can help current businesses stay innovative by sparking right-brain activity through incorporating laughter, fun, and spirituality into peoples workflow.I like Pinks portfolio sections at the end of each chapter that provide how-to exercises for increasing your right-brain activity.This book will spark your creative juices and encourage you to think differently about work and meaning in your life.I give it five stars!

Jimmy is an amazing teacher and educator. This book has a great best blend of background science, interesting personal stories and practical application. I would highly recommend to anyone who is serious about losing weight and slowing down the aging process.
This is my third LaCie external HD. I've traveled all over the country filming interviews and it works wonderfully. Highly recommend; especially if you're into video/photography!

2:09 Mins It's a great book with over 240 pages of content and another 150 pages of real food recipes designed to help you tune up your metabolism, balance blood sugar and reduce inflammation all by increasing the health of your gut microbiome.Dr. Mullin gives you the inside tract as to how these trillions of bacteria orchestrate your physiology; including thoughts, food cravings and level of body fat.If you've hit a weight loss plateau, have been on a low-carb, high-protein diet for an extended period of time this book will benefit you tremendously. I say that because Dr. Mullin shares the science about how microbiome shifts can slow down weight loss efforts and how to overcome them with his patient-tested 3 Phase protocol and recipes.The biggest aha moment for me was learning how high-meat diets impact our gut ecology. Now, more than ever, I'm motivated to make meat a condiment (rather than a staple) and boost my intake of phytonutrient-rich vegetables.

I like to read in bed at night but used to read on my iPad, but it was hard on the eyes and would keep my wife up. Also, the iPad was hard to read in daylight. This one is nice because you can increase light intensity on-demand. Turn up in dark rooms and turn off in daylight. I love it!
1:35 Mins I travel a lot for work, so I really enjoy this desk. It fits in my overhead bag and I bring it on all trips with me. Study and easy to use.

I know the owner of MCT Lean, Karen Malkin. She is a  fantastic healer and nutritionist. Her blend is very clean, tastes great and mixes easily. Arguably one of the best vegan products on the marketplace.
I think the glycolic cleansing mousse is the power-house in this formula. It really works well to tighten up skin.

I give this a 5 star! Dr. Christianson was kind enough to send me an advanced copy prior to a podcast we did this past fall. I found The Adrenal Reset Diet to be the biggest breakthrough in adrenal and hormone health yet. Dr. Christianson shares shocking science that many people may not know: imbalanced cortisol rhythms are a strong predictor of an early death (even more so than obesity and smoking).Thankfully, Dr. C provides step-by-step lifestyle tools that help you reclaim the health of your adrenals, metabolism, and cortisol rhythms.You'll learn advanced tactics for nutrition and meal timing, carbohydrate cycling, stress reduction, exercise programming, and how to get the best sleep ever.Dr. C cuts through the noise when it comes to nutritionally supporting the adrenal glands with dietary supplements and real food. (Many companies provide kitchen sink adrenal formulas with herbs and glandular products that counteract one another.)The biggest discoveries for me were the progressive muscle relaxation strategies and bedroom light tips discussed in the book; they have really helped my wife and me to luxuriate in deeper and more restful sleep.If you implement the concepts in this book you'll lose weight, increase daytime energy, strengthen mental focus, open up sexual drive, and sleep better! They worked for me.
Love the microphones. This case is easy to travel with as well. I interview healthcare professionals and have had great results so far with these microphones.

My standing desk is near a window and I was getting a lot of high-pitch tones for recording podcasts. These panels really helped to turn the home office into a more professional sounding studio. Working on my audio book now too.
I have two of these. One for garage studio and one for office studio. Easy to tear down and set up. LimoStudio makes great stuff. I have their lights too.
These are excellent for keeping my videos looking good with green screen and white-screen look. These are a must.
I installed these in my home office. Great for making higher-quality recordings. Really adds nice throaty sound and enhances podcast.
Great memory! I have a few of these lying around for Sony and GoPro
Timeless book loaded with strategies that will change your financial outlook on life forever. Highly recommended, would start reading as soon as you can--no matter your income level.
I travel with this for interviews. Great piece of equipment, easy to operate.
Excellent lighting! I am finally able to get the infinity white look going on. I wish I had purchased this lighting sooner. It's easy to travel with for interviews as well.

This book is loaded with simple, powerful and timeless concepts that will help you optimize your success in the life. This is my once a year read to make sure my mind is in the right place. Thanks for the great work Darren Hardy!

Dr. Finker is a great clinician and healer. This book is an excellent read. She reveals many natural approaches to treating complex conditions. Give it a read if you want natural alternatives to improve your health.
I have ben a follower of Gary Vaynerchuk for a while but he really nailed it with this book. I like the pictures and real-world examples. Fantastic read.
This is a very quick read but great resource. It's at my desk when I'm writing email, social media posts and blogs. If you're producing written content this book is a must.

I've ben following Esther's work for years. All her books are great, but in Cavewomen Don't Get Fat, she tackles the core issues that many women struggle with: digestive issues, hormone imbalances and low energy. This book has time-proven tips that will help you get the results you are looking for.

This was the first book I read after graduating college in 2006. I re-read it this past summer as a refresher. It's a great once-a-year reminder to fine-tune timeless people skills that will help you in all areas of your life. Highly recommended for everyone.

This is an eloquently written book with sound advice for anyone that owns, or wants to own, a business. This was recommended to me by my friend Dr. Ben Lynch and I am so glad I read it. I realized that a lot of flaws in my open skill sets that would prevent me from business success had I not read this. It's a must for all entrepreneurs.
I've read this book twice in the last year. The timeless lessons sprinkled throughout have changed my perspective and communication styles. This is a must for anyone that wants to thrive in business.

This is a book all MEN should read; no matter age or health status. Dr. Goodyear is a true pioneer when it comes to improving health and optimizing hormones-- and it shows with his latest book. There are so many nuggets that one can learn from this excellent book to not both improve testosterone and also to maximize overall health. Dr. Goodyear reveals how belly fat can be causing low testosterone and what you can do about it. Also he gives insight into the sources of many hidden toxins and estrogens in your environment that maybe causing ill health.

I really resonate with Brenda's overall message: digestive health and the type of bacteria in our intestines must be addressed if we're going to successfully lose weight and keep it off. Even more, the "gut factor," as Brenda has tagged it, is honestly the foundation for whole-body health. This is no longer a proposition; it is an essential understanding of the functionality of the human body, backed by a vast amount of reliable quantitative and qualitative research.Brenda shares personal lessons that she learned from the experience of restoring her digestion and gut health after long-term exposure to antibiotics and medications. She includes charts and diagrams that will help you evaluate the state of your own gut health (and "inner ecosystem"), and she supplies ample success stories along the way to support you in your quest to reclaim your health.Each chapter has a summary and action steps that you can implement right away to reclaim control of your gut and, ultimately, your health.
Amazing book. I have read this book TWICE now and it's loaded with notes. It's essentially a 'cliff notes' version of Cialdini's previous writings. I highly suggest.

I really like Ramit's laid back and motivating attitude here. He is a writer and will push you to get off your butt and start spending wiser, and investing NOW. This is a must for any mid 20's through early 30's who haven't taken investing very seriously yet.

Although our family eats a diet rich in nuts/seeds, lean protein, and locally grown vegetables and fruits, we found Dr. Perlmutter's recipe book to be very informative. I gained a lot of new ideas from the many soup, sauted greens, and grilled vegetable recipes that we've already started to make in our kitchen. (It's easy to get in a rut in the kitchen and eat the same old stuff, but this book will help anyone, at any culinary level, clean up AND spice up their diet with some fresh recipe concepts.)While many recipe books can be intimating due to the amount of shopping time, prep, pre-cooking, and heating, The Grain Brain Cookbook: More Than 150 Life-Changing Gluten-Free Recipes to Transform Your Health calls for a minimum of fresh ingredients and preparation. Another great aspect is that each recipe includes the nutritional profile (calories, fats, carbs, fiber, and protein, etc) of each ingredient.I tend to cook fish the same way every time (butter, garlic, and lemon juice), but thankfully I now have tons of options to choose from. The same goes for meats.I think families will resonate with the chapter about snacks. We gathered a bunch of great ideas from that chapter as well.Last but not least, Dr. Perlmutter reminds us about the key takeaways from his bestselling book, Grain Brain: The Surprising Truth about Wheat, Carbs,  and Sugar--Your Brain's Silent Killers inflammation is the root cause of all dis-ease, and the processed foods so pervasive in our diet today ignite a smoldering fire in our bodies and brains. When this low-grade fire starts in the brain, it may go unnoticed until it's too late. As such, Dr. Perlmutter reminds us that everyone, including children, need to start making better food choices right now.Thankfully we now have the practical tools to do so, and the recipes are congruent with this anti-inflammatory theme: rich in healthy fats and inflammation-busting herbs, spices, and vegetables.
Great sound. I use this for webinars and podcasts. It's really worth the money and better than Yetti or snowflake.
I've read a lot of books this summer but this one tops the charts. This is an absolute must read for educators, small business owners and entrepreneurs. I enjoyed it so much I may even read it again!

Dr. Raphael Kellman does a great job exploring the importance of the forgotten metabolic organ inside our body: the microbiome. He provides the science that will convince you to stop the calorie, carb, and fat counting!Instead, Dr. Kellman suggests a better approach: a diet that is healthy for your gut AND gut microbiome. I couldn't agree more! He also discusses how eating Western foods (sugar, grains, soy, gluten, processed fats, and dairy) can activate the immune system and lead to cravings, inflammation, and fat storage.I really like how Dr. Kellman reveals simple strategies and food choices that we can all incorporate to improve the health of our microbiome, including herbs, spices, and lesser-known foods that have prebiotics to feed our good bacteria.Last but not least, I found chapters 7 and 8 to be most informative about stress. Balancing stress and mindful eating are major areas that many people underappreciate, and Dr. Kellman points to the science that shows how stress can disturb your gut bacteria and make you fat.
This book is loaded with many fantastic public speaking tips and tricks. It has changed how I present and teach. Must read for those who give talks regularly!

Dr. Bland reveals a cutting-edge blueprint to help quell complex chronic diseases, including obesity, diabetes, cancer and heart disease. He eloquently explains the crux of the problem with our current health-care infrastructure: its optimized to manage trauma and infectious illness, yet chronic diseases arise from many different causes. As a consequence, many are forced into the polypharmacy trap. Thankfully Dr. Bland reveals the true origins of many common ailments and chronic diseases; and supplies readers with natural, science-based solutions to help solve these ailments. This is a great read for everyone.
I really like this overview. I've been a fan of Dr. Ben's research and teachings for quite some time, this review succinctly cleared up some unanswered questions for me.

Im so impressed by this author! What a fresh writing style. Unfortunate Souls (Book 1) by Jade M. Phillips, starts with a breathless description of death that is both riveting and disturbing. Do you know what dying feels like? I do. And believe me, it is not something I would recommend. And she goes on to describe the coldness of it that actually made me reach for a sweatshirt. It unfolds into an incredible paranormal story. The author writes in such a way that everything seems real, everything as if you were there . . . really amazing. Cant wait to read more. Highest recommendation. Five stars.

Warning these books are addicting  fortunately, she has written at least a dozen of them! Murder At The Bed & Breakfast: A Liz Lucas Cozy Mystery, by Dianne Harman, is one of the best! The first paragraph of the prologue ends with the line. . . . a person wearing a ski mask dressed entirely in black barged into the room. Ive adored all these books. The author takes us to so many wonderful locations. Relaxing and warmly described filled with ordinary and friendly people we feel like we know  the occasional rogue and, of course the killer, too. She sets up the perfect atmosphere for us to want to figure out who did it. Clever and crafty. Everyone who has read her other books will be happy for this new addition and anyone who likes cozy mysteries or a great story will enjoy this and any of Harmans book. Highly recommended. Five stars.

Impossible to read without smiling. Makes me want to get more of the books. My son has memorized it. Wonderful! Stevie - Big Red Balloon: DrinkyDink Rhymes, by Paul Williams and William O'Brien, is special. Recommended. Five star.

This has been a riveting series. Toxic New Year: The Day That Wouldn't End (Alex Desephano Series Book 4) by Judith Lucci, is another thrilling story and several times really surprised me. If youre up to book four then you know how realistic and exciting her books are  a true page turner. Higly recommended. Five stars.

This is a great little set. My son had it on his wish list for a long time because of the purple an blue "lightning bolt" pieces. The little spider vehicle is great. Fun build  and good value. Love Lego and great amazon selection. Highly recommended. Five stars

I could see this as if watching a movie. Drama and passion push this story. I love the music and the Dallas, even with the mistakes. The authors have populated this book with true characters. So quirky, intense and funny that they must be drawn from real life. Im sure I know a few. Fortune Brawling (The Fortune Series Book 2) by Hunter S. Jones and Jennifer Theriot, is another fun and exciting read that will entertain. Recommended. Five stars.

Exciting read. The Starbirth Assignment Part One: Shifter, by J M Johnson, is quite an adventure. The author manages the impressive feat of combining genres and pulling of a sci-fi thriller. You can tell a lot by the first line of a book. If Lock had been alone he might not have been quite so terrified, but he wasnt alone. The author pushes and pulls us through the book like that  love it! Looking forward to the next one. Recommended. Five stars.

This is a fast and suspenseful read. Cisco Bandits: A Gwynn Reznick Novel, by Inge-Lise Goss, is filled with action and drama. Gwynn is a wonderful character -  smart, brave, clever . . . Gwynn charged into the bedroom, dropped her robe to the floor ad swung a holster over her shoulderThis book was a surprise, because although Id heard this was a great thriller, I wasnt expecting to discover a new favorite author. Recommended. Five stars.

The word gripping gets tossed around quite a bit these days. But in this case it definitely fits.Life in the remote town had been peaceful and quiet---that is, until people began disappearing, some even turning up dead on the beach. After the sun set and darkness fell on the picturesque streets, dark indistinct figures could be seen roaming through town.Kind of makes you want to rethink your vacation plans. The Dead Game, by Susanne Leist, is difficult to put down. Paranormal surprises and drama leap across the pages. This is a chilling tale well told and I cant wait fro more from this author. Recommended. Five stars.

Like a wizard stick. Small and powerful. Not as fast or high capacity as some, but for the price and the size, these are amazing to have around and give to team members. Never not have what you need again. Easy to fit on any keychain. Highly recommended. Four stars.

Whoever is putting these British Mystery Multipack collections together is brilliant. The best stories, wonderfully presented - great stuff.The Big Bow MysteryThe Four Just MenThe Invisible ManThe Wrong ShapeThe Valley of FearThe Doomdorf MysteryHighly recommended. Five stars.

Another collection of thoughts, or more like dreams, somehow captured and put to paper. The author seems to have a magical way of catching fleeting moments of inspirations, of love, of hope . . . of things hard to see, and showing them to us. Love, Love Hearts, Love Mist: Tiny Thoughts - Vol 2, 7 & 8: A collection of tiny thoughts to contemplate - spiritual philosophy, by William O'Brien is something special, part philosophy and part mystical. Highly recommended. Five stars.

Im a great fan of great opening lines and this one is on my list.Inspector Cullot had only been staying for two days at Ye Olde Boar in the Valais region of Switzerland when he knew that there would be at least two murders committed at the hotel over the next two days.Wow! How can you not read on? Exotic location, intrigue, murder(s), that may or may not be preventable, the smart inspector, its all there and more. And I can tell you that, The Case Of The Pinioned Bosoms: Inspector Cullot Mystery Series Book 2 by Alan Hardy, does not disappoint. A story full of surprises, perfectly written - and Im a fan of this author, too! Highly recommended. Five stars.

A personal story set in historical context. Soldier Story: I Was A Cold War Soldier, by Thomas Jerome Baker, presents a powerful memoir as set against the backdrop of history in a time when we came closer than ever before to WWIII. Yet, reading Bakers story is more than a history lesson. We share part of a fascinating life. Well written and inspiring. Highly recommended. Five stars.
Yummy and made of such good ingredients that they are almost good for you - okay not really, but a lot better than eating the traditional kind. Everyone loves them. Recommended. Five stars.

Superior penetration. These Gamo Luxor Cu Sharp Pyramid Shaped .177 Caliber pellets are excellent and far better than the flat lead pellets. Shot an old tea kettle and they easily entered and exited at fifty feet. Also much more accurate (within an 1/2 an inch). Just wish they were a little less expensive. Recommended. Four stars.

After having read the marvelous Twelve Months of a Soviet Childhood:Short Stories (Russian History Series) by this same author, I was excited to see the collection. And it is even better than Id hoped  really enchanting. Adventures of Alex and Katie: (The Firebird, The Lollipop, Snowdrops, Grandma Witch and Cinderella and Her Prince) by Julia Gousseva are modern tellings of classic Russian folktales written in a light, easy flowing contemporary style that fills your head with the images as the stories breeze by. Its as if Aunt Karina was telling these exciting tales. They have the adventurous tone of the Magic Tree House series. I love this collection and cant wait to read them to my son (hes still a little young for them) Anyone would have a great time reading these. Highly recommended, 5 easy stars!

Having helped teach my son to read (my wife did most of the work) I can tell you that A Rock Star Reader By Kindergarten, by Lorraine Carey, is an invaluable resource. She is a real expert and has the background and knowledge to provide true and useful techniques to not only make it easier but also fun. Case studies, tips and her golden rules make this practical, fun, and easy to use. Highest recommendation. Five stars.

I was excited to discover this series and was hoping it would be as good as the reviews said it would be. Well, The Highlander (The Rise of The Aztecs Book 1) by Zoe Saadia was even better! And the other books are incredible too. Its a non-stop adventure. Action, drama and history merge in a brilliantly written story expertly woven. These novels just sweep you away. A true breathtaking saga. Highly recommended, five stars!

Sophia is such a dynamic character. I know her! The author spins a spell on her readers with this one! Paranormal romance and fantasy are my favorite types of books so I consumed the Forever Girl series, by Rebecca Hamilton, (or at least the first two books). I cant wait for the next one!! The whole series needs to be a movie! Recommended to everyone who enjoys paranormal, romance and fantasy or just an amazing story. Five stars!

Tried several brands - these (Philips Flexible Earhook Headphones) were the best ones by far. High quality sound, and they stay secure, even when jogging. Just as important is the fact that they are extremely comfortable to wear. Really happy with this purchase. Highly recommended. Five stars

The new neighborhood seemed rather nice . . .  The key word is seemed. Ghost In The Kitchen, by Deborah McClatchey, is an exciting read. The author definitely knows how to scare and surprise us. Recommended. Five stars.

Who doesnt love Tom Sawyer and Huck Finn? This is a great collection Tom Sawyer Collection - All Four Books (Illustrated + Audio links. Includes 'Adventures of Tom Sawyer,' 'Huckleberry Finn' ' + 2 more sequels) by Mark Twain. Great illustrations and other extras make this the collections to get. Wonderful! Five stars.

I really loved Anyas Story (the first book in this series), so I was excited to see Struggling to Survive: A story of love, crime, and deception in the new Russia by Julia Gousseva. Because of the authors first hand knowledge of life in Russia she is able to put us in the events as if they were happening to people we know in places we know. It is great to continue following Anya through her challenges. A pleasure to read. Highly recommended. Five stars.

Another amazing book in the People of the Longhouse series. The Warpath by Zoe Saadia (book 4 in the series) is impressive because like the others books Ive read by this author, its as if she was there. Her historical depictions and detailed settings are stunning. It brings a great authenticity to what is also a well told and exciting story. Recommended. Five stars.

This is a wonderful series that kids love! And its so clever that grown-ups love it too. Fantastic illustrations, sharp humor and many messages make it a real pleasure to read. Nicu - The Littlest Vampire: In 'Dead Again' (Book 4 in the series) by Elias Zapple is a must for any age. Vampire funerals are immediate and happen the second that a vampire is dead again. Its not as if vampires need to order coffins  they have an abundance of them . . .  Zapple writes a smart kids book. Highest recommendation. Five stars.

Great item. Got this five pack for my mother who has arthritic hands and it has made a big difference and allowed her to write more and often without pain. Nice ink flow and the lanyard is handy as well. Highly recommended. Five stars.
Hand and well made. Not sure why the retail price is so high, but the product works well and enhances the user experience of the Beretta by always having an extra loaded magazine on hand. Four stars

Goof product overall, but like many pellets they seem to have an accuracy problem. But for short range target practice they do okay. Would like to see the price of lead-free ammo come down. Four stars.

This was a good concept, although not original per se, the author made it seem very fresh. "If I Stay" by Gayle Forman is an entertaining story that also brings depth and great themes about creativity, sacrifice and courage. It's well told in that the author takes us back and forth with a sense of urgency and pulls all the emotional strings at the right time. Highly recommended. Four stars.

This was written by one of my favorite authors, Uvi Poznansky. My Own Voice (Still Life with Memories Book 1) is another fine example of her story telling ability. Its as if she paints the story, allowing the reader to find the lush details among the greater canvass of the world she creates. An artist inviting us in to a secret place that leaves us different once we have been there. We first meet Anita at seventeen and follow her as she makes mistakes, learns, falls, grows and questions. The author explores and illustrates the emotions that drive her characters in their decisions and relationships. This is truly a richly woven story. Highest recommendation.

This is an exciting series filled with suspense. Katie and Amy are back in CULL  Bloodstone, by Eric J. Gates, and the trouble is intense. What I really like about this author is the way he shoves you face first into the story and makes it impossible for you to stop reading. Amy, Amy. For Gods sake! Wake up! Wake up! Were under attack! AMY! Wildly exhausting and exhilarating at the same time.I loved the first, this is even better, I cant wait for the next one. Im buying Cull Blood Feud, right now). Recommended. Five stars.

This is a serious and comprehensive book. Jim's Weight Training Guide, Superset Style!: A Resistance Training Method For Weight loss, Muscle Growth, Endurance and Strength Training by James Atkinson, gives you everything you need to do it. The author knows his stuff and I feel like I have a personal trainer. The book is well presented; hes organized it in sections that make it easy to follow. Its amazing how I can work this stuff into my routine. Great tips on making my workout more efficient. Recommended. Five stars.

Fun set! Love all the bananas. My son like having the large Gorilla to use with his large Lego HULK. Fun build and the extras are always nice - six pieces in this one. The Invisible plane is very well done with a nice mix of new pieces. The "robot" is also an exciting toy for him to play with. Hours and hours of fun. Great set. Recommended. Five stars
Great quality - very happy with it and will purchase again. Recommended - Five stars

This is one of those books that is so engrossing you just want it to keep going, so I was very happy to see its a series of four books  and I plan to read them all. The CULL - Bloodline, by Eric J. Gates, is full of exciting action and drama. And this is an original story, both in its take on vampires and the smart main characters of Katie and Amy. The author has spun a complex web, but one we can clearly navigate. Fast paced and filled with surprises. Im really looking forward to the next CULL book. Highly recommended. Five stars.

Heavy issues handled with care and humor. Abbie, with her authentic been around the block tender-toughness, immediately enders herself to the reader. Beyond the Pale by C Michelle McCarty, is a more than a family saga, its a finally woven story filled with true characters that touches you. I particularly liked the cast of characters from the trailer park. Some make you laugh, (Russell) and some annoy you (Doug) but they all make for a very entertaining read. My favorite dynamic was the relationship between Abbie and her son, Mick. This is a wonderful story. Highly recommended. Five stars.

We usually buy another brand, but when One Organic Sushi Nori Premium Roasted Organic sheets went on sale we decided to give it a try. Happy to say we are very satisfied. Everyone has enjoyed the taste and consistency of these sheets. Great value and we're repeat buyers now. Definitely recommend them. Five stars

I really cant say much about this book because it left me so breathless. That is to say, I cant say enough about it! Leaving Shadows by Eric J. Gates, is an engaging thriller to say the least. I dont remember being pulled into a book quite this way before. Seventeen minutes . . . thirteen minutes . . . two minutes! Its pretty wild how the author tosses us readers around in the story until we are exhausted  in a good way. Highly recommended. Five stars.

When a novel starts like this, I know its time to buckle-up. Seventy-six kills. Seventy-six. If circumstances were different, hed rank amongst the most prolific serial killers of the twenty-first century. He grabs you from the first line and never lets you catch your breath. Full Disclosure by Eric J. Gates, is another masterful thriller. Great scene of a frustrated US President really gives us the stakes. From there we go into a Secret Service scene that left my palms sweating around the kindle. And it just keeps going like that! Tension and action could be trademarked by this author. Highly recommended. Easy Five stars.

This is a fun and exciting book with amazing illustrations (so great I think Ill have to get the print edition). I love the positive message and my six year-old loved the story. Find the Cutes, book 2: Festival Fun (seek and find books for kids, look and find books for boys and girls, fun look and find book) by Celestial Noot and illustrated by Vincent Noot, is wonderful. Highly recommended. Five stars.

If you like a fun romance, you're likely to enjoy this one. This was definitely a fun one. A hot, light and quick story, filled with all the right stuff. BILLIONAIRE: The Billionaire Untamed (New Adult Contemporary Billionaire Romance) by Julia Sparks, is a good escape read. Recommended. Five stars.

After reading the description, I could hardly wait to read the book. What a time, fifteen, the late sixties! From Australia to Germany: An Adventurous Journey in a 4 Wheel Drive by Gus Pegel, takes us there. We begin with all the modifications to their amazing vehicle (not including the life raft beacon) and tools, permits, food, entertainment and vaccines. The getting ready was an adventure in itself! Departure day on  no spoilers  proved to be an exciting and fascinating journey. What a great true story to have lived and then shared in this well written, engaging book. Highest recommended. Five stars.

I so loved the first book in the series, The Clay Lion and Tin Men (The Clay Lion Series Book 2) by Amalie Jahn, is equally as wonderful. Charlie is a skillfully drawn character and his story is captivating. The author has created an intriguing time travel romance that engages the reader. She uses mystery and emotional threads in her telling of what really is a beautiful story with plenty of suspense:  When I snooped, I found only locked doors and empty files. My parents kept a secret from me my entire life. And it was finally time to find out the truth.I like how the author creates tension even when explaining the issues with time travel: It was at that point the real dangers became apparent, especially with regard to making changes in the past. As more and more people were traveling back to relive wonderful moments in their lives, some of those infinitesimally small changes began to affect not only the travelers life , but also the lives of innocent bystanders.As Brooke helps Charlie to find what he is looking for, their own love story makes an excellent parallel to his fathers life. The questions presented to the protagonist make this one of those stirring books that stay with you, that makes you think. Themes of love and trust run deep in this story. I highly recommend this book and the whole series. Well done. Five stars.

This was a cool and useful primer on all things emergency. First Aid: 11 Effective First Aid Tips That Will Help You Save Lives (How To Survive Your First Disaster) (Urban Survival Guide, First Aid Basics, Emergency Preparedness) hits the key stuff in a fast overview. Starting with trauma and emergency situations, this book give you clear and memorable methods on the best way to handle these situations. I like that it is concise, because thats all youll be able to recall when an emergency happens. Recommended. Five stars.

This is a fantastic overview of astrology written in an easy-to-understand manner. ASTROLOGY: The Definitive Guide to Zodiac Signs, Compatibility, Career and Relationships by Michelle Hall, may not actually be the definitive guide, but it covers a lot. Ive read a lot of books on astrology and Im amazed at how much the author packed in this little book. She covers history and meaning, uses, career, relationships, success, etc. Well done. Recommended. Four stars.

Ive been composting for years, but learned quite a few great ideas with this book and the Mini-Farming book is filled with tips and tricks and good info. The Farming and Composting Box Set: A Starting Guide to Making Your Own Compost and to do Farming at Home (Urban Gardening & Homesteading) two-book set by Timothy Pena, and Lillian Harper, is a concisely written introduction into these two complimentary areas of gardening. I found them useful and well presented with photos to make it easier to follow. Recommended. Five stars.

This book covers the important stuff and includes great formulas. Excel: Microsoft Excel Mastery - Your Guide To Increasing Your Productivity With Excel Formulas, Shortcuts & Spreadsheets! by Sean Cazar. Is well presented, clear and easy to use. It explains templates, automation, shortcuts and more. Recommended. Five stars.

I want to tell you about the Cucumber Avocado Gazpacho  really tasty! The author has brought together a great collection of tasty and healthy recipes. Paleo 3 Step Cooking: More Than 50 Easy Healthy Recipes: Paleo Diet Cookbook - Healthy Gluten Free, Grain Free and Lactose Free Recipes by Lise Gottlieb, is easy to use and includes nice photos and nutrition info. Recommended. Five stars.

Great alternative to a BOB. We used this for four years and then ended up selling it used for $60. It is durable and held up great. We took it on rutted dirt roads, gravel, wooded patter with roots and all. My only complaint id the cover didn't always block enough sun. We bought the extension and that didn't really work well. We ended up putting baby blanket on the top on sunny days, which worked great if it wasn't windy. In spite of that, I'd buy this again and recommend it. Four stars plus.
This turned out great!  I'm impressed with both the quality and the speed in which I received this custom product.

The "Cocky" decal detached from the underlying trailer hitch cover within the first month.  Worse still, it hadn't even been placed on the truck yet.  It came off just sitting inside the house so I doubt it would have even lasted a week outside in the elements.  This was a waste of money and I very much regret the purchase.I ordered this item in September of 2015.  The cost of the items was $15.99 and shipping was free.

Sand, sun and wind burns and dry the face and a good no-nonsense moisturizer is real luxury to send a deployed soldier. When sending a lotion to a soldier you need to send tubes (like these), not pump dispenser, and it needs to be fragrance free.  This Cetaphil meets the criteria and does a good job.I last ordered these in March of 2015 and had them shipped directly to a military APO, AE address. I paid $17.58 at that time.

Q-tips are always in demand.  These are used for personal hygiene but also for cleaning sand out of nooks and crannies in weapons.  These travel size packs are the way to go and this eight pack is great for sharing.  I last ordered these in March of 2015 and had them shipped directly to a military APO, AE address.  I paid $12.45 at that time.

I last purchased this in December of 2014 and paid $10.63. As of April of 2015 when I'm writing this review I see the rice has dropped about 6% to $10.00.Most people probably don't know that you can no longer send electronics containing lithium batteries to military APO/FPO addresses. That's not a special military requirement, it's a USPS requirement as lithium batteries are apparently potentially dangerous when being transported in airplane cargo holds. The down side to that is that it limits your choices in electronics you can send to soldiers as most newer products have rechargeable lithium batteries inside.This handheld gaming device runs on alkaline batteries and can be sent to military addresses. The games are entertaining and it has pretty good battery life even on alkaline batteries (Galaga is my favorite).This game is very popular and a great distraction. I recommend this as a terrific gift option for your to send to your soldier.

This battery is the top-rated alkaline in Consumer Reports most recent AA battery ratings scoring 57 out of 100 possible.  The overall top scoring AA battery is the Energizer Ultimate Lithium (Energizer AA Lithium Batteries 16 Pack with Bonus Flashlight) and there wasn't even a close second.  If you need a AA battery for a high drain device, like a camera for instance, you're better off going with a lithium.I use these Duracell Quantum Alkalines primarily in wireless keyboards/mouse, remote controls and clocks and for these uses they rate right up there with AA lithium batteries for longevity.  My order arrived in good condition, all the batteries were fresh.  I have never encountered any leaking or performance issues that would cause me to give these anything other than a five star rating.  I'm sorry to see that not all Amazon customers have had the same positive experience.I last ordered these in April of 2015 and paid $8.33 for this 12 count package.

I have ordered this 5 lb bag on Amazon twice now and I'm pleased with the quality of the candy and speed in which both orders were sent. This is also a great candy product to send to military addresses in parts of the world where it is not practical to send chocolate (because chocolate melts in the heat). Bit-O-Honey does much better in the heat. In fact, I think it is better when it is a bit warm and prefer to enjoy them once they've been in my pocket for a while and softened up a bit from the heat.Here's a "Bit-O-History". This candy was originally produced in Chicago in a plant located at 4700 W Augusta Blvd, Chicago, IL 60651. That building survives today and is Citation Box company. You can check it out on Google maps/earth.In February of 2015 I paid $21.86 for the 5 lb bag. In March of 2015 I paid $21.80.  Shipping was free with Amazon Prime.

...and yes, that's an awesome pocket-sized Nerf football in my pocket.  Come on, where did you think I was going with this?Yes, this Nerf fits in your pocket and like all Nerfs never needs air, it floats and this aero flyer makes it easy to throw a perfect spiral.  It has a surface coating that makes it better-suited to outdoor conditions than some of the other Nerf footballs versions.  It's a lot of entertainment for the price.I last ordered this in December of 2014 and paid $6.48.

I last purchased this in December of 2014 and paid $10.63. I did not own the original Catchphrase and as such have no complaints about repetition between the two versions as some reviewers have observed.  My buddies and I have had a lot of fun with this game.Most people probably don't know that you can no longer send electronics containing lithium batteries to military APO/FPO addresses. That's not a special military requirement, it's a USPS requirement as lithium batteries are apparently potentially dangerous when being transported in airplane cargo holds. The down side to that is that it limits your choices in electronics you can send to soldiers as most newer products have rechargeable lithium batteries inside.This handheld gaming device runs on alkaline batteries, can be sent to military addresses and this is about as good as it gets for handheld electronic games that run on alkaline batteries. It has a large color LCD screen, the games are entertaining and it has decent battery life even running on alkaline batteries, but I suggest you include a package of alkaline batteries in your order for uninterrupted game play.This game is very popular and a great distraction. I recommend this as a terrific gift option for your to send to your soldier.

I have this loaded on my FireTV.  I'm glad to have it as an option for playing music through the Spotify app on my FireHD.  However, if it were a full fledged version of Spotify, instead of just the "Connect" version, I'd be giving it five stars instead of four.

I paid $6.50 for these Bicycle Rider Back Poker Playing Cards in March of 2015 and had them shipped to a military APO/FPO address.  At the same time I included a set of the Bicycle Poker Chips.  I think the quality of these cards, and of the poker chips, are very good for this price and that they have more than paid for themselves.  A lot of soldiers have bonded over hours around a table with these Bicycle cards and chips.

These are exactly what you would expect for the price and I'm in no way disappointed with the quality or construction.  I had these shipped to an APO/FPO military address, they get a lot of use and have provided hours of entertainment.  I last ordered these in March of 2015 and paid $6.69.

I last purchased this in December of 2014 and paid $21.95. For comparison sake, at the time of this review the same system is being sold at Walmart for $28.89.  There are reviews posted here talking about how much kids enjoy this game but it's good for big kids too - college age kids and beyond.This is a great alternative to spending hundreds of dollars on Gameboy, tablets, and other gaming system and one of the games is very similar to Mario. Drawback:  the device doesn't save the level of the game, so the games will start at the lowest level after turning it on.Most people probably don't know that you can no longer send electronics containing lithium batteries to military APO/FPO addresses. That's not a special military requirement, it's a USPS requirement as lithium batteries are apparently potentially dangerous when being transported in airplane cargo holds. It has a large color LCD screen, the games are entertaining and it has decent battery life even running on alkaline batteries, but I suggest you include a package of alkaline batteries in your order for uninterrupted game play.This game is very popular and a great distraction. I purchased this in March of 2015 and paid $49.95.  It has been used daily for just over a month at the time of this review and if I should encounter durability issues in the future I will update my review.  There is a lot to like about this grinder and as of this writing I'm happy with the purchase.  I only have one dislike to report so far and that's the design of the grind chamber.  I find it difficult to replace back into the grinder and I don't think the shape is conducive to emptying.  Hopefully in time it will get easier.  But that aside, I'm happy overall with this purchase and hope that will be the case long after the honeymoon is over.

I have two best friends. One walks on four legs, the other rides on four wheels and the tricky part is combining the two without either one doing damage to the other. Lately I've been trying out various products to find an option that works well for both.I decided to give this hammock sling a try in hopes of keeping my pooch from falling into the footwell/wall on particularly rough and bouncy expeditions.  After researching hammock options I knew I also wanted seatbelt flaps (to keep out dirt) and "human passenger" unzipping options.This sling met all my pre-purchase criteria and ended up being a great purchase -  my Labradane took to it immediately.  It's waterproof, machine washable and has tear-resistant fabric, easy-to-adjust headrest straps and durable stitching.  I like this color and that clean-up is basically as easy as three shakes.I bought mine on the manufacturer's web site at $60.  There was a 10% savings offered for joining their mailing list but the price still wasn't as good as here on Amazon.There were some interesting facts on their web site and I'll share some of them below:100% of dogs with fur shed60% have had bathroom accidents in the car25% of dogs vomit due to car sicknessAverage trade-in value of cars using seat covers:  $8,202Average trade-in value of cars never using seat covers:  $5,741*Numbers based of a 2009 Toyota Camry with 60,000 miles

This app makes me so happy.  WatchESPN delivers live access to ESPN, ESPN2, ESPNU, ESPN3, SEC Network, SEC Network +, ESPNews, ESPN Deportes, Longhorn Network, ESPN Goal Line and ESPN Buzzer Beater.  I can't believe this has the SEC Network!  Again, so happy!  You can go to the app's web site page for more information.I use this app on my FireTV and on my Xbox 360.  My cable provider is RCN and my subscription verification was a quick and easy process.
This ready-to-eat 12 packs ship to APO/FPO addresses and make a great addition to a military care package.  I last ordered this in December of 2014 and paid $22.15.

I know that it is more economical to buy SpaghettiOs by the can and a lot of reviewers feel compelled to point that out.  They're right of course.  I for one didn't want the cans - I wanted these microwave containers because I shipped them to a military address where the convenience of these containers was perhaps especially appreciated.  These are small servings for grown men, but they taste good and are a reminder of simpler times.  Thanks SpaghettiOs.I last ordered these in December of 2014 and paid $14.37 for the six pack.  That comes to $2.40 per serving.

I downloaded this app for use on my Fire TV.  I'm giving it three stars because it's Fox and at least there's some Fox News for the Fire TV, so that's better than nothing.  However, this app has a long way to go and I hope that "the powers that be" will jump on this and give the Fire TV version full functionality.  I guarantee it will have a huge audience on the Fire TV platform.

My review is not of Hulu itself, but of this Hulu Plus app.  Specifically, the performance of the Hulu Plus app on the Fire TV.The app installed easily and it was easy to link to my Hulu account.  As with all connected devices, to watch videos in HD on Hulu, you need at least an Internet download speed of 3 megabits per second, or Mbps, though for SD, or standard definition, you only need 1.5 Mbps. Note that HD videos are only available for Hulu Plus members; other memberships only have access to videos in SD.I have previously encountered streaming issues with Hulu on devices despite having met these minimum speed requirements.  In visiting with Hulu support I discovered that in addition to these minimum speed requirements, they also want your to have a Ping (latency) score of less than 50 milliseconds (the lower the better).  Your Ping score is included with a speed test and I use speedtest(dot)net to check my scores.  The Ping test determines whether your computer can communicate with another computer over the network. Then, if network communication is established, ping tests also determine the connection latency (technical term for delay) between the two computers.My speed requirements and Ping score are all within the requirements for buffer free streaming of Hulu Plus and this application is working great on my Amazon Fire TV over my home Wi-Fi.  I have not encountered any problems after over a month of use, but if you should, Hulu recommends the following steps for the Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick:If you continue to experience issues with Hulu Plus on your Fire TV after general troubleshooting, please try these suggestions:  Clear all temporary files from Hulu Plus. From the main menu sidebar, go to Settings > Applications > Hulu Plus. Then, select both Clear Cache, and Clear Data.  Uninstall the Hulu Plus application. (From the main menu sidebar: Settings > Applications > Hulu Plus > Uninstall). Once complete, re-download the application: Search > Enter "Hulu Plus" > Select the Hulu Plus App > Download.
I think these are great, and unlike some of the reviews posted here, I've never had a bad experience with this product.  My last order was in December of 2014 and I paid $17.90 for the 32 oz bag.

I last purchased these in January of 2015 and paid $7.00.  I think these do a good job of keeping rust stains in check and probably do a better job of eliminating them altogether if you catch them early.I did have a bad experience using these in one of my toilet tanks and that's the reason for my three star rating.  The toilet in question had a Fluidmaster 400CR Toilet Fill Valve and Flapper Repair Kit fill valve.  Shortly after placing this Whink Rust Guard in this particular tank the valve started to malfunction.  I suspect that "flotsam and jetsam" from this tablet dissolving got kicked up in the tank and some of this entered the valve and caused the problems.  What happened is the tank began refilling very, very slowly.  It would take a good hour for the tank to refill for the next flush and I ended up having to replace the valve altogether.In all fairness it could be a coincidence.  It's just I've never had something like this happen before and the fact that it presented itself within two days of adding a Whink tablet to the tank leads me to this conclusion.

I have never encountered any leaking or performance issues that would cause me to give these anything other than a five star rating. I last purchased this in December of 2014 and paid $49.95.  As of April of 2015 the blue version is showing up as selling for $89, but the red version is selling for $34.95.  I personally don't care about the case color and would go with whichever is the least expensive.There are a lot of reviews posted here talking about how much the reviewer's kids enjoy this.  For this review I'm going to tell you that it's good for big kids too - college age kids and beyond.Most people probably don't know that you can no longer send electronics containing lithium batteries to military APO/FPO addresses.  That's not a special military requirement, it's a USPS requirement as lithium batteries are apparently potentially dangerous when being transported in airplane cargo holds.  The down side to that is that it limits your choices in electronics you can send to soldiers as most newer products have rechargeable lithium batteries inside.This handheld gaming device runs on alkaline batteries, can be sent to military addresses and this is about as good as it gets for handheld electronic games that run on alkaline batteries.  It has a large color LCD screen, the games are entertaining and it has pretty good battery life even on alkaline batteries.This game is very popular and a great distraction.
