At the time of this review (April of 2015) this is selling for $9.99.  When I purchased these in December of 2014 I paid $18.97.  One of the reviews posted here indicates the customer paid nearly $30 in December of 2012 and that once she saw them in person she felt they were only worth about $10.  It's good to see that today's price finally reflects what some feel should have been the price all along.Most people reading this review grew up with Nerfs or are otherwise familiar with them.  In my opinion these are just what you would expect in terms of Nerf construction and quality, but they may be smaller than you imagine.  This entire boxed package is probably only 14 inches across on the long end and the largest balls about 4.5 inches across.  These are great for indoor use and we've had a lot of fun with them - my only advice is just to make sure you're comfortable with the size and price before ordering.

I last ordered this in December of 2014, paid $4.40 through the Amazon Add-on Program and had it sent to an APO/FPO military address.  It's the classic Frisbee, just like the name says, and comes in strong colors that are easy to see flying through the air.  It flies well, it's inexpensive and it's entertaining.  It's hard for me to imagine how anyone could complain about this product, especially at this price.

I last ordered these in January of 2015 and paid $35.82 (with vase price).  For out-of-town deliveries I usually use Proflowers or 1800Flowers and this was my first time to place an order for flowers through Amazon.  I bought Peruvian Lillies because they seem to last so much longer than other flowers and they're such a good value.  While I didn't buy these because of the "Rainforest Alliance Certification" it's nice to know.  My gift recipient told me the flowers were beautiful and that they lasted a full week.  I had these sent to a fairly remote region that probably added an extra day to the delivery time, plus it was in the cold of winter, yet they still arrived undamaged and in good shape.  I am happy with my experience here and will definitely order them again.
I paid $4.49 for this two pack when I last ordered these in January of 2015.  Great replacement bulbs at a great price.

I purchased these here on Amazon in December of 2014 and paid $13.38 at that time. I had these sent directly to an APO military address and I highly recommend them for this purpose. You shouldn't send chocolate to most soldiers deployed in the Middle East because it gets too hot and the chocolate arrives as a melted mess. These Twizzlers don't melt like chocolate but provide the same satisfaction. Plus, having a pack of six of these means there's plenty for sharing. I'm really happy to have these available here on Amazon highly recommend these for any care package being sent to a soldier.

I last ordered this in November of 2014 and paid $1.96 for the 15 oz can.  I put this chili to good use as the starring ingredient of this great-tasting 7-Layer Chili Dip:Serving Size: 8+Total Time: Under 15 MinutesPreparation Time: Under 15 MinutesPreparation Method: MicrowaveMeal Occasion: Appetizers & SnacksLevel of Difficulty: BeginnerINGREDIENTS1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese, softened cup milk3 cups shredded Cheddar cheese1 (15-ounce) can HORMEL Chili No Beans, heated1 cup shredded lettuce cup sliced green onions cup sliced ripe olives (I omit this ingredient if the group isn't made up of olive fans) cup chopped tomatoCrackers or chips, if desiredDIRECTIONS1.  In small bowl, blend together cream cheese, milk and 2 cups shredded cheese. Spread mixture onto large serving platter.2.  Spoon warm chili over cheese layer. Continue to layer remaining ingredients (lettuce, remaining cheese, onions, olives and tomatoes). Serve with crackers or chips for dipping.

This app installed easily on my Fire TV and verification/authentication to my cable provider (RCN) to confirm my subscription took only a few minutes.  I'm glad this app is available.  I can't speak to how useful this app is if you don't have a cable company subscription, but with a cable subscription there is a quite a bit of content from which to select.

These may not rise to the level of clean you feel after brushing your teeth in the traditional sense but they sure beat not having anything at all.  These travel well in a pocket and you get a lot of them for the price.  These ship to APO/FPO military addresses and they are very popular for use in the field.  I last ordered these in March of 2015 and paid $18.97 for the pack of 100.

I appreciate that this 4-pack is available through Amazon's "Add-on program" and that the free Prime shipping extends to military APO/FPO addresses.  I like the head/bristle design on this toothbrush and the integrated tongue cleaner.  If you don't share a bathroom and you're buying these to use for yourself the blue handle theme works fine.  The same is true if you're having these shipped to a military address and they are going to be distributed to a group that isn't keeping them in the same toothbrush holder.  However, if you're intending to use these in a common shared bathroom toothbrush holder you might want to consider if the slight color variations on the toothbrush heads are enough to help you identify whose is whose.  I am much less likely to pick up a toothbrush that isn't mine if the handles are different colors. If you are sharing a toothbrush holder with a guy like me you're probably going to want that guy to have a toothbrush color that stands out and is distinctly different than the others.  Guess I'm just not as observant as some when it comes to small details like the color variations in these toothbrush bristles.I last purchased the 4-pack in March of 2015 and paid $8.97.

Looks like all the Campbell's soup reviews are being lumped together.  This review is for the Homestyle Chicken with Whole Grain Pasta.All things considered, this is just a really good chicken noodle soup, only healthier.  While many factors affect heart disease, diets low in saturated fat and cholesterol may reduce the risk of this disease and this soup is American Heart Association certified as a heart-healthy food.0 grams trans fat per serving. No MSG added except for the small amount naturally occurring in yeast extract.I last ordered this in November of 2014 and paid $1.50 for the 18.6 oz can.  I'm really glad I gave this soup a try and will be a repeat customer.

This app installed easily on my Fire TV and verification/authentication to my cable provider (RCN) to confirm my subscription took only a few minutes, I'm not 100% sure on this, but I believe you need a cable subscription that includes the Lifetime channel in order to unlock/access all the features of this app/additional content.

Napolean said that an army marches on its stomach.  That may be true but a sure fire way to forget a rumbling stomach on the trail is to have foot problems. Sweaty, itchy feet are sure to get and keep your attention.  Fortunately this Gold Bond is super absorbent and helps relieve fungal symptoms of itching, burning, and irritation.  This ships to APO/FPO military addresses and is helps soldiers prevent boot rash.I last ordered this 10 oz size in March of 2015 and paid $11.14.  Shipping was free with Amazon Prime.

Individual dose packets like these are well-suited to work environments and that was my motivation for ordering.  With both this Tylenol "dispenser box" and this Advil Tablets Pain Reliever Refill,200 mg, 50 Two-Packs per Box sitting out side-by-side, the Tylenol box regularly empties about twice as fast as the Advil.I last ordered these in March of 2015 and paid $14.12 for the 100 caplet size.

This app installed easily on my Fire TV and verification/authentication to my cable provider (RCN) to confirm my subscription took only a few minutes.  I'm only giving this app three stars because it doesn't provide as much content as I had hoped.  It also seems to load slowly and to encounter more buffering hiccups than other streaming apps I have downloaded/installed.

I have to admit that I prefer chili con carne and only eat this on occasion.  Of the medium versions of Amy's Chili I have tried I prefer the Amy's Organic Chili, Medium, 14.7 Ounce to this medium version with vegetables.  This chili is also about 20% more per can than most other cans of chili available in Amazon's Prime Pantry.  I paid $2.49 per can when I included this in my November, 2014 Prime Pantry order.

I have Nuance Dragon Assistant (version 3.1.30.7) installed on my Windows 8.1 PC.  Dragon Assistant gives you the freedom to use your voice to control or get answers from your computer and can stream millions of songs for free through the Spotify desktop application.  If you have Spotify Premium, Dragon can also learn your Spotify playlists and starred items.  That's what got me try Spotify and to eventually upgrade to Spotify Premium.I have become a big fan of Spotify Premium.  It has simplified my life - no more need for buying music or trying to get copies of my music library installed on multiple devices and platforms.  I have this Spotify app installed on both my Kindle Fire HD and HDX.  It works great on both devices.  I also have Spotify Connect installed on my Fire TV and stream from this Spotify app.

This is the first syringe-type water blaster under the Nerf Super Soaker brand, but is akin to the old Power Soaker Jr. Cannon (1993) and Power Soaker Water Cannon.  It is good for use near lakes and/or pools where the water source is abundant and offers good performance for a syringe-type water blaster.  Use is limited due to its lack of internal water storage.Pros - Nice styling, comfortable to hold even for its small size. Produces a solid, thick stream.Cons - One, perhaps two good shots at best; attempting to get more shots per fill will significantly reduce the performance of each shot. No on-board reservoir. Larger-diameter nozzle may dribble to some degree.I last ordered these in March of 2015 and paid $11.50.

I know that there are chili enthusiasts who would scoff at any canned chili and that many of them believe a "true" chili contains no beans. I guess I'm not one of those guys because I'm just fine with having beans in chili and the convenience of canned chili complements my lifestyle. Maybe someday I'll learn to appreciate the nuances, but for now tasty, hearty, convenient, fast and easy meets my criteria and this chili makes the grade.I usually cube a little cheddar and add some Oyster crackers for a filling meal. I've also tried this chili poured over white rice and for me that makes a fine meal as well. I'm sure it would also be good as the chili for a chili dog meal if that's what you're looking for. I'm a fan.I last purchased this on Amazon in November of 2014. The price for the 15 oz can was $1.89 at that time.

I live in Chicago and really enjoy the local news content available through this app. This is one of the most used apps on my Kindle Fire HD. National news coverage is available here as well, but my primary interest in the app is for the local content.
I have this installed on my Fire TV and it works great.  My cable provider is RCN and the verification/activation went through without a hitch.

The one part of baby lotion scent signature I always seem to pick up on is coconut (Johnson's Baby Lotion comes to mind).  Anyway, that's how these Cottonelle's smell to me.They do well enough for cleaning up after yourself and I'm glad to have them over not having anything available but toilet paper.  However, as a guy, if I get to pick I prefer something that smells less like a baby product.  Both MANGROOMER Biz Wipes Flushable Moist Personal Wipes Engineered for Men, Executive Scent, 50 Wipes (Pack of 6)M and Dude Wipes - Flushable Wipes, Fragrance Free & Naturally Soothing, Dispenser Pack (48ct) are other brands I have used and I prefer the scents of both to this Cottonelle version.  Neither one of these wipe products I've listed will necessarily appeal to women as both have a more masculine fragrance.

It seems that Kindle Fire users are hungry for news content so apps like this are appreciated. However, in its present form this is not a news app I would be using as often if there were superior news apps from which to choose. There are too many commercials, too many non-news cross-promotional stories and too many lengthy pauses between stories. It's a good start and I hope they will keep making improvements and perhaps even a paid version that excludes commercials.

If you haven't tried these before you might be interested in knowing more about the comfort waist band.  It basically the same stretchy material waist band as found on similar styled underwear, but it's covered on both sides by a soft material so it's more comfortable against the skin.  It' nice.These are a good fit for a 36 inch waist and otherwise similar to other Hanes briefs.  Fit and finish seems to be of decent quality and so far I don't have any construction or durability problems to report.  If I do find they don't last as long as others I have tried I will update this review.  As of this writing I have nothing but positive things to say about this purchase.

This company also makes Fresh Balls Lotion The Solution for Men - 5 oz tube and this Fresh Feet Lotion seems like pretty much the same formulation.  Both go on as a lotion and dry to a powder.  Both products work for their intended purpose, but both are messier than powder (leaves white residue on hands) and not my favorite for use right before I get dressed because the lotion takes some time to completely dry on the application site.  Sometimes I don't have the time or patience to wait before putting on my underwear or socks (depending on which "Fresh" product I'm using), and I find that if I put on my underwear/socks before the product is completely dry I left feeling damp and uncomfortable.  My advice is this is a good product if you have time to fully air dry the application site before dressing.  Otherwise, I suggest you stick with a powder.
Snow TV doesn't do much for me.

I live in Chicago and really enjoy the local news content available through this app.  This is one of the most used apps on my Kindle Fire HD.  National news coverage is available here as well, but my primary interest in the app is for the local content.

It seems that Fire TV users are hungry for news content so apps like this are appreciated.  However, in its present form this is not a news app I would be using as often if there were superior news apps from which to choose.  There are too many commercials, too many non-news cross-promotional stories and too many lengthy pauses between stories.  It's a good start and I hope they will keep making improvements and perhaps even a paid version that excludes commercials.

We needed a relatively inexpensive pant we could buy multiples of for several guys that would be working a trade show booth.  All the guys needed to be wearing the same "uniform" but the trouble was finding a pant style that was available in a variety of sizes and that would look good on a variety of body types.  This is the pant we settled on and it was a good choice.  The cotton/poly blend kept the pants looking crisp throughout the duration of the show.  The flat front styling is an up-to-date look and the comfort waist-band helped assure that any "spread" between true and stated waist sizes was covered.  I would absolutely buy these again.We went with the "Ancient Stone" color but "Castlerock" was a close second.  There was only one in our group who had the white pocket material showing as some have complained.  However, to be fair, I am going to guess that particular guy understated his true waist size by a good four inches when we turned in the order.  It seems the pants needed to be really tight on a guy in order for the white of the pocket to show in our 10-man sample.  The guy who had this issue was probably a 44 waist and had a 40 waist ordered for himself.  They looked uncomfortably tight on him.I last ordered these in March of 2015 and paid $34.99.

Coffee loses flavor with exposure to light, air, moisture, and carbon dioxide released after the roasting process. The Friis Coffee Vault keeps coffee fresh by locking in flavor while blocking out light, air and moisture. The Friis Freshness Valve vents away flavor destroying CO2 gas. When stored in a cool, dry place, your coffee stays fresh longer.

Like the original version, the Duo avoids zippers for a 64-inch wide integrated "comforter" that folds down for easy entry, folds up for warmth, and folds any which way to suit your preferences.  There's enough room for most couples to fit together and with a shape slightly larger than the opening it fills it's easy to tuck in the sides and create a natural seal to trap warmth.I'm a warm sleeper and I'm comfortable in this bag into the lower 20s, however, a cold sleeper may need add layers and huddle for warmth, but after all, that's kind of the point here, right?  At 2 lbs per person It is easier to carry this one Duo rather than two separate bags.  It has excellent compression.

I have two best friends.  One walks on four legs, the other rides on four wheels and the tricky part is combining the two without either one doing damage to the other.  Lately I've been trying out various products to find an option that works well for both.This was the Center for Pet Safety's 2013 highest-rated safety restraint and is essentially a padded vest with three possible anchor points to distribute crash forces evenly over a dog's body.  Options for securing include a single lockdown for riding in the cargo area to two LATCH child-seat anchors with a human three-point seatbelt looped through the harness.I recently tried this out for the first time with my Labradane.  He seemed mildly confused when I put the harness on him and outright annoyed when fully buckled to the seat.  It makes sense that dogs unaccustomed to this type of restraint, like mine, are going to feel constricted and uncomfortable at first.  Still, this is going to take some time and I'm wondering if I can teach my old dog this new trick.I ordered mine from the manufacture's web site and there it asks for your pet's exact measurement in inches and provides instructions for accurate measuring.  Apparently if you pet is bigger than 60 in. or smaller than 31 in., "it will NOT fit."

This is a stripped-down design with a single-compartment bag, roll-top closure and a rope strap that let's you pile on extra gear. It's got small mesh pouches on the shoulder straps that work well for lip balm and sunscreen. Six straps lock the load tight against the spine. The shoulder straps are densely padded and provide adequate support for 15-20 lbs, but anything more than that is probably not going to be comfortable and will overwhelm this frameless design. It has a hip-belt to stabilize the load. My one dislike is that this pack spoons the back so closely that it really limits airflow and tends to get hot.  On the positive side, this bag material is tough enough that I'm not worried that it's going to shred when I'm scooching down a rocky section of a steep descent.I like this piece of gear.  If asked I would recommend it to others and I would be willing to purchase it a second time.

Without a doubt these spring-loaded step-on door stops are the most convenient door stops I have ever used. I purchased several here on Amazon in April of 2010 and the cost per piece at that time was $4.00. Unlike this model, the ones I purchased previously were brass and that listing is still available here on Amazon (National Hardware V811 Door Stop/Lock in Brass).  If you don't require the stainless steel finish this other listing is a much, much better price.  Going on five years of service now they still working flawlessly.I purchased this stainless steel finish version in March of 2015 and paid $21.99.  Installation is easy and I am pleased with the look and construction of the product.

I'm glad that organic products like this are available. And while this is probably a good choice from some, I found it a bit bland and doubt I will include it in future Prime Pantry orders. I last ordered this in November of 2014 and paid $2.19 for the 15 oz can.

I ordered a couple of packs of these in November 2014 Prime Pantry order.  At 98 per pack, which is what I paid at the time, I figured it was worth a try.  For instant potatoes I think they did a good job with the consistency and texture and based on this experience I am going to try their four cheese and their buttery homestyle flavors.  That being said, I found the garlic flavoring of these potatoes to be overpowering and not to my liking.

I bought one and liked it so much I bought a second, then a third and a fourth. This is the best bowl I have ever owned. I can't think of one thing they could have done differently to improve on the design. All three pieces can go in the dish washer. Soups can go straight from the microwave to the table. It even doubles as a storage container. The deep ceramic white bowl is great for cereal too. Sometimes I use the blue plastic base as my snack size microwave popcorn bowl.  Highly recommended!I've now placed three orders for these bowls here on Amazon.  My most recent order was in March of 2015 and I paid $9.61.  That's probably the best price I've ever paid for one of these bowls.  My first order here on Amazon for these bowls in in January of 2012 and I paid $12.90 at that time.

It looks like several varieties of Campbell's are being lumped together.  This review is for the Chunky New England Clam Chowder.I like that this soup is a good source of protein, fiber and calcium, is low in cholesterol and has no trans fat.  I also appreciate the easy open pull tab.  This 18.8 oz can holds two servings but this variety also comes in a single serve 10.75-oz. can as well as a microwavable bowlThis is a hearty, great tasting stand-alone soup, but it is also great with spaghetti in Campbell's Chunky Clams & Pasta recipe as shown below:At a glance:Prep - 20 min.Total - 25 min.Serves -  2What You'll Need:1 can (18.8 ounces) Campbells Chunky New England Clam Chowder1 tablespoon chopped fresh fresh parsley or 1 teaspoon dried parsley flakes1/4 teaspoon garlic powder4 ounces (1/4 of a 1-pound package) spaghetti, cooked and drainedHow to Make It:1.  Heat the soup, parsley, garlic powder and spaghetti in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat until the mixture is hot and bubbling, stirring occasionally.How's that for easy?  Add a small side salad and you've got a nice, quick and healthy meal.I last purchased this on Amazon in November of 2014.  At that time the price per can was $1.50.

I thought Rebecca De Mornay was great in "Risky Business" and "The Hand That Rocks The Cradle".  I watched this movie solely because she was in it and assumed that alone would make it a watchable experience.I wish I could go back in time and not see this.  It made me feel sad for her.  I'm sure her fans would point out that she wasn't given much to work with in this movie and I have no doubt that's true.  Still, I suggest you skip this one even If you're a Rebecca De Mornay fan (especially if you're a fan).

I purchased the four pack in November of 2014 and paid $7.99.  They arrived with non-retail plastic packaging that looked professional and in no way diminished my confidence in the product.  The expiration date on the side of the batteries indicated they were best before March of 2018.  Some reviewers have indicated that the bottom of these batteries show a different date.  That information stamped on Duracell battery bottoms deals with the date of manufacture, not the date of expiration.  The bottom of my batteries had a stamp mark of  "4090 A967".  I imagine I could find a web site that could help me decode this information if that's something I wanted to pursue.  Knowing that I have a good three years of shelf life as shown on the battery side is enough for me.Some smoke alarms and carbon monoxide detectors require manufacturer-specified battery brands.  I always thought this was just an endorsement made for some monetary compensation provided from the battery manufacturer.  However, I put a generic 9 volt battery in a First Alert Carbon Monoxide Detector and it malfunctioned.  When I replaced the generic battery with one of these Duracell batteries the detector resumed normal monitoring status.  The generic 9 volt battery worked fine when I used it as a battery back-up for a digital alarm clock (the only other use I know of for a 9 volt battery).  It was only in my carbon monoxide detector that the generic battery caused a problem.  This has convinced me that I should use the recommended replacement battery brands and model numbers, especially on something as important as a carbon monoxide or smoke detector.On the back of my carbon monoxide detector it lists three acceptable replacement batteries: Duracell (MN1604), Goldpeak (1604A), Ray O Vac (A1604).  This listing is for the correct Duracell model.  The Goldpeak model is available here on Amazon 4pcs GP 1604A 9V Alkaline Battery Gold as is the Ray O Vac RAYOVAC A1604-4CF Alkaline Batteries (9V; 4 pk; Reclosable).  However, at the time of this review this listing for the Duracell 4 pack is still the better deal.Duracell Coppertop Alkaline Batteries (9 Volt) from my local grocer are $5.00 each.  These came to $2.00 each here on Amazon at my date of purchase.  Premium batteries at a great price!

The description for this scent on the Unstopables web site reads, "Add a capful or a shake and prepare to luxurify. For this is a luxuriful laundry experience that leaves your laundered with a sweet, flowery exuberance that exubers for up to 12 weeks*. So much so, that you'll start making up new words."  I think they're exubberating.I like the concept of the pellets and that the product weighs so much less than the liquid.  I don't think this Glow scent smells bad or anything like that, but to me it doesn't smell as nice as my favorite Downy liquid, which is Downy Ultra Liquid Fabric Softener, Clean Breeze, 103 Oz.  I believe the liquid version of this scent is Downy Ultra Infusions Liquid Fabric Softener 48 Loads, Cashmere Glow, 41 fl oz.Glad I tried it but this was a one-time purchase for me.  I paid $9.79 for this 19.5 ounce bottle (31 loads) in November of 2014.  Shipping was free with Amazon Prime.

I purchased these here on Amazon in October of 2014 and paid $16.60.  Shipping was free with Amazon Prime.  I've waited to review these timers because I wanted to have some experience with them first.  I've used them now for almost five months and so far they have been dependable.This was the first time I purchased a digital timer and have used Intermatic TN111K 15-Amp Lamp and Appliance Timer or similar timers exclusively for decades.  These mechanical timers are okay, and I have several still in service in my home, but it seems like they eventually start loosing time and require adjustments.These Woods digital timers have not required any adjustments and are keeping perfect time.  I haven't encountered any power failures since I installed these so I can't speak to the effectiveness of the built-in battery back-up, but I've never had a battery back-up in the other timers I linked to above so I guess anything in this regard is an improvement.I would give these five stars if they were easier to set up.  Others have made mention of this as well in their reviews.  This is one of those items that I know I'll have trouble with in the future if I ever misplace the instructions as programming these, in my opinion, is not intuitive.Despite this, I'm not unhappy with this purchase and when my mechanical timers eventually wear out I'll purchase more of these Woods models.

What a clever design.  I much prefer this case to that of the case I purchased for use with my Kindle Fire HD.  Hats off to the designer.  It is refreshing when a form follows function design is also elegant and unique.  I also find this to be surprisingly sturdy and well made.  Good job!I paid $69.99 for this in February of 2015. This works just as expected.  It is the right size and shape to clean the grinder.  It may loose a bristle now and then but that isn't a big deal.  I purchased mine here on Amazon in March of 2015.  I paid $6.97.

I am glad I made this purchase.

I wasn't sure what this App did and because of the name I mistakenly assumed that it was an email client of some sort.  I realize that this must sound naive to those who are familiar with this App and the U.K. Daily Mail newspaper.  For others who may also be confused, MailOnline is the website of the "Daily Mail", a newspaper in the United Kingdom, and of its sister paper "The Mail on Sunday".  According to Wikipedia, MailOnline is the most visited English-language newspaper website in the world with over 11.34m visitors daily in August 2014.  That pleasantly surprised me as I assumed the New York Times held that distinction.I have become a fan of this App for the most part.  It is customizable for U.S. or U.K news and includes categories you can select to sync.  The categories apparently equate to sections of the newspaper.  Taping sections in the app syncs the stories to your device.The news homepage can be set for either the U.K. or U.S. and that's also true of a section they have called "Showbiz".  For some reason the sports section is just called "Sport", as if there were only one.There are other sections one typically expects to find, such as Health, Money, Science & Technology, Travel and Motoring.  There is a section called "Femail" which is apparently a lifestyle section intended for female readers.  I guess that play on words/paper's name works well in the U.K. but it looks strange to my eye.  There's also what I would call a Huffington Post-type section named "RightMinds" as well.This app and its content loads quickly on my Kindle Fire HD.  There is apparently also MailOnline Tablet Apps for the iPad, iPad Mini, Android Tablets and Blackberry platforms but I have no experience with any of these variations.  I am surprised when I hear Blackberry anything these days and don't think I know of one person who still has one of those device.I would give this app five stars if there were a way to customize the presentation such that it wasn't necessary to scroll through empty sections to find the section one has chosen to sync.  If you haven't installed this app I know that must not make much sense.  As an example, if you have chosen to sync the Money and Travel sections only, you are still going to have to scroll through Home, Showbiz, Femail, Sport, World News, Science&Tech, Health and RightMinds before you can get to the information you've chosen to sync to your device.  If that is altered in future releases I will give this app five stars.

These are great for any guy, anytime, and are also my favorite for deployments. When out in the field, facilities for showering and taking care of personal hygiene are infrequent and in many locations non-existent. Well-meaning moms/wives who send their soldiers care packages often include Pampers wipes. Don't make your soldier use Pampers, send him these Dude Wipes instead - they're MUCH cooler.Also, the individual Dude Wipes have condom-like packaging and are easier to carry - Dude Products Dude Wipes 2 Boxes of 30.Seriously, every guy appreciates these. Soldier and civilian dude approved! I last purchased this Dispenser Pack (48ct) on March 12, 2015. The cost was $6.99 and shipping was free with Amazon Prime.

I am now careful to make sure any plastics that come into contact with my food are non-toxic polyethylene/BPA-Free and these Gladware containers meet this safety criteria.  I haven't had a need to stack these with their lids on so the lid design some have complained about hasn't been an issue for me.  These are sturdy and a good size for smaller leftovers and snacks.  I last purchased these in November of 2014 as a part of a Prime Pantry order.  The price at that time was $2.57 for the 4 oz 8 ct package.

I installed this on a Kindle Fire HD 8.9 (3rd generation Fire Tablet).  I am giving this three stars because it allows me to look at my LinkedIn and see updates and photos from my connections and that's enough for me in terms of my tablet needs. The scratching post is the best I've seen and I'm really happy about that purchase.  I got mine at PetCo and I didn't event know this perch existed.  I wouldn't have bought it except I noticed that my cats were jumping up and sitting on the top of the post without the perch so I went on to Amazon to see if there was a perch accessory.  There was, and I figured if they liked it up there that much I'd spring for this perch.Installation of this perch on to the post was easy.  It went on smoothly and attached securely.  The entire installation took under a minute.Some reviewers have complained about the size of the perch and suggested it should be larger.  I believe the manufacturer's made the perch as large as they could given the size of the base.  Any larger and the entire post probably becomes unstable.My two cats both just jump up onto the perch and either don't need or don't want to claw their way up the post to the perch.  As a result I haven't seen or encountered any of the perch pad durability issues that some of the others have pointed out.  But I really think my cats would be just as happy even if it didn't have the pad on the perch at all.  They have lots of padded beds and softer sleep options so this is really more for entertainment and distraction option than a long term resting place.Bottom line - the cats like it a lot.  I think it is durable and that installation was easy.  I can't give this anything but five stars and I'm glad I made the purchase.  I purchased mine here on Amazon in March of 2015 and paid $16.99.  Shipping was free with Amazon Prime.

I really like this in the morning as a juice, but it also makes a nice granita.  Granita (in Italian also granita siciliana) is a semi-frozen dessert made from sugar, water and various flavorings. Originally from Sicily, it is available all over Italy in somewhat different forms. It is related to sorbet and Italian ice; however, in most of Sicily, it has a coarser, more crystalline texture.  The recipe is on the V8 juice web site or just do a quick Bing search for "Pomegranate Blueberry Granita" and you'll probably get a hit right away.  It's easy and provides for a tasty and unique frozen dessert.Prep: 10 minutesChill: 5 hours 30 minutesServes: 6I last purchased this here on Amazon in November of 2014 as part of a Prime Pantry order.  I paid $2.98 for the 46 oz size and the Prime Pantry Box shipping flat rate was $5.99.

Clotrimazole works on two types of fungus where the active ingredient of competing over-the-counter (tolnaftate) only works on one. This works great on both jock itch and athlete's foot.I last purchased this in February of 2015 here on Amazon and the 3 pack price was $7.00.  Shipping was free with Amazon Prime.

3.5 CocktailsThere are some great things about this book and some issues; first let me tell you about the story.Dorrie Applegate is on her way to London to write her first biography on the most famous male model  Grant Maxwell.  This is her first assignment and her company sets her up in first class and in one of the best hotels in London.  Of course sitting next to her is a gorgeous Brit who takes a liking to Dorrie and who Dorrie accidentally falls asleep on.  The get to London spend the evening together and one thing leads to another and spend the night together  the next day Dorrie goes to meet the handsome Grant Maxwell and of course standing there was the man she just spent the evening with  of course he gave her a fake name and the story kicks off from there.  After a lot of misunderstandings and some time apart they find each other again and live HEA.What worked for me  I love the idea of a great looking man falling for a real women with curves who is not afraid of taking what she wants and both Grant and Dorrie fit this bill.  Overall I loved Grant  he is funny, shy doesnt date much and is a loner.  He would rather read non fiction than go out to and that is very different than what you sometimes finding in stories like these.  Dorrie is curvy and not shy.  She takes what she wants and gives with her whole heart  loved that about her.  They are opposites but fit so well together and I believed they belonged together.What didnt work for me  I didnt get the choices both Dorrie and Grant made throughout the story.  For Dorrie I know she is young and inexperienced but what she did with Luke came completely out of the blue for me  the reasons why didnt make sense within the context of her relationship with Grant.  I know there needs to be conflict but this was harsh.  Though her remorse and realizing that what she thought she wanted was not true to her heart was well done.  I felt her pain.For Grant after he and Dorrie break up  within 24 hours he is already with another women and Dorries cousin no less.  Again out of context for me  didnt understand it.  Also the reasons why he chooses to continue that relationship rather than go back to Dorrie who clearly loves did not resonant with me.  Grant is a gentleman and I loved that about him it just took a little long to get to the next part of the book for me.Getting past what didnt work I thought Julia Harlows writing was well done  she is very descriptive and I loved that.  I did think the characters banter back and forth was a lot of fun and I loved how Grant was able to show Dorrie a different life.  If you are looking for a good summer read this is a great book for you.Reviewed by Felicia for Cocktails and Books
these espadrilles are cute, but they do run a bit narrow.  I could wear the shoes for a few hours before the sides of my feet would start to hurt.  I think, in time, the leather will stretch.

And I loved how Whitney G proved, through flashbacks, that these two truly were meant for each other from the moment they met in fourth grade.Another amazing story from an author who is on my autobuy list. 4.5 CocktailsAnother great book by Ms. Opal Carew. Loved the storyline, the characters and just plain loved it. Laurie has been dating Donovan for several months he was sweet in the beginning but has been becoming more controlling and abusive. They are celebrating their 6 month anniversary at a bar that just so happens to be the same bar where a badass MC club is celebrating the birthday of their leader, Steele. Laurie's brother feels that something is up with Donovan so he uses his connections to have her kidnapped but Steele is not onboard with the idea, it appears to him that Laurie and Donovan are happy together  but when he leaves the bar he tells one of his buddies to keep an eye on Laurie and it doing so he sees Donovan become physical with Laurie and has no choice but to rescue/kidnap her. Laurie is thrown into the MC life which is so different from what she has known. She tries to escape several times without success and the tension and attraction between her and Steele really heats up. This story has lots of twists and turns that keep you reading to the end.Reviewed by Susan for Cocktails and Books

The sandals are great.  However, the leather on the side does dig into my little toe on each foot.  The leather is loosening up each time I wear them, so I'm confident it will eventually give enough where it won't bother me after a couple of hours.

Shannon's ThoughtsCOME TO ME RECKLESSLY was another AL Jackson book that sent me on an emotional rollercoaster, which is something AL Jackson is really, really good at doing.Christopher Moore was a character we were introduced to in the first 2 books in this series.  He was a bit of a manwhore, but you figured he was young and sowing his wild oats.  But in COME TO ME RECKLESSLY we discovered there is so much more to Christopher than we ever imagined.  He was broken and using whatever means he could:  alcohol, women or both, to numb his feelings and to not remember his 'light'.Samantha Schultz was Christopher's high school sweetheart.  She owned him completely, but her inexperience and faith were constantly at war with the intense feelings she had for Christopher.  And when they were tested, by her parents forced separation and his foundation shattered, Samantha's trust in Christopher and herself was severely broken.  So when she comes face to face with part of her past in Target, everything Samantha had been running from for seven years became the same things she found herself running towards...no matter the outcome.There was no doubt in my mind these two characters were meant to be together.  The sheer depth of Samantha's terror and Christopher's 'hate' (because he never really hated her, even though he said he did) meant they had big feelings for each other.  But I had to wonder how AL Jackson was going to get these two past all the hurt, the lies and Ben for them to be together.  She definitely didn't make it easy on the two of them.  They each harbored their own set of hurts over what happened to them, but once Christopher put that stake in the ground and said he was going to stop hurting Samantha, you could tell things would be OK....eventually.I loved the chemistry between these two.  Despite some of the harsh things he had said to her early in the book, Christopher was careful with Samantha.  He knew she was fragile and needed him to hold back, even if it was killing him.  It was a testament to just how much he felt for her, that he was there to praise her when she needed it or just to make her smile.  And with Christopher, Samantha grew.  She shed the timid girl who did as she was told and became the woman who could do whatever she wanted, be who she wanted, with the right kind of support.AL Jackson's couples never have an easy road, but she always brings them out the other side with a solid foundation and a knowledge they can get through anything together.  Samantha and Christopher were no different.  You knew their faith in themselves and each other would get them through whatever storm they faced and they would always be together.

3.5 CocktailsI've read the first two books in this series and they were great. The last better than the first, the story distinct from each other even with the same setting but Brody's story. it was good but it kind of fell short to expectations. Brody goes away leaves the love of his life behind but comes back when his job doesn't work out. Madilyn the woman who refused to go with him feels slighted even though it was her own fault. But everything works out, quicker than the norm but I was glad for that. I really don't like it when guys apologies when the woman is at fault.Then a horror from Brody's past is introduced and even that ends quicker than normal. I guess what I'm saying is I wasn't given time to get immersed in the story and the characters because it all went by too fast. Maybe if the reconciliation and the threat were concurrent, plus a litle back story it would have been more engaging. It felt more like a rest stop before the real story in the subsequent stories.But I still love this series and I'm looking forward to the next books especially Sam's and Wyatt's stories.Reviewed by Rina for Cocktails and Books

This is a set of two shorter novels about the Masters brothers, Chance and Lucky, who had a horrible childhood and work to overcome those issues to be with the women they love.Second Chance Cowboy is the story of Chance and Kenzie. They have known each other since she was a little girl and he was a teenager/early 20 something bull rider/hand on her fathers ranch. She has been in love with him since high school and hes been fighting his attraction to her just as long. After not seeing each other for 10 years, hes back and they discover that their feelings havent really changed.I really wish this story had been a little longer. The author does an excellent job of letting us catch glimpses of the history between these two and letting us know why Chance feels the way he does, but there were several places that felt rushed. We also went from Chance staking his claim and explaining his childhood to Kenzie to them instantly being engaged. It seemed that we missed out on several key relationship steps that would have really added to the story.Lucky in Love is a companion to Second Chance Cowboy and really wouldnt work as a stand-alone. It is the story of Chances younger brother, Lucky, and Kenzies best friend, Cammie. Again, we have a younger woman who has loved her Masters brother since high school, but he really didnt pay too much attention to her.Where Second Chance Cowboy was too short, Lucky in Love was just right in length. Neither Lucky nor Cammie really struck me as characters that I could spend a lot of time with and not want to crack their heads together. I enjoyed Luckys story, but it could have become repetitive if it had continued too much longer.Overall, Cook County Cowboys was a sweet anthology and I wouldnt mind coming back to meet some of the neighbors.Reviewed by Elizabeth for Cocktails and Books

Callum is a Dom who is the process of opening his own club.  He is juggling a lot at one time.  When he meets Lee, he is unsure he has the time to train Lee properly.  Callum wants to protect Lee as well as get to know him better.Lee is a submissive who has never been trained to be a submissive.  He is a natural.  He has had a rough childhood and is wary of those around him due to the abuse he suffered at his step-fathers hands.The connection between Lee and Callum is intense.  While the both seem to fight there attraction to each other, but they still end up together no matter how much the try to fight it.  The sex scenes were scorching.  I enjoyed seeing how both of them kept planning for the future.I found this book well written with a distinctive plot. The main characters and the secondary characters were mesmerizing. At 120 pages, this book had a well-defined beginning, middle and ending. While the ending was a little predictable, the journey the book takes the reader is gripping with several unanticipated twists and turns. I had a hard time putting this book down. Overall, this was a very enchanting book and I cant wait to read the next book in the series.Reviewed by Victoria for Cocktails and Books

4.5 CocktailsKeely James loves his partner and cant imagine a life without him but Dominic has worked so much that Keely rarely sees him.  When Keely really needs Dominic, he cant get a hold of him.  Keely makes a life altering decision that in the end is what is best for Keely.  It takes a strong person to themselves first and make decisions that are best for them.Dominic Loudan loves Keely and really thinks he show Keely by working so much, so they have a more comfortable life style. He works a lot and spends more time away from Keely than at home.  It comes to the point that he has not spoken to Keely in weeks and when he gets home from a business trip finds out his life has turned upside down and they only person to blame is himself.The connection between Dominic and Keely is intense. When they are together they fit together very well the biggest issue is how much Dominic works.  Dominic is bent on making as much money as he can to make his life with Keely better but seems to miss the bigger picture, that life is not just about money. The sex scenes were scorching.  The only issue I had with this story was where did Dominic live when he was away from Keely.  To be gone that much meant he had to sleep somewhere and that was never really explained.I found this book well written with an intense and fascinating plot. The main concept of the story is very simple but the story stays with you long after you finish the story. The main characters and the secondary characters were mesmerizing.  The ending was a bit predictable but this book is more about the journey to the end that how the story ends.  I had a hard time putting this book down. Overall, this was a very captivating book and I would love to see these characters again in the future.Reviewed by Victoria for Cocktails and Books

Gigi is starting her first real adult job, at the Vampire Headquarters, and of course things dont go as smoothly as they should. Ive read other books in this series, but it had been awhile so I was a bit confused at times, yet Gigi drew me into her world and I was entranced. Throw in Nik, a vampire who kisses her one second, attempts to kill her the next, yet remembers none of it.Gigi was definitely meant for a dark and brooding vampire, and of course Nik is probably all the more mysterious and enticing because all of the over protective vampires in her life want to keep them apart.There is villain that keeps causing hijinks and it really works for the story. This is a first person story, and while thats not always a favorite of mine, Molly Harper always has such interesting characters that I easily enjoy their inner monologues.I definitely recommend this one, its a fantastic story that does a decent job of introducing new readers to the series world.Reviewed by Sheri for Cocktails and Books

Lady Serena of Talisand has already lost so much.  She lost her father to war.  She lost her brother when he left to join the rebellion.  She lost the only place shes ever called home, Talisand, when King William gave the land and her hand  in marriage to one of his knights Renaud de Pierrepont The Red Wolf.  The only recourse that will allow her to have some independence is to escape before The Red Wolf arrives.  However, Serena doesnt realize that escaping from her destiny is going to much harder than she ever imagined.Lady Serena is loyal, loving, independent, fearless, and determined to protect the people of Talisand from The Red Wolf.  I loved her character, and I immediately became vested in her happiness.  She was more concerned about others than herself.  She didnt consider herself above the people, and she wasnt afraid to work and/or walk among them.  The Red Wolf was not what Serena feared. He was loyal, caring, humble, and fierce in battle.  He dealt with Serena in a very sympathetic but firm manner.  He was wise in the way he handled King William, but he protected his wife and their people from harm.  I loved him as a hero in this story.  He had a difficult job, but he readily accepted his lot and made the best of it.  The chemistry between the two of them was off the charts.  It was definitely a passionate union.The storyline kept me engaged and entertained.  I followed every twist and turn in the plot with great interest.  I cheered Serena on as she blended in with the other women and spurned The Red Wolfs advances.  I felt her trepidation when it was obvious that there was no way to get away from The Red Wolf.  I felt conflicted as Serena fell more in love with her husband and sought to protect the interests of her family and the people of Talisand.  I literally held my breath as I read the battlefield scene.  Each time The Red Wolf showed himself to be the consummate gentleman and warrior.  The secondary characters also won my heart.  I cant wait to read their stories.I love Regan Walkers work.  She is author in a class by herself.  She goes to great length to remain true to the medieval period an even includes actual historical information.  She goes into even more detail at the conclusion of the novel.  Im not a history lover, but Walkers weaving of history leaves the reader panting for more.  Her character development is unparalleled.  I enjoyed every aspect of this book, and I hope that the remaining stories are of the same superior quality as this one.Reviewed by Michelle for Cocktails and Books

An enjoyable read, you have a woman running from an abusive boyfriend she befriends the leader of a motorcycle gang and sparks fly.  But will it all last? They are from different worlds, can she adapt and accept the rules of the gang and can he commit to her and only her? The story was good, it could have been a couple of chapters longer.Reviewed by Susan for Cocktails and Books

Angel is house sitting for a friend when late at night she hears noises from the first floor of the house. Little does she know that the intruder is actually the older brother of her friend who she is house sitting for, he is on a short leave from the military.  He is the older brother who just happens to be a hot navy seal she has had a crush on since seeing his picture. Though she had never met him she had fallen in love with him from his picture and what his sister had told her about him. Now he was standing in front of her in the flesh. What now?Reviewed by Susan for Cocktails and Books

This is the second book in The Nelsons Tea series.  I did read the first book, and I enjoyed it.  This book is easily read on its own.Captain Henry Guffald meets his match in Lady Adele Seaton.  Both have something to prove and will stop at nothing to accomplish their goal.  Lady Adele masterfully takes control of Captain Guffalds ship.  That happens fairly early in the story and it goes downhill from there.  The characters are unrealistic and poorly developed.  Lady Adele the pirate turns into a spoiled brat.  She throws tantrums and has to be locked in her room by her father.  I just kept thinking how old is she supposed to be.  It just killed the whole image of her character being independent and fearless.  I think the author just went too far in an attempt to show that Adele was feisty and had a temper.  I liked Henrys character in the previous book.  I felt sorry for him, and I had high hopes for him in this book.  His character seemed bitter and never seemed to find happiness in this book.  I never felt vested in any of the characters, and I never bought into them being a coupe.  There was no real chemistry between the two of them.The storyline has a few bright spots but ends up being bogged down with details and very little action.  I felt like there were details that left you hanging.  The author never really clarified that Adele and Henry were after the same goal.  So there was no point where they came together and decided to work together to free Adeles brother.  It just all sort of happened at the end of the book and then the story was basically over.It was a struggle to stay engaged in the story, and I hope the next book is better.Reviewed by Michelle for Cocktails and Books

The hero is John Dalkington-Smythe. He wanted to escape his role as just in case heir to the title. He goes into the military and moves to Canada following the war.  Unfortunately tragedy strikes and he must return to claim the title and produce an heir with his assumed wife.  The assumed wife is Faith Smith.  She is the real widow of John Smith.  As John Smiths widow Faith would have been destitute, but John Dalkington-Smythes widow would receive widows benefits.  So she pretends to be the widow of John Dalkington-Smythe not knowing that her husband is still alive.  This was a great storyline that just never took off.  The characters were just sort of blah.  I was never vested in the characters or the storyline.  I did like that they had great chemistry and genuinely seemed to respect each other.  Each wanted to do the right thing and worked together to resolve their plight.There was no excitement to the storyline.  The rejection from society seemed overblown even for a historical novel.  Each plot twist fizzled even what I thought would be the main twist which was the man that wanted to blackmail Faith.  He ended up being killed and that was that.  The embezzlement from the estate was also easily solved.  There wasnt enough intrigue to keep you interested in the storyline.There wasnt anything spectacular or memorable about the book.  The characters were just average and the pace of the storyline was slowReviewed by Michelle for Cocktails and Books

There are certain authors on my auto-buy list. By that I mean authors whose new releases I purchase sight unseen.  Christine Feehan happens to be one of those authors. That being said, this was not one of my favorite books by Feehan. The Ghost Walkers series is a long running one and its pretty fantastic if I do say so myself. So of course I expected nothing less in this the 11th book in the series.Although filled with action and great characters, I found it a bit slow to really get started. The story just seemed to drag on far longer than I felt was necessary. That being said, eventually the story did pick up. However, I still I found a lot of the dialogue to be redundant and unnecessary. At times, even the main character comes across as a real jerk and not likable.Perhaps it was wrong timing for me. I just couldnt seem to get in to the story. Do I give up on it entirely and call it a day? Im thinking no. On the off chance that maybe it was a fluke and I was just not in the right frame of mind for it, Ive decided to wait a couple of months and try rereading it. Feehan had never let me down before Viper Game so I see no reason why this time would be different. So my current recommendation is Read at your own risk.Reviewed by Iris for Cocktails and Books

Harper is running from her past bent on not deal with the lasting effects of what the Sculptor left her.  She is closed off and not looking for a relationship at all.  Harper is an artist who is very good at what she does. She tries almost desperately keep out of the spotlight no matter who much people want her to do.Evan Hawthorne is a man who gets what he wants and he wants Harper.  He is bent getting to know her and the more she tries to pull from him the more he wants to know her.  There are times that Evan comes across almost stalker like with his intent to pursue her.The connection between Evan and Harper is intense.  Evan tries very hard to break Harper out of her shell as much as Harper tries not to fall for Evan.  This book had a great balance of mystery and romance.  The sex scenes were scorching.Another Brush Stroke is the first book in The Carnal Exhibitions series by L. W. Barefoot.  I found this book well written with a unique plot. The main characters and the secondary characters were mesmerizing.  This book ends with a cliffhanger so those not fond of them keep this in mind. Overall, this was a great book and I cant wait for the next book in the series.Reviewed by Victoria for Cocktails and Books

OMG! This was a great story, if you love an alpha male and a self sufficient female with steamy sex and bad boy bikers you need to pick up this book and get reading.  The story moved smoothly and was captivating I could not put the book down until I was finished with the story.  I just found myself a new author to follow.Reviewed by Susan for Cocktails and Books

4.5 CocktailsOh, I loved this book!  Erin Leaf is a favorite of mine, and she's never disappointed me...never.  "Rock Star Baby" is another win for me!This is the love story of Ryan, a rock singer, and Bardulf, the Alpha Heir to his pack of wolf shifters.  They meet through a hilarious series of events, and the sparks fly right away...I mean REALLY fly.  I don't want to give too much away, but what happens when the two of them are together for the first time is so primal and HOT that I had to take a break for a few minutes after I read it.  After their...er...lovemaking (ok, so it was some really great and insane sex), something is unleashed in Ryan that he'd never thought possible.  The love story between Ryan and Bardulf isn't all smooth sailing.  There are misunderstandings, occasions where both of them act like fools, but still their relationship continues to grow.  Our guys are also trying to deal with the distance between them.  Ryan is on tour with his band, and Bardulf is left to tend to pack business.  To me, that felt like the most difficult part of all.  I really felt for them, but they work it all out when they are presented with a wonderful surprise.  Once again, no spoilers, but it DID make me smile a mile wide, and once again, I really could feel their emotions.  That is one of the things that Ms. Leaf is best at.  She writes so well that the reader can really connect with the characters in her stories."Rock Star Baby" has a really great underlying plot.  It's a real mystery, and it's an interesting one at that.  It was an important part of the story without detracting from the romance.  I was completely enthralled, and when I found out what was happening, I was gobsmacked.  Also, there are some background characters who have some awesome personalities, and I can't wait for the sequels that are bound to come because I'd really like to get to know these guys better.All in all, as you can see, I really enjoyed this book.  It's romantic, sweet, HOT, and very sexy.  If you like your MM stories filled with shifters, miracles, and suspense, this is definitely for you.  If you're new to Erin Leaf, this is a good starter novel (although she writes about all sorts of things).  You need to pick this one up.Reviewed by Kenna for Cocktails and Books

What harm could come from impersonating royalty?After years on the road conning wealthy nobles out of their gold, Kiera is ready to give up her life of crime and return to her childhood home of Cearbhall. Shes got one last job in mind, one that will see her set for life. What harm could come from impersonating a country princess to marry a prince and live wealthily ever after? Except her childhood home is nothing like she remembered. The king has gone senile, his younger sons rule with terror, and the crown prince is missing. The prince shes to wed is only interested in siring an heir, and her future brother-in-law wants to get into her skirts. Deciding the grifters life wasnt so bad after all, Kiera plots her escape. Before she can steal away, shes discovered and thrown into the dungeon with a crazed wolfborn to die.Lachlan never thought that he'd see his childhood sweetheart once his wolfborn affliction set in. Nor did he expect to ever see daylight. Imprisoned in the dungeon since adolescence, his brothers have usurped the throne and trail evil in their wake. When Kiera lands in the dungeon with him, he recovers his will to put things right. Kiera may not remember him, but he remembers her, and Lachlan vows to save her from his brothers and their schemes.Except Kiera wields a power unlike any other, and she doesnt need saving. But the people of Cearbhall do. As Kiera and Lachlan fight the evil princes, they uncover a greater magic in the world around them, and a powerful magic between them that cant be denied...Reviewed by Elizabeth B for Cocktails and Books

4.5 CocktailsDelicious Surprise is the second book in the Interracial Heat series by E. A. Reynolds.  While this book is part of a series, it can be read and enjoyed as a standalone novel.Koji Snow is a man who is looking for a special someone in his life.  So far, he has not found anyone.  So Koji signs up for a dating service which leads to a match with Jamal.  However, Koji gets flashes of what could be called memories and it frightens him greatly.  It leads him to try and reject him, but Jamal wont go that easily.Jamal Jameson is a man who goes after what he wants.  The more Koji tries to pull away the more Jamal is intrigued by it and wants to get to know him.  Jamal is also a Dom who is looking for a sub and Koji seems like a good combination.  Jamal does his best to protect Koji from the mysterious man who is stalking him.The connection between Koji and Jamal is intense.  Their love has survived several lifetimes.  The more Koji and Jamal spend time together the more Koji remembers his past and the man who wanted to break them up.I found this book well written with an interesting plot. I enjoyed how the author incorporated romance and mysterious in a believable way. The main characters and the secondary characters were realistic.  While the ending was a little predictable, the journey the book takes the reader is gripping with several unanticipated twists and turns. I had a hard time putting this book down.  Overall, this is wonderful book.Reviewed by Victoria for Cocktails and Books

4.5 CocktailsI have to say that, "Apples and Gin" from Jenna Jones is one of the sweetest romances I've ever read.  I mean it, and I'm not just talking about just in a male/male story, but in ANY category.  I was so pleasantly surprised by it!  Sure, the blurb looked interesting, but I was just amazed and how much I enjoyed reading it.Sawyer is an up and coming country music star, and he meets Noah, a well known celebrity photographer, when the record label sent him to have his picture taken for his first album.  There's obvious chemistry between the two of them, but they don't become a couple right away...and their journey begins.  I don't want to give anything away, but I do want to say that I really liked Ms. James's writing style.  She started the book in the present, then went back ten years, then back to the present, then back nine years, and so on.  I know that may sound a bit convoluted, but it really wasn't.  It was very easy to follow and also quite smooth.  We got to meet Sawyer and Noah and get to know them as men, watch them grow, and look into their lives together AND apart.I smiled A LOT as I read.  Of course, there were a few moments when I started to tear up.  There was just enough angst to move the plot along.  There weren't many sex scenes, Sawyer and Noah certainly made them count!  They were hot, but they were tender and romantic as well.  These men just fit together so perfectly, and I fell in love with both of them as the story progressed.This isn't a very long book.  In fact, I read it in one sitting in about an hour, but it was a fantastic hour.  It's been a long time since a short read has been so satisfying to me.  I loved everything about it, and I can't gush about it enough.  Please, please, please get yourself a copy of "Apples and Gin".  You won't be disappointed.Reviewed by Kenna for Cocktails and Books

Master Squire is the sixth book in the Masters of Tabu series by Gray Dixon.  While this book is part of a series, it can be read and enjoyed as a standalone novel.Jagger is the security manager at Club Tabu.  He is continually frustrated at his job because his partners do not listen to him.  Jagger has a volatile temper with is pushed to the limits when the other do not listen to him.  Jagger also struggles with PTSD from his time in the military.Zayne is a doctor who is in over his head.  He keeps baling out his brother from trouble and the latest problem his brother gets involved in is no different.  Zayne is slow to trust anyone because is all the problems his brother has landed him in.  However, Zayne is attracted to Jagger and when they meet again wants to get to know him.The connection between Zayne and Jagger is intense.  Jagger is attracted to Zayne and wants to help him even as he does not know the reason Zayne is on the run.  The sex scenes were scorching.I found this book well written with a realistic plot. The main characters and the secondary characters were fascinating.  While the ending was a little predictable, this story has twists and turns that keep you interested all the way through. I had a hard time putting this book down. Overall, this was a very captivating book and I hope to see these characters again in the future.Reviewed by Victoria for Cocktails and Books

So, I just finished "We Need Him" part two.  I am so tense right now, I feel like I could snap.I read "We Need Him" part one and liked it very much.  Sure, there was a cliffhanger, but I was satisfied thinking that all would be well at the end of part two.  When I find a new author whose work I enjoy, I like to look them up on Amazon or Goodreads to see if they've got any other books out there that I might like to pick up.  Anyway, long story short, I discovered that part two was NOT going to be the end.  Turns out that Sage Mattison (who is very talented, by the way) has a lengthy series planned for our lovely triade...plus holiday shorts.  I was taken aback and did a little freak out when I realized that I wasn't going to get an HEA at the end of this one.  So, I had to step away for a few days.  It's not that I was angry.  I wasn't, but in book one, I'd become emtionally attached to Brett, Jake, and Jamie.  I wanted everything to neatly wrap up for them.  I think that they're one of the best triads I've come across in a long time.With a series, I like to wait until all of the books are available before I read it.  I am a big fan of instant gratification.  I've got zero patience when I'm excited about a story.  I want everything...NOW!  As I mentioned in my review of part one, the three main characters have incredible chemistry.  Seriously...lightning shot out of my Kindle.  They have extremely hot sex...whether it's just Jake and Jamie, or when Brett joins in.  It's not just sex for sex's sake, though.  Those scenes bring the whole thing together.  This is a fledgling relationship, and each of the three have some issues that need to be dealt with...especially Brett.  I feel really connected to him, and my heart goes out to him when he finally comes clean, and here is what I love.  Jake and Jamie have absolutely no trouble accepting him for what he is.  It's angsty.  It's heartwarming.  It's just so damn loving!Now that I'm fully invested, I feel like I'm going to tear my hair out.  Book three became available two days ago, but now I'm not sure if I'm going to one click quite yet.  I'm sure if I do, my stomach will be in knots at the end of that because I won't be able to jump into a part four right away.  I'm giving serious consideration to waiting until the series is complete.  It would probably save my sanity.  Still...I'm not quite married to that decision.Do I recommend this book?  Yes!  From what I've read so far, I can tell you that this will be a great series.  If you have an iron constitution and can relax between waits, give Brett, Jake, and Jamie a chance.  They won't let you down.Reviewed by Kenna for Cocktails and Books

Okay... there was just entirely too much going on in this book for me.  I read the first book in the series a while ago and truly enjoyed it.  But as the series has progressed, I've liked it less and less.  Glory used to be a character that I admired.  I loved that she was a "heavier set" lady (even though I'd HARDLY call a size 12 heavy).  But as time has gone on, she annoyingly harps on herself.*Slight soap box moment*Nothing irritates me more than when an author writes a female character as a heavy set woman and sucks all of the self-confidence and self-worth out of her. They always write them to have self-doubt and low self-esteem and spend chapters of an otherwise worthy story using it as an excuse to constantly drone on with fat shaming jokes and comments.  Is it truly so hard to believe that a "fat" woman can't just be happy with who she is?  It is inconceivable to believe that she can live a normal life like anyone else regardless of her size?  Sorry for the rant, but it's so infuriating!Aside from that, the book was okay.  It had a lot going on in it, which was at times a little overwhelming, but the core of the story was solid.  The author created a lot of scenarios that kept me wanting to read on, and I did enjoy that aspect of the book.Overall, I think that the author should spend less time making her main character someone I don't want to spend time with, and more time on expanding on this creative world she's built.Reviewed by Marie for Cocktails and Books

4.5 Cocktails.In the emotional and somewhat nerve-wrecking ending to Liz and Sam's story, I found myself incredibly torn about whether or not these two could overcome all the obstacles in their way.  You can feel the love these two characters had for each other.  It was almost as if their love was a secondary character in the story.  It was always there, peeking around a corner, waving a flag, saying "here I am, but I don't think I want to get mixed up in that," pointing at the mess that always seemed to be between Sam and Liz.  The mess was epic, was a result of some disturbed individuals, but also because of Liz and Sam themselves.Liz and Sam are perfect for each other, but they have in incredibly annoying knack of letting others determine what they should do and they both can't quite seem to bring up things that are important in a relationship.  They're both quick to believe the worst in the other and then beg for forgiveness when they realize they were wrong.  And as heartbreaking as it was to follow these two and their inability to get it together, it was also frustrating.  I often found myself yelling at my kindle, telling Liz to stop being a freaking doormat or demanding Sam grow some freaking balls and stop the insanity.  The eventually get it right, but it's a roller coaster of an emotional ride that had me making all sorts of deals with my kindle hoping it would end as I want.Another fabulous book revolving around the characters of New Hope.  Lexi Ryan, knows how to write a story that can drive me over the edge and then just when I'm about to give up all hope, make me believe in the hero and heroine again.

This book started out slow, alot of laying the background of the main characters but once you got past this it was a very good book. Dusty a retired Navy Seal and April a Nurse new to the area each coming from different family backgrounds and trying to understand each other. Dusty is a loner and like it that way whereas April enjoys being around people and helping when she can. April adopts a couple of horses so they won't be put down. In her search for a place to house her horses she meets Dusty and even though he has his quirks and does not like to be social this does not stop April from wanting the best for him.  This story has many ups and downs but does end with happily every after.  I look forward to reading more of Ms. Cheyenne Meadows writings.Reviewed by Susan for Cocktails and Books

CRASHING THE NET is the perfect blend of wonderfully written hockey romance, with realistic characters and sizzling chemistry.  Izzy has always had a tough life and learns at an early age she must make sacrifices for her family.  She and her sisters start a business called Party Crashers and while working at one of the parties she meets Cooper, a professional hockey player with the Sockeyes.  They are attracted to one another, but they are cautious and stubborn and fight their feelings for each other.  I admire Izzy and all she has accomplished. She has practically raised her sisters herself.  She hasnt had an easy life, but she never gives up and always has an optimistic attitude.  Izzy is an independent woman and doesnt allow Cooper to overwhelm her with his macho, overprotective ways and I love how she stands up to him.  He is not used to a woman like Izzy and isnt sure how to deal with her smart mouth, which he finds both aggravating and sexy.  Cooper is jealous and protective of Izzy and it drives her crazy that he doesnt trust her, but he cant help how he feels, his past has taught him not to trust women.  Cooper is easy to like.  On the outside he is a big, tough hockey player, with a loud bark but he is also a nice guy with a big heart.Jami Davenport writes a captivating story about a sexy hockey player who is macho and sensitive and a sassy woman who gives him a run for his money.  This is the third book in the Game On in Settle series and each one is a stand-alone.  I thoroughly enjoyed getting lost in this book.Reviewed by Karen for Cocktails and Books

WHEN FATE ISN'T ENOUGH picks up shortly after then end of WHEN FATES COLLIDE.  Lily is following Gavin to London in hopes of healing and fixing her relationship with Gavin.  But as fate would have it, Lily's past follows stirring up more trouble and then Gavin's past steps up, testing just how strong the bond is between Lily and Gavin.It's hard to write this review and not giveaway vital pieces of information that must be discovered by the reader as they get to it.  But if you read WHEN FATES COLLIDE, than you know Isabelle Richards is about to take you on one hell of a ride.  IGavin and Lily are truly a great couple.  When things are going right for them, they're fun, sexy, and can burning up the pages.  But they spend too much time fighting each other.  Gavin is over-protective with Lily, so she ends up sneaking behind Gavin's back because she knows he'd flip.  In the end, Gavin flips anyway and they have to do the whole fight, apologize and make up thing.  But we expect this, because Lily was the loose cannon.  But in WHEN FATE ISN'T ENOUGH, Gavin also becomes a bit of a loose cannon.  He's moody, hiding things and spend more time trying to make it up to Lily.  He explains why and I could understand his temporary mood swings.  But there can only be one loose cannon in this series and I think Lily firmly owns that.I'm on pins and needles waiting for the next book.  Fate can't be as cruel as it appears to be, so I'll put my faith in Isabelle Richards that there will be a happily ever after.  I'm too invested in this series for it to be anything else.

This book was unbelievable! The action, the politics, the suspense, the subterfuge; I was completely enthralled. Aria is Psykera human born with psychokinetic powers. Arias power is pyrokinesis. Her father was also a Psyker and tried to teach her to harness and control her abilities before he was murdered before Arias eyes. One of the last things her father said to her was to stay away from other Psykers. Aria doesnt know the reason but she hides her abilities and quickly moves away when she thinks anyone may be on to her secret.Aria is currently in Spokane, Washington working as a mercenary. Shes working an abduction and murder case of a 7-year-old boy. The boy turns out to be a shifter and fingers are pointed at the vampire coven as the ones responsible. When a second shifter is murdered along with a vampire, both shifters and vampires begin preparing for war. Are one or both factions responsible or is there another deadlier threat on the horizon? Chaos ensues and lines are drawn. Aria wants no part of the upcoming war but she may not have a choice as every faction plots to woo herand her invaluable powersto their side. The action is just starting to heat up in this brilliantly crafted dog-eat-dog world where trust is deceptive and safety is a faade.Oh my GOODNESS! I completely devoured this book in one siting it was THAT GOOD! I loved the reading about the new reality after the Awakening and about all the paranormal beings. I also loved Aria. Her strength was admirable and her constant struggles with self-control made her easily relatable. I liked how the story is told from first person point-of-view but I would have loved to have had other POVs from James, a wolf shifter whos a friend of Arias, Mike, Arias boss and father-figure and other characters in the story. On the other hand, being told from first person leaves more of a mystery and its one Im completely hooked on!Im not sure what genre this book falls under but while reading it, it did feel a bit like a New Adult fantasy. There wasnt any romance in the book but theres certainly promise of one and I could see the possibility of a love triangle but there have been no love/lust feelings developed between Aria and any character in the book, yet. The story was solely focused on the suspense/mystery aspect as well as the threat of war.I thought the story was amazing and I loved every word of it.
