I have a great Bench Dog Tools 40-102 ProMax Cast Iron Router Table Extension that is excellent that I bought from Amazon a few years back!  Love it.I had my great older "Traditional Style" Craftsman Router (a very beautiful tool) mounted under the table where it could not be seen nor used easily.  Buying this assembly, has allowed me to save my Craftsman router unit, and place my nice, but not quite as nice, Bosch under the table..... but now, with the extra body base, I can slip out the Bosch router motor assembly with ease, I can also slip back in the motor from the Craftsman if needed and use it instead, and/or place it all back into the regular base or plunge router base and use it.This is very high quality.... as high as anything I have seen or used.... and is not set up to use other than with a table so they leave the other stuff like the plastic slip base bottom plate out, or handles, and give you mounting screws and hex key adjuster handle as pictured.  Nice!  Works perfectly.  Buy with confidence: reasonable price and great quality Bosch!  Enjoy!

This is an excellent heater unit!  The price is higher than some, but it has several very good things going for it:1:  It is a USA made product for which local service/parts are available, if ever needed.2:  It really does look good, is not too large or heavy, and does not take up a lot of space. (Very well made!)3:  It does not get real hot, so fire safety and child safety are much less of a concern.4:  It has NO moving parts to break, wear out, or fail quickly on it. (A very good thing too.)5:  It relies on convection instead of a fan to distribute the heat into the room. (No fan to quit on you.)Most people are NOT really aware of electrical concerns when looking for a portable electric heater.  This one stays under the level of power use that would cause one to have to be concerned about overloading your circuit breakers..... that sure does matter.  This unit, at the high power setting only requires 12 amps @ 120VAC.  However, if you are going to use this in a front room, or possibly a bedroom setting be aware that your home may be wired with only 15 amp wiring and a 15 amp circuit breaker;  this fact would mean that for continuous use, this is the ONLY thing you want to have plugged into that circuit.  Do NOT plug any heater of 5 KBTU or more into your bedroom or livingroom circuit, then turn on a couple of room lamps and a TV as well.  Plan to never load a circuit to more than 80% of it's rated continuous current.  So, a 20 amp branch circuit should NEVER be run for long periods of time over 16 amps total load, nor a 15 amp at over 1440 watts.  Example:  You take this unit on high, 1500 watt setting which uses 12 amps (as opposed to the "low" 1000 watt switch setting).  Then add a 100 watt light bulb in two night stand lamps, plus you have the TV in your room which takes 250 watts for a total of 450 watts of extra power all in the same room added to the heater which, at 12 amps = 1440 watts..... total load = 1890 watts.  If your bedroom has all the outlets on one 15 amp panel breaker (many/most do), then 15 amps= 1800 watts MAX load short term; @ 80% = 1440 watts.  You will blow the breaker, and possibly risk overloading and over heating the circuit itself.  Some of the larger heaters are full load, by themselves, even on a 20 amp circuit (like the small appliance circuit in most kitchens).  So do use these with wisdom.  As a State Licensed Master Journeyman Electrician of over 20 years, I do caution you with all electrical appliances to not overload and blow circuit breakers over and over, it can lead to panel damage and even a house fire.  This is not meant to say do not use these, fore I am also using one.... right?  :-)  Just do it wisely, and use it right, and it will serve you well and safely.  I hope this helps someone be safe.  Enjoy!

These were an exact replacement of the new factory lighting only 1/5th the cost of OEM by GM! (Installed today on a 2006 Chevy Avalanche Z71.)They look great and to adjust them you do NOT have to have a special security star wrench..... a simple phillips #2 will do very nicely. I installed this into my new Asus A88X-Pro Mobo and it is an Excellent Processor to be sure!  This processor, in the midst of all the over priced units, stands out as being quite a performer in it's own right.  It runs just over 4 GHZ without any board tweeking or boosting of voltages on auto mode: it runs smoothly, has no seeming weaknesses at all, and is an excellent buy for the money paid!!This processor is much under rated and under valued...... that will save you money.  From the many AMDs I have used and worked with, this one stands right up there with my 8 chip processor running at 4.1GHZ...... no real advantage to the higher priced units until you really tippi-toe on the egde I guess.... and since I don't go there because......... reliability is paramount to me......... this is an EXCELLENT choice.  Enjoy!

I purchased this about 2 weeks ago and have been installing the new system and such into this board.  This board has excellent capabilities!  After having the ROG Z board for year now the Bios on this one seems a bit limited, but it is still a great board!  Asus has reduced their warrantees to only 3 years on this board, but being Asus, that is not really much a worry.  If you are looking for the biggest, greatest, fastest Mobo out there, then this is just might not be what you are looking for, and you had prosibly best go for a ROG Asus board to get all you can get.  But if you need a good stable and reliable system, this has a LOT to offer by far over many others out there.... most for a lot more money too!  The built in video is no slouch! The USB 3.0 is fast and flawless in operation! I took this Mobo to replace a fast Dual SLI Mobo that died and did not even bother to add the High Performance video card.  Again, when not into the extremes, this board can really save you a lot of money with all this, and, it is simply built onto it.  It's built in test function for adding various memory sticks make it very easy, and if the BIOS setting crashes while setting it up, you push one onboard button and instant restart that works.  Once again Asus has come up with a excellent product if used for the purpose that it is designed for.  I am using this to do my business work, files, word processors, and graphics displays.... it will be an excellent choice and still have enough to have fun with some pretty good games too.  If I ever (even) need to, I can always add a serious video card and sound card to it.... I am notlikely to need that though from all I have seen so far!I hope this helps........ by the way, the AMD A6-6400+ processor I used runs in it at 4+GHZ with simple auto mode setup!  Works with ease and no over voltages or tweeking is required: This is much skipped over and underated processor that can do well and save you a lot money in the purchase!  As always, be certain to choose proven and tested memory to get the most out of it.  The new memory Test Function is great and saves a LOT of time on setup and testing too.  Enjoy!UPDATE as of 14 November 2014 up to 5 stars:  This has worked flawlessly, and with the afore mentioned auto-speed function in the AI Suite II program, you can seriously get some much higher working speeds going if you want to with flawless ease!  I am regularly running over 4.1 GHZ and it does it all for me without going to over boosting the prosessor volts!  If my ROG MOBO dies on me, I just may replace (even) it with this board or the next itteration of it.  It is that good!  Enjoy. :-)

In my case, I downloaded the "Free Trial Version" to see if it would really work...  It looked so good, sounded perfect, and had some great web reviews..... so with the "Money Back Guarantee" how could I go wrong, right?WhatI actually bought was the "EaseUS Recovery Program" from them.  It looked so good, and the write-ups about the software sounded just right,so I paid the money and then tried to use it.  It was 6.5 hours into the file recovery process and it completely crashed and locked up my computer and all had to be reloaded.....AND.... what you must have to some degree on all of this stuff is a good dose of patience and perseverance.  We all have variations in our computers and sometimes software will work on one and hick-up on the next.So be wise.  Learn from the expereinces of others, for as I learned later, there were a lot of others just like me.  For some it apparently works perfectly, for others you just got stuck for a bit.  So, if you are among those of us where it does not work quite right - you merely have to be patient and they will work with you several ways to make it work for your own system and in the end they will either give your money back, or they will work through the problem with you.  Can't ask for much more than that, eh?  Enjoy.

I have for my own uses pretty much come down to this: NO other drive, or other new drive, unless it is a WD drive.  Yes, they are that reliable and that good... plus, the price is right.... as long as you buy them using a degree of wisdom.  Buy the right type of drive(life & use), the right physical size of drive(fit), the right characteristic of the drive for the use intended(speed), and from the right store (price).This is one of the best internal drives that WD makes right now (IMHO).  It is fast, not THE fastest, but fast; it has a good sized cash memory built into it (64 MB) to help with speed and processing, and does not cost too much either!  Possibly, from what I have seen, right now.... this specific drive just may be the best bang for the buck that is out there!  Some are faster, but require 3 or 4 times the money too!  Some are larger too, and the same applies to cost.  No one out there has a better or longer warrantee than WD drives do.  WD does not "lavish" customer service on us, but they ARE there if you need them!!  You just need to apply a bit of effort now and then to get it.  Good people!  How can you go wrong?  Buy with confidence.  Enjoy!

I gave it 4 stars for being a tad bit larger than I had hoped it would be: It is not huge, but the footprint on my desk is just a bit larger than I had hoped for.  But it is well worth the 4 stars since it has great and easy functional attributes.  It is easy, fast, straight forward to use, and seamless in OPS.  The price is also quite reasonable, and in a way, this unit "could" be used instead of an external standby drive for back-up very easily;  and that would make it much more versitile than one of the great externals we usually see used in a non-portable way. Why?  Because you then are NOT limited to one drive, but could have several that you run when needed from this one station!  Cool, eh?  :-)  For a portable use, the externals from WD are fantastic and so very small as to be simply amazing in how easy they are to use for the cost involved.  If you do not need portability, then this just might be the perfect fit for you.  Do enjoy!

I suppose that this is a good program.  But it is NOT a free program at all, as the listing might lead one to believe.  They want $20 in 30 days.  So is it really truth or a lie to sucker you in....??  You must decide..... in 30 days, ha ha!After an extensive download, and looking it over, it seems to be a good program otherwise.  One thing I did like is that it can be set to do a comprehensive full unencumbered scan as the computer comes up on startup.... this runs it BEFORE windows even opens so it looks as if it will take at least an hour or possibly two to do it all, but this has good points too.Hope that this helps you to make a choice on this "free" program.  :-)Just now yet another pop-up window from Avast came up wanting to sell me a "Premium Service" for "only" another $30..... I suppose that is okay too, but it had better not be a regular pest or I will downgrade it to a 1 star rating!UPDATE same day:  I thought to sign up for the extra features for the $19.95 services (free 30 day trial)  and when it installed itself, it completely crashed windows on restart!  I finally fixed it all and reinstalled the anti-virus basic only and all seems okay now.  On their help website I saw where I was NOT alone in having this happen, so DO be careful to use only the simple free basic.  Ha ha!  Good luck guys!

I think that this was written to be sort of a very very short primer on many subjects.  The answers are very short, and usually bring up more questions after you read them.  It is easy to use, and it does have a good number of excellent photos too.  The author does offer some good ideas on step by step elimination of this or that, but like most books..... it has large gaps here and there.  It is a good book, but it will not be your single answerbook in most problem cases.  One problem with all books of this nature is that they do spend a lot of time on things that, "Simply anyone would find that on their own."  It is the more obscure things that leave us stumped from time to time and that we need a book like this one to use in troubleshooting the problems.  I guess that it is a lot like one of those pocket dictionaries you can buy.... lots of words, but most are the common words that you need no help with..... does that explain my idea better?  You will get some benefit from this book:  The book is compact and spiral bound for ease of use, and the author has many good insights in it so I gave it 4 stars for that and the reasonable price.  Enjoy

I was trying to find a slightly heavier base weight plastic blanket material that would take use without being torn apart so easily.  These are just that.  They are inexpensive but slightly heavier than most I have bought and used previously.  Previous materials would barely hold themselves together, so-to-speak, and would not hold up to any real serious use.  My best guess is that I had normally received plastic base materials of 2 to 2.5 Mil thickness.  These are at least 3 mil and are just a tad bit better/ tougher.I think that these will do much better and yet they are about the same price as others that are much less quality.  Enjoy.

These are designed to be used in case of emergency.  They are simply a thin plastic reflective liners/covers that will undoubtedly do the job intended and do not break the bank doing so.  Low cost, very tight and compact, easy to use, easy to get rid of when worn out, and are low priced.  How can you beat that?  These are not super heavy and extra high quality or the price would be 3 to 4 times as much.... right?  So for compact service in case of emergency, they are just light enough to be small & easy to store, but heavy enough to not fall apart toooooo easily either. :-)  Good deal for the money.  Enjoy.

This book is not written to be an expose or serious accounting of British history, but it is an excellent overview of that, and it is well written.  It is written so that even a (10 year old+)child could under most of it easily, so it fit me well, and I bought it for my grand kids to enjoy.  See if you can find out "why" Alfred the Great was called "Great" down through time.... there is a specific reason that he was great.  Enjoy.

I used these various colored tapes to make my boat trailer after repainting.  I was worried that they would not stick well, nor last for long.  So far they look great, are faily easy to use and are well worth the price paid.  I am glad I used them and would recommend them for use with ease.  Enjoy!

I used these various colored tapes to mark my boat trailer after repainting.  I was worried that they would not stick well, nor last for long.  So far they look great, are fairly easy to use, and are well worth the price paid.  I am glad I used them and would recommend them for use with ease.  Enjoy!

It may be true that these are a bit high priced (4 stars) but, if you want to protect your expensive gauges and keep them accurate, then this is about your only way to do that.  Without these covers, the gauges will most certainly be damaged over time.  Unless the gauges are protected they will most certainly be bumped, dinged, and damaged, which means that we cannot do our jobs right with inaccurate indicators, right? :-) In my actual use, they quite literally fit over and around the gauge like a glove.  The front edge is larger and built up a bit to extend (protrude)forward enough to give some extra protection, though not a covering of course, of the front face of the gauge. Now that I am using them, I will never go back to a good gauge set without them for protection!  The soft rubber like material should last the full lifetime of the gauge set.  So buy with confidence.  Enjoy!
These offer one a great opportunity to avoid stomach irritation while not having to pay the usual overpriced store prices.I received this FAST, and the large bottles are economical.  Enjoy.

This is hardly the most toxic insecticide on the market and yet it works great for better than a month. I do repeat the spraying every four weeks. I make sure to spray when I have a couple of days of fair weather ahead and I never spray when it's windy. Anyway, what I wish to eliminate in certain areas of my yard are chiggers, ticks, and mosquitoes. I have used this product for the past five years and these have been eliminated entirely. It was a big problem prior to that. As far as ants, it only works on certain species, apparently not the ones I have but I'm not concerned about those anyway. We do have a bird-feeding area and some flowerbeds where we encourage bees, butterflies, and praying mantises. Of course I give these areas about an 8-foot berth and I have seen no ill results.This insecticide does what I want it to do. The grandchildren play in the yard and they come in without bites and my pets (cats and dogs) have no ticks and very few fleas. I keep the pets out of the sprayed area until the spray has dried and have experienced no problems there. The spraying only takes me about 20 minutes and I use a cheap 2 1/2 gallon hand sprayer that you can buy almost anywhere. I am using three tablespoons of the concentrate per gallon of water. I guess I'm a happy customer.

This is one of those stories, starring Tom Baker and Lalla Ward, where there exists the all-too-common nuance of *lots* of running around here and there to fill in for large segments of script that was either never written or perhaps snipped out. Still, it's a better-than average yarn overall.THE STORY: An alien (the last of his race) has launched "shards" of himself into oblivion when his spaceship explodes long before man's presence on earth. Somehow, these pieces return to exist as entire beings, disguised as humans, throughout various epochs of Earth's history. The alien's objective is to go back to that egregious moment and manipulate history so that his ship doesn't detonate and thus his race can live on. Well, we all know that The Doctor cannot allow such nonsense as that.Meanwhile, The Doctor's (Baker) and Romana II's (Ward) holiday in contemporary Paris is thus train-wrecked. The enigmatic instant is first detected in a caf as the two experience a slight time wrinkle, another more dynamic force occurring while the two view the Mona Lisa, a priceless painting which the alien is about to steal to finance the necessary research and equipment to complete his time machine.Due to The Doctor's continuing interference with his plans, the disguised alien, (who actually has a greedy human wife who is unaware of his extraterrestrial status!), captures The Doctor, Romana, and a bumbling plain-clothes cop who finds himself on board with helping the pair of time travelers. Lots of running around Paris ensues, The Doctor makes a visit to Leonardo da Vinci, and the alien attempts to commence his hawking of fake Mona Lisas.This story incorporates plenty of humor which some fans prefer to see maintained at a minimum. David Fisher wrote the original story but the Script Editor, the late Douglas Adams of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy fame, altered it so much that the standard script-writer alias, "David Agnew", was substituted. One positive caveat: this was probably composer Dudley Simpson's finest moment as his clever incidental music really enhances the story although he did confess to "borrowing" some major elements of An American in Paris... and rightfully so. Even Douglas Adams' dear friend, the rascally John Cleese, snags a cameo in this one (more humor) so there's that.By this point in his career as The Fourth Doctor, Baker was losing some of his dynamism and enthusiasm for the program and unfortunately it shows more than a little. He had become somewhat unmanageable for the Production Nabobs (chiefly causing palpitations for Producer Graham Williams), occasionally improvising his own lines and adding one-liners to the rehearsed script. Baker eventually married Lalla Ward and, from all accounts, it was a turbulent relationship and it certainly did not endure for long. Fortunately they were apparently getting along during this production and much goodwill on the set was also likely attributable to Director Michael Hayes, whose laid-back approach made him popular with Baker and most others. The story having been shot largely on location in Paris augmented the final production's great look.I should mention that a second supplementary disc manifests pure treasure for Classic Doctor Who fans with a lot of insight devoted to mischievous production happenings, both on the set and off. One dubious entry on this disc entitled "Eye on Blatchford" probably conveys a lot more meaning for Brits than it did for me.There are much better Tom Baker Doctor Who stories and this one cannot compare to the work he achieved with Elisabeth Sladen or Louise Jameson, or even with Mary Tamm, (Romana I), for that matter. Still, this four-episode, (100 minutes), romp is a must for any fan of Tom Baker as The Fourth Doctor.

There's no such thing as a marginal Arthur Upfield mystery - however, this one, (originally published in 1952), is a poster example of his very finest efforts.Once again, Inspector Napoleon Bonaparte gets called out to the Australian boondocks to resolve two otherwise unsolvable murders. If you are unfamiliar with "Bony" don't be put off by his name or by the fact that his ethnicity is mixed. A lot of folks, (including me), often read a back cover summary and view such thrown-in devices of the author's fancy as a dreary gimmick, contrived solely to enhance an otherwise dull story. No fear! Bony is half-Aborigine and half-Caucasian and he draws upon the many strengths of his unique racial blend to solve his endless difficult cases.In "Venom House" he faces numerous impediments launched by two squirrelly sisters, their mentally-challenged Atlas of a half-brother, and their domestic workers, all of whom are isolated from local society by means of a sprawling shallow reservoir. The manor house is situated on an island at the center of this nearly immutable obstacle to casual visitation. This prickly caveat makes it extremely problematic for Bony to sneak and snoop around the premises as is his habit. But more than that, it's an ideal setting for a murder mystery. Location rivals ambiance, (which is artfully conveyed in equal abundance), in this marvelous whodunit.The somewhat meek and elderly matron of Venom House, (so-called by all, based upon a history of wicked incidents perpetrated by a long line of onerous family members), has been strangled and dragged into the portentous nearby lake. A local butcher, recently more flush with cash than he should have been, has also been strangled and submerged. The residents of Venom House are suspected although others in the nearby hamlet must remain in the suspect pool as well. Bony utilizes a combination of his great intelligence, effete diplomacy, and his wholehearted willingness to totally ignore police procedures to affix the crime on the actual perpetrator. However, before he can fully launch his inquiry yet more infamy looms upon the horizon, a nuance which complicates an already perplexing investigation.Through his gifted prose, Upfield's characters, locations, and settings are vividly conveyed to the mind's eye of murder mystery enthusiasts. I pigeonhole his numerous works within "The Golden Age" genre of mysteries much akin to those of Josephine Tey, Agatha Christie, and Dorothy L. Sayers. His works deliver that diaphanous Gothic feel which his fans have come to appreciate so devotedly. The late Arthur Upfield was English but spent most of his life in Australia, a nation that has adopted him as one of their top authors and a man who, through his writing, has serendipitously conserved much of the aboriginal anthropology of the island continent's colorful past.If you're up for a great rainy weekend mystery read, this is the one -- highly recommended.

This is the best product of all the available dishwasher detergents. Nothing else works as good as this.I have a fairly cheap, (but new), dishwasher and when I use the Cascade Actionpacs I never worry about pre-rinsing anything or scraping off dried food from plates, silver, or pans.I like it that you don't have to tear open the packaging. It rinses well, even without a special rinsing agent. I get no spotting on the silver or glass.I could not be happier with a cleaning product.

This acquisition was convenient as my wife was already using the original Burberry which she likes very much and so do I.However, The Beat is divergent. The fragrance is quite apart from the original Burberry. It's the same *sort* of fragrance and yet very different. Its not Burberry thats been added to or taken from  it conveys its own essence.How does one describe a fragrance? One doesnt. But I can offer some dynamics of the product: The Beat turns heads, (male chiefly, from my observation.) The name is perfect  it marches to its own drum. And this is a sneak attack perfume  while not overpowering, it still carries nicely.This small bottle will last a long time unless you take a bath in it  not necessary. While my wife and I are partial to the original fragrance as compared to other brands, we both like The Beat even more, at least for now.Highly recommended.

I'm compelled to confess that this device was considerably beyond my ability to work with it -- I have clearly reached the point where technology has left me behind. This, of course, is not the fault of the manufacturer. I would only contest them on one point of their marketing assertions: "easy set-up". This might be quite true if you're nineteen and plugged in to the endless technology which surrounds us today, or, if you're older and have the patience of Job to attempt to digest the written instructions, a virtue with which I have never been blessed. (And please do not ask me about did I call  in for technical assistance because the only thing I hate more than printed instructions is having someone I don't know try to explain some technical actions over the phone.)Honestly, I never got to first base on set up, (and quite frankly, I wasn't sure that I even knew precisely what I wanted to do with it as the keyboard performs so many functions in the contemporary household.)Finally, my young son-in-law got me up and running. It took him awhile and he is up on high-tech devices but after a few false starts, it worked. Soon after he left and maybe following an hour or so of tinkering around, I placed it back in the box to revert to my comfort zone of doing everything the old fashioned way with one control for each device. That is probably why I have numerous remotes falling off my end-tables but that's how I like it.This unit is for those who wish to move with the times and I'm all for that. I just don't wish to be part of it.As for the quality of the components, it seemed very good and really, fascinating when it's up and running. So if you want all your electronics at a central location and at your fingertips, I think you'll be pleased and impressed with the Logitech Keyboard. As with any product, it's simply not for everyone.

This bag is fairly light, comfortable, and as utilitarian a cart bag as you'll find anywhere for the money.There is seemingly no end as to the number of pockets, (with a very thoughtful large "cooler pocket" at the base), and the zippers seem pretty rugged. It features a grab handle as well as a shoulder rig with fourteen slots at the top for clubs. The height of this bag is a neat thirty-four inches.I have gotten some chuckles from my golfing pals about the camouflage color design but I noticed that it doesn't show mud very bad so that's an advantage if you care about such things.I'm very pleased with this bag and would definitely recommend it to other casual golfers.

I don't golf a lot but I was pleasantly surprised by the performance of this wedge. It's very light, (I was used to a heavier, older model), and it weighs in at precisely sixteen onces according to my cooking scales which are pretty accurate.This is not a fancy piece of work but I must say it's incredibly utilitarian. For me, it's a basic, get-the-job-done wedge. My pals have all tried it and not one of them didn't like it. The length is thirty-seven inches if you stand it up plumb and measure up. The rubber grip conveys a great feel.I have nothing but good things to say about the this Carnahan wedge -- highly recommended.

I'm only a casual golfer and I think that is the reason I liked this driver so much.It's *extremely* light at eleven ounces, (I actually weighed it on my cooking scales), but don't be put off by the lightness of the club. You can drive a ball astonishingly far with it. The length is just a hair over forty-six inches if you stand it plumb and measure straight up. The "feel" of the light rubber grip is very good -- as for its durability, I'll have to wait and see about that. It does come with a very nice, attractive protective boot.I cannot say that I'm crazy about the camouflage paint scheme but neither do I find it particularly hateful. I do get comments about it from fellow golfers, some jibing me and others loving it, wanting to know where I acquired it.Overall, it's a great driver as far as I'm concerned.

To guys (or gals) of my generation, [the Woodstock one] few things are more perfect than a '57 Chevy. The author achieved something here that I always wanted to do myself but never worked up the ambition: He traced back the history of an awesome classic car, from owner to previous owner.Really for me, there are only three cars: a '55 Chevy, a '65 Mustang, and a '57 Chevy, the latter being my number one preference. So you might see how I got heavily drawn into this tale of the people who owned the car and how very different they were... and yet with one thing in common.This is a fascinating story and I must confess that I was wholly unprepared for the conclusion which I will save for you to discover.Highly recommended..

While these are not professional grade (restaurant) pots and pans you'll find that for your home they are pretty much all you need.Every feature of this set is well thought out and of high-quality, from the non-stick to the handles. So far as glass lids are concerned, people either love them or hate them. I like them because you can shake the pan/lid to clear the fog a bit and see how your dish is progressing without lifting the lid, so that's a big bonus.The metal on these pans is thinner than I anticipated but I have encountered no problems as the heat spreads evenly and cooking in these pots and pans is a delight. The handles are also easy to grab.For home use, highly recommended.

Folks, I feel compelled to say that in a general sense where printers are concerned, (as least for good ones), gone are the days that they hiss, plunk, and clunk before one measly copy rolls off the press. These high tech machines are built to last and this one is at the top of them all.It prints, faxes, copies, and scans. The color copies are beautiful. Honestly, I think that when I use matte paper in it they are very good but the glossies look like something from a large-negative camera done at a studio. I just cannot believe how nice they are.This is a large machine with endless features but if you read the manual you will find that everything from set-up to practical use is pretty much a breeze.I would recommend this unit over all others in its price range -- I'm very happy with mine.

I should point out up front that it might be easy to make a mistake if one is in a hurry and doesn't read the product description closely. Yes, It is a fax/copier/scanner/printer but it does not do color. What you have here is essentially a very high-speed, efficient, budget-priced, and compact office printer. If you typically print lots of documents and you like to have them in a hurry (and you have no need for color printing), then I could highly recommend this excellent.The feature that I most like for two reasons is the fact that it uses toner instead of ink: I can get my toner much cheaper than ink. The document look just as excellent to me so that is a huge plus. Also, I go for long intervals sometimes between printing large volumes of documents, weeks at the least. Ink tends to dry out and toner continues to work as good as the day I bought it.Yet another great feature is that this unit is wireless. I have it sitting in the opposite corner from my computer. You *can* plug it directly in to your computer port if you wish but it works just as well in the wireless mode.Highly Recommended!

The cats seemed to love this product and I trade off feeding this and another product so they don't get tired of just a single food.I have a dozen cats and all but one (she pretty spoiled) are enthusiastic about this food. According to the label it's pretty nutritious and so I don't have to worry that they aren't getting sufficient nutrition.While this product is a little pricey I think it's worth it. As long as it makes my cats happy, I'm happy.Recommended.

I have a dozen cats and all but a couple are pretty enthusiastic about this product.Of course, since this is a Hill's product it is very nutritious for my cats and I don't have to worry about any problems associated with a lack of vitamins or anything along those lines.It's a little pricey but I think a good value for the money since the cats do, for the most part, like it.

When I came across this product I was pretty happy. We have lots of power outages, usually during a thunderstorm, and my basement leaks like a sieve when it rains hard.I have a submersible sump pump but, of course, it operates on electricity so when the power goes out my basement floods unless I get on the ball and hook up the gasoline generator. I have already lost two refrigerators due to flooding in the basement so I have been looking for a solution.My problem is always at night. If the power goes out and I'm unaware of it the basement can flood before I know it. This device alerts me to the problem. I rarely leave the house and if I do someone else is here so I don't need the texting feature.In the end, I can relax and sleep away now that I have installed the Wayne alarm.

Here's an over the counter product that you can depend on.This is a mild laxative that works every time for me and I experience no bad side effects. When the manufacturer says that it's "predictable" that is exactly correct.If I had a continuing problem with constipation I would see the doctor about it but for an occasional problem Dulcolax works great.Recommended.

If you are tired of plain salt or cheesy salt on your popcorn this makes for a nice change.I think I can say with some authority that everyone who has tasted the product on popcorn here, (about 6 people) has selected the garlic Parmesan flavor over the others but I continue to use all three just for the uniqueness of flavor.I was concerned about off-tastes at first but found none of that -- it tastes just fine.

My 7 year-old grandson gets a lot of mileage out of this one.The idea of it is that it launches these little discs, which he thinks is the coolest thing in the world. The discs are light and they won't hurt anyone so there's no worry there.The bottom line is that this is associated with Spider-Man which increases the cool factor substantially. It's pretty well-made and has already provided hours of fun.Recommended.

We are using this as a regular umbrella and not as a golf umbrella.There is no reason I can see to not use this instead of a regular umbrella, (it's considerably larger), since it works so smoothly and it unfolds easily. Both my wife and I can fit under it easily in the rain when we are together. We love the bright colors and everyone asks where we got it.The quality of this product is first-class. I could not be more happy with it.Highly recommended!

This is the first entry in Mervyn Peake's three timeless Gormenghast novels. The novels cannot rightly be called a trilogy because Peake had planned to write more books in the series -- unfortunately he fell to insanity before he could do so and he required help in completing the third novel, "Titus Alone". When you reach that point, you'll find that the overall work is indeed unfinished, much as it would be as if you stopped reading at the end of "The Two Towers" in "The Lord of the Rings" trilogy.I'll be honest, your listening experience with the audiobooks will be much enhanced if you read the books first. The best choice is the all in one paperback volume, now available. However, reading the books is not a must. The performance of Simon Vance on this audiobook is so terrific that you will get the complete story, no problem. [Every prospective buyer should be aware that another narrator, Robert Whitfield, is available for this audiobook - my review is aimed at the Simon Vance version.]One more point: there's not much use in listening to the first book unless you plan to also hear "Gormenghast", the second entry. The third book (or audiobook) is another matter altogether but I'll get to that later. Here is what *this* audiobook story is all about:The Kingdom of Gormenghast is ruled by the 76th Earl of the line. He's a vague old duffer but still spry enough to sire a son during his sunset years. He also has a daughter in her late teens. This place is strange... fantastical. Peake made it a great challenge, impossible actually, to put your finger on a time or place. The ambiance is definitely gothic, (but not all three books are gothic novels.)Gormenghast exists to exist. Over the centuries it has deteriorated to a place of strict ritual, pomp, and circumstance. Progress has ceased altogether and the biggest event is the annual selection of carvings produced by the Bright Carvers, the folks who pretty much make up the population outside this huge castle-fortress. There is an equally large population inside, chiefly servants and minions.This first novel sets up the story. The place is described, the onerous principals are identified and everyone's purpose and relationship to one another is established in great detail. Titus Groan is born and this is a great joy for all in the kingdom since they now have an heir who will become the 77th Earl. But an undertone of malevolence suddenly gives rise to an accelerated miasmic decay in the Gormenghast heavily-structured way of life. This is largely attributable to one Steerpike, a fast-rising young sociopath, freshly-escaped from Chef Swelter's hellish kitchens. That's about as far as I can go.Unlike Tolkien's "The Lord of the Rings", do not look for orcs, elves, or dragons here - no magic either. But it always *seems* like their might be some magic around. Peake's style is unmatched.This audiobook is made up of 15 discs, (17  hours) and should play on your car CD player or elsewhere. However, at some point in time it was also available (or at least I think it was) on *one* disc, MP3 formatting. I think that many libraries favored this type so be aware of this if you buy a used "library copy" or a new one that mentions MP3. If you do acquire this type of compressed formatting, it will play on your computer auxiliary drive or if you have a CD player which accepts MP3 it will play on that as well. (I just bought such a portable player at Big Lots for $30).I should mention some key points about the next two novels in the series since it might affect your decision to acquire this first novel. The second entry sees Titus Groan growing up. But the third novel is *very* strange and far-ranging in its scope. Titus leaves Gormenghast and goes into "the world". Everything changes and a lot of readers complain clamorously about this third novel. Personally, I fancy it and I think it's the best of the three but there, I am much in the minority. One could almost pigeonhole the third entry as science fiction.So there you have it. You might think that there are way too many contingencies and red flags associated with this series based upon what I've told you. Therefore it's important to know that Gormenghast is an experience that you will never forget - there's nothing else like it and it defies genre classification, (at least for the overall series.) What I have discovered is that enthusiasts of the "Gormenghast" series are almost universally equally impassioned about "The Lord of the Rings" - but the reverse is not always so. I hope that observation helps. If you have further questions or comments I try to monitor my reviews and I'll attempt to respond if requested.Highly recommended to fantasy, science fiction, and/or gothic fiction readers!

For the benefit of the uninitiated, nearly all of Arthur Upfield's mysteries feature Detective Inspector Napoleon Bonaparte ("Bony" to his friends), of the Queensland [Australia] police. Still, every police province in the country attempts to steal him away in the hope of solving their most difficult cases. This time Bony is working for the New South Wales police in the town of Mitford.Bony is half-Caucasian and half-Aborigine so he can connect with either race. He is an expert tracker and he loves to brag that he has never failed to resolve a case. But this one is unusual as someone is stealing babies... *male* babies. The newspapers are pouring Australian heat down on Bony's superiors to resolve this heinous mystery and, of course, the brass tries to interfere with Bony's investigation; however, he knows exactly how to rid himself of the bureaucrats.The town is bulging with very strange people and a definite social class deviation stands as a challenging impediment to Bony's ability to ferret out the facts. One of the key elements of the case is that the mothers do not appear to care much about their respective offspring, excepting the most recent one. And there is one additional difference in that case -- the mother gets herself murdered!An unusual caveat to this case is that Bony takes on a partner... a female partner. Before it's all over, Bony has to risk his neck to solve the case which involves Aboriginal legend and a bit of Australian-style voodoo aimed at damaging Bony's well-being.While this entry is not the best of Upfield's works it's still First-Class. It's not the Upfield mystery I would recommend to newcomers to this author but devotees will again revel in the Upfield's renowned ability to paint lively landscapes and to convey Australia's anthropological heritage as he weaves this fascinating tale. Newbies to Upfield might first try either Murder Down Under or Wings Above the Diamantina (A Scribner Crime Classic).Highly recommended.

For the benefit of the uninitiated, nearly all of Arthur Upfield's mysteries feature Detective Inspector Napoleon Bonaparte of the Queensland [Australia] police. Still, every police province in the country attempts to steal him away in the hope of solving their most difficult cases. This time "Bony" (to his friends) is working undercover for the New South Wales police out of Menindee.Bony is half-Caucasian and half-aborigine so he can connect with both races. He is an expert tracker and he loves to brag that he has never failed to resolve a case. This is yet another convoluted situation: an outback sheep-ranch hand, Gillen, drowned months back in Lake Otway, a reservoir which is disappearing at an alarming rate due to a great drought. The death first appeared to have been an accident but there are those who believe otherwise because Gillen was known to be carrying 1,250 that he won in a lottery, a great deal of money for the period and certainly enough to be murdered for.When Bony arrives on the scene disguised as a horse-breaker who has been hired by the ranch owner he receives mixed greetings. He is warned about the two women who do the cooking for the ranch hands, a mother-daughter team who have perfected the art of soliciting expensive gifts from these lonely fellows. Some of the men have already laid claim to these women and Bony is so informed soon after his arrival in the form of an implied threat.Most these itinerant hands are eager to discover Gillen's remains when the lake finally goes dry, the focus being a locket that he wore around his neck. And more death, human and otherwise, hovers on the horizon. As usual, Bony risks his neck to solve the mystery and to recover the murdered man's money, for murdered he was.Prepare yourself for shifting loyalties and surprises around every turn. This is one of the better Upfield works, even when you consider that there is no such thing as a mediocre Upfield entry. It's not the Upfield mystery I would begin with but devoted fans will again revel in the author's renowned ability to paint lively landscapes and to convey Australia's anthropological heritage as he weaves his compelling story.If you are new to Upfield you might wish to first try Murder Down Under, (aka, Mr. Jelly's Business (Inspector Napoleon Bonaparte Mysteries: the Arthur Upfield Collection)).Highly recommended.

These are very nice, durable dividers and they are perfect for my purpose. They are actually designed for business use but I am writing a book and I just needed something to separate my typewritten chapters in a three-ring notebook.The benefit here is that the tabs themselves aren't labeled. They are transparent (different colors) with a master sheet, (cardboard), behind them and *that* is labeled for business use: research, budget, marketing, sales, technology, forecast, earnings, and summary.I simply flipped the cardboard over and labeled it as I wished, (in chapters). So you could use the dividers for any purpose. You could even write on the tabs themselves with a Sharpie if you wished,These dividers are really nice heavy plastic that is not going to break or tear if you drop your notebook -- very high quality and attractive.Highly recommended!

Probably the top feature of this case includes things you can't see, that is, the case has undoubtedly been tested to assure the full protection of your phone. Other than that, it's rather plain-looking. If you are into the look of your phone, (I'm not), then there's nothing spectacular about the appearance of this case.It *is* thin and I like the feel of the rubberized sides, (the dark parts), and if your hands are a little wet you can still hang on to it just fine. The rest of it is a durable plastic that will bend without cracking.I did have to drill out the little hole on top just slightly to accommodate my cables but that was a simple one-minute fix and everything works okay now.The price seems a bit high for what you're getting here -- I mean it's just a hunk of plastic. But if protection of your phone is a priority for you then you'll find that this case does the job.

I never seem to go wrong with Purina products. I especially wanted to try this one due to its healthy ingredients.I would caution people who try it, do not make an instant change to this product from whatever you're using because it caused, at least in the case of my two mutts, some diarrhea. I backed off it and then started mixing it in with their regular food (Hill's Science Diet). After that, everything was okay and I can now feed this product without blending it with anything else.The dogs were pretty excited to get something new so I've decided to rotate their dog foods, definitely including this one.Highly recommended.

I need to say up front that three of the four dogs I fed this to really like it so, based upon my experience with high-end dog foods, that's a pretty notable response.It is formulated for large breeds and unfortunately it was the smaller dogs that liked it. Still we mixed some of this product in with the largest dog's regular food (Gravy Train) and she eats it that way and is now getting the benefit, (at least to some degree), of this high-quality product.Highly recommended.

A young friend of mine, (11 years old), had to do some book reports for school and he said there wasn't much in his school library so I got him this book and one other. He had it finished in no time at all and was enthusiastic enough about it that he wrote a nice book report for which he was given an A.I only scanned it to make certain that it was okay for kids and, of course, it was. One could hardly go wrong these days in acquiring a book that involves video games as a topic for a young male. It seems like video games is all they do but I'm pleased to say that this work got my little friend interested in reading again. His mother was astonished.A great gift idea.

While this is actually a performance shirt I just wear it wherever I go -- it is attractive enough for that and it retains its shape and smooth appearance at all times.The best feature of the shirt is that it "breaths" so that you don't feel sweaty and hot. The material feels great on your skin, very high quality.Highly recommended.

Here's why this thing is great for power outages:1. Because it's an LED light, the batteries last forever.2. It's really lightweight and you can get it into small spaces with it if you need to.3. It works either as a flashlight or a lantern, simply by flipping the top.I used to fire up my Coleman lantern during power outages, (which always includes a lot of preliminary hassles.) But not now. I can even read just fine by this light which also makes it terrific for tent camping. The strobe function can be used as a signal in emergencies. I wrapped a little strip of red cellophane around my globe and use it in the car for breakdowns in hazardous spots.For the money you won't go wrong if you grab a couple of these remarkably shrewdly-designed mini-lanterns.Highly recommended.

After washing my face with this product my skin felt super clean and I felt really refreshed.It is not in any way greasy and after using the product your skin feels very smooth after the first application.Highly recommended!

This is the most perfect knife that you will ever use of its kind. The alignment is exactly straight and it double locks.The quality of the knife is second to none and it would be the perfect gift for any fireman or police officer to use on the job.

I had a little trouble getting started on this one because its a different sort of futuristic escapism fantasy/sci-fi tale than I have previously encountered. (I don't read a huge amount of this genre.) Also, it was obvious from the start that this story emanates from a larger work with which I was unfamiliar.That being said, all this also goes to the benefit of this particular tale of contemporary fantasy *because* it is different and this original, at least for me.Getting away from a doomed Earth for one reason or another is, of course, not an original idea but how one achieves this can be. I liked author Vaughn Heppners approach to the idea. To get to New Eden (Solar System), he made use of human telepaths who manipulate space to travel the many light years of distance.I wouldnt call this one a page-turner but its a thoughtful work and its certainly original enough in many aspects to be worthwhile reading.Highly recommended.

Im not a huge fan of contemporary fantasy but this yarn sort of pushed the right buttons for me.The key to a great fantasy novel from my view is the manifestation of a magical ambiance and author Brian Staveley achieved it in spades in this instance. This idea goes beyond lyrical prose and clever plots. I was captivated by the story and thats what counts.Elements of this warrior tale include numinous monks, warriors-assassins, secrets (which of course are tendered for dramatic benefit to the reader), and monsters a winning combination. While the names of the characters seemed a bit pulled out of the air I can still live with that given the quality of all other aspects of the work. The important thing is that I didnt get the characters confused at any point, an aspect of unclouded writing.This one is certainly a page-turner and I will be reading more works by this author.

I'll have to say that this product works pretty good. After starting it on my medium-sized, long-haired dog for a week or so, his coat looks much better and the shedding seems to have cut way back from my previous experience.The dog eats these tablets readily and he seems to like them as much as his treats.You can store these in a medicine cabinet, (away from children), at room temperature and they keep just fine for the duration of the dosage. I can definitely recommend the product.

This product worked as advertised on my medium-sized dog, at least so far as one can determine from the animal's fur being sleek and healthy looking. Only time will tell so far as the claim on the immune system benefits but I have no reason to doubt the claims.The dog eats these small blocks quite readily and he seems to like the flavor.The caveat here is that once you open the product you need to refrigerate it so plan on that. I keep the entire package inside a gallon-sized zip-lock bag.If you want your pet to have a healthy coat, this product will probably work for you.

I could not be more pleased with this lovely necklace. The stone is quite large and the cut is magnificent.This looks like a much more expensive necklace that it is. The light catches the facets and the surrounding diamond chips in this one, making it show up quite nicely on the wearer.Anyone who receives this necklace as a gift is going to be VERY pleased to get it -- a terrific gift.Highly recommended.

I waited a long time to acquire one of these units and now that I have it I can say that I have a lot more peace of mind. Quite honestly, just having the cameras up and running is enough to deter most thieves and other intruders. The fact that this unit records all that goes on (about fifty hours' worth) is a huge bonus. That is the purpose of the DVR unit which comes with the package.The package also comes with four very nice, sturdy cameras and I decided to modify the mounting on them. Instead of mounting them directly to the house I thought they would look much better with a pre-drilled flange at the base and so I went to Lowe's and picked some up (thin wood ones that I painted white, the same as my house -- very cheap to buy) and the mounting looks much better against the siding.If you live in the country as I do and you are gone for two and three days at a time, this is a very worthwhile investment.

I must confess that I was skeptical that these pills would change my dog's behavior for the better but it did in a most astonishing way.I gave these pills to a small male terrier-type mixed breed dog that was very hyperactive. He barked constantly and jumped up on everybody. He also nipped people which was a nuisance. I started giving him these pills as prescribed on the label and all that nonsense ended! Now he is well-behaved and normal. Everybody was amazed that this was the same dog.The main ingredient seems to be a magnolia extract. I happen to be an expert on toxic plants and in large doses, magnolia is toxic to humans BUT, like many medicines, used in the correct dosage, such chemicals can render beneficial results with no harm to the animal. I only mention this to stress that you need to strictly follow the dosage as prescribed on the label.If you are experiencing the difficulties with your dog that I have listed above I can highly recommend this product.

I have never owned a pneumatic staple gun before and now I am wondering why I have waited so many years to acquire one.This device works perfectly, uses various lengths of staples (depending upon your application), and is quite easy to operate. The craftsmanship of this stapler is excellent -- it is quite well-made.I should also note that loading the staples is easier than loading regular staples into my desk stapler, so there are no issues with that.You will find that you need a moisture filter (recommended by manufacturer) between the air compressor and the staple gun. I bought one at Advance Auto Parts, (all auto parts store sell them), which fits right in line using common tools, (2 minute installation), for twelve bucks. I use the softer type red hose on my compressor (as opposed to the black hose which is less pliable) for ease of use.Highly recommended.

In the past I have not used many products like this, taking a personal view that most of it was expensive snake oil. That, of course was based upon my own vast ignorance of such products. In this case, I was pleasantly surprised.The first thing I noticed when I used it is how nice and cool this made my face feel. I expected it to feel "greasy" after applying the creme but such was not the case to any degree. This moisturizer absorbs quite readily and it made my skin feel very soft, due of course to the fact that that moisture was being retained after application.I would also go so far as to note that the product manifested a healing effect for my dry skin from the very first time I used it.What more can I say? This moisturizer does all that the manufacturer advertises and more.

I'm not telling anyone else to do this but I used this gum as a "supplement" as I was getting off the nicotine patches, near the end of a non-smoking program.I serially quit smoking. I have the habit bad and I am committed to quitting but, as those who are having the same experience know, it is very difficult. So when I got down to the least potent patches, I started skipping them for 2-3 days at a time. In between the patch days, I use this gum in moments of craving and it gets me through so I'm not really following the method they recommend. Still, it works for me this way so I thought the idea might benefit someone else. You would never want to use this gum at the *same* time with patches. That is definitely not recommended.In summary, I have to say that this is just one more good tool to help me stop smoking and, because it *has* helped, I can definitely recommend it.

This is the very sort of adventure tales that young boys like to read. I got it for my friend's grandson who just had an eye surgery which enhanced his ability to read and this was his trial book -- he loved it.I read the book before giving it to him so we could talk about it afterwards and I have to say that author Anne Ursu knows more about boys than most male authors. I could relate to Oscar from my own youth and found this one to be a page-turner. Any time you have magicians, ancient forests, and a protagonist to wander through such a world, it is the perfect environment to catch a young lad's attentions.My young friend is 11 and he had no trouble reading the book and he wants to read more from this author -- highly recommended.

My friend was so pleased to receive this wonderfully-crafted necklace. It really catches the eye and, a bonus, if you have blue eyes it makes for a wonderful accent piece.Everyone notices the necklace and asks to see it. The detail is perfect and the price makes it a very attractive addition to the jewelry box.Highly recommended.

What a wonderful bracelet! If you love the sea this is the perfect accessory. Every charm is beautifully crafted and one person after another remarks about it and wants to know where they can get one.I have to say that the price of this bracelet has to be a great selling point. I don't know how they can manufacture something this nice and sell it for the low price that they do.For you next trip to Myrtle Beach, make sure you have one of these and you'll fit right in.Highly recommended.

I am very pleased with this printer and I have tried to be specific, rating every aspect on a 1-10 basis:Price [8] -- A  good value for the ease of connectivity and quality of printing.  Seems to be a good basic printer.Set up [9] -- Very easy, can print from windows, smartphone, and i-pad.  I went box to print in 15 minutes with no problem. Once I got the app, making the wireless connection was easy. Instructions could use some minor re-vamping for clarity.  The interface window is a little small.Quality [7.5] -- It's great for black-and-white printing but just okay for the color. I would not use this unit mainly for my main quality photo printing but itll get you by. It was nice to see cartridge levels in screen.Print, scan, and copy [8] -- All features work nicely and navigation in between is easy. I have not used the fax function.  I experie3nced the occasional paper jam, however those are aberrations and not the norm.Overall, highly recommended!Speed  6  not really fast, but speed is not so important to me.  Great for home use, maybe not in an office setting.Ink Price  6  pretty average pricing,  I have not had it long enough to determine cartridge longevity.Durability  8  felt solid out of the box, nothing seemed flimsy.  Seemed quality.  However, paper catch tray seems pretty cheapValue  8  features, ease of setup, accessibility, and quality make this all in one printer  a good buy overall.

These are some of the most handsome pearls I've seen anywhere and several people have told me that the quality appears excellent.Whether this is so or not, the fact remains that this is an incredibly beautiful necklace and my wife loves it. She especially likes that fact that it can be worn with about any of her clothing, formal or informal. She wore it to a church event last week and it caught everyone's eye -- folks there made many positive remarks about it.The design is especially artful and, quite honestly, it looks like more than it is. I think this would make a great gift for any lady and, as the crafting is quite excellent, I'm sure that anyone who receives one would be quite happy.Highly recommended!

I love this printer/fax/copier for multiple reasons but mostly because it is cheaper to operate than any I have previously owned.You will want to look the specifications and description of this machine over very closely before you buy because it might not be exactly what you think, most of all, it does *not* make color copies/photographs as most of them do. I have no issues with that because I have a color printer on another computer port.The reason that you get no color from this machine is because it uses toner instead of ink and I find this a much more economical way to get copies and printed documents; however, I hasten to add that the black-and-white photos that this machine produces are *beautiful*. We made Christmas cards with this unit this year, (a photo of our tabby kitten), and everyone thought they were expensive specialty cards. So do not worry about the quality of your documents -- they will be first-class.Finally, the copies spit out in a hurry. This is the fastest printer I have ever used and I am VERY pleased with it.Highly recommended.

If you want a stone that shows up at a distance while you are wearing it, this one definitely does -- it is quite large. The stone is intricately cut and nicely reflects light. The quality of the stone is terrific. If you happen to have blue eyes the stone will accent your appearance.I think this is a birthstone (blue Topaz) for a couple of different periods but definitely for early December.In any case, this necklace is beautiful and one that makes a great gift. Anyone who receives this lovely accessory is not going to be disappointed. Given the economical price, you will get your money's worth and more with this exquisite necklace.Highly recommended.

This is a fantastic old Sci-fi set of four films on two discs (each one flips over so there's one film for each side) and here's the most important thing I can tell you: Big Lots has this 4-film set (this exact DVD, as of 11-25-13) for THREE DOLLARS. I bought it yesterday. So go get it! Two of these films are in beautiful period color/letterbox and the other two are in black and white and, as I recall, at least one of them is letterbox, maybe both. If you have any questions about them, just ask and I'll try to respond quickly.These period Drive-in double feature films are for us old-timers who like the hokey old monster/sci-fi flicks so if you're not into that, don't waste your money.

My Grandson collects these boys' action dolls and this Gosei Great Megazord made his day. The best thing about them is that this is an "add-to" toy. The parts are interchangeable and so the kids can make them into whatever they want. This one is well-made and, of course, it's quite educational in that the child is constantly fitting various parts on to them (and removing them as well.) My Grandson (age 6) gets hours of entertainment from this and the other ones he has collected. It would make a fine Christmas gift.Highly recommended.

I especially liked this doll as the hair looks and feels quite natural, a shortcoming of cheaper dolls. The shoes stay on great and that is yet another difficulty with most dolls -- the result is typically that the shoes come up missing but it probably won't happen in this case. I cannot say that this doll is collectible -- I know nothing about that; however, I think that this is more of a nice, well-made doll for girls to play with on an everyday basis. My Grand-daughter loves it.This would make any young girl a fantastic Christmas gift.

My Grand-daughter loved the doll. I cannot address the topic of collectability but I don't think it's that sort of doll -- it's more one for children to play with. The hair feels quite real although I thought the color was a little off from anything natural. Of course she blinks and the eyes look good and one of the best things about it involves the boots: they stay on good which is a pain with most dolls. The large size (18 inches high) is something that makes the doll more attractive.This doll is well-made and I think it makes a terrific gift.

This is very easy to download (the apps for the I-pad are free to download) -- nothing to it! We took it to a birthday party where there were lots of kids (ages 5-12) and they really loved it. The best thing about this set is that it teaches the kids a *lot* about colors. Easy to use.Highly recommended.

It was funny about this dog food. Some of the four loved it and one showed no interest whatever. I have to confess that the one who wasn't interested was a large dog and this food is recommended for adult small breeds, so, for the animals for which it is intended, I have to say it's a winner.Of course this is very good food for your dog, very healthy and made from good products. I like the idea of rice in dog food and this one offers that facet.Recommended.

There is a certain degree of suspense that ties to a girl who links up with a biker which makes this such a great premise for a story.They say that girls love outlaws (outlaw in the sense of one who is adventuresome) and that is Duke's appeal to Anna.A terrific yarn.

The history of Henry VII and his wives is one of the most fascinating aspects of British history -- or at least it's the part we remember.Here you will get a marvelous and sagacious insight into the era. A tale told well.

What a fine knife!This folding/locking blade knife by Coast is, bar none, the sharpest blade you'll ever encounter anywhere. The size makes it nice for the pocket of the average pair of jeans. There is not the slightest blade wobble, (no matter how hard you try), and it feels great in your hand.This would make a great gift for any fisherman or small game hunter. It would be really easy to clean and rust is not going to be an issue.My highest recommendation!

Law Enforcement Officers (I was one for 25 years) used to carry the Buck Brand folding knives when they first came out in the early 1970s (or perhaps a little before) and that remained the industry standard for many years. A cop is always needing a razor sharp knife for many purposes and the Buck fit the bill for the era. However, as seat belt laws became more strict from state to state, and as people began to wear them with more frequency, the Buck was not so good. Why? Because you need a serrated blade to cut through a seat belt in a hurry. When you are trying to get someone out of a car that has landed in the water, or one that is about to catch on fire, you need to get that seat belt off in a big rush. Why not just un-buckle the belt? There seems always to be a complication in doing that from outside the car and they often won't unbuckle easily, even for the person wearing it, especially if they are over-excited.To make a long story short, this Coast Folding Knife is *perfect* for this job. The lower half of the blade is serrated and the upper is smooth. Add to that, never in all my years have I encountered a knife that is this sharp. The blade is made of a steel that will not soon dull -- this knife is going to hold an edge for a *long* time to come.If there is a down side, it would be that it's almost impossible for a lay person to properly sharpen a serrated blade, (but the upper half will still sharpen fine.)The blade locks securely, the weight is good (hefty for its size), it feels nice in your hand, and the blade has not the slightest wobble, no matter how hard you try to make it move in that way. There is also a dandy belt hook to carry it. A nice leather belt sheath would have been a great perquisite but you can't have everything.My highest recommendation -- this is a super-quality product.

I had a mental impression of a much bigger truck when I ordered this, not that bigger is better. But then, once I got it out of the box and messed with it, I understood why it is the size that it is.What you have here is essentially a big flashlight that looks like a truck and which can be played with like a toy truck. The kids like the additional numerous flashing lights on it and they have integrated it in with their other similar-sized toys when they are playing.But the fact that is functions quite effectively as a flashlight, (the purpose of the top handle which had eluded me earlier),  is the big draw. That's chiefly what the boys use it for, (they are older than the recommended age, 9 and 10), and so they're happy with it.Highly recommended.

Well, first and foremost, this is a thing of beauty, Second, if you hand-wash lots of dishes and cook from scratch like I do then you'll learn the joy of having a tall spigot... and this one is *very* tall.The quality of this unit is first class -- it is quite heavy-made. I am no plumber but I was able to install the unit without any major setbacks. It probably took me a lot longer than the average DIY guy or gal to get it going but I was over-cautious to make sure that I didn't ruin something.The big disappointment was the lack of the escutcheon plate. This thing only requires one hole in the sink and, for the life of me, I do not understand why this is not included in the deal, especially considering the price.Still, I now have something much nicer than what I had before and it's a joy to use. I knocked the star off for the lack of the plate I needed to make things look right.Recommended.

There's usually not much that one can say about a shower-head but this one is certainly worth discussing.I like it for three main reasons. First and foremost, it is truly like showering in a downpour of rain. Second, it is a single function shower-head -- I have never been one to utilize all the gewgaws that are often a facet of fancy shower-heads so this one suits me fine.Third, the quality of this unit is first-class. You will find none better. It is quite heavy, clearly manufactured of the finest available material.Highly recommended.

Having set this trap according to instructions at various locations around the yard over the weeks I have owned it, I have yet to impale a mole.Granted, something sets it off and it penetrates into the ground just fine where the mole *should* be. I really cannot say why I haven't nailed one yet. The trap is plenty sturdy and of quality manufacture. The yard is plagued with the critters and there is no shortage of molehills.In summary, I think I have simply been unlucky, (or rather the moles have been lucky), because there seems to be no logical reason for this trap to not work.I will say that if I had cats around, I would not use this trap. You know how cats can get into things and places where they are not supposed to be and if one dug around the trap with his paw, he might get nailed. But, of course, if I had cats I would likely not have the moles in the first place.I won't say to not try this product but I have to be honest and point out that, in my case, it was not effective.

This work stands on it's own -- here's the shaved-down version of this well-imagined (and nicely-conveyed) fantasy yarn [WARNING: Semi-spoiler at the end of this review.]:Humans attempt to kill a Dragon Queen [Tintaglia] for "parts" believed to have medicinal properties. The variable-colored, telepathic, venom-spitting dragons naturally retaliate, drinking silver for magical energy.Elders, which are humans changed into winged half-serpentine "servant-protectors", join the dragons in their quest for vengeance.Dragons, Elders, and humans return to re-build their ancestral city of "Silver".It's a compelling read that any fantasy buff will surely enjoy.

I don't usually care much for shrewdly-written novels in the contemporary style. However, this one integrates enough substance into the text that I approve.I'm compelled to observe that this work of fiction is life experience first, bird-watching as a connecting theme. The thrust of this yarn focuses upon clever, if not earth shattering, experiences.When I say this, I have in mind the backwoods encounter with the rifle-packing mushroom hunter who clearly wishes a fraternal relationship with the protagonist. Or the one-armed wheelchair guy who curses the protagonist and complains that his new "nurse" is neither female nor sensual [paraphrasing].And I award high marks to the author for being the first, (who I know of), to effect an accurate depiction of the average park ranger: surly, officious, ungoverned, and very clean. I know because I was one for 25 years. I'm a bird-watcher too. But you don't need to be a bird-watcher, (nor do you even have to *like* bird-watchers, a clannish faction at best), to appreciate the story.In summary, if you enjoyed Slumgullion Stew by Edward Abbey, then you'll find this fast read equally palatable.

This toy is much larger than the impression I got when I ordered it. That was much the attraction for my grandkids, a boy and a girl, who love it. They call it "The Castle Toy" and you know when toys get special names that they are popular.Because of its large size, one kid gets on each side so it's easy to share. The horses clip pity clip down the walk easily, a very clever device They use this "castle" in combination with a large dollhouse and other similar toys when their friends come over and it keeps them occupied for hours.The durability is excellent, they have played with it for a good while now and nothing has broken. Overall, I can say nothing short of "highly recommended!"

We had hours of fun with this device and will no doubt do so again as soon as we have plenty more broken crayons, (which by the way, you can always find for free at yard sales.)First, the machine is durable and safe. I can see no reasonable way to get burned, (which was my number one concern), unless you are just outrageously careless. Cleaning up afterwards was another big question and that turned out to be a non-issue as well. You just hold the metal tray under hot water, eliminating a need to use PAM(tm), silicone spray, or any substance like that.Just read the instructions, placing the unit on a sturdy table or other solid surface, plug it in, and it will warm up. The instructions are easy to read and they provide lots of suggestions for use. It will melt any crayon or wax and, by the way, you can make new crayons from old broken ones.Expansion packs are available to make little cars, bling rings, twisted crayons, spinners, and critters. Twenty-four crayons are included in the kit.This is an entertaining toy that puts the adults working together with the kids. So that's a big plus.Highly recommended.

Oxo has a good name in kitchen utensil products and these measuring spoons work just fine. The shortcomings are quite minor.The best thing about these measuring spoons is that they will fit into most medium sized spice and herb cans, (depending upon the spoon that you are using.) In other words they are designed to fit down a rectangular hole, an oversight of most manufacturers.Of course they are accurate and it's easy to scoop excess ingredients off the top. (I don't believe in "heaping teaspoons" - that messes up everything in a recipe.) However, while they feel good in the hand, I have always shied away from non-metallic handles. They are a pain to wash if something gooey gets on them and I think all-metal ones are more sanitary.As to quality, these spoons are "stamped out" and not milled. The metal is very thin. Honestly, this is more of a guy issue since it probably doesn't matter unless you accidentally step on it. But I will never give up my Cuisipro Stainless Steel Measuring Spoon Set. They are made of heavy stainless steel and you could drive a car over them without any damage. They cost about the same as the Oxo spoons.In the end, I give the Oxo spoons the thumbs up on utility which, after all, is what most cooks/chefs want in the home kitchen.

It's gratifying to be pleasantly surprised when you naturally anticipate a story and you're treated to something quite divergent from and notably better than your expectations.This semi-bildungsroman is told in first person by a fictional urban Jewish teen who encounters life's little train-wrecks, as well as a few more positive events, as we all have during that joyous period of life. He has agreed with a creative teacher to write a book in place of having to study Shakespeare, (which he ends up doing anyway - that's not a big spoiler.) The teacher's actual agenda turns out to be quite different than what he has alleged to this bright lad; however, to reveal *that* would indeed be a spoiler for which you would not thank me.This young student, Twerski by name, lands upon one event following another, most of which are at least tenuously linked. These various activities embody everything from sports to puppy love and I must say that the conveyance of these youthful rites of passage launched me back to some hair-raising memories from my own dubious boyhood.What I found particularly compelling and inspiring about the work was an absence of "the coolness of possessing things", and a distancing of the characters from any compelling need to be anything but a regular kid. A complete void of noxious mentions of fashion and an equal dearth of obscene language represent the icing on the cake, features which seem to have become somewhat rare in contemporary teen reading.
