That considered, the tendency for leather to stretch makes the ChokeFree perhaps the better harness if one always applies it to the dog in the same direction (one side designated as the right side and is always on the right side of the dog). Because it's only one thin layer of leater (the metallic ones, being excepted), it will soften up and form to the dog more quickly. This means it will be a more comfortable harness for some dogs. However, the thin single layer of leather invites greater risk of breakage. Some of our dogs hate the buddy Belt and will reluctantly accept the ChokeFree. One thing that for me is a huge plus with the Buddy Belt is that it is actually is easier to put on and take off despite it having a metal buckle The leash can remain attached to the Buddy Belt at all times which saves us time as our dogs' harnesses are removed as soon as we get home and we like to store them attached to the leashes. With the ChokeFree you have to remove the leash each time you take it off.

Sizing is off and it's not very stretchy but feels so soft. I bought this thinking it could fit one of our chihuahuas or a kitty. It's not stretchy and though the neck and chest of the pets in question fit within the size chart guidelines, this did not fit them (couldn't even get it on) my suggestion would be to add at least 3" to the pet's neck and chest measurements and order the size that would accommodate that. If you're looking for the sizing chart it's there in the images (not obvious when shopping on a smartphone). It does feel very soft and like quality fleece, but I would hesitate to describe it as such without giving it a few washings to see how it holds up.

If you are new to DMSO, you should take a peek in the DMSO books on Amazon. It is a wonderful solvent. It dissolved the varnish on our coffee table in less than 30 seconds. It does other wondrous things that I can't comment on for risk of losing my license, but please read up on it if you have any interest in rapid healing.
Feels like quality cotton, color is consistent and nice. It has a comfortable fit and is easy to put on.

Green tripe odor is horrible in any form but when freeze dried it doesn't carry more than a foot so it won't stink up your house. We offer these as a probiotic treat. One out of five dogs won't touch it but most go nuts for it.

I have bought these at the store before and not noticed any deficiencies. The ones I got from Amazon were suprisingly defective. One was completely dead no charge at all. Another was pretty much dead by definition of my battery tester. The next two were on the border of "replace" and charged. Initially I thought it might be my battery tester but now that I've gotten some fully charged batteries from the store (Duracell) I see the tester is fine. I think this was random and not what most people would experience, but wanted to note my experience just in case seller is funneling old batteries out through online sales.

These are a bit smaller than the advance training pads I was used to and seeming not as absorbent, though I've never done a side by side comparison with a known amount of liquid. It's just my observation. The Advance training pads doubled in price so I tried these instead. I will switch back if they lower the price of the others.

I take one of these with 200mg Magnesium Citrate every night before bed. The magnesium prevents the constipation that might occur with iron and the iron prevents the loose stool that might occur with the magnesium.

We volunteer at a senior assisted living facility and bought this for a special patient. He had a very hard time putting the pieces together at first. He loved the image and that helped keep his interest. We used the puzzle as a gauge of his improvement and were able to determine the degree of improvement based on the time it took him to piece the puzzle together.I am sure the puzzles and Joggin Your Noggin games have helped him improve and also help us determine where he is in terms of clarity. I recommend puzzles, word games, and question and answer sessions for all seniors in the beginning stages of dementia.

It's far too long for our 15 lb dog and very awkward to put on and keep on. We're not using it on walks because it's just a pain but might use it for training dog-aggressive dogs to see if it keeps them from lunging.

This is formualted to create a balanced meal out of 100% meat products (raw or canned) which don't already contain bone or adequate amounts of added calcium. Meat does not contain an adequate amount of calcium to sustain dogs and cats. Meat which is processed will lose many nutrients so a product like this should be added to all meat diets (or meat and veggie diets).Unfortunately the Wysong company doesn't make it super easy to figure out what supplement of theirs you should use, but if you spend some time on their website you will figure it out. We have been using this product and others in their line for about 10 years. If it weren't for the price, I'd have used them consitently.Note: C-biotic (C=canine) and F-biotic (F=feline) are ideal to add to a raw diet WITH bone, and Add Life should be added to any cooked diet.
Contains whey, hydrogenated oil(s), and a long list of non-cheese ingredients. This is not "cheese powder" it's "cheese-flavored powder" but even that is arguable it seems.

They seem to be trying to compete with the Buddy Belt which is much more sophisticated in terms of leather, cuts stitching and hardware. These are obviously a LOT easier to make and IMO quite overpriced, thus the 3 stars. Also the rough hook portion of the hook and loop closure faces the dog so if there's any overlap, these are not going to be comfortable for very short haired dogs or dogs with fine fur and sensitive skin.

We own several buddy belts which cost about as much as these. The Buddy Belts are a more detailed design and involved more leather and hardware. I like that the buddy belt has the leash O-ring in a position that the leash doesn't have to be detached and reattached each time you take the harness off. With the ChokeFree, you have to remove the leash each time which for us is a burden because we are harnessing and walking several dogs several times a day. Granted the way it's designed will ensure that the hook and loop closure cannot come completely undone which adds an additional amount of safety. Our dogs have managed to get one or both legs out of these. However these seem to be better tolerated than the buddy belts (our dogs hate putting on the Buddy Belts). These are not escape proof and should only be used with dogs who are trained not to bolt. If your dog is a bolt risk, use this and a martingale and attach the martingale ring to the leash as well. Adjust the martingale so that it won't choke the dog if it's pulling but will prevent escape should your dog slip out of the chokefree harness. If anyone knows a completely escape proof dog harness, we'd love to know about it.

I'm not usually disappointed by these ready made frosting tubs. We bought this at the store tonight and brought it home to realize it has nothing in it that even resembles cream cheese. It tastes like petroleum jelly and artificial sweetener. My time is too valuable to attempt to return it, but taking 2 minutes to write a review seemed like a good idea to spare others from the same disappointment. This is an example of dishonest labeling and disgusting frosting.

The picky ones get this as an appetizer before their meal. It takes a few minutes to hydrate their freeze dried "The Real Meat" beef dog food because it's sometimes in rather large clumps. This brand is overpriced for what it is, but it also does a job that I need it to do (Add a new flavor without adding a new protein and its 100% raw). I can sprinkle a bit of this into their meal if they balk at feeding time, and it gets them to gobble up their mel.I also got the Vital Essentials tripe treats which are disgustingly odorous, but delicious to some of the pets. The princesses won't touch them without a lot of encouragement and assurance that it is indeed edible. The boys have no issues gobbling them up and one of the senior cats (over 20) who sometimes seems to have lost her ability to enjoy food, gobbles the tripe balls up like candy.

I am guessing that I and a few other reviewers got a run of a bad batch made from low quality, unripe berries. The flavor is shockingly sour and though I tried each berry type seperately, there was not one bit that was pleasing. Too sour to even hide them in cereal or yogurt. Anything but delicious.

This is a good harness. Dogs could slip out of it so we recommend it only for well behaved dogs. Also the harsh velcro faces the dog's skin. The velcro strips should be reversed. We bought two and are about to order two more. Sizing was off. If your dog is over 12lbs, I'd suggest adding 2" to your dog's measurement behind the front legs. Even with 2 inches added, we found ours to be very tight and we stretched them out a little before putting them onto the dogs. A 13lb dog with 15 inch chest is in the 17 and it's starting to stretch to a perfect fit. If only they could come up with a way to keep dogs from slipping out of these.

Absolutely dishonest seller here, or a very strange coincidence. There was no photo at all for the seafoam option. After we receive the bed and find it to be an army green (to our dismay) we see that they have added an faded army green color swatch to the ad as if to cover their buts. It's not seafoam, but it is cheap foam. It's suitable for a dog about 40lbs. but I'd be hesitant to get this type of bed for a larger dog because the foam is thin.

From the description and photo I was expecting this to be tan on top (where it matters most) and the bottom. It is black fleece on top. The fleece shows every bit of fur and it isn't easy to remove because of the fluffy texture. It would be fine for black/gray pets, but we have mainly light colored pets. If the manufacturer/seller improves the description on this product, I will give it 4 stars for it is something our small dogs love. The cats haven't used it even when we put catnip on it. This only fits chairs with wide legs so be sure to measure your chair before ordering.If you have smaller chairs or a tighter budget, you might look into ProSelect Wild Time Pet Cage Hammock which is a bit smaller and less than half the price. I just looped the strap around chair legs and secured the snapbolt to the strap. Being that it's half the price (was $13), and made with off white fleece, it is a much better product for us (note: this hammock will only fit dogs up to 13lbs, the 15lb dogs don't quite fit right and are better able to snuggle in the cat cribs).

Product is decent in terms of ingredients but may arrive stale as ours did. Your cat may not eat it whether or not it's stale- our cats do not like this product, however, one of our liver disease dogs loves it so we found a backup use for these and didn't have to throw them out.

I can't say if her liver values have improved, but the cat loves the flavor of this medicine. She also loves the renafood and renatrophin also by Standard Process so they seem to be great at making flavorful supplements. These pills are also easy to crush with my fingers for sprinkling onto the food.

This is a really great product. I am an efficiency fanatic so I love non-toxic products that don't need rinsing or other extra steps. This is one step- just apply it and leave it- or wipe it, whatever you wish. It's so easy. No odor, no irritation to pets, no accidental bleaching of your favorite clothes, and no whining housekeepers with sensitive skin. Needless to say we love this!Everyone knows silver is a potent (perhaps the most potent?) antimicrobial available. I haven't heard of a single pathogen that can survive being hit with this strength of ionic silver solution. I recommend  PureGreen24 to every germophobe, and to anyone who might have a weak immune system and a legitimate fear of microbes.When left on surfaces, this solution has a residual effect of at least 24 hours. I imagine that it actually lasts for months, but they don't want you to know that because you'd use less. When they make antimicrobial socks and such, they add silver to the fibers and that lasts for months/years and hundreds of washings. If silver embedded in a fiber can last for years why wouldn't this product have a residual effect when left on a surface without rinsing? One wouldn't have any idea where the silver residue was and where it might be wiped away so to be on the safe side, use this daily if you have a germ concern.Tip- When you add this to your bottle of dish soap and apply to a sponge, the sponge is dissinfected in the process of washing your dishes. The sponge will retain antimicrobial activity if you don't rinse all of the soap+silver solution out of it. I use Dr Bronner castille soap and PureGreen24 (4:1) as a dish soap. I love knowing if there is any soap residue (a risk with castille soaps), it will be safely antimicrobial.Tip- If you want to be really careful about germs, you can do what we do and pre-treat your kitchen and hand towels in this. I just dip the washed (still damp) towels, into a bucket filled with 1 cup of this and 3 cups water, wring out well and put them in the dryer. When they are dry, I have antibacterial/anti-viral towels (and the dryer, if it wasn't already, is totally germ free).Tip- This is a great roach control product as well and won't harm your pets/kids. A lot of people don't know that many insects, roaches included, need bacteria to survive. Use a dallop of soft food (like meat baby food or hamburger), mix it with the puregreen24 in this solution. Leave a tiny bit out each night and after a few nights the roaches will be eliminated. Tf your pets happen to eat the roaches (Dead or alive) there is no risk of poisoning from the PureGreen24 (unlike toxic roach baits).We also recommend using it on hot spots and itching bug bites. We dilute it 1:3 with purified water if the skin is broken as the acid could sting. Then again, sometimes the sting of an acid will remove the itch of an allergic hive. If you are inclined you might experiment carefully with using this product on itches and wounds. It works better than the home made ionic silver and vinegar solutions we have tried over the years.I gave 4 stars, not 5, only because of the price. It is FAR cheaper than mesosilver silver products (I'm thinking of their oral solutions and spa dissinfectant), and it's impossible to make .03% ionic silver (300PPM) at home, so this is a good buy for us. However, I still feel it should be less expensive. It isn't hard to make ionic silver in a production facility and the citric acid added isn't valuable. My guess is that this will become more affordable as it becomes more popular. So, folks, try it and share your excitement with friends so that one day everyone can afford this super safe alternative to toxic chemicals.

The collar looks just like the photo and I am pleased with the white paint which has held up for a month. The paint will wear off wherever it rubs against anything metal, of course, but I expected that. The leather is so thin that I was able to easily stretch the collar with my hands an extra inch in order to put it on the dog we purchased it for. He has a 15" neck. This collar arrived in a size suitable for necks up to 14" and after a quick stretching it fit him just fine. After about a month of use (5 minutes a day, at most, of being used with a leash) it stretched out another inch or more on it's own. We now have to use the 3rd hole to keep it from looking droopy. We put this on a medium size dog who is off leash for 95% of his walk, so most of this stretching is occurring during short periods when a leash is attached and he isn't a puller. It is not safe for a dog that pulls or any aggressive dog as it would easily rip.

After receiving two defective adapters I assumed my computer needed it's display port replaced. However I hadn't found any information online about this being an issue with the Mac Mini. So, finally, I ordered this adaptor and discovered there was nothing wrong with my computer's display port. The two I purchased previously that did not work were by Rocketfish and TGOM.

The following is what the seller claims and my notes are in parentheses:  10 ounce Shampoo enhances silkiness and shine. (my hair was dull, tangly, and frizzy after using it)  Protects color and restores vibrancy (I only used this 3 times and it seemed to strip color)  5 ounce Deep Conditioner cuts down drying time strengthens hair and adds vibrancy (I didn't notice faster drying)  5 ounce Smoothing Balm cuts down drying time assists in style hold (the "smoothing balm" doesn't smooth)  Protect your hair from the environment while adding shine and cutting down on Frizz (I had serious frizz with this)  Improve elasticity and strengthen hair (didn't use it long enough to comment on this)I think the issue may be that this isn't a sulfate free shampoo. One seller claimed it was and I purchased this trio based on that information. I highly recommend the sulfate free it's a 10 shampoos, and the leave in spray conditioner with keratin.
Our chef/nutritionist surprised us with with these cookies. All I can say is wow! They are very delicious- very close to an Oreo with a bit more crispiness.

I just took my miele into the shop because the motor died. The machine isn't old and has only had 450 sf of space to clean weekly. It was running fine until I started buying knock off bags. I started to notice stronger odors when housekeeper was vacuuming. Eventually it just died (it was on it's 5th 3M Filtrete bag) and when I took a look, the bag was in place perfectly but the inside of the canister was very dusty, even had sand sized particles. So dust got through or around the seal of this bag, into the inner canister, through the cheap secondary filter, and into the motor in abundant quantity. I am waiting to hear if the Miele-authorized repairman can fix the motor (he said it doesn't look good). I am hoping 3M will step up and cover the repair or the cost of replacing my vacuum. At the very least, I'm hoping they will find out what flaw caused this issue. Please don't use these if you notice any dust at all inside your canister. It's not worth it.

Nowhere on the package or bowls does it state that these bowls are stainless steel. They look impure with dark grey residue on them or leeching from them. I would not use them without verification that they are stainless.

It's not high quality materials, but our old dog finds it comfortable. I pulled out the foam and wrapped it with trash bags before placing it back into the cover because I wanted it to be wet-proof. It wasn't too difficult getting it back into the cover, but it is a snug fit and shrinkage is a concern. To make this a better bed for my dog and to cut down on the likelihood that I'd have to wash the cover, I top it with a washable, 24x36 memory foam bath mat. The old dog appreciates the extra cushion.
We really like the size for wife's hand (1 cup size is not ideal for large man's hand. The only thing I'd like to see changed is the drawstring as others have mentioned. For $6, I can't complain.

I am really impressed with these pads.The multiple straps make it easy to hold from several different angles depending on what kind of kicks you're practicing with your partner.They are thick and firm enough to take a good bit of impact without injuring the holder.You wouldn't want to punch them without gloves or wraps on. The firmer filling is definitely designed to withstand kicks, not just punches.I'm very impressed with the quality for the price.  Much better than ones we looked at from a sporting goods store recently.

I am an average-sized female. Generally speaking, when I shop, I buy gloves in the "medium" size range, or sometimes small. My fingers are not long, but my hands are a bit wide at the wrist, not gently tapering like the ones in this picture. For a nice, tight fit, these gloves were perfect for my hands. They slid on easily without rolling and bunching. The fit was snug but not uncomfortable.The bigger "plus" over later (for me) was that these have much better sensitivity. I could feel heat and cold and tiny edges of metal instruments without the dullness latex gloves generally give. It was much closer to having bare hands functionally. Much better than I had imagined.Can't see me going back to latex after using these. They just feel so much more natural.

I am an average-sized female. Generally speaking, when I shop, I buy gloves in the "medium" size range, or sometimes small. My fingers are not long, but my hands are a bit wide at the wrist, not gently tapering like the ones in this picture. For a nice, tight fit, these gloves were perfect for my hands. They slid on easily without rolling and bunching. The fit was snug but not uncomfortable.The bigger "plus" over later (for me) was that these have much better sensitivity. I could feel heat and cold and tiny edges of metal instruments without the dullness latex gloves generally give. It was much closer to having bare hands functionally. Much better than I had imagined.Can't see me going back to latex after using these. They just feel so much more natural.

My husband is not a HVAC certified, but he does have some electrical training. He has done rewiring and new wiring in several private homes and rental units and said that this tool was very helpful to him. Simple to use and easy to read.
This is the best quality feeder we have ever gotten. And the prettiest. It took less than 5 minutes to prepare and hang up. A very nice, bright color, too.

Absolutely delighted with this crib. Not ridiculously heavy nor too light. Easy to assemble and easy to adjust the crib height when baby is old/tall enough to pull themselves over the railing.The big bonus here is that it has one removable side to convert to a toddler bed when a crib is no longer appropriate. This is actually a really big deal to us. When my first daughter was ready for a toddler bed, she was really sad to leave her crib, so we found a way to make it a toddler bed.This one does that easily and is set up for it. And yes, once it's a toddler bed you CAN put the rail back on to become a crib again.If this isn't your favorite color choice, it's available in several other colors to suit your nursery.I will be interested to see later on how well the powder coating finish holds up when baby starts chewing on the rails, though.

I am pretty new to the world of "smart phones" and quite frankly, not that keen on technology.From that perspective, I found this phone pretty user friendly just following the on-screen prompts.It does look a lot like and Iphone and I can add it to our Verizon account as an extra line for $10/month more than our current contract.The included accessories is huge. I'm used to paying an extra $30 - $40 for those AFTER the cost of the phone.The real bargain here is if you are buying a phone outright. I know that many people get their phones pretty inexpensively through their service providers, but it's generally at the cost of a 2 year or more contract. This is a very affordable way to add a smart phone to an existing contract without paying hundreds out of pocket.

My 5 year old LOVES the bright colors and small ear pieces on this set.The sound quality is decent. Not high-end, but we didn't expect that for a budget set.She often carries a Kindle in the car when we travel or gets on the internet for her on-line school work. Unlike an adult sized set that slides right off her of her head, this kid-sized one is just perfect. So glad we ordered these.

This set is EXCELLENT in quality. We've had some plastic, light weight sets before that just don't even compare. This is self-contained. It can be folded up like a small suitcase with pockets for the bean bags and washers to stay in. The carrying handle seems SUPER sturdy and makes it really convenient to get in and out of storage for the kids to play. It would be great for a church or community group that hosts children's events.

The sound on these is wonderful. I have other high-end sets from different companies and can't tell a significant difference between this brand and another quality head set. But there IS a substantial difference in sound quality between these and your average $50 set. Very substantial.I'm not much for vanity products and won't endorse a "high end" product simply because it bears a name. These are just plain comfortable and very easy to set up for blue tooth. Despite saying that they are compatible with Iphones, pads, etc, they do work just fine with my last-generation Kindle Fire, even with the blue tooth.And if you spend a lot of time with ear phones on, this is one investment you should make for your long-term hearing. Clean sound is far less damaging to the ears than "dirty" sound with a lot of other static and background noises. Since I have 3 young kids who play and learn on hand held devices, I want the best quality on their little ears to prevent hearing loss. It's worth it for that reason.

I got this in anticipation of an upcoming baby shower. My kids had a couple like it when they were babies. Babies love books, but babies CHEW on books, so these little soft plushies are usually well loved.Unlike ones we had in the past, this one had a much better variety of sounds and textures than the "old school" books that basically made a crinkling sound or had a squeeze ball in it to squeak. But for the amount of materials here and the still-poor sound quality, the original asking price of $15 listed seems pretty high. I, personally would probably not have paid more than $10 if it weren't a test product.It is a better-than-average baby book toy and I realize that price is a matter of personal value. Just my opinion since baby will probably only use it for a few months before they outgrow it.

I'm not a 49ers fan, per se. But was in need of a heavy weight stapler that could do about 20 sheets of paper. I was pretty happy when this one arrived and had some serious weight to it. Unlike the $10 device I recently purchased that barely punched through 8 pieces of paper, this one does actually do up to 25 as it indicates. Another bonus feature is that it can lay flat to tack staples (like to a wall or bulletin board) which I have always used a power staple gun to do in the past. And it does it pretty well, too. Just doesn't sink in as flat at the gun without some serious force.

This keyboard case has some serious weight to it. Makes the Ipad feel like a full-sized laptop, which is actually a good thing, because wehen you set it down on a desk to use it LIKE a laptop, it doesn't fall right over. The keyboard is a nice size and a whole lot more convenient than trying to type messages on a screen keyboard. I hesitated on this one for a while, then finally decided to order it. Really glad that I did. It's especially great for travel when we take our hand held devices, but need to maintain work away from home. Have a REAL keyboard to type and do e-mail saves a lot of time, but still gives the fun and convenience of a handheld device. Perfect.

These are nice, thick, but not heavy cloth.  It uses velcro to help keep the swaddle in place.  Great quality, with nice seam lines.  Easy to use, especially for first time moms who don't know how to swaddle already.  There's a hole in the butt region which I'm assuming is a way to check for a dirty diaper, but I'm not sure.Velcro is super sticky and hard to open but I'm sure that'll fade with use. Seems good right now, though.

I am pretty pleased with these cloths. I pre-washed them before using to see if they would shrink. They did, but very, very little.The water in my washing machine wasn't tinted purple, either, so it would also seem that it is a good quality due.The cloth is thick enough that it doesn't feel like you're washing dishes almost bare-handed, but not so thick that you can't feel through it.The textured "waffle" of the fabric gives it a little bit of "scrub" action, though not abrasive.This is the first dish-style cloth that really stands out to me above the average ones I've gotten in the department store.Will probably be ordering more of these.

Love the texture of these for scrubbing, but absorption is not as good as my all cotton cloths. The texture of them seems to be really good for scrubbing counter tops and pans that have a gluey or sticky surface better than a standard dish cloth, but they do pill and look worn out more quickly. I do like them for cleaning in general, but not as much for dishes. It seems like the dirt and grime is harder to rinse out of these than my standard cloth, which makes it take a little longer to wash dishes since there's more grease and grime than with standard house cleaning.

Huggies little snugglers were fantastic as a diaper. Great absorbency and didn't leave red marks around the legs where the elastic rubbed. They did a great job of containing odors and keeping the skin on baby's bottom dry, but for us, the chemicals in these left a nasty rash on my infant. I am not saying, "Don't buy these" because I am certain that not every baby is sensitive to the same stuff. But if you have an infant with very sensitive skin, I thought it worth mentioning that these weren't agreeable for ours. The product itself is really excellent.

I cannot say confidently whether this is helping my immune system (though I believe it is) but I can say that it IS gentle on the stomach. I have tried several dozen kinds of supplements, but have a rather delicate stomach. Most I have tried left me with a gassy stomach, mild indigestion or the flavor coming up my throat for hours after I would take them. I quit most supplements for that reason. I took these with some water a couple of hours after breakfast but felt no side effects or stomach upset at all. For that reason, I would recommend them.

The bear is REALLY cute in person. Much more than I would have expected from the picture. His voice was not annoying like so many talking toys tend to be. And the crawling is great. Just not ideal for people with thick carpets as he doesn't tend to travel well on those.

Much better than my $20 a dozen bar mops. I purchased a mega-pack last year of all whites on a friend's recommendation. They were ok at best. They dried well, bleached okay, but looked shabby after just one washing. These towels have a better quality edging with a full, finished seam. I am not exaggerating when I say that my previous bar mops started to unravel at the first washing and I was often cutting loose strings off of them.These ones have a thicker cotton with a bumpy texture that seems to grab water more readily.In fact, I put one on my kitchen counter and tested it next to a microfiber cleaning towel. I poured one quarter cup of water across the surface of each. This cotton towel grabbed most of the water on its own and I didn't have to continue rubbing the counter with the still-dry parts of the towel. The microfiber felt much wetter to the touch and let a lot of water go through to the counter. These grabbed most of the water and let very little pass through. The microfiber spread the remaining water on the counter. This towel actually continued to pick up water even after I poured 1/4 cup of water onto it. I was impressed.They did shrink a little in the wash (almost all cotton does) but still came out looking like a decent kitchen towel, not a large washcloth.Overall, I think the function, look and quality of these is great. Will definitely be buying a couple of additional sets.

I can't say that I will be using these as dish towels. It might be a mental hang-up, but microfiber-type cloths in my experience have mostly been used for cleaning. I can sort of see why. I got these towels and a set of all cotton bar mops on the same day. The cotton bar mops, quite frankly, did a much better job of absorbing water and quickly. These took a little longer, felt "wet" to the touch when the cotton ones felt only a little damp (like the water stayed on the surface rather than sinking in) and proceeded to spread water around on the counter while the cotton ones picked up the remaining moisture. And I started by pouring about 1/4 cup of water across the surface of each towel.They one place they out-performed the cotton towel was in scrubbing. There was some sticky residue on my counter from mixing sweet tea that came up more readily with the scrubby-type fibers when the cotton left some sticky behind. So, I will probably be using these for house cleaning, but not likely for dishes.

I am consistently impressed with the quality of toys from this company. This one is no exception. While the tea set isn't as "cute" as some of the the frilly, super-girly sets we've ordered in the past, this one was no less well received by the children. It's the only tea set that came with cute littel pieces of "toast" and a caddy of tea leaves, which they absolutely loved. That was probably the real standout feature. My kids used to take my tea bags and pretend to brew them in their glass tea set, but the cute little tea caddy and "leaves" just added to their creative play. Sometimes those little changes make a world of difference. I, personally, like that they set has a bit of weight to it, like a glass set rather than a light plastic one. It makes it seem just a bit more real and the kids are developing hand strength and dexterity in a way that light plastic toys to not encourage.

This is a very well-made and generously portioned sweater. My nearly 10-year-old daughter has a very athletic build and generally finds a standard size 10 a bit too tight. Even most 10-12's are  just barely right for her in the arms or legs. This sweater fit her quite comfortably with plenty of length in the torso and arms. She is, by pediatric standards, on the tall end of the growth chart, so we often have to buy her one size up in clothing for length. This was plenty long to hit her in the mid-hip area comfortably and had enough length in the arms to cover her hands when stretched out.

This thing sounds amazing. I don't have a smart-phone, but everyone in my family uses their Kindles on a regular basis. And while I am pretty low on the literacy scale with electronic stuff, this was EASY to set up and use following the prompts from the booklet. The sound isn't home-theater quality, but IS surprisingly clean and enjoyable when we hooked it up to our Kindle and ran our music playlist through it.

I would describe these as a "slim fit" pant. My nearly 10-year-old daughter could get them on and they had a little room around the waist, but they were narrow in the thighs. They do, however have a lot of stretch to them. She said she was comfortable despite that we normally have to fight with her to wear anything but leggings. They also came with a "scarf" style belt that she removed immediately.
Well made, noises aren't annoying but pleases the baby.  Nice plastic handle that baby can grasp and shake.  Material good for baby teething/sucking.  Dogs like it too! LOL

This concept really didn't impress me when I first saw it. But my kids have gotten HOURS of entertainment from it.Like most "kits" that come with paper, there's nowhere near enough to last for more than one or two play sessions. You can, of course, buy from the company at a ridiculous price, or make your own squares using a paper cutter (which we did).The colors are easy to use (not too hard to squeeze) and layer well on top of each other.Some paints tend to just muddy and mix together. I guess the extra air flow from the spinning helps these to dry quickly so they do layer on top of each other to make interesting designs.You can adjust the speed to change the patterns. The instructions have lots of little tips and tricks for creating various patterns and ideas.Although it's designed for older kids, my 5 year old was able to use it with a little instruction.I am also surprised that it cleans up so easily, which is wonderful. The paints come out of the machine with just a little water and a rag.The paints DO last for quite a while, but with 3 kids, we had to order more just a week after they started using it.Definitely a great gift for kids. Boys or girls.

My kids were really pleased with this toy. They used it on a carpet so it didn't tip quite as easily. I didn't think they would get very many animals stacked up before it would topple, but was surprised to see them doing quite well at it. My 3 kids are ages 5, 7 and 9 and they all thought it was fun. The quality is comparable to Melissa and Doug brand products. Simple, well made, sturdy pieces. Not too heavy, but not cheap and plastic feeling in your hands. I much prefer to have my kids playing with real materials than cheap plastic trash, and this is a great quality set for a very reasonable price. It looks like it will hold up for a long, long time, too.

I can hardly believe how realistic this looks. The metal caddy is just like one you would see on a dining table. The salt and pepper make a little "shake" sound when you "use" them. The ketchup and mustard bottles have a string that comes out (but not all the way) and looks like you're putting a line of sauce on your food. And the hot sauce disappears in the bottle like those old-fashioned toy baby bottles with the disappearing "milk".It's got a little weight to it, too. Sits upright without tipping over every time someone bumps it.All 3 of my kids, ages 5, 7 and almost 10 absolutely love this and have been sharing it ever since it arrived.This is definitely something I would buy as a gift item.

My husband tried these on both his mountain bike and his road bike.He described them as "very easy" and was pretty impressed by how user-friendly they were.He was also pleased to see that they worked with a standard pair of clipless bike shoes.So he left the pedals on the road bike in order to switch back and forth without changing shoes.He considers that to be a "big bonus".He called them "very user friendly" and said they "felt good" pedaling.He's been a mountain bike enthusiast for more than 20 years and was very pleased.

This is the 3rd portable net we've purchased. Although the first two were from a different company, the design and set up are almost identical. True to promise, it is pretty quick and simple to set up, which is great. Because items that are hard to set up just end up collecting dust in the shed. My kids have thoroughly enjoyed the other two nets until one recently got a hole after being blown around in a storm (our fault, didn't have it anchored).I've been pleased with the overall quality and durability of the other two we have. This one seems to be the same material. Hopefully, it holds up well. Straps and anchors also look to be of the same quality as our previous nets.I'm sure we'll have some very happy campers when they see this up in the yard.
This is so cool and funnyI made pony

This toy basically took the concept of Thomas's wooden train set and fixed everything that was wrong with it.The tracks were a nightmare. Constantly coming apart. Toddlers would disassemble daily and we would waste countless hours putting them back n the "correct" positions again just to have them repeat the process.These ones can be assembled, gently disassembled, put together with other track sets and used with other sets.Now I'm looking to see if we can just get the connectors to use with the box full of wooden tracks that we already had.I was happy to see that the set came with a couple of trains, too. It's basically a perfect started set for a young toddler to pre-schooler.

This is the 4th body composition scale I've ordered in the past few years. The price is comparable to the better ones I own. The "cheap" ones that I paid less than $50 for varied greatly in their readings and didn't last very long.This one seems to be well constructed and have a decent amount of weight to it.Compared to the scale I've been using, this one is pretty similar in variations from one day to the next. Though I don't remember the name brand of the one I have presently (it's not on the scale) it was one of the top rated just a few years ago by health and fitness professional magazines and product testers.For the same price, it holds more data. My scale only logs for 2 users.I have NOT tried using it with the app. I'm just not a big app user in general. Don't care. Just want to monitor fat loss and weight on a regular basis.I'm pretty happy with it, overall.

I have owned Mr. coffee and Starbucks brand espresso machines as well as Krups and another I can't think of at the moment.This one tops them all.It is, hands down, the easiest set up, fastest brew, easiest clean up and makes the smoothest coffee with no hint of bitterness.The pods are ridiculously convenient.It has a catch tray/drawer built in for your old pods to fall into.You can make one shot of coffee after another without stopping to reheat for several minutes.It is the quietest we've ever heard - we could still have a normal level conversation in the kitchen while it was running.It also has the smallest footprint. Compact in size and not super heavy.I am putting these on my wishlist for gifts to my closest family.

When I first ordered these, I wondered if it was a new marketing angle. So many companies produce the same exact product but "specialize" their marketing to appeal to various groups of people. I was suspicious that these would be no different than standard Avery printer labels, but I was wrong.They are substantially thicker/more durable than the office-type labels.They ARE waterproof. Unlike the office variety which smear ink when damp.They have a stronger adhesive which makes them apply well to things like plastic bins and spray bottles (which is primarily what I wanted them for). Mostly, I wanted them for home made cleaning solutions so that when the solution drips or leaks on the bottle, I would still be able to see the label. No issues there at all. Nothing I've spilled so far has done damage to these.Still clear, crisp and readable.

I am truly pleased with the quality of these blocks. We have tried some others that literally started chipping paint the moment the kids began using them. These have beautiful color and a really nice variety of shapes. I love the building suggestions that come with it.All of my kids, ages 4, 6 and 9 liked these very well.They aren't as "easy" to use as large lego-types that lock together, but the kids didn't seem to mind at all.I will probably buy a couple of extra sets to keep around as gifts.

The Jackson HSL-100 is an excellent piece of equipment.  I have had an HSL-2R for a couple of years now and this is even better.  Having the large field of view allows me to see much more of my work.  The sturdy construction is much better than some of the auto darkeners out there.  Unlike most of the other hoods I have seen there is no warning against using it for overhead welding.  The headband is comfortable and fits well.  Narrow profile  makes it good for snug spaces.  Overall very pleased with this product and hope to have it for many years of use.

This toy was received with great anticipation at our house. And it is definitely a lot of fun. But for the nearly $100 price tag, it's seriously lacking in durability and practicality.While the picture shows 2 small children jumping together inside, that is more fantasy than reality. There is very little actual jumping area inside the "ring". Half the fun of this activity for my kids (and many others I've seen) is jumping together with a friend or two. There simply isn't enough room here. They would have to stay very carefully in one precise spot and jump only up and down to avoid smashing heads with the other jumper. If you've ever watched kids in a large bouncer, you would realize that is simply not how the y like to play in them. Because of these limitations, they lost interest after a very short time and didn't ask to go back. In the larger bounce house we used recently, we couldn't tear them away from it.Another weakness is that you can't anchor it anywhere, so a good wind would remove it quickly. We thought of setting it up on our enclosed porch, the the directions specifically say not to set on cement. And probably for a good reason. The sides that appear to be there for protection are just additional balloons tied together with string the thickness of shoe laces. They make the appearance of adding safety (giving a clear visual, border) but when our larger child of nearly 50 pounds actually bounced into one, the entire bounce house started to tip over with the child.My final comment is that you need a high pressure air compressor to inflate it. Ours took close to an hour. And air compressors have different sized fittings. This does not include a compressor, which you will need to have if you purchase one.There is no way a person could simply blow this up by mouth, in case you're wondering.

I find the pre-freezing "cup" concept with these incredibly annoying. I ordered this hoping that we had gotten a machine that would grind standard ice cubes. Not so. It came with a couple of custom-sized bowls to freeze water in. It creates an ice hocky puck that fits neatly into the grinding shaft. And because there are only 2, it requires some preplanning, freezing, emptying and re-freezing if you want to make cones for an entire family. It did grind well, and easily into a very nice "shave" that my kids loved. But it only grinds thoroughly for about 80% of the block then requires some fussiness to get the remaining parts in at just the right angle to shave into cones.For the price of this snow cone maker compared to the other 5 star rated one I have, I feel like I'm paying a lot more for the snow man head and arms, which make it impossible to fit in an upper cupboard anywhere in my kitchen. For the additional price, they could have at least included a substantial number of paper cones rather than requiring you to purchase an add on pack almost immediately.While it does the job quickly and relatively quietly, I find the necessary pre-planning and space mongering highly annoying.Unless your kids are absolutely nuts about Olaf or you're giving this to someone with lots of cupboard space, go with the smaller model from Hawaiian ice. No frills but a smaller footprint.

Phil Kim has a very enjoyable persona both in person and in writing. This is the 2nd book of his I've read and found it very enjoyable. Though he's obviously quite educated and experienced in his field, his approach is very tangible. Rather than reading like a scholarly know-it-all, he sounds very much like the "guy next door" who just happens to be an expert in business.The concepts here apply to businesses and non-profits regardless of size. If you have 4 or more people working for you whether you're a CEO or a department leader, this is a good introduction to team-work.You WON'T find cheesy activities for building teams or developing trust.You WILL find many practical applications of being a leader rather than a boss.How to build morale. Why a happy employee isn't necessarily a productive one.How to create problem solvers in your group.How to develop appreciation for your team and among them.Raising the bar and finding the right level to challenge your team, but not overwhelm.Creating a group that works together rather than competing.Helping your team see the "big picture" and why it matters to them.What causes people to engage or disengage from their work.Why clear job descriptions matter.How positive and negative reinforcement work for and against you.There is a lot here. He doesn't delve too deeply into any specific category, but gives you a clear direction and "why" for making the big picture happen. And realistically states that some people just won't fit in that picture. It's ok to let them go.If you're new to team building or just want a starting toolbox to get started, this is it.

This is a nice little work light, but only for a small work area. I set it up on my side table in place of my lamp. It's not much brighter than a 60W light bulb and the light doesn't travel as far because of the shape. The USP port is of no interest to me whatsoever, I was primarily interested in a work light for table top projects. It is ok for writing/calligraphy, but wouldn't be ideal for drafting or something covering a larger area.It does, however, make a very good reading light for on top of our piano. The light is more than adequate to make the music visible and the shield keeps the light out of your eyes while playing.

These are a very attractive set. They look like a quality mitt rather than a cheap junk set. They also feel thicker on my hands than an all-cotton pair I bought for the same price. They did a better job of protecting my hands when pulling hot trays from the oven, too.Wasn't really sure how well the black surface material would work, but I'm very pleased with it.In my all cotton set, I could feel quite a bit of heat passing through the mitt, with these I did not.

These are SO helpful for underneath crib sheets. Not just for babies, but in the toddler years, as well. Toddler beds use the same mattresses as cribs, and kids often have accidents either leaking out of diapers or peeing out the bed during potty training times. It's wonderful to just change the sheet and pad in the middle of the night instead of having to deal with scrubbing a mattress, drying and changing out all the bedding.Very convenient. Also works nicely for a washable changing pad on the go.

This toy is just a lot of fun. Kids love to throw things, and my kids like the minions a lot. So a toy that involves imagination, minions and valuting things is just great. They are enthralled with launching toys through the air and being allowed to do so. I can't vouch for the long-term quality of the item, but all of our other mega blocks toys have held up well. I hope this one does, too.It seems to be fairly well constructed. Time will tell.

These dolls are absolutely exquisite. The box and graphics make an impressive presentation. The accessories included have a great amount of decorative details. The clothing is well stitched, not basted. And she seems to be constructed to last for quite some time (can't say the same of some other dolls we've purchased recently from "Ever After" which fell apart the first day). Most of the dolls we have gotten from other brands cannot be posed, or only move one or two ways with visible joints. These are exceptionally well done.

I am new to the world of lego. This book is almost overwhelming. My imagination has been stretched, and I'm sure my childrens' will be, too. I set the book on my desk to read/review but the kids kept running off with it. Go figure. Now all they keep asking for are legos for Christmas.I love the way they designed the book. It has categories for themes of ideas, which is pretty clever since kids will probably build in themes. It opens with an introduction spread with the various types of blocks and how to connect them. It gives basic measurements and geometric information.From there, the theme centered directions look like this:OUTER SPACE: robots, forklifts, doors and walls, a lab, aliens, space plants, scenery, spaceships and so forth.MODERN METROPOLIS: Basic buildings, museum, roofs, cars, furniture, plants, farms, lights, signs and fruits and veggies, etc.THE WILD WEST: Wagons, scenery, cavalry fort, jailhouse, saloon, steam train, old mine, riverboat, outlaw hideout and more.FANTASY LAND: A fantasy house, fences and pathways, waterfall, tree slide, castle wall, towers, catapult, etc.THE REAL WORLD: A cell phone, bathroom, gingerbread man, baking items, popsicle, candy, "box of chocolates".Each picture is not a step-by-step but gives a general idea of how to put it together. Several of the more complex ones gives a pulled-apart image so you can see how all of the items fit together. At the back of the book is a breakdown of all the kinds of bricks available.This is a truly impressive collection of ideas. Certainly a great place to start inspiring imaginations.

This is a great balance between mousse and gel. Not to thick or too thin. I used about 3 pumps for my mid-length hair. I didn't do the recommended curl method, simply because I didn't have time. I have naturally wavy hair that usually falls flat with gel or gets greasy looking with mousse (and stiff). This product was perfect. It gave me a soft "scrunch" curl with a nice, soft texture. Not stiff, not greasy. It did add a little bit of shine to the lower strands that are generally a little dry looking from frequent hair coloring.Generally speaking, I just don't bother with most hair products after the first time or two because of how they leave my hair feeling (or the horrendous perfume smell). This is one I will be using on a regular basis. Very surprised and pleased with the results.

I have a 7 year old daughter with a developmental issue. She still cannot get through the night without wetting her underwear. She is very sensitive and often has irritation, itching and discomfort with regular pull ups. When I brought these home, she was delighted. I was concerned about how much they would hold since she's been known to soak through overnight pull-ups, but these were fantastic. She absolutely loved the feel of the fabric "underwear", saying they were soft and very comfortable. There were no leaking issues at all.My only complaint is that the pads are a bit challenging to get in and out of the holders. Not really sure what would be a good fix here, but it could use some improvement.

Well, I can't say this watch is beautiful, because I don't personally think that it is. But when my husband caught a glance, it made a good first impression. The look and feel of it, overall, it one of quality. It doesn't look like a $20 or $30 watch with a big price tag. It definitely gives the impression of something well crafted. The tension on the wrist band is pretty nice. Not too tight or too floppy. The water resistance is a critical because my husband works outside and quite often in the rain. So far, no issues at all with water getting in.

I had given up on hanging files years ago. Just absolutely frustrated and annoyed with the support frames that were constantly giving out, lifting off the drawers when I pulled the files and flopping all over the place. I went to a standing pocket file which also has its drawbacks. My husband, however, insisted on keeping our overflow files in a hanging system. Since I still needed to interact with said system again and again, I thought I would try this frame and I'm glad that I did. It is weighed enough to stand on it's own outside of a file cabinet or set down inside of it. It did go together pretty easily and doesn't wobble easily like the frames I've used in the past. If you're having the same issues, I definitely recommend trying this one.

I have a 7 year old daughter with a developmental issue. She still cannot get through the night without wetting her underwear. She is very sensitive and often has irritation, itching and discomfort with regular pull ups. When I brought these home, she was delighted. I was concerned about how much they would hold since she's been known to soak through overnight pull-ups, but these were fantastic. She absolutely loved the feel of the fabric "underwear", saying they were soft and very comfortable. There were no leaking issues at all.My only complaint is that the pads are a bit challenging to get in and out of the holders. Not really sure what would be a good fix here, but it could use some improvement.

This stuff works. I truly didn't believe that it did, but someone gave me a bottle for my tiny office bathroom. It is closet-sized, opens into a public hallway and has NO ventilation. I was hopeful, but a bit skeptical. No longer. Everyone at the office has assured me that it does the job amazingly well. Since there's no "evidence" otherwise, I am inclined to believe them, especially since my own experience agrees with theirs.

I am really enjoying this study. It is set up to be a group study, but works as an individual study, as well. There is a lot of depth to the subject of being "set apart" and some practical applications of how we do that. Most of the scripture passages for study are printed in the book itself, but there are suggested additional readings that you can look up yourself. You read a small passage then answer a few questions about each passage. And it covers some interesting parts of the O.T. that you are not likely to have studied elsewhere.In a culture where Christians are looking, acting and sounding more and more like the rest of the world, the subject of being "set apart" is highly relevant. It's harder than ever to be "in the world but not of it" in my opinion. The culture shift just in my 40 year lifetime has been profound.This is just a study of a different flavor. When so many subjects have been addressed to the point of overkill, being holy is one that I think we need to take a closer look at.

I was skeptical when my Dr. asked me to try this supplement. I had tried similar ones in the past that did not contain MSM and really didn't notice any difference. With this blend, I really do. I still have to take a small amount of pain meds for some mild arthritis, but after just 2 weeks I can tell a difference in the pain and swelling. If you've never tried this combination before, I would encourage you to do so. This is a reasonably priced brand, so it's not a great loss if it doesn't work for you. But you may be pleasantly surprised, as I was.

These doll is absolutely exquisite. The box and graphics make an impressive presentation. The accessories included have a great amount of decorative details. The clothing is well stitched, not basted. And she seems to be constructed to last for quite some time (can't say the same of some other dolls we've purchased recently from "Ever After" which fell apart the first day). Most of the dolls we have gotten from other brands cannot be posed, or only move one or two ways with visible joints. These are exceptionally well done.

I have always wanted to make soaps. Hadn't thought of including young kids in the process. And I hadn't thought of using my microwave as a means to do so. I was under the impression that we would need an entirely separate set of cooking utensils and pans to do the melting, mixing and setting. Not wanting to front the money for all those supplies, I never tried. This soap set is just perfect. It was a fun way to start without buying loads of "stuff" and it is child-friendly and fast processing. We are both delighted. Will definitely be trying again, and probably getting some to use as gifts.

This is just adorable. My kids have had many shape sorters before, but this is the first one I've seen that will fold up to transport easily in the diaper bag. That is a wonderful feature when taking baby to the Drs. office, grandparents or store. It doesn't take up much space in the diaper bag and gives him/her something to do. And it's just plain cute.

My only previous experience with baby washclothes were those tiny little half-tissue sized things from Gerber. They were super-soft, so we tolerated them for baby's comfort. But saw these and wanted to know if they would be better. They are MUCH better and for little more money than the ultra-thin rags we used on our own kids.These actually look like a quality wash cloth with a super-soft texture, vivid color and size reasonable enough to wrap around baby's limbs or belly while washing. Wish I'd known about these several years ago.They would also be excellent for seniors or people with very sensitive skin since the size is closer to that of a standard wash cloth.

This is probably the most user-friendly and cost effective high chair I've ever seen. The dishwasher friendly tray is wonderful. From experience, I know that washing those things in the kitchen sink usually results in water being sprayed all over the counters.The seat is comfortable and nicely padded with a full harness system for holding the youngest eaters who cannot hold themselves up for long.The wheels make it really nice to pull to the table for feeding when the chair is out of range (but baby will eventually push away from the table with their feet, so you have to keep the feet turned away from the table itself).The wide base is nice and sturdy. It doesn't feel like it could tip at any moment (like one I had).The ability to convert this to a chair booster and high chair simultaneously is just awesome. No need to have 2 accessories in the same kitchen.The colors and neutral, mocha-like. More contemporary to an adult decor rather than looking like a giant child toy in your kitchen.It doesn't fold up as small as some others we've used, but that's a very small gripe. Not even an issue if you have a place in the kitchen large enough to store it upright.

This doll is absolutely gorgeous. The box and graphics make an impressive presentation. The accessories included have a great amount of decorative details. The clothing is well stitched, not basted. And she seems to be constructed to last for quite some time (can't say the same of some other dolls we've purchased recently from "Ever After" which fell apart the first day). Most of the dolls we have gotten from other brands cannot be posed, or only move one or two ways with visible joints. These are exceptionally well done.

This doll is absolutely gorgeous. The box and graphics make an impressive presentation. The accessories included have a great amount of decorative details. The clothing is well stitched, not basted. And she seems to be constructed to last for quite some time (can't say the same of some other dolls we've purchased recently from "Ever After" which fell apart the first day). Most of the dolls we have gotten from other brands cannot be posed, or only move one or two ways with visible joints. These are exceptionally well done.

We are consistently pleased with the quality of fabric and construction from Wrangler brand. First, in jeans and now in dress pants and casual wear, as well. These are no exception. The fit seems to be true to size compared to other brands with the same size label. The seams lay flat and the stitching is good. No gaps, loops or strings hanging off. Will definitely order again.

I got the mobile tonight.  I love it!  It's easy to put together and take apart.  I love the idea of the soother being able to be separate  from the arm.  The mobile only lasts about 5 months, so the separation of the soother from it allows it to be used a lot longer.  The mobile/animal hanger part can be removed and put on a stroller, ensure longer use if the child still likes it and/or, can be transferred back and forth between the mobile and stroller.  There are 3 options of sounds:  White noise, music, and county sounds, such as crickets.  There are 2 levels of volume for these.  There's a remote that comes with it. The remote changes the song and turns the mobile back on.  The downfall is that it doesn't turn it off.  The machine will automatically turn off after a few hours, it says.  Also, I'm not sure of the point of being able to change the lullaby, unless the infant gets calm to one particular song.  As far as hooking it to the crib, I feel it's top heavy and leans forward too much. It's held on by a rubber strap.  I tried tightening it as much as I could, but it's still unstable.  It leans forward and if you accidentally bump it, it moves a great deal.  I'm tempted to just put the soother on the bookshelf and not use it as a mobile.  I will have Jason try tightening it and see what he thinks tomorrow.  Overall, if we can get it tightened and more sturdy, I'd give it 5 stars.  If not, 4.  It's a great idea, they just need to come up with a better system to latch it onto the crib.

This book has been a God send. I have a husband who is mild-mannered, has a gentle spirit and doesn't fit the masculine Hollywood stereo type. To make matters worse, he works in a prison where he is constantly insulted, questioned about his sexuality and has wondered, "What's wrong with me?" Naturally, as his wife, I tried to assure him that what was "wrong" is our society, not him. But one person's assurance only goes so far.I requested this book for him. I cannot say anything specifically about the content, but I can say this... He is not much of a reader, but this book has been moving around with him. He even took it on vacation. And I'm hearing a difference in the way he perceives himself. It seems like the author's perspective has helped to reassure him that Christ-like masculinity is not the same as movie-masculinity. And just as much as women have struggled for not feeling like super models, men seem to struggle with knowing whether they are "manly" enough. The push of feminism has certainly not helped that. Men are treated as inferior in so many scenarios. I am grateful that someone tackled this issue. It's very timely.

I cannot attest to the story line or writing style, as I purchased this for my 9 year old who is not highly motivated to read on her own. There's nothing wrong with her abilities, she would just rather do almost anything than sit down and read a book. So imagine my surprise when she starting flipping through the pages and the next thing I knew she disappeared to her room to read. Later that day I asked her if she thought she would like th book and she told me she had read half of it already and told me the story line. I was pleased. You may be, too.

I love the extra depth of this skillet. It doesn't look like it so much in the picture, but in person, it is somewhere in depth between a deep skillet and a wok. Excellent. This is fantastic for a small stir-fry or a saucy main dish. The ceramic coat is reasonably good as a non-stick surface, but still very much needs a coat of cooking spray or light oil.It does seem to clean pretty easily, but I've not tried cooking meat bits onto it.I didn't think I would like the ceramics, but I am pleasantly surprised.

This game is fun. But it's not thoroughly engaging. The graphics and interactive aspect are really cool initially, but not enough the kids on the higher end of that age range will want to play again and again. There just isn't enough variety and changeability to hold their interest. If you have several kids who share the game, it's still worth the money to buy, if you have the console system already. However, if you are buying it for one, and they are on the upper range of that age recommendation, I doubt it will hold their interest for long. The games themselves are really cute, but I wouldn't pay almost $25 for this if only one child were going to be using it.

I'm pretty pleased with the thickness and quality of these pants. My husband doesn't like "light" or "summer weight" denim. He's pretty rough on his jeans and wants something sturdy and with thick fabric. These fit the bill. He also is pretty particular about fit, especially around the waist. These seem true to size compared to other brands boasting the same waist measurement.The blue really is "blue". Not a denim blue, but truly has a hint of vibrant blue. Not tacky, but not faded looking. Rich color.

I'm a little disappointed. This serves many purposes as far as portability, but I thought it could be charged and used on the go. Not so. It has to be plugged into a wall or USB port to function. My bad.Still a pretty cool device, though. Saves the hassle of toting around multiple plugs, cords and chargers when you take a quick trip.It's definitely a life saver in that respect. Try 3 kids, 2 laptops, 1 hotel room and a few Kindles. You get the picture.The ability to plug several devices in simultaneously is wonderful.Kudos, Belkin. Now, can we make it fully portable?

I have purchased several of these Vtech tables as gifts. The brand is more reasonably priced than the better-known baby company products such as Fisher Price, but the quality is the same. In some cases, I have noticed the Vtechs are easier to assemble. They are very user friendly for set-up and attaching the legs took only seconds. They still remove easily, as well. The toy is sturdy and does not tip easily, which is a concern when you have a little one putting their body weight on it. And the variety of toys built in is very nice. It allows for pushing, sliding, turning, and flipping. When baby isn't big enough to stand yet, you can lay the toy on the floor and let them play with the board sans legs, which is a nice feature.

This doll is absolutely gorgeous. The box and graphics make an impressive presentation. The accessories included have a great amount of decorative details. The clothing is well stitched, not basted. And she seems to be constructed to last for quite some time (can't say the same of some other dolls we've purchased recently from "Ever After" which fell apart the first day).

If you're kids are fascinated with "Brave" but aren't up to a REAL bow and arrow, this one is a really fun start. Kids love the noise it makes when the arrows are released. The fact that you don't have to reload after each launch just makes it that much more fun.Of course, the distance they say they shoot is a maximum with the right amount of pull and just the right everything. But it does go pretty far. The kids were pretty impressed overall. Aim isn't terribly accurate. This is definitely for "fun" shooting, not target practice. But it might be a good gateway toy to get your kids interested in real archery.

I love the light, non-greasy feeling moisture in this product. I have VERY sensitive skin (band aids leave me with welts) and this had no side effects at all. But the smell is VERY strong. I only put a tiny dot on my finger and the fragrance made my eyes start to water. That is a huge deterrent to me. Can't deal with strong smells. They generally give me a headache in a very short time.Sorry, Ahava. Not a returning customer.

I LOVE leap frog. We've been really pleased with the quality of their products, their customer service and even their free trial products. When we ordered free games to test and review, they included leap pads with them for testing. Their educational games are fun and engaging. All 3 of my kids, ages 5, 7 and 9 love them. Some more than others, but generally the interest lasts a few months and they're ready for something new. That's really not all that bad considering how frequently they abandon their Kindle downloads and go looking for new games.I am really glad that they can still enjoy the games without the cards and "pad" that come with this. Mostly because they are kids and kids lose stuff. I keep after them pretty regularly but it still happens daily. At least Leap Pad understands the nature of kids and doesn't make it a necessity to have the cards on hand. As a Mom who picks up said items all too often, I find their inclusion annoying. They do, however, include a cute little tin to try and keep the "map" type thing and cards together in one place. Nice try, Leap pad. They're still kids, though.

I LOVE leap frog. We've been really pleased with the quality of their products, their customer service and even their free trial products. When we ordered free games to test and review, they included leap pads with them for testing. Their educational games are fun and engaging. All 3 of my kids, ages 5, 7 and 9 love them. Some more than others, but generally the interest lasts a few months and they're ready for something new. That's really not all that bad considering how frequently they abandon their Kindle downloads and go looking for new games.I am really glad that they can still enjoy the games without the cards and "pad" that come with this. Mostly because they are kids and kids lose stuff. I keep after them pretty regularly but it still happens daily. At least Leap Pad understands the nature of kids and doesn't make it a necessity to have the cards on hand. As a Mom who picks up said items all too often, I find their inclusion annoying. They do, however, include a cute little tin to try and keep the "map" type thing and cards together in one place. Nice try, Leap pad. They're still kids, though.

I love that the cover is water proof and the latch opens and closes, easily. But I'm not impressed at all with the ring binder. My kids destroy these things way too quickly and this is not the most impressive quality that I've seen. They're not destructive kids, in general, but cheap binders are no match for impatient kids pushing hard on the open/close tabs repeatedly. If you're plunking down $15 for a school folder, you will certainly want it to last through the year, especially if it's fully loaded with paper and dividers. I don't see that happening with this particular product.

I'm a big fan of Avery label products. We've had good experiences with their office and craft lines. Especially when it comes to ease of use with their website templates. You have to access the internet to use the template if you want a perfect printing on your tags.  There are the occasions when the printer will mis-feed and you may end up with a sheet of wasted tags. Very frustrating when that happens. But a little practice will have you doing this smoothly. The final product is adorable and looks very professional for gift shop items or wedding favors.

I was a bit skeptical when I ordered these. I didn't believe they could actually be applied and reapplied, but they can. And they remove pretty nicely. If you write on them with a chalk marker, the ink won't smear off easily as it does with stick chalk. If you want at truly permanent result, you can write on them with a white pen marker. Both are available in the section of your store where you purchase craft paints and brushes.These look high quality and really add a classy touch to your gift. We mostly use them for labels on kitchen jars. It's a great way to clean up and recycle old peanut butter and jelly jars. Then dress it up with a chalk label.

These are very simple to use and add a really nice decorative flair to simple decor and gifts. We mostly use them for gift items such as home made cake mixes, gifts-in-a-jar and food baskets. It's a cute and inexpensive way to make labels for the items in the basket and add to the decor rather than using cheap freezer tape or some other "tacky" label.
This concealer is creamy and blends into the skin quick.  It's a neutral tone that woul work for many different skin tones though it has a yellow undertone.  Best of all it has a slight shimmer.

This duster cleans thoroughly.  I was especially impressed with how it cleaned my computer monitor and TV because it picked up all the dust unlike  when I use a wet towel or some kind of spray.  With water or spray I seem to be pushing the dust around and no matter how careful I am there are still patches of dust.  Also, the duster is much faster.  What I don't like is the necessity of buying replacement dust cloths.  It's easy to take off or replace the duster.  There are two prongs that go to almost the very tip of the duster so it's secure.

Wildflowers is soothing and mild.  It also washes off completely.  I have sensitive skin that tends to breakout and haven't been bothered with either issue with this soap.  I wasn't as impressed with the delivery system.  It's powder so you have to wet your hands, pour it into them and mix it so it lathers slightly and then apply it to your face.  Also, it's not easily clear how to open the bottle....you push the center piece back and forth to open and close it.  It has a mild smell that is not over powering and disappears as soon as you wash it off.

This to is thick and soft.  I'm not sure that justifies the higher cost but if you're having bathroom issues it would be comforting to have this product on hand.  Sheesh it's hard to talk about such a thing without implied double entendres.  To sum up this is a luxurious product with an accompanying price tag.

I'm at a loss about the usefulness of the product however if someone has severe breakouts with it's accompanying redness there could be a need for this salve,  I like the distribution mechanism where you twist the cap and a roller ball appears to smooth it on.  Per the directions you're meant to keep the tube in the fridge between uses whic seems inconvenient.

They taste oddly musky or smoky which I assume the hemp?  It's not so much an unpleasant taste as it is an unexpected one.  I was reminded of fig newtons.  They have 140 calories which was too much considering their taste.  Last was the high amount of fiber... Way too much for my system.
This is a neutral and very light shade.  It's texture is extremely silky so it glides on easily.  Since I have fair skin I've been using it more as contor than as a blush.
This moisturizer feels incredibly soothing on the skin but unfortunately I couldn't detect much alieviation of wrinkles.  It has a pleasant floral scent which was too heavy for my taste.

It goes on smoothly and doesnt have a strong smell.  It also lasts a reasonable length of time without chipping or cracking.  It seems thicker than most polishes.  The color I got was peach side babe which Im not too fond of.

This is a light weight oil that smoothes on easily though it takes some time for it to fully sink into your skin.  Im not a fan of the over flowery smell either.  I was hoping the smell would dissipate fairly quickly but that didnt happen.  What it does well is ease skin dryness.

I wasnt going to leave a review for this horrible product but since the manufacturer keeps sending me emails bugging me to do so I will.  It is not as depicted in their promotional information or the picture on this site.  Its shown as having a rigid, open loop in which you can place your leg and with the help of the flexible hand strap you can lift up your leg.  The problem is that there is no loop.  It came flattened in a box and at first I assumed it had been flattened for shipping purposes but no matter how I try to bend it into the rigid loop they advertise it will not bend in that way.  When I tried to use it what happens is after many gyrations and an inordinate investment of time I can manage to get most of my foot into the ultra skinny flat opening but then when I try and lift my leg with the device my foot slips out either completely or Im barely able to hold at least my big toe in the loop as I try and lift the leg.  This is painful and dangerous.  This is a useless product and a waste of money.

I was skeptical about applying this moisturizer to wet skin but it was amazingly effective when used in that way.  The first thing I noticed is the all but overwhelming.  Though I'm sure it's supposed to be the scent of monoi but to me it smelled like magnolias.  Per the ingredient list it contains almond and coconut oil so maybe that's what created the odor.  The only other ingredients were lots of chemicals.  Despite usually finding such strong odors off putting I didn't in this case.  It also didn't give me a headache which often happens.

These are tiny earrings, maybe  by . The good news is they are sparkly because theyre diamond cut and have a securely closing snap closure, and because theyre 10K rather than 14K they are strong.  They could b good for someone who wants an easy unobtrusive everyday earring especially if the wearer is a tiny person or a child.  They come in a sturdy box wrapped in a plastic envelope and have a drawstring black presentation bag.  The current price of about $50 seems very high for this level of quality and size.
