This is one of the very few products that is virtually scentless making it easier for it to take on the smell of the essential oil of your choice.  It has a pop top for easy dispersal and the texture is wonderfully light and silky so it warms quickly in your hands.  There was no skin irritation with this soothing oil.  If scents irritate you this could be an ideal product for you.

This is the at least the third Five Star product Ive used and so far Im impressed with their quality.  This five subject notebook has five sturdy dividers in different colors all with clear storage pouches on either side.  It has an extra wide metal spiral at the spine which allows for easy opening and closing in addition the spiral is covered with a cloth like material.  Another notebook I have had extremely light printing on the lines but this one has easily visible lines.

Overall I found the taste of these bites pleasant.  Mostly they taste of nuts but there are bits of blueberry that pack a smaller bunch of flavor.  Im not sure if this is unique to me but there was a slight bitter aftertaste.  Theyre about the size and shape of an average scallop.  I liked how handy they were because of their handy grab and go size and packaging.  In the TMI category like most granola products just a few of these provide a distinct laxative effect.

This is the second Jami Attenburg book Ive read.  The other was The Middlesteins.  She has a unique style of blending lightness with seriousness.  Like Middlesteins the main character, Mazie, is a serious person who doesnt place undo weight to herself.  Mazie is rescued from a bad home situation by her older sister Rosie.  They live in Brooklyn and one of the best things about this book is how alive the Brooklyns street are.  Most of the action takes place during the 20s through 30s and Mazie watches people live through prosperity and giddiness through the harsh reality of the depression all from her ticket giver post outside her brother in laws theatre.  Shes literally in a cage but that doesnt stop her from trying to help those she meets.  Does Mazie forget to live her life with her obsession with others or is this very passion her lifes mission.or are both true?  Above all Mazie remains an everyman because shes so real and likable.

Loving Day is a timely book.  It deals with race, racism, and the sometimes amorphous definitions of both.  The main character is a cartoon illustrator whos the product of a black woman and an Irish man so hes very light and often not recognized as being African American though thats the identity he internalizes.  The story is about his losses but also some surprise additions that bring challenges to his life.  Along the way he falls in with a group of people with ambiguous heritage similar to his own and his journey of redefining himself begins.I know this all sounds like it could be volatile but at heart this is a sweet coming of age story.  Its never too late to grow up and become mature or at least more mature.

This lamp comes in lots of pieces which I at first found daunting but the directions were clear so I had it together in no time.  I had trouble stabilizing the bulb part but after a check of the directions learned where a knob was located and was able to direct the light as needed.  It comes with a non-glare light bulb thats easy on the eyes.  Its a stark black shiny color and the base is surprisingly heavyId estimate about 10 lbsso there are no worries about tipping it over even though it looks like the height might impinge on stability.

I have to admit Ive mostly been using these gloves with my microwave, my toaster oven, and my George Forman grill rather than using them outdoors.  When I first opened the package the first thing I thought was how huge they looked however when I tried them on they fit very well though I have large hands for a woman and often feel most comfortable in mens small or even medium size gloves.  One of the best features about this product is that its covered almost completely with raised almost heart shaped ridges that aids in gripping things.  Since theyre 100% plastic its easy to clean them.  I felt almost no heat when handling hot foods or plates.  As with most such gloves dont expect to be able to do any fine handling of food because the ridges make them awkward.

I'm conflicted about this juicer.  On the plus side it works well however there are five large pieces that need to be washed after each day's use and that doesn't include the spout which I would like to wash but can't figure out how or if it detaches.  It also takes up a lot of table top space which is a big negative in my galley kitchen.  Also, there are only two blending speeds however they do work sufficiently well to blend most things.  The directions are clear and are in both English and Spanish.

It has a padded back for comfort.  Its lightweight.  Its complicated.  There are instructions on how to unfold it and use it in multiple ways and the instructions are necessary because theres nothing intuitive about this backpack which is what I find lacking.  Apparently theres a way to to strap your smartphone (assuming you have such a thing) into a velcro compartment and let it record something for some reason.  Why not just hike and enjoy the scenery?  This backpack would probably appeal to the younger crowd rather than people who enjoy hiking for the enjoyment of itpeople who tend to leave their devices at home or bring them just for safety reasons.

IIts a pretty orange color that makes it stand out in your purse for easy access.  There are two separate zip compartments, one thats open and the other has 8 fan out credit card holders plus two additional holders that are attached to either side of the opening.  Its nice to feel more secure about protecting my credit card info.Thank you to the manufacturer for providing a sample.

They have a nice metallic gold color that will go with many decors.  Its a great idea to have them soft sided and foldable which makes it easier to tote them and to move offices or office configuration.  Another nice feature is the clear clip that allows the user to attach the pieces together.  My biggest hesitancy is that the material seems like it would attract a lot of dirt which might be hard to clean since theyre a cloth like consistency.  I suppose you could use scotch tape to dab the accumulated bits and pieces.

"The Cartel" is intense. it's not your average thriller or crime drama though it has elements of both those genres. A long time FBI officer is called back into the Mexican drug scene to hunt down an old enemy. He reluctantly answers the call and then becomes sucked right back in to all the duplicitous action that surround drugs.The book is probably too long but it provides so much information given in such an interesting way that that's easily forgiven.

Ive never been fascinated by pirates but after reading Kurson Pirate Hunters thats changed.  I am interested in history and Kurson brings lots of that alive in Pirate Hunters specifically the history of the golden age of Piracy in the 17th century around Hispaniola (now known as Santo Domingo).  At that time it was a Spanish colony but the French and English were there in abundance as well for the lucrative trade opportunities.  And where lots are goods are being moved youll find those who want to exploit the situation for their personal gainenter the Pirates.  Bannister, the English pirate at the center of this book, was an unlikely villain.  Hed been a loyal English merchant sailor for all his life.  His motivations and his background make history come alive as does the modern day search for his sunken ship Golden Fleece and its treasure trove of history.Pirate Hunters is also the story of two men whod been devoted to underwater diving for most of their lives.  Matera and Chatterton were relentless in their search for Golden Fleece.  The story rocks back and forth from their personal stories, their professional backgrounds, a paper chase in many of the worlds legendary libraries, and their love of diving.This short book is over way too soon.  The only negative about it is how tiny the maps are.  Its all but impossible to read them.

I wasnt sure what to expect with the biography about the legendary pimp Robert Beck.  On the surface it would look like our world views, his and mine, would have no meeting place.  Wrong.  Beck lived in many of the key cities in the 30s through the all important for counter culture 70s when black Hollywoods exploitation was at its peak; Chicago, Cleveland, Detroit, Los Angeles.  These cities were abuzz with racial unrest.During these times but most importantly during his childhood he grew up in the only sections of town designated for African-Americans to live as dictated by white society.  As he looked around Beck saw that it was the pimps who always seemed to have money and status so that is the profession he decided to study and pursue.  For obvious reasons that career choice didnt work out so well but along the way he began to reflect and write about his experiences on the streets.  The pimp tradition included the pimps gathering on corners and talking smack about one another in rhythm and rhyme.  Through his writing this tradition became the key to Slims fame.  The pimp toasts led to our current day rapping.  An art form is born.  Robert Beck is a tragic but interesting writer and so is his life.

The End of Tsarist Russia is an extremely well written textbook though I doubt that students are Lievens key audience.  I came to this book almost completely ignorant of this time and place when Nicholoas and his heirs lost their lives and rule.Lieven makes clear many of the issues that led to World War I  while still retaining the complexities of the alliances in place between the various countries during that era.  He doesnt dumb it down for a mass audience.  This can be a rewarding read if youre willing to spend the time and intense concentration it requires.  I resorted to some of my ancient student study cheats to help make sense of the readingtechniques such as reading the beginning and ending of each chapter to get an overview, going back to read for key concepts and finally reading in-depth with pencil in hand.  It was worth the effort in my opinion.

This is an inspiring story about the first New York policeman.  Browne outlines his past and his family's past which helps to understand the values and strength that helped him succeed.  Along the way of course you'll read about the social and civil environment that makes Battle's rise even more amazing.

This is a lovely coffee table type book.  The lush pictures depict many different styles though most seem more ideal for warm temperatures.  When I see such rooms I cant imagine myself living in such environmentscant imagine putting my feet up on the coffee table or setting a glass down on a table for fear of marring the effect.  Its even difficult trying to be inspired by the looks but Im sure most people wont feel that way.

Before I even opened the outer box I could smell cherries. The pyramid type tea bags come wrapped in a drawstring cheesecloth bag in an inner sealed plastic bag. Only three ingredients are listed; organic green tea, rose petals, and natural flavors. Like most herbal teas the the color remains light while it steeps. The taste is light as well but slightly sweet so you probably won't need to add sugar though a drop or two of honey enhances the taste.

Driving Hungry is fun.  Its an engaging biography vaguely wrapped around food.  The best parts of the book focus on the exotic locations Mosler lives in such as Argentina, Berlin, and New York.  Even though I havent been to any of these cities it sure seems like she highlights some of the most lovable and sometimes unlovable parts of each one often as seen through the eyes of each locations cab drivers.  Cabbies can have a unique take on locals because they become so familiar with the area and its citizens and sometimes its cuisine.  Diving Hungry is also a love story of sorts along with its inevitable heartbreak.  I was expecting much more food information and though there is some its not the central part of the book.  Mosler is an engaging and likable writer.  This is a page turner.

After seeing former CIA Deputy Director and Author Michael Morell speak on a news show I sought out his book though with some reservations.  I worried it would be too overtly political, too technical or just plain boring.  None of my fears turned out to be valid.  The writing is amazing; very clear and engaging and most important Morell always brings the individuals personality and character to the forefront which makes their motivations clear and no matter how unsympathetic human.Obviously this is not a book that will help its readers sleep well at night other than to know there are some very capable people standing between America and some #(!* scary folks.  One of the most instructive chapters was toward the end where Morell provides a mock (but true) terrorist assessment similar to what he and his cohorts give to the President.  It helped me gain a handle on whom and what we are dealing with.  Im sure Morell is a skilled writer on his own but I have a feeling his co-author, Bill Harlow, provided some excellent input because the book reads like an all too real thriller.

Ive never tried fondant before so I was excited to try this but Im lost.  It came in two big hunks of whiteness.  It was difficult to roll out.  I see that others have said it tasted of marshmallow but to me it was fairly tasteless other than being vaguely sweetthere was certainly no vanilla taste to it.  It didnt adhere to the cake I made and when I tried to cut the cake it smashed the dough.  Per the directions there was no need to microwave it but I should probably have tried that since rolling it was very difficult and time consuming.  The texture was stretchy.

From a short distance these square shaped earrings with a brilliant cut center stone surrounded by tiny brilliants could easily pass for real diamonds.  They measure just shy of 10 centimeters.  They have a butterfly closing on a post that did not irritate my ears (though I seldom react to any metals).  The white gold plating is believable.Thank you to the manufacturer for providing a sample.

There is a five centimeter zirconia on the post and two curved bands with a pearl drop at the base.  The largest pearl is ten centimeters and the smallest is seven centimeters.  Theres some motion from the drops but not a lot.  The only negative is the color of the yellow gold looks brassy in my opinion.  They have a comfortable butterfly closing on a post that did not irritate my ears (though I seldom react to any metals).Thank you to the manufacturer for providing a sample.

If you want to make a statement these 10 centimeter single stone stud earrings should accomplish that.  From the base they have a profile measuring about 5 centimeters off the ear.  They have a butterfly closing on a post that did not irritate my ears (though I seldom react to any metals).  The yellow gold color looks brassy to me but since you really only see the four securing pieces thats not a real issue.  They come in a velvet like box that would be ideal for gift giving.Thank you to the manufacturer for providing a sample.

As the title implies many of these stories are about music or war and the ones that combine both topics are often the best.  Makkai also writes about the art world, movie production, and literature.  Flash Fiction is included as well as a more traditional straight forward short story format.  One story is told entirely in the present tense and another in snippets of what appears to be an interview or interrogation but lacking both sides of the conversation.The action takes place alternately in the US and the Baltic States with Czechoslovakia, Romania, and Hungary being represented.  Makkais is an inventive voice and the story arcs rarely end up where the reader expects but they never fail to fascinate.

These are cute cartoon themed placemats that are microthin yet feel sturdy and stay put wherever theyre placed.  Im using them under pet food dishes and their thinness helps prevent tripping over them.  They measure 11.75 x 17.75 and are easy to wipe clean with a damp cloth or paper towel.  They come in a pack of four.  Now could someone please explain to me what a cartoon minion is??

I like the white polka dot and turquoise background color of this backpack.  Its not heavy but feels strong.  It measures about 11 across by 15.5 and has a large 7.5 by 9.5 zip compartment on the front.  It has 2.5 cushioned back straps and a black hook type carry strap at the top for easy totting.  On either side are slots to slip in smaller items.  The large side to side zipper has a flap of cloth covering it so even if you get caught in the rain your belongings will be protected.Thank you to the manufacturer for providing a sample.

I really wish book jacket blurbs would not compare books to other books or authors or at least not make unwarranted hyperbole.  Innocence is touted as Chandler-esque.  I didnt see it.  The writing is not similar to Chandler at all other than seeing lots of people in a negative light.  In Innocence all the characters are flawed.  The action in set in post World War II Czechoslovakia so theyre all influenced by the Soviets worldview and no one feels free to be honest about who they are and what they want out of life.  Of course most of their desires are dark indeed.When two murders occur in and around a local movie theatre everyone tries to cover their behind even if theyre not guilty.  Maybe I should say not guilty of murder because they all have secrets better left hiddensex with underage people, husband on death row for crossing the communists, affairs with married men, and those are just some of the highlights.  Innocence is a dark tale darkly told.  What Kovaly does best is delve into the dark side of people and their motivations especially when surrounded by a repressive government regime.

These yellow plated earrings drop about one inch and have an elongated eight centimeter pearl at the bottom.  They also have tiny zirconias that crown the pearl and a marquise shaped, gold enclosed stud attached to the post.  There is no movement to these earrings.  The only negative is the color of the yellow gold looks brassy in my opinion.  They have a comfortable butterfly closing on a post that did not irritate my ears (though I seldom react to any metals).  These would look great for evening.Thank you to the manufacturer for providing a sample.

From a short distance these square shaped earrings with a brilliant cut center stone surrounded by tiny brilliants could easily pass for real diamonds.  They measure just shy of 10 centimeters.  They have a butterfly closing on a post that did not irritate my ears (though I seldom react to any metals).  The white gold plating is believable.Thank you to the manufacturer for providing a sample.

I love earrings with motion so these are great.  The drop is about 1.5 inches with an eight centimeter pearls and a series of slightly graduated zirconias.  They have a comfortable butterfly closing on a post that did not irritate my ears (though I seldom react to any metals).Thank you to the manufacturer for providing a sample.

The first thing I noticed about Beneleaf eye gel is the smell.  Its a subdued scent of freshly mown grass and it fades as soon as you apply it so it wont interfere with your perfume.  It disperses easily from the pump bottle and feels cool as you apply it under your eyes.  It blends in quickly and leaves no residue so it wont interfere with applying makeup.  Ive had trouble with other eye gels that make my eyes water but not with Beneleaf.Helps with under eye puffiness but I didnt notice any huge difference in under eye wrinkles though it does smooth them somewhat.  Also the pump puts out more than Id like to use unless Im hyper careful to press lightly.  Its made in the US which gets huge points for me.Thanks to the manufacturer for providing a sample.

FACTS:*Produced in the Philippines*No sugar added*Only ingredient is Organic Coconut Water*40 calories per 8 oz serving (soft sided bottle contains 16.9 oz)*Says its a good source of potassium and other electrolytesPersonal Impression:I didnt love the taste.  Because its unsweetened its bland with a vague taste and but no smell of coconuts.  It wasnt distasteful but its not a flavor Id seek out though I love coconut anything.  It has a resalable twist off cap.  It doesnt say to keep in refrigerated after opening but that would seem the wise thing to do.  Its use by date is shown as about seven months after I received it.

Alexander Rose goes through three key battles in American history, Bunker Hill, Gettysburg, and Iwo Jima, explaining the specific characteristics of each one.  Its an impressive effort.  He does a good job with the details about Bunker Hill and Gettysburg it becomes belabored however with Iwo Jima his writing is inspired.  I read the first 50 pages or so of the earlier battles and became bored so I moved on to the next battle.  I couldnt stop reading when I hit the World War II section, the details are fascinating, the pacing is good.  He explains how, at least by 1944 and 1945, the men felt they were there to do a job like any other job with the reward of going home in one piece or mostly one piece as their reward.  Prior to this time the military had a lot of career military men and hyper patriotic types reacting to the outrage of Pearl Harbor.  Neither is better or worsejust a different outlook and motivationIn all three war zones the men were innovative and learned to change tactics depending on their enemys actions and the terrain they fought on but at Iwo they were inspired probably because they were so often cut off from command and had to independently improvise.  Also, the mortality rate was s quick and high that they had to continually incorporate new soldiers which also led to changes in tactics.  Unlike the earlier battles there was a racial component to the war with Japan and Rose addresses that.  I forced myself to go back and finish the Bunker Hill and Gettysburg sections but they didnt sing for me.  Id give those sections three stars and the one on Iwo five stars.  That section alone is well worth the price of the book.

These earrings remind me of the ones the woman wears in Vermeers famous painting The Woman with Pearl Earrings.  They have a drop of about 1 1/8 and the circumference of the imitation pearl is 10 centimeters.  They have a plastic stopper backing to hold them in place.  They are comfortable to wear and the metal didnt cause any allergic reaction for me though I seldom suffer from that type of irritation.  This is a silhouette that I love.Thank you to the manufacturer for providing a sample.

There are two main reasons I like these bags.1)  Theyre heavy duty2) The zip is strong and really holds food in and theres no guess work about knowing theyre truly sealed as opposed to the notched type closure bags.  No matter how careful you are to get them sealed you can still have surprise messes or spoiled food.  The zip prevents this.I know theyre more expensive than some other bags but when you factor in how much food you wind up throwing out when its not been stored correctly when using other bags these make sense.

This is not a balanced account but thats fair.  The author is entitled to her beliefs and world view.  Elliott carefully goes through the serial killer Michael Rosss life and his crimes as well as his mental state and capacity.  She also retells as much as is known about the crime committed on each of his many victims.  This part of the book is excruciating to read however I respect that she did it.  Each victim deserves to be accounted for along with their fear, and often their rape and murder.  Strangely this is not the most painful part of the story. For me I was more offended with all the empathy she wastes on Ross.  To be fair she also gives the victims families and others associated with Ross equal empathy.Elliotts writing is clear and articulate and sheds light on some of the intricacies of our judicial system as well as Rosss psychopathology  As much as I disagree with Elliotts stance I feel I came away from her book more enlightened.  The Man in the Monster is a horrible subject told well.

Its fairly easy and intuitive to put together though the instructions are helpful if you get stuck.  Its surprisingly light weight.  Its made up of one long twist screw rod, three non-moveable rods, and one smaller non-moveable rod which is included in case you have an extra tall ceiling.  The rods fit into one another and the baskets with their infinitely adjustable screws are easy to install and move around depending on your showers lay out.  One nice feature is the two add on pieces that fit onto the baskets that can be used to secure razors.After initially putting all the parts together I found it awkward to move it to my shower and to get the twist section at the right height to make it stand up securely.

I love the packaging for Euphoria.  Its in a space age type bottle and the contents are lavender.  The bottle is indented on both sides providing a handy place for your thumbs to hold on to.  I often get serious headaches from scents but that was not the case with Euphoria.  I cant say I love the overly sweet smell however.  Its not overpowering but even a little spritz lasts a long time.

The Governors Wife is charming in part because it has such a retro feel though its set in current day Chicago, IL.  If cell phones and computer research and use werent included in the plot it would easily be possible to imagine that the action takes place in the 30s or 40s.  Michael Kelly is an ex-cop turned PI and its impossible not to equate his worldview with Chandlers Philip Marlowe.  Hes pessimistic.  Kelly is more erudite with his love of ancient Greek literature and how it informs him about his cases but is environment and the corruption he finds in the big city are similar to what Marlowe encounters.  Sadly its all believable.Uncovering the characters motivations is the key to the plot and the psychological underpinnings lead to a surprisingly satisfying conclusion.  Im not sure how Harvey did this in less than 250 pages but he did and he did it well though darkly.

The Forever Bridge is a story about how people deal with the unthinkable.  In an instant lives can change and they do in this book and not for the betterat least not initially.  This isnt a comfortable read but its uplifting.  Its also probably not a good Mothers Day Gift type book.  Greenwood is a moving author but not one who makes their readers feel at peace.  The hardest part is reading about what the kids go through.

Leaving Before the Rains is a roller coaster of a memoir.  Alexandra Fuller was born and lived most of her early life in southern Africathrough civil war and harsh, unpredictable weather on an isolated farm with an eccentric hard drinking sanity challenged and challenging family.  Then she married and moved to the US with her risk taking outdoorsman husband Charlie and things calmed down and got even crazier.I loved the tone of Fullers book.  Its irreverent and frank in a stark way.  She doesnt hold back and I found myself crying through sympathetic tears.  Her style is breezy even when shes describing some pretty horrendous experiences.  Im used to reading accounts of Africa that focus on the beauty of the scenery and the wildlife and she includes that but she also talks about rabid dogs, big cats and hippos and elephants that can attack out of nowhere if you startle them.  The river currents and their beautiful falls can also be deadly even if you know what youre doing as Charlie did.  When she moved to Idaho she was confounded how alone yet not alone she was.  In Africa there was little and sometimes no accessible emergency infrastructure.  You and your family had to deal with emergencies on your own at least until you can find your way into a city and diseases such as yellow fever and malaria are ubiquitous.  Strangely though emergency services in the States were a phone call away and the care could be excellent and affordable it wasnt always and emotionally, when tragedy strikes, you can still find yourself alone.  Fullers story is sad and glorious and revealing.

I dont love the color or pattern of this curtain or mat but thats a matter of taste.  The curtain is a nice blend of cloth like material and plastic and it has strong, well reinforced hook holes.  The hooks themselves are adorable.  They are a coordinating pink and button like in appearance.  They too seem strong and balanced enough to hold the curtain firmly in place.The bath mat is another matter.  Again the pink/fuchsia color is unpleasantly bright and it is flimsy without a strong backing that would have helped hold it in place on potentially slick bath tiles.  Its also not very large at 23 x 16.  At about $30 this set could be a good starter set for dorm rooms or someones first apartment.

The best thing about this shower caddy is that it is completely flexible and folds up easily.  The worst thing about this shower caddy is that its flexible and folds up easily.  Its easy to pack, light weight, unfolds quickly, and holds a lot.  The tricky part is getting all your bath accessories balanced so it doesnt tip over but thats not a huge issue.  There are three pouches on both sides and two larger ones at either end and a large compartment in the center.  The black and white color is pretty and since its made of loose mesh* it sheds water quickly and dries thoroughly no matter how wet it gets.  Im more familiar with the hard plastic caddies with a handle at the center but for portability this one has hard plastic beat all ta heck because its so light and easy to pack.*The mesh is loose enough to allow quick drying but fine enough that a razor and a toothbrush wont fall through it.

Gates characters are often New England academics, creative folk, intellectuals or intellectual wannabes.  Hopefully that wont be off putting to some because they are very real and almost uncomfortably honest in displaying their foibles, there are drugs and drinking and hard blue grass guitar strumming.Gates was a former Newsweek staffer were he wrote about music and books so most of his stories have multiple references to literature and classical, jazz, and bluegrass music which I found enjoyable though probably too many of the references only brought vague recognition for me.  Another theme Gates hits hard is dysfunctional or flat out unworkable relationships.  The good news is he doesnt leave his readers with a sense of despair because his insights have depth and hope no matter how broken or lonely his characters are.  His male characters were more effecting than his female ones.  I found myself enjoying his writing almost despite myself.  If you begin to wonder why some of his stories give you a sense of dj vu its probably because theyve previously appeared in literary journals.

For some reason I keep returning to World War II in my reading life.  I want to know the why of it, how it could have happened.  Hitlers Germany seems almost too horrible to be true.  I suppose my World War II addiction is a way of avoiding the nightly news and the daily fresh news it brings with the slight comfort of knowing that World War II happened so long ago.  When I read about Shepards new book I determined I wouldnt spend the time to read it yet in the end I did.  Im glad I did.Its the fictional account of some real life people.  Janusz Korczak was a Jewish doctor living in Warsaw Poland when the Germans marched in and forced all the Jews into a policed ghetto.  Aron was one of the orphaned children Korczak rescued.  I know this sounds grim and of course it is however a large part of the book, which is told from Arons point of view, focuses on how he and his resourceful friends became smugglers in an effort to feed their families.  Theres lots of wry humor that accompanies horror but this is what their lives have become as things daily become more desperate in a way thats not immediately apparent.  Less food, families and strangers forced into overcrowded apartments, disease, lice, people disappearing never to be heard from again, etc.  Yet Korczak keeps begging his fellow captives for money and food in order to keep his orphanage afloat and they give it.  To help with this he organizes and puts on plays starring the children as a means to lighten peoples lives and let them know his kids still need help.  Shepard writes with a touch of humor which actually makes their nightmare situation more real.  It doesnt matter how many accounts of World War II youve read.  Youll still want to read The Book of Aron.

Margaret of Anjou was French and married to Henry VI who was the contemporary King of England.  She was also the mother to a child, Edward, who she hoped would someday secede his father.  The problem was that Henry VI was ill and lay in a coma like state while Richard of York ruled.  Henrys Lancaster clan was symbolized by a red rose and Richards clan by a white rose.  Iggulden writes and interesting and often exciting tale.  Though lots of the action takes place on the battlefield I was afraid Id be bored but he writes a detailed account of war with lots of buildup and back story.  Hes also surprisingly neutral which gives the action veracity.  Iggulden includes several pages outlining the historical goings on and where he consolidates events he explains how and why.  Dont be surprised that the subtitle Margaret of Anjou doesnt fully describe what you can expect to read in this book.  Women werent the main players during this period and Margaret, though an interesting player is not central to the action.

Although theres an instruction guide in both Spanish and English this heater works very intuitively.  I like the fun lime green/Kelly color.  (It also comes in blue.)  Its basically a plug and play set up.  There are two knobs on either side of the rounded rectangle box.  On the left as you face the unit is an infinity type thermostat gauge and on the right is the control knob where you can turn the heater off, put it on fan only (no heat, low heat or high heat.  Its the perfect height for warming your feet or you can put it on a higher surface to direct the heat elsewhere.  It does a good job of putting out warmth.

It has all the usual things weve come to expect from Lonely Planet travel guides such as great maps, highlights of the most sought after sights, brief histories, etc.  The downside is that there arent as many gorgeous pics as usual however thats remedied by over 1,000 pages of text that supply many tips and insights into travel in France.  When I fantasize about an ideal trip to France I think art museums, cheese and wine and thats all included.  Another thing that screams France to me is history and thats all here but Lonely Planet also talks about new architecture, thoughts, and the modern world which is eye opening.Lonely Planet guides are always good at giving a plethora of hotel and restaurant available in your chosen destination and France is no exception.  They include price info and amenity facts and often link you to a website address.  Most key areas have detail maps.  One feature I love is some key sights like the Louvre for instance has a museum map with details of what floor and where you can find key famous art works.  Are you looking to see the north rose window at Notre Dame?  Or the Hall of Mirrors at Versailles?  The Venus de Milo or Mona Lisa, or maybe Jim Morrisons grave at the Cimetiere du Pere Lachaise?  Lonely Planet provides maps to get you there.  Im also hearing on the news that the Dollar is  strong vs. the Euro so this might be an opportunity for travel dreamers!

This popcorn was some of the best of the microwave type that Ive ever tasted.  There was little artificial taste, no weird overly chemical butter overtones, etc.  It also had the least number of unpopped kernels; Id estimate less than 20.  Another great thing is that I didnt have many pieces that lodged in my teeth which is something I usually experience with microwave corn.

Im appalled.  Im appalled because The Professor in the Cage is written by a learned man who has a hankering to understand and participate in smacking another man around in the ring.  The problem is that anyone who is a man or knows men or boys knows that a lot of them want to and are proud of standing up for themselves and that means at times that theyre not overly concerned about whether they are hurt or hurt others.  The good news is Gottschall has done a good job of analyzing what makes men aggressive and why especially in his historic perspective.  The bad news is how depressing it is.  He posits that in the absence of women and children men resort to primitive one ups man ship.What is horrible to me personally is how violence is almost glorified.  Whats even worse is that I came to understand how some of this might be hardwired and almost even necessary.  Ive always admired geeks, the men who think first and then act.  Have such men always felt less than the guys who lead with their brain damaging fists?  Youd think that someone whos a professor would have no need to bare his knuckles.  I must be wrong.  According to Gottschall all men feel the need to defend at least themselves no matter what the cost if only to test and/or prove themselves.  I truly hope this is not the case but Gottschall makes a good case that this is the case.  Have fists, will travel either in the gym or the classroom or the boardroom.  The best part of The Professor in the Cage is the historic perspective and Gottschall's presentation and his thoughts on that.  This book challenged me and helped me gain understanding.

Ive tried to read Nemirovsky before but couldnt finish but Fires of Autumn was excellent.  It begins at the start of World War I and concludes with the Second World War.  Its about three interlocking families, the Jacquilins, the Bruns, and the Humberts.  All are lower middle class Parisians and live close together and visit often.  A child from each family grow up together but in adulthood their lives swerve in different directions while their families stay acquainted.  Bernard Jacquilin enthusiastically enlists at age 18.  Renee Humbert and Therese Brun become nurses though for different reasons.  Renees motivation is more social but Therese wants to feel useful as she awaits the return of her soldier husband.Nemirovsky gives readers a riveting account of the time, especially the 20s, yet her themes are universal.  Her themes are the importance and influence of family and background, the meaning of love or even the questioning whether it exists, and the devastation and personal cost of war.  I was very struck by what a generation who were involved in two major wars...potentially close to a decade of combat involvement or at home trying to exist while worrying desperately about loves ones at the front.  Fires is a short novel with a big impact... Im going to have to hunt down the other Nemirosky novels I previously abandoned and try again.

Ghost Fields is one of those books that you set aside any other book youre involved in.  One of the best things about Griffithss main character archeologist Ruth Galloway is the science.  Oddly this is probably one of the least science intensive in the series but that doesnt slow things down.  DNA links the ancient and current population to the local gentry; the Blackstocks.Griffiths keeps us guessing who the bad guys/girls are though youll probably guess long before the end of the book.  Her characters are so charming and idiosyncratic thats its difficult not to love them.  The main love story continues and the cute kid reads as real rather than overly sappy.  Ruth seems like someone you know or would like to know.  Hard to put down.  By the way if you havent read all the books in this series dont worry about picking up this most recent book.  You wont feel lost.

Swift returns to his perpetual themes of loss and what its like to be different.  Oddly one of my least favorite stories in the book is England but other than that there wasnt a clunker in the book.  Most are short and he gets to his point in very few pages.  Theres an undercurrent of emotion but its restrained which makes the tales more effective.  He comes to the point slowly but it has an impact.  Most of the narrators are male but are still universally relatable.Some of the stories are dark but the violence takes place offstage so to speak or its merely implied.  War and military men are featured as well and again the violence is hinted at though the impact on their loved ones emotion of their loss or potential loss or sometimes just physical or mental damage is explicit and heartbreaking.  Along with this comes perceived betrayal.  Did the widow already have an intimate relationship with her next husband before she loses her current beloved?  Has the soon to be single woman relieved when her soldier is killed at war?  Betrayal is usually just a blind with the theme of loss having the pride of place.  Swift is wonderful at capturing a childs viewpoint as well.  He isnt a cheerful writer but hes compelling.

These colorful pencils are fun though other than the tints theres nothing unusual about them.  To me they seem to write lighter than most other #2 leads.  Each pencil has two colors, one for the stem and another for the wood closest to the lead.  This can help you locate the pencils in a purse or backpack and also differentiate them from pencils your friends are using.

Some series are ok if read out of order.  The Skull Throne isnt one of those.  This is my first introduction to Bretts writing and while I feel he writes well I was lost despite the introductory material thats included at the beginning of the book.  Also, a book needs to be super interesting to support 700 pages of text.  Because I love the fantasy genre I kept reading hoping Skull would ignite but it never did.  The worst part was there wasnt a certain character that I felt connected to or concerned about.  Its a lot to ask a reader to stay with a story for 700 pages without including some compelling character or situation.

Like so many people Im in love with Morrisons writing.  What youre about to read is biased.  Morrisons style has changed in her last three books or so.  Shes gone from highly metaphorical to a more grounded, and some might say accessible, more mainstream, style*.  I like both approaches.  As always she writes about racism and how endemic it is and how grounded in economic reality it can be.  She always writes about family emotional ties and how those ties can transcend blood and race yet cant escape being tied in together.The main character is the daughter of a light skinned woman who panics when her child is born too dark.  In her mind she practices tough love in order to prepare Bride for the discrimination shell face in the world.  This is a blessing and a curse because it causes Bride to become creative in order to achieve in her career and find love.  Her name marks her as a blank slate in need of defining herself.  She finds heartbreak as well as love and success.  Ultimately, like most of us, she finds her place in the world and some happiness.  Bride moves from the perpetually standing on the cusp of fulfilling her dreams and living in partnership with others into engaging life in earnest.*I think Mercy is her last book in the older style.

I can't say enough about this soap. It lathers up beautifully and gets my skin clean and soft. In fact I was having some issues with dry itchy patches that have gotten much better since I switched to this soap. It has a nice, soft aroma that I love. I have also been using this on my daughter who has very sensitive skin and it works very well for her as well.Overall a great product.I recommend this to anyone looking for a soap that's good on sensitive skin.I received this to review. My opinions are my own.

This lice treatment works very well. My niece's children had lice and we have tried a few treatments on their beds and furniture. After using this the kids have stayed bug free! This spray is easy to use and goes a really long way. It even costs less than many pesticides used for lice control. It has almost a pleasant odor, which isn't at all chemically. I love that thjis is safe to use around kids and pets. Overall a great product.I recommend this to anyone who have kids that are high risk for lice like preschoolers.I received this to review. My opinions are my own.

These containers are great for taking my lunch to work. I can write on the tops and that way the lunch thief knows who he's stealing from. My food stays fresh and ready to heat up in these. The lids seal tightly to assure the food stays good. The plastic is actually pretty durable for a toss away container. I love that I can take these right from the fridge to the microwave. I find these are really easy to wash so I get a lot of uses out of them. Overall a top quality product.I received these to review. My opinions are my own.

These makeup brushes are high quality. The bristles don't fall out and feel great on my skin. The hold onto my powdered makeup nicely so it's easy to get the right amount where I want it. This set has everything I need to get my makeup done for a night on the town. The brushes are easy to hold onto and maneuver. The case looks great as well! Everything about these brushes screams quality! Overall a great product.I recommend those who are looking for a great set of makeup brushes.I received these to review. My opinions are my own.

These roll on bottles are great for mixing up my essential oils and using them while I am out. They are easy to label as well. I used sticker type labels that stayed in place nicely. I mixed up coconut oil with some lavender and use it at work when I'm getting stressed out. I just roll this across my wrist and just the right amount is let out. The bottles are very attractive as well. Overall a great product.I recommend this to anyone who uses essential oils.I received this to review. My opinions are my own.

This high quality ring was perfect for my husband. He loves to hunt and so camo is one of the few things he loves to wear. The ring is durable and well made. He hates gold and silver rings so something like this was perfect for him. I also have to admit I love the way it looks as well. Overall a cool product.I recommend this to hunters.I received this to review. My opinions are my own.

This speaker has awesome sound quality. I can't get over how great my music sounds when I use this. I love that I can move it from room to room with ease as I clean as well. It synced quickly to my phone and I haven't had any issues with it since I've been using it. The volume and other controls are a breeze to use. This speaker fills my room with high quality sound. Overall a top notch product.I recommend this to anyone looking for a great speaker to use with their devices.I received this to review. My opinions are mine and mine alone.

Having teenagers and having the skin of a teenager myself this kit has been great. I am easily able to remove blackheads and pimples with ease and with very little pain. In fact when I use this my face looks better within a day! The tools are easy to use and to clean. I use rubbing alcohol and also soap and water. These tools are easy to grip and don't slide around in my fingers. Overall a great kit.I recommend this to teens.I received this to review. My opinions are m,y own.

This charger works great. It's perfect for a large family like ours as we can plug multiple things in at once. Since we are a family always ont he move this is great. This plus in easily to our cigarette lighter in the car and comes out just as easy. Our cords fit perfectly and the evices charge quickly. Overall a great product.I recommend this to large families.I received this to review. My opinions are my own.

These bats were the perfect Halloween accessory. I decorated my van for trunk or treat and these hooked right onto the trunk of our van. They moved in the breeze and looks so cool. They actually have a fairly realistic look. The fact the squeak made them even neater!  Overalla  top quality product.I recommend these to anyone looking for a rubber bat or cool prop for a good scare!I received these to review. My opinions are my own.

I can not express how much I love this serum. I have been using it for a while now and have seen a dramatic difference in the coloration differences and the fine lines on my face. I have a more youthful appearance and my skin seems healthier. It goes on smoothly and leaves my skin feeling fresh. There isn't a hint of a sticky or oily film left on my skin. Overall a great product.I recommend this to the aging like myself.I received this to review. My opinions are my own.

These socks fit perfectly and the seams were barely noticeable. That's great for someone with sensory issues like myself. I love the designs and colors. They are so fashionable. I received this colander at a discount in exchange for sharing my experience with it, whether positive or negative, in a review. I've had another colander of the same size for over 20 years and thought it was time for a new one.One of the things that I liked about this one is that even though it's the same capacity as my old one, it is a little shallower. I find that easy to work with.The holes are pretty small so don't let pieces of whatever you're straining out easily. The handles and base seem very firmly attached and the metal is shiny. It looks very nice. The handles, being plastic, don't get hot.I was disappointed, though, that the handles don't appear to be rubber as advertised, or at least not what I think of as rubber. They seem like hard plastic. I think rubber would have been a little nicer to hold with wet hands. The hard plastic has some rough bumps in it -- they are small but the perfectionist in me is a little bugged by it. One of them, on the inside edge is rough enough that I think I will try to file it down.I should also mention that because it is fairly lightweight, it is easy to lift. The base is also a little taller than my previous colander, which gives it a little more room to drain into the sink.Overall I'm pretty pleased with this colander. If the handles had been a little better I would have rated it five stars.

I received this free, so that I could try it out and share my experience with it -- whether positive or negative -- in a review.I actually got it for a family member's house after discovering, after a shirt lost a button, that they didn't have needle and thread to sew it back on! That's just not right -- every house should have basic sewing supplies. So I was hoping this would be good quality and would give them a complete sewing kit so they can make small repairs in the future.I was pleased to see that the kit was very complete. It actually has everything they need, plus some. It sure beats those tiny little kits -- these are actual spools of thread, rather than a short length wound around a piece of cardboard like other kits I've owned. And there is a lot more included than with other kits I've seen -- there are 18 spools of thread in various colors, and even a crochet hook and knitting needle. There are many sizes of needles and a selection of large-headed pins (easy to hold onto). There are buttons and safety pins, tape measure, and a metal thimble -- and more.I am pleased with the quality of this set and felt really good about gifting this and my family member was overjoyed with it. She couldn't get over how much was included. Glad I took a chance on it.

I received a free set of lights to try out, so I could share my experience, whether positive or negative, in a review. I'd never seen lights like this and wasn't sure what to expect, but I decided to take a chance on them.I'm glad I did. All 8 are connected together in a string. and the lights travel up and down the length of each one, changing color as the go. They way they cascade is really mesmerizing. The colors are bright and saturated.My husband was impressed by them, too, and we have put them in our front window, where they can be seen from the street and really grab attention. (We've already begun decorating for the holidays! Though they are perfect for that, they are fun for any time of year and I expect to bring them out for other occasions during the year.)I also tried them gathered together like a bouquet in a vase and they were lovely like that too.Very glad I took a chance on these and I would really like to have more, to create a string which will span an even greater length.

I received free socks to try out so I could share my experience -- whether positive or negative -- with them in a review. I really needed some warm new socks and hoped these would fit well and be comfy.They succeeded on the first count. My feet are size 10 and these went on easy and fit very well. They could also fit a smaller foot -- or a larger one. They have the right amount of stretch.And, they are as comfy as I'd hoped. The wool / polyester / spandex blend is very comfortable and not at all itchy. They are thick enough -- but not bulky, just right.I got hte Wave" design. The colors are bright and I think they look wintery (but cheerful). We live in a cold place and these both look good and keep my feet warm! I'm glad I took a chance on them; they've met all my expectations and I would buy this brand again.

I received a free shaker to try out, so I could share my experience with it -- whether positive or negative -- in a review. I wasn't sure what to expect, as I hadn't heard of this company before. But I decided to take a chance because I needed a shaker of this type, and I was attracted to the design.When it arrived I was pleased to see that the colors are vibrant and the vintage-inspired graphics are cool.  It looks better in person than in the photo. And  no way does this go missing in the cupboard; it's big, bright and easy to spot.This shaker actually holds more than I need it to -- but that's certainly not a bad thing. It is a good weight, stainless steel -- thick enough to be very sturdy but not so thick that it gets to heavy with seasonings in it. The top twists smoothly on and off and the holes are a good size. It seems to have been thoughtfully designed and manufactured, and built to last.I am kind of a perfectionist and always cast a critical eye over the things I use and review -- and I always point out any issues I find and rate accordingly. I was pleasantly surprised by this shaker, though, and can't find anything not to like about it. It lived up to my expectations and I'm glad to have it for our own custom blend.

I received these mailers free to try out so I could share my experience in a review, whether positive or negative. I've been selling online for about 15 years now on various sites, including my own, so I go through a lot of shipping supplies and was curious to try these.I sell items made of fabric -- vintage fabrics and trims, and occasionally clothing or scarves. This type of mailer works well for those items because:-- It's light weight and doesn't add much in postage costs.-- It's plastic so it protects from moisture / rain / snow / postal carrier's coffee, etc.-- It closes securely so protects the contents from loss or damage.-- Adhesive mailing labels stick well to them.I also use these to give extra protection to items inside a box -- so in case, for example, the postal carrier leaves the package out in the rain or snow and the box gets wet, the contents inside will be protected.I'm pretty picky about the things I use in my business, but I can't find anything not to like about these. They lived up to all my expectations and I'm glad I took a chance on them.

I received a free set of these to try out so I could share my experience with them in a review, whether positive or negative. I wasn't sure what expect as I'd never used anything like this before and wasn't familiar with the company.The ones I received were a little darker in color than the photo here -- but that's perhaps just due to my monitor settings. The colors are still bright and very noticeable. That's good because if you use them on checked baggage, or even a carry-on, the color makes it easy to distinguish from other bags.The velcro is very strong and keeps the wrap fastened securely. I sew a little and always notice construction details on the sewn items I use -- these are well-made with straight seams and heavy-enough thread.I have tried these on a big duffel bag and also on a tote bag I use a lot with stiff plastic handles, which get uncomfortable when it's loaded. They worked well in both cases. The neoprene adds some cushioning, making them much more comfortable to hold than the bag's own handles.I always cast a critical eye over the items I use and review -- and point out any issues and rate accordingly -- but couldn't find anything not to like about these. My husband and I will continue to get a lot of use out of them on our various bags when we travel, whether just for a weekend trip or farther away. We're glad to have these and I am thinking of buying more for family members who travel more often than we do.

I received a free set of these to try out, and to share my experience -- whether positive or negative -- in a review. I wasn't sure what to expect, since I hadn't used this kind of pony tail holder before and wasn't familiar with the company.I first noticed that the colors were true to the photos. There are no seams -- the ends are secured inside a faceted bead which matches the color of the pony tail holder. Each holder is spiraled. My hair is pretty straight, and very long; most pony tail holders (and barrettes) slide out after a while.These are plenty wide -- I can wind one around my hair 4 times. Unlike most other pony tail holders I've used it stayed put really well -- probably because of the spiral; it's not just smooth like a plain band. That is a big plus for me. They also don't pull my hair when I'm taking them out.The colors are good -- the set I ordered had a few bright colors, plus black, dark blue, brown, and beige -- they coordinate with just about everything in my closet. I would like to have more in the brighter colors.I can't find anything not to like about these pony tail holders -- if I had to nitpick, I guess they could be a little shorter in length -- and am very glad to have found them.

I received this tweezers set at a deep discount to try out so I could share my experience with it, whether positive or negative, in a review. I wasn't familiar with this brand and wasn't sure what to expect.As it turns out, I'm glad I took the chance. The tweezers are very nice quality. The pointy ones are very sharp, as they should be. And the slant-tip ones -- the style I use every day -- are very precise. I was able to get both coarse and fine hairs with them. I need to pluck daily and find that these do a really good job. I found them easy to grasp, too.I would give them five stars, but I am deducting a star for the case. It is nicely designed. But the one I received was a little grubby. The white leather outside had grey smudges on it, and the white binding had black in it (maybe smudges from the black ink from the logo that's printed on the case?).So, it doesn't look great. But the zipper is good and the elastic that holds the tweezers in works well.Overall I'm pleased to have this set. I've used a lot of tweezers over the years, and these are some of the better ones I've owned.

I received a free flashlight to try out so I could share my experience with it, whether positive or negative, in a review. I wasn't sure what to expect from it. But we live in a windy place and we can count on the power going out several times during the fall and winter months.In addition to the power going out we like to do DIY projects where we often need some extra illumination.I found that this flashlight is good for both of these purposes. The small size makes it easy to slip in a pocket (or purse, or bag). It is very compact, and takes one rechargeable battery (which is included). A charger for the battery is also included. But if you don't want to use the rechargeable battery, you can use a AA battery instead. It's nice to have the option.Though the flashlight is small, it seems very solidly built, of metal -- aluminum -- not plastic. There is nothing flimsy about it.The light is very bright -- for such a small flashlight it really throws quite a lot of light. I like that the LED light draws little power and last a long time while still being very bright.There are two other features not found in most other flashlights I own -- you can twist to focus the light on a narrower or wider area. It is also water resistant -- so if I have to go out in nasty, rainy weather (liwve north of Seattle and get a lot of that here!) I don't have to worry about if it will keep working.I always cast a critical eye over the things I use and review -- and don't hesitate to point out any issues I find and to rate accordingly -- but there's nothing I don't like about this little flashlight. I like having a powerful light that's compact enough to keep in my pocket and can be used in man situations. I am glad I took a chance on it.

I received this ring at a discount, so I could optionally share my experience with it in a review. I hadn't heard of this brand before, and wasn't quite sure what to expect with regard to quality or fit. But I really liked the way it looked in the photo so decided to give it a try.As it turns out, I needn't have worried. The ring is true to size. It also is very nicely finished, with the goldtone metal polished to a high shine. The stones really sparkle! There are many of them to catch the light.I found it pretty comfortable to wear, too -- I'm not used to wearing a wide band, so it took a little getting used to. Being that it is wide, it really calls attention to itself.I always cast a critical eye over the items I use and review -- and point out any issues I find and rate accordingly -- but I can't find anything not to like about this ring. I'm glad I took a chance on it.

I received a free headlamp to try out and, optionally, share my experience with it in a review. I hadn't heard of this brand and wasn't sure what to expect from this headlamp. Here's what I found.I have another headlamp, but this one is lighter weight and not as bulky. I like that. It's easily adjustable, both on top of the head and around the side, with a plastic buckle which is really simple to adjust.Though it's just a small thing I like the red color, too. Makes it easy to spot when I'm looking for it, too.I like to do DIY projects; this is so great for getting down and working on the interiors or undersides of furniture, or down below the sink. And it's great for anyplace that's dark and hard to see --- like that space behind and beside the dryer that seems to attract small items of clothing like socks, like a magnet. It keeps my hands free while I work. And, it is easily adjustable too by adjusting the lens in front. Oh and it is really bright! (Always a good thing in a light, right?)I always cast a critical eye over the items I use and review -- and I always point out any issues, and rate accordingly -- but just couldn't find anything not to like about this headlamp. Though fairly lightweight, it seems very well-made. I'm really glad to have it.

I received a free scarf to try out so I could, optionally, share my experience with it in a review. I hadn't heard of this company before and wasn't sure what to expect from the scarf.Turns out, I'm glad I took a chance. The scarf is super soft, and very smooth. It's a deep blue, with a paisley design woven in a lighter blue. (The photo I took didn't quite capture the depth of the blue.)It's a sophisticated look that could be worn to dress up a casual outfit or could add punch to a little black dress. I like scarves like this which can be worn with a variety of outfits -- it is really versatile.This scarf has a very soft fringe on the end, which feels wonderful against the skin. The color is rich. The fabric is a nice weight -- not too flimsy for winter, but also wearable during warmer months -- substantial but not bulky. To me, it feels luxurious.I always cast a critical eye on the items I use and review -- and point out any issues and rate accordingly -- but couldn't find anything not to like about this scarf. It is truly beautifully made, and I'm so glad I decided to take a chance on it.

I received a free scarf to try out so I could, optionally, share my experience with it in a review. I hadn't heard of this company before and wasn't sure what to expect from the scarf.I usually think of silk as being very soft and smooth, but this is a little different. It is a loosely woven fabric which gives it more texture than most silk scarves. It has a very organic, natural, feel to it and is obviously handwoven rather than mass-produced. I really like that.Despite having some texture, it isn't at all scratchy; it feels really nice against skin. The ends are hand-knotted; each fringe is about 3 inches long to the tip of the tassel.I got the green scarf. The color is exquisite, with gradations from a light, fresh green to a darker hue. I'm fair skinned with pink tones to my skin and this really flatters my skin tone. It would go wonderfully with earth tones, reds, blues, and yellows, so can accessorize a lot of different kinds of outfits.I always cast a critical eye on the items I use and review -- and point out any issues and rate accordingly -- but couldn't find anything not to like about this scarf. I'm pleased with both the quality and style of this silk scarf and am glad I took a chance on it.

I received a free battery charger to try out, so I could, optionally, share my experience with it in a review.My phone battery always seems to die at the most inappropriate times! I've begun bringing a battery pack with me for those times -- so I can quickly either recharge it or power it up wherever I may be. If I'm out shopping or out to eat, there is usually no outlet that's convenient to use and even if there is I don't always want to stop and wait for my phone to charge.With this, I can just plug it in and charge it wherever I am. I also like it for when I'm out on walks or hiking, because it's so easy to tuck into my pocket. I actually have two of these -- one that I keep in my coat pocket (for those walks) and another I keep in my messenger bag or purse. It has been a lifesaver!2800mAH is enough to charge my phone multiple times, or to get my tablet going again. Even though it's pretty powerful it's fairly lightweight and small so it doesn't weigh me down or take much space.I always cast a critical eye over the items I use and review -- and always point out any issues I find, and rate accordingly -- but can't find anything not to like about this battery pack. Thinking about giving these as stocking stuffers, too.
