Since they stopped making "Job Squad" paper towels, these are about the best, most cloth-like paper towel you can buy. I like them a lot, HOWEVER it does take some space to store 24 rolls of paper towels, it turns out!
These are well made, but I couldn't figure out how to attach them.

I bought a pair of these to brush my cats, and they LOVE them. These are, however, unlike any boar bristle product I've ever seen in that they feel like all the bristles are nylon or some other plastic, not boar hair at all. Maybe the Chinese slave labor factory that produced these figured "boar bristle brush" meant the SHAPE of the brush? They are cheap-ish little brushes, and, as I mentioned, my cats love them. Do not expect boar bristles and you will not be disappointed.

I used to buy giant sized clear trash bags for our recycling before we replaced our small bin with a recycling bin the size of our trash can. Same idea here, you want to know what's in the bag if it's recycling. These are about 90% clear and the perfect size with a built-in drawstring on top. My kids tend to pile up recycling on the dryer and it gets somewhat annoying. Very pleased to have these bags to hold the recycling on the way to the garage and the big recycling bin. Less chaos! Always a good thing.

Not a very pleasant fragrance, a lot like what I remember my grandmother's hair smelling like. Sits rather heavily on the hair. Doesn't work all that well as a conditioner IMHO compared to the super-cheap conditioners I usually buy. I'm not really impressed with this product. Nice squishy bottle which is easy to use in the shower, however. Perhaps it will work better for you.---At the end of the day: this product produces nicely behaved, manageable hair! It doesn't go on all that well IMHO, but as your hair dries and you go about your day, your hair is kept from getting too frizzy and out-of-control. Still not wild about the fragrance but this product does a nice job keeping your hair looking good (I've got long hair).

I spent money on this thing and have spent the past seven hours trying to get any picture from it. Remember the first Moon landing? The video was better from the surface of the Moon in 1969. Why did I spend money or time on this thing? Complete and utter dog excrement. Sucks out loud. Oh, how I wish I could use more colorful language and still have my review published. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
I think these are good quality, but I couldn't figure out how to use them on my Toyota.

What a deal!!!!! Two absolute classic 1960s Japanese sci fi epics on two DVDs IN JAPANESE!!! The horrible US dub versions we grew up with always suffered and I always wondered if I couldn't find the real original versions out there somewhere -- are here they are!!! Excellent transfers, great sound -- I could not ask for more! Buy these now while they're still available! Unique and delightful entertainment.
My daughter wanted this, and she seems quite happy with it. I'd never heard of such a thing before. It seems well made. If she's happy, I'm happy.
I couldn't figure out how to use these on my Toyota. They appear to be well-made, but I eventually gave up and took my car to a body shop ($$$$) for repair.
I think these are ok -- I was baffled trying to repair my Toyota and really couldn't figure out how to use these, and finally went to a body shop and paid $$$$ for the repairs.

I was provided with a sample of this product at no cost to review it.They had me at "lime green" -- I *love* lime green, and the photos of this product don't do it justice, the photos are more of a green-yellow-green while the genuine article is a BRILLIANT pure lime green, nearly electric green!!! It's BIG AND HEAVY, plenty of heft. Very flexible, populated from edge to edge with thick, stubby rubber fingers. There's a lip that runs all the way around the mat.It's got an awful rubber smell right out of the (triple!) bags, but I've scrubbed it and I'm waiting for it to dry. I've got a spot in my kitchen right in front of my aquarium (you don't have an aquarium in your kitchen? why not?) where I conduct most of my kitchen business, preparing meals, emptying wine bottles, et cetera, and this is going to fit perfectly. No more wandering cutting boards! And it's large enough to collect glassware waiting to be washed.I like the material a lot, both the weight and flexibility, but the COLOR really carries the day -- fantastic splash of color that lights up your kitchen. Very clever product. When the smell is washed off, it'll be perfect! Quite tickled with this item. Far better than I'd anticipated.

Details matter, and Slumberjack sleeping bags pay attention to all of them. I had a Slumberjack sleeping bag I took with me on a trip to Europe THIRTY years ago (!!!) which lasted and lasted through car camping and Cub Scout camping trips. So I was very happy to see this sleeping bag offered for review -- my daughter has outgrown her kid's sleeping bag. And when you're younger having a decent sleeping bag makes travel a lot easier (sleeping on friend's floors, etc). The channeled zipper is a really nice touch, it's no fun having a cold draft make your teeth chatter when you're outdoors. The pillow pocket is a clever idea. Yes, it's hard to roll up a new sleeping bag. Stick with it. The stitching in particular tells you this is a quality product. When you're camping you don't want to realize that a cheap sleeping bag with poor attention to details is not a good buy! This is not a toy, this is a high quality sleeping bag which you will use for years and years to come. It comes with a good quality stuff sack.
Great everyday paper napkins but IN A VAST QUANTITY. I have paper napkins stored in our pantry, my closet, my bookshelf... I strongly prefer Vanity Fair, but this is a LOT of napkins!!!

Another typically brilliant redesign of a common cable by Belkin. THIS LOOKS AWESOME. It's a matter of style -- the standard clunky CAT5 cable or this black, FLAT CAT5 cable? Little details such as this cable make you look more professionally and generally increase your awesomeness. That someone at Belkin noticed this and acted on it is genius.

I'm impressed! Much better than I expected, starting with fragrance. I thought it was going to be really heavy-handed and perfume-like. The scent is actually agreeable, and leaves your skin smelling nice if you stick your nose right to your skin and sniff, but it doesn't radiate fragrance. I was dubious that the shampoo+conditioner thing was going to work, and it works quite well! Better than a separate conditioner! AND it works as a body wash! the stuff is a translucent deep blue, which is kind of trippy looking. Overall I'm really impressed, this stuff is much better than I expected on all three features -- cleaned my hair and left it surprisingly manageable, plus it cleans your skin and leaves you smelling very nice, but not flowery!

Kind of a weird concept, which was appealing. Tiny, soft-ish rubber tools that you carefully insert into your ear with a gentle twisting motion. Not terribly productive, but certainly a novelty. Definitely unique. These didn't do much for my ears, but I was amused by them and they are like nothing I've seen before. Perhaps you'll have better results than I did.
Very comfortable. The recycled handles are big enough for adult fingers. The blades are quite sharp. Nice quality scissors. Not too small.

Agreeable scent (nothing like coffee btw), easy to apply to damp or dry hair. Looks great, provides good hold (no flyaway hairs or cowlicks). Even the package looks manly. Not too much hold, but rather just enough to keep your hair under control. Excellent product for men.

Clever re-packaging of the classic Best Foods / Hellman's mayonnaise. Easy for kids to use. Perfect for camping. A little mayonnaise on the bottom bun of your burger keeps your hamburger from soaking the bun, yes? Makes a nice little "curlicue" pattern. Ideal for kids to use -- reduces messes.
Spooky, atmospheric, haunting and haunted at the same time, Bela Lugosi is incomparable, as is the actor who portrays Van Helsing. A true classic. Absolutely love this film.

A truly classic product. I remember my mother using it. It's more economical to buy the 200 ft roll. Ever notice that there's a dull side and a shiny side? It's actually TWO layers of aluminum foil, and if you're interested in Dutch oven cooking, try putting a sheet of Reynolds Wrap SHINY SIDE UP below your bottom coal layer -- it reflects more heat that way!The product is perfect and I could go on for some time about the nearly endless uses for it. Tenting meat once it comes off the grill is an obvious one. It handles leftovers well (aside from really spicy food, which melts it), is what you want to keep food warm or cover a roast or turkey once it's browned enough for you, you can hang a piece from the rabbit ears on your 1950s era television for better reception... double-wrap food going into the freezer but LABEL IT, would you? Otherwise you end up with a chest freezer full of mystery parcels.The one complain I have about Reynolds Wrap does not have to do with the product, but with packaging, which up until a few years ago was fairly substantial and strong enough to hold on to the roll of foil! Then it was made lighter and cheaper and it didn't hold the roll and really fell apart by the time you got down to the core of the Reynolds Wrap. When I opened the shipping box of this review item, the box was broken open on both ends! The lightweight cardboard they use for the package isn't strong enough to have the push-in die-cut tabs hold the roll. I had actually e-mailed Reynolds about this a few years ago. The box isn't strong enough. Make it like it used to be. It used to be perfect.I think there's a market for somebody who could make a decent cardboard box for Reynolds Wrap. Seriously. I would buy one and use it.This is a product you NEED in your kitchen. It's that simple. There is no substitute. I have nothing but good things to say about this product. And thank goodness they haven't gone insane and tweaked their packaging art or colors over the years. Perhaps they realize there is no need to change this absolutely beloved and iconic product. But, guys, spring for a decent box, would you?

NOVELTY is an often overlooked feature of life. And this product is most definitely novel! An automated cat litter box? Who thinks up these things!? AND IT WORKS! My cats are fascinated by this thing. Putting it together was something of a puzzle that my daughter and I worked out. The instructions leave a bit to be desired, but eventually we got it put together.Sure enough, 15 minutes after the cat has vacated both itself and the little box, a motor crawls the length of one side, pushing a metal screen, which then dumps its load into a narrow tray for disposal. Very amusing to watch in operation.  A little weird sound, but not terribly noisy. It's a little longer than our other litter boxes. No cover. But the cats use it and watch it carefully as it harvests their deposits. It's difficult to say who is the most amused, the cats or myself. The color is battleship grey and it ships with a supply of long, thin bags meant to contain the collected deposits along with a very nice "litter catching" kind of carpet.A genuine novelty for you and your cats. I'd never seen anything like this before. And it appears to work fairly well!---A couple of weeks later: This automatic litter box has no cover, which is kind of an issue. It's not super efficient at cleaning urine clumped litter at the bottom of the tray. The noise is  a little odd late at night and my cats are highly suspicious of the device when it goes through its  cleaning cycle. Might be a cat-eating monster. Overall, and it pains me to report this because I do admire the gadget quality of this thing, it's not a particularly robust solution.  A cover would help a great deal, but the wire fence that collects deposits isn't aggressive enough to be effective. It is quite a novelty, however, and that's worth something.
